Text

" In [England]1-england , where [boys]2308-boys go to [boarding schools]2309-boarding schools , if the holidays were not long there would be no opportunity for cultivating the domestic affections . "—Letter[57-paul] of [Lord Campbell]56-lord campbell 's , 1835 . On a certain Monday evening late in January , 1881 , [Paul Bultitude]57-paul , Esq . ( of [Mincing Lane]2-mincing lane , [Colonial Produce Merchant]211-colonial produce merchant ) , was sitting alone in [[his]57-paul dining - room at [Westbourne Terrace]3-westbourne terrace]212-his dining - room at westbourne terrace after dinner . [The room]213-the room was a long and lofty one , furnished in the stern uncompromising style of the Mahogany Age , now supplanted by the later fashions of decoration which , in their outset original and artistic , seem fairly on the way to become as meaningless and conventional . Here were no skilfully contrasted shades of grey or green , no dado , no distemper on the walls ; the woodwork was grained and varnished after the manner of [the Philistines]58-the philistines , the walls papered in dark crimson , with heavy curtains of the same colour , and the sideboard , dinner - waggon , and row of stiff chairs were all carved in the same massive and expensive style of ugliness . The pictures were those familiar presentments of dirty rabbits , fat white horses , bloated goddesses , and misshapen boors , by [masters who , if younger than [they]214-masters who , if younger than they assume to be assume to be]214-masters who , if younger than they assume to be , must have been quite old enough to know better . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was [a tall and portly person , of a somewhat pompous and overbearing demeanour]215-a tall and portly person , of a somewhat pompous and overbearing demeanour ; not much over fifty , but looking considerably older . [He]57-paul had a high shining head , from which the hair had mostly departed , what little still remained being of a grizzled auburn , prominent pale blue eyes with heavy eyelids and fierce , bushy whitey - brown eyebrows . [His]57-paul general expression suggested a conviction of [his]57-paul own extreme importance , but , in spite of this , [his]57-paul big underlip drooped rather weakly and [his]57-paul double chin slightly receded , giving a judge of character reason for suspecting that a certain obstinate positiveness observable in [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's manner might possibly be due less to the possession of an unusually strong will than to the circumstance that , by some fortunate chance , that will had hitherto never met with serious opposition . [The room]213-the room , with all [its]213-the room æsthetic shortcomings , was comfortable enough , and [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's attitude — [he]57-paul was lying back in a well - wadded leather arm - chair , with a glass of claret at [his]57-paul elbow and [his]57-paul feet stretched out towards the ruddy blaze of the fire — seemed at first sight to imply that happy after - dinner condition of perfect satisfaction with [oneself]217-oneself and things in general , which is the natural outcome of [a good cook]218-a good cook , a good conscience , and a good digestion . At first sight ; because [his]57-paul face did not confirm the impression — there was a latent uneasiness in it , an air of suppressed irritation , as if [he]57-paul expected and even dreaded to be disturbed at any moment , and yet was powerless to resent the intrusion as [he]57-paul would like to do . At the slightest sound in [the hall outside]219-the hall outside [he]57-paul would half rise in [his]57-paul chair and glance at the door with a mixture of alarm and resignation , and as often as the steps died away and the door remained closed , [he]57-paul would sink back and resettle [himself]57-paul with a shrug of evident relief . [Habitual novel readers on reading thus far]220-habitual novel readers on reading thus far will , [I]0-i am afraid , prepare [themselves]220-habitual novel readers on reading thus far for the arrival of [a faithful cashier]221-a faithful cashier with news of irretrievable ruin , or [a mysterious and cynical stranger]222-a mysterious and cynical stranger threatening disclosures of a disgraceful nature . But all such anticipations must at once be ruthlessly dispelled . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , although [he]57-paul was certainly [a merchant]223-a merchant , was a fairly successful one — in direct defiance of the laws of fiction , where any connection with commerce seems to lead naturally to failure in one of the three volumes . [He]57-paul was [an elderly gentleman]224-an elderly gentleman , too , of irreproachable character and antecedents ; no [Damocles]59-damocles ' sword of exposure was swinging over [his]57-paul bald but blameless head ; [he]57-paul had no disasters to fear and no indiscretions to conceal . [He]57-paul had not been intended for melodrama , with which , indeed , [he]57-paul would not have considered it a respectable thing to be connected . In fact , the secret of [his]57-paul uneasiness was so absurdly simple and commonplace that [I]0-i am rather ashamed to have made even a temporary mystery of it . [[His]57-paul son]225-his son [Dick]60-dick was about to return to [school]226-school that evening , and [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was expecting every moment to be called upon to go through a parting scene with [him]57-paul ; that was really all that was troubling [him]57-paul . This sounds very creditable to the tenderness of [his]57-paul feelings as [a father]227-a father — for there are [some parents who bear such a bereavement at the close of the holidays]228-some parents who bear such a bereavement at the close of the holidays with extraordinary fortitude , if [they]228-some parents who bear such a bereavement at the close of the holidays do not actually betray an unnatural satisfaction at the event . But it was not exactly from softness of heart that [he]57-paul was restless and impatient , nor did [he]57-paul dread any severe strain upon [his]57-paul emotions . [He]57-paul was not much given to sentiment , and was the author of more than one of those pathetically indignant letters to the papers , in which [the British parent]229-the british parent denounces the expenses of education and the unconscionable length and frequency of vacations . [He]57-paul was [one of those nervous and fidgety persons who can not understand [[their]231-their own children]232-their own children]230-one of those nervous and fidgety persons who can not understand their own children , looking on [them]232-their own children as objectionable monsters whose next movements are uncertain — much as [Frankenstein]61-frankenstein must have felt towards [his]61-frankenstein monster . [He]57-paul hated to have [a boy]233-a boy about [the house]234-the house , and positively writhed under the irrelevant and irrepressible questions , the unnecessary noises and boisterous high spirits which nothing would subdue ; [[his]57-paul son]225-his son 's society was to [him]57-paul simply an abominable nuisance , and [he]57-paul pined for a release from it from the day the holidays began . [He]57-paul had been [a widower]236-a widower for nearly three years , and no doubt the loss of [a mother]237-a mother 's loving tact , which can check the heedless merriment before it becomes intolerable , and interpret and soften [the most peevish and unreasonable of rebukes]238-the most peevish and unreasonable of rebukes , had done much to make the relations between [parent]239-parent and [children]240-children more strained than [they]241-they might otherwise have been . As it was , [Dick]60-dick 's fear of [[his]60-dick father]242-his father was just great enough to prevent any cordiality between [them]241-they , and not sufficient to make [him]60-dick careful to avoid offence , and it is not surprising if , when the time came for [him]60-dick to return to [[his]60-dick house of bondage]243-his house of bondage at [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's , [Crichton House]4-crichton house , [Market Rodwell]5-market rodwell , [he]60-dick left [[his]60-dick father]242-his father anything but inconsolable . Just now , although [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was so near the hour of [his]57-paul deliverance , [he]57-paul still had a bad quarter of an hour before [him]57-paul , in which the last farewells must be said , and [he]57-paul found it impossible under these circumstances to compose [himself]57-paul for a quiet half - hour 's nap , or retire to [the billiard - room]245-the billiard - room for a cup of coffee and a mild cigar , as [he]57-paul would otherwise have done — since [he]57-paul was certain to be disturbed . And there was another thing which harassed [him]57-paul , and that was a haunting dread lest at the last moment some unforeseen accident should prevent [the boy]246-the boy 's departure after all . [He]57-paul had some grounds for this , for only a week before , a sudden and unprecedented snowstorm had dashed [his]57-paul hopes , on the eve of [their]247-their fulfilment , by forcing [the Doctor]248-the doctor to postpone the day on which [[his]57-paul school]249-his school was to re - assemble , and now [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul sat on brambles until [he]57-paul had seen [the house]234-the house definitely rid of [[his]57-paul son]225-his son 's presence . All this time , while [the father]252-the father was fretting and fuming in [his]252-the father arm - chair , [the son]253-the son , [the unlucky cause of all this discomfort]254-the unlucky cause of all this discomfort , had been standing on the mat outside the door , trying to screw up enough courage to go in as if nothing was the matter with [him]253-the son . [He]253-the son was not looking particularly boisterous just then . On the contrary , [his]253-the son face was pale , and [his]253-the son eyelids rather redder than [he]253-the son would quite care for them to be seen by [any of [the " fellows "[253-the son] at [Crichton House]4-crichton house]256-the " fellows " at crichton house]255-any of the " fellows " at crichton house . All the life and spirit had gone out of [him]253-the son for the time ; [he]253-the son had a troublesome dryness in [his]253-the son throat , and a general sensation of chill heaviness , which [he]253-the son [himself]253-the son would have described — expressively enough , if not with academical elegance — as " feeling beastly . "[253-the son] [The stoutest hearted boy]257-the stoutest hearted boy , returning to the most perfect of [schools]258-schools , can not always escape something of this at that dark hour when the sands of the holidays have run out to their last golden grain , when the boxes are standing corded and labelled in [the hall]259-the hall , and [some one]260-some one is going to fetch [the fatal cab]261-the fatal cab . [Dick]60-dick had just gone the round of [the house]234-the house , bidding dreary farewells to [all the servants]263-all the servants ; an unpleasant ordeal which [he]60-dick would gladly have dispensed with , if possible , and which did not serve to raise [his]60-dick spirits . [Upstairs]264-upstairs , in [the bright nursery]265-the bright nursery , [he]60-dick had found [[his]60-dick old nurse]266-his old nurse sitting sewing by the high wire fender . [She]266-his old nurse was [a stern , hard - featured old lady , who had systematically slapped [him]60-dick through infancy into boyhood]267-a stern , hard - featured old lady , who had systematically slapped him through infancy into boyhood , and [he]60-dick had had some stormy passages with [her]266-his old nurse during the past few weeks ; but [she]266-his old nurse softened now in the most unexpected manner as [she]266-his old nurse said good - bye , and told [him]60-dick [he]60-dick was [a " pleasant , good - hearted young gentleman]2310-a " pleasant , good - hearted young gentleman , after all , though that aggravating and contrairy sometimes . "[266-his old nurse] And then [she]266-his old nurse predicted , with some of the rashness attaching to irresponsibility , that [he]60-dick would be " [the best boy this next term as ever]2311-the best boy this next term as ever was , and work hard at all [his]60-dick lessons , and bring home a prize"—but[266-his old nurse] all this unusual gentleness only made the interview more difficult to come out of with any credit for self - control .

Then [downstairs]268-downstairs , [the cook]269-the cook had come up in [her]269-the cook evening brown print and clean collar , from [[her]269-the cook warm spice - scented kitchen]270-her warm spice - scented kitchen , to remark cheerily that " [Lor]63-lor bless [his]60-dick heart , what with all these telegrafts and things , time flew so fast nowadays that [they]2312-they 'd be having [him]60-dick back again before [they]2312-they all knew where [they]2312-they were ! "[269-the cook] which had a certain spurious consolation about it , until [one]271-one saw that , after all , it put the case entirely from [her]271-one own standpoint . After this [Dick]60-dick had parted from [[his]60-dick elder sister]272-his elder sister [Barbara]64-barbara and [[his]60-dick young brother]273-his young brother [Roly]65-roly , and had arrived where [we]274-we found [him]60-dick first , at the mat outside [the dining - room]275-the dining - room door , where [he]60-dick still lingered shivering in [the cold foggy hall]276-the cold foggy hall . Somehow , [he]60-dick could not bring [himself]60-dick to take the next step at once ; [he]60-dick knew pretty well what [[his]60-dick father]242-his father 's feelings would be , and a parting is a very unpleasant ceremony to one who feels that the regret is all on [his]60-dick own side . But it was no use putting it off any longer ; [he]60-dick resolved at last to go in and get it over , and opened the door accordingly . How warm and comfortable [the room]213-the room looked — more comfortable than [it]213-the room had ever seemed to [him]60-dick before , even on the first day of the holidays ! And [[his]60-dick father]242-his father would be sitting there in a quarter of an hour 's time , just as [he]242-his father was now , while [he]242-his father [himself]242-his father would be lumbering along to [the station]280-the station through the dismal raw fog ! How unspeakably delightful it must be , thought [Dick]60-dick enviously , to be grown up and never worried by the thoughts of school and lesson - books ; to be able to look forward to returning to [the same comfortable house]281-the same comfortable house , and living the same easy life , day after day , week after week , with no fear of [a swiftly advancing Black Monday]282-a swiftly advancing black monday . [Gloomy moralists]283-gloomy moralists might have informed [him]60-dick that [we]284-we can not escape [school]226-school by simply growing up , and that , even for [those who contrive this and make a long holiday of]286-those who contrive this and make a long holiday of [their]286-those who contrive this and make a long holiday of lives , there comes a time when the days are grudgingly counted to a blacker Monday than ever made [a school - boy]287-a school - boy 's heart quake within [him]60-dick . But then [Dick]60-dick would never have believed [them]283-gloomy moralists , and [the moralists]288-the moralists would only have wasted much excellent common sense upon [him]60-dick . [Paul Bultitude]57-paul 's face cleared as [he]57-paul saw [[his]57-paul son]225-his son come in . " There [you]225-his son are , eh ? "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , with evident satisfaction , as [he]57-paul turned in [his]57-paul chair , intending to cut the scene as short as possible . " So [you]225-his son 're off at last ? Well , holidays ca n't last for ever — by a merciful decree of [Providence]66-providence , [they]2313-they do n't last quite for ever ! There , good - bye , good - bye , be [a good boy]2314-a good boy this term , no more scrapes , mind . And now [you]225-his son 'd better run away , and put on [your]225-his son coat — [you're]225-his son keeping [the cab]2315-the cab waiting all this time . "[57-paul] " No , [I]60-dick 'm not , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , " [Boaler]67-boaler has n't gone to fetch one yet . "[60-dick] " Not gone to fetch [a cab]2316-a cab yet ! "[57-paul] cried [Paul]57-paul , with evident alarm , " why , God bless [my]57-paul soul , what 's [the man]2317-the man thinking about ? [You]225-his son 'll lose [[your]225-his son train]2318-your train ! [I]57-paul know [you]225-his son 'll lose [the train]2319-the train , and there will be another day lost , after the extra week gone already through that snow ! [I]57-paul must see to this [myself]57-paul . Ring the bell , tell [Boaler]67-boaler to start this instant — [I]57-paul insist on [his]67-boaler fetching [a cab]2316-a cab this instant ! "[57-paul] " Well , it 's not [my]60-dick fault , [you]242-his father know , "[60-dick] grumbled [Dick]60-dick , not considering so much anxiety at all flattering , " but [Boaler]67-boaler has gone now . [I]60-dick just heard the gate shut . "[60-dick] " Ah ! "[242-his father] said [[his]60-dick father]242-his father , with more composure , " and now , "[242-his father] [he]242-his father suggested , " [you]225-his son 'd better shake hands , and then go up and say good - bye to [[your]225-his son sister]2321-your sister — [you've]225-his son no time to spare . "[242-his father] " [I]60-dick 've said good - bye to [them]2321-your sister , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick . " May n't [I]60-dick stay here till — till [Boaler]67-boaler comes ? "[60-dick] This request was due , less to filial affection than a faint desire for dessert , which even [his]60-dick feelings could not altogether stifle . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul granted it with a very bad grace . " [I]57-paul suppose [you]225-his son can if [you]225-his son want to , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said impatiently , " only do one thing or the other — stay outside , or shut the door and come in and sit down quietly . [I]57-paul can not sit in a thorough draught ! "[57-paul] [Dick]60-dick obeyed , and applied [himself]60-dick to the dessert with rather an injured expression . [[His]60-dick father]242-his father felt a greater sense of constraint and worry than ever ; the interview , as [he]242-his father had feared , seemed likely to last some time , and [he]242-his father felt that [he]242-his father ought to improve the occasion in some way , or , at all events , make some observation . But , for all that , [he]242-his father had not the remotest idea what to say to [this red - haired , solemn boy]292-this red - haired , solemn boy , who sat staring gloomily at [him]242-his father in the intervals of filling [his]292-this red - haired , solemn boy mouth . The situation grew more embarrassing every moment . At last , as [he]242-his father felt [himself]242-his father likely to have more to say in reproof than on any other subject , [he]242-his father began with that . " There 's one thing [I]242-his father want to talk to [you]225-his son about before [you]225-his son go , "[242-his father] [he]242-his father began , " and that 's this . [I]242-his father had a most unsatisfactory report of [you]225-his son this last term ; do n't let [me]242-his father have that again . [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone tells [me]242-his father — ah , [I]242-his father have [his]62-dr. grimstone letter here — yes , [he]62-dr. grimstone says ( and just attend , instead of making [yourself]225-his son ill with preserved ginger)—he says , ' [[Your]225-his son son]2322-your son has great natural capacity , and excellent abilities ; but [I]242-his father regret to say that , instead of applying [himself]2322-your son as [he]2322-your son might do , [he]2322-your son misuses [his]2322-your son advantages , and succeeds in setting a mischievous example to — if not actually misleading — [[his]2322-your son companions]2323-his companions . ' That 's a pleasant account for [a father]227-a father to read ! Here am [I]242-his father , sending [you]225-his son to [an expensive school]2325-an expensive school , furnishing [you]225-his son with great natural capacity and excellent abilities , and — and — every other school requisite , and all [you]225-his son do is to misuse [them]2326-them ! It 's disgraceful ! And misleading [[your]225-his son companions]2327-your companions , too ! Why , at [your]225-his son age , [they]2327-your companions ought to mislead [you]225-his son — No , [I]242-his father do n't mean that — but what [I]242-his father may tell [you]225-his son is that [I]242-his father 've written a very strong letter to [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone , saying what pain it gave [me]242-his father to hear [you]225-his son misbehaved [yourself]225-his son , and telling [him]62-dr. grimstone , if [he]62-dr. grimstone ever caught [you]225-his son setting an example of any sort , mind that , any sort , in the future — [he]62-dr. grimstone was to , ah , to remember some of [Solomon]68-solomon 's very sensible remarks on the subject . So [I]242-his father should strongly advise [you]225-his son to take care what [you]225-his son 're about in future , for [your]225-his son own sake ! "[242-his father] This was not a very encouraging address , perhaps , but it did not seem to distress [Dick]60-dick to any extent ; [he]60-dick had heard very much the same sort of thing several times before , and had been fully prepared for it then . [He]60-dick had been seeking distraction in almonds and raisins , but now [they]293-they only choked instead of consoling [him]60-dick , and [he]60-dick gave them up and sat brooding silently over [his]60-dick hard lot instead , with a dull , blank dejection which [those only who have gone through the same thing in [their]294-those only who have gone through the same thing in their boyhood boyhood]294-those only who have gone through the same thing in their boyhood will understand . To [others , whose school life has been one unchequered course of excitement and success]295-others , whose school life has been one unchequered course of excitement and success , it will be incomprehensible enough — and so much the better for [them]294-those only who have gone through the same thing in their boyhood . [He]60-dick sat listening to the grim sphinx clock on the black marble chimneypiece , as it remorselessly ticked away [his]60-dick last few moments of [home]296-home - life , and [he]60-dick ingeniously set [himself]60-dick to crown [his]60-dick sorrow by reviving recollections of happier days . In one of the corners of [the overmantel]297-the overmantel there was still a sprig of withered laurel left forgotten , and [his]60-dick eye fell on it now with grim satisfaction . [He]60-dick made [his]60-dick thoughts travel back to that delightful afternoon on Christmas Eve , when [they]293-they had all come [home]296-home riotous through [the brilliant streets]299-the brilliant streets , laden with purchases from the [Baker Street Bazaar]6-baker street bazaar , and then had decorated [the rooms]300-the rooms with such free and careless gaiety . And the Christmas dinner too ! [He]60-dick had sat just where [he]60-dick was sitting now , with , ah , such a difference in every other respect — the time had not come then when the thought of " only so many more weeks and days left "[60-dick] had begun to intrude its grisly shape , like the skull at an ancient feast . And yet [he]60-dick could distinctly recollect now , and with bitter remorse , that [he]60-dick had not enjoyed [himself]60-dick then as much as [he]60-dick ought to have done ; [he]60-dick even remembered an impious opinion of [his]60-dick that the proceedings were " slow . "[60-dick] Slow ! with plenty to eat , and three ( four , if [he]60-dick had only known it ) more weeks of holiday before [him]60-dick ; with Boxing Day and the brisk exhilarating drive to [the Crystal Palace]301-the crystal palace immediately following , with all the rest of a season of licence and varied joys to come , which [he]60-dick could hardly trust [himself]60-dick to look back upon now ! [He]60-dick must have been mad to think such a thing . Overhead [[his]60-dick sister]302-his sister [Barbara]64-barbara was playing softly one of the airs from " The Pirates "[64-barbara] ( it was [Frederic]69-frederic 's appeal to [[the Major - General]303-the major - general 's daughters]304-the major - general 's daughters ) , and the music , freed from the serio - comic situation which it illustrates , had a tenderness and pathos of its own which went to [Dick]60-dick 's heart and intensified [his]60-dick melancholy . [He]60-dick had gone ( in secret , for [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul disapproved of such dissipations ) to hear the Opera in the holidays , and now the piano conjured the whole scene up for [him]60-dick again — there would be no more theatre - going for [him]60-dick for a very long time ! By this time [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul began to feel the silence becoming once more oppressive , and roused [himself]57-paul with a yawn . " Heigho ! "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , " Boaler 's an uncommonly long time fetching [that cab]2328-that cab ! "[57-paul] [Dick]60-dick felt more injured than ever , and showed it by drawing what [he]60-dick intended for a moving sigh . Unfortunately it was misunderstood . " [I]305-his parent do wish , [sir]2329-sir , "[305-his parent] said [[his]60-dick parent]305-his parent testily , " [you]60-dick would try to break [yourself]60-dick of that habit of breathing hard . [The society of a grampus]2330-the society of a grampus ( for it 's no less ) delights [no one]2331-no one and offends many — including [me]305-his parent — and for [Heaven]70-heaven 's sake , [Dick]60-dick , do n't kick the leg of the table in that way ; [you]60-dick know it simply maddens [me]305-his parent . What do [you]60-dick do it for ? Why ca n't [you]60-dick learn to sit at table like [a gentleman]2332-a gentleman ? "[305-his parent]

[Dick]60-dick mumbled some apology , and then , having found [his]60-dick tongue and remembered [his]60-dick necessities , said , with a nervous catch in [his]60-dick voice , " Oh , [I]60-dick say , [father]2333-father , will [you]2333-father — can [you]2333-father let [me]60-dick have some pocket - money , please , to go back with ? "[60-dick] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul looked as if [[his]57-paul son]225-his son had petitioned for a latch - key . " Pocket - money ! "[57-paul] [he]57-paul repeated , " why , [you]60-dick ca n't want money . Did n't [[your]60-dick grandmother]2334-your grandmother give [you]60-dick a sovereign as a Christmas - box ? And [I]57-paul gave [you]60-dick ten shillings [myself]57-paul ! "[57-paul] " [I]60-dick do want it , though , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick ; " that 's all spent . And [you]2333-father know [you]2333-father always have given [me]60-dick money to take back . "[60-dick] " If [I]57-paul do give [you]60-dick some , [you]60-dick 'll only go and spend it , "[57-paul] grumbled [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , as if [he]57-paul considered money an object of art . " [I]57-paul sha n't spend it all at once , and [I]57-paul shall want some to put in the plate on Sundays . [We]2335-we always have to put in the plate when it 's a collection . And there 's [the cab]2315-the cab to pay . "[57-paul] " [Boaler]67-boaler has orders to pay [[your]60-dick cab]2337-your cab — as [you]60-dick know well enough , "[242-his father] said [[his]60-dick father]242-his father , " but [I]242-his father suppose [you]60-dick must have some , though [you]60-dick cost [me]242-his father enough , Heaven knows , without this additional expense . "[242-his father] And at this [he]242-his father brought up a fistful of loose silver and gold from one of [his]242-his father trouser - pockets , and spread it deliberately out on the table in front of [him]242-his father in shining rows . [Dick]60-dick 's eyes sparkled at the sight of so much wealth ; for a moment or two [he]60-dick almost forgot the pangs of approaching exile in the thought of the dignity and credit which [a single one of those bright new sovereigns]308-a single one of those bright new sovereigns would procure for [him]60-dick . It would ensure [him]60-dick surreptitious luxuries and open friendships as long as it lasted . Even [Tipping]71-tipping , [the head boy of the school , who had gone into tails]309-the head boy of the school , who had gone into tails , brought back no more , and besides , the money would bring [him]60-dick handsomely out of certain pecuniary difficulties to which an unexpected act of parental authority had exposed [him]60-dick ; [he]60-dick could easily dispose of all claims with such a sum at command , and then [[his]60-dick father]242-his father could so easily spare it out of so much ! [Meanwhile Mr. Bultitude]71-tipping , with great care and precision , selected from the coins before [him]242-his father a florin , two shillings , and two sixpences , which [he]242-his father pushed across to [[his]242-his father son]225-his son , who looked at them with a disappointment [he]242-his father did not care to conceal . " An uncommonly liberal allowance for [a young fellow like [you]225-his son]2338-a young fellow like you , "[242-his father] [he]242-his father observed . " Do n't buy any foolishness with it , and if , towards the end of the term [you]225-his son want a little more , and write an intelligible letter asking for it , and [I]242-his father think proper to let [you]225-his son have it — why , [you]225-his son 'll get it , [you]225-his son know . "[242-his father] [Dick]60-dick had not the courage to ask for more , much as [he]60-dick longed to do so , so [he]60-dick put the money in [his]60-dick purse with very qualified expressions of gratitude . In [his]60-dick purse [he]60-dick seemed to find something which had escaped [his]60-dick memory , for [he]60-dick took out a small parcel and unfolded it with some hesitation . " [I]60-dick nearly forgot , "[60-dick] [he]60-dick said , speaking with more animation than [he]60-dick had yet done , " [I]60-dick did n't like to take it without asking [you]225-his son , but is this any use ? May [I]60-dick have it ? "[60-dick] " Eh ? "[71-tipping] said [Mr. Bultitude]71-tipping , sharply , " what 's that ? Something else — what is it [you]71-tipping want now ? "[71-tipping] " It 's only that stone [Uncle Duke]72-uncle duke brought [mamma]2339-mamma from [India]7-india ; the thing , [he]72-uncle duke said , [they]2340-they called a ' Pagoda stone , ' or something , out there . "[60-dick] " Pagoda stone ? [The boy]246-the boy means [Garudâ Stone]73-the stone . [I]71-tipping should like to know how [you]225-his son got hold of that ; [you]225-his son 've been meddling in [my]71-tipping drawers , now , a thing [I]71-tipping will not put up with , as [I]71-tipping 've told [you]225-his son over and over again . "[71-tipping] " No , [I]60-dick have n't , then , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , " [I]60-dick found it in a tray in [the drawing - room]2342-the drawing - room , and [Barbara]64-barbara said , perhaps , if [I]60-dick asked [you]225-his son , [you]225-his son might let [me]60-dick have it , as [she]64-barbara did n't think it was any use to [you]225-his son . "[60-dick]

" Then [Barbara]64-barbara had no right to say anything of the sort . "[71-tipping] " But may [I]60-dick have it ? [I]60-dick may , may n't [I]60-dick ? "[60-dick] persisted [Dick]60-dick . " Have it ? certainly not . What could [you]225-his son possibly want with a thing like that ? It 's ridiculous . Give it to [me]60-dick . "[60-dick] [Dick]60-dick handed it over reluctantly enough . It was not much to look at , quite an insignificant - looking little square tablet of greyish green stone , pierced at one angle , and having on two of its faces faint traces of mysterious letters or symbols , which time had made very difficult to distinguish . It looked harmless enough as [Mr. Bultitude]71-tipping took it in [his]71-tipping hand ; there was no kindly hand to hold [him]71-tipping back , no warning voice to hint that there might possibly be sleeping within that small marble block the pent - up energy of long - forgotten Eastern necromancy , just as ready as ever to awake into action at the first words which had power to evoke it . There was [no one]2331-no one ; but even if there had been [such a person]313-such a person , [Paul Bultitude]57-paul was [a sober prosaic individual , who would probably have treated the warning as a piece of ridiculous superstition]314-a sober prosaic individual , who would probably have treated the warning as a piece of ridiculous superstition . As it was , [no man]315-no man could have put [himself]315-no man in a position of extreme peril with a more perfect unconsciousness of [his]315-no man danger . " Magnaque numinibus vota exaudita malignis . "[57-paul] [Paul Bultitude]57-paul put on [his]57-paul glasses to examine the stone more carefully , for it was some time since [he]57-paul had last seen or thought about it . Then [he]57-paul looked up and said once more , " What use would a thing like this be to [you]60-dick ? "[57-paul] [Dick]60-dick would have considered it a very valuable prize indeed ; [he]60-dick could have exhibited it to [admiring friends]316-admiring friends — during lessons , of course , when it would prove a most agreeable distraction ; [he]60-dick could have played with and fingered it incessantly , invented astonishing legends of its powers and virtues ; and , at last , when [he]60-dick had grown tired of it , have bartered [it]317-it for any more desirable article that might take [his]60-dick fancy . All these advantages were present to [his]60-dick mind in a vague shifting form , but [he]60-dick could not find either courage or words to explain them . Consequently [he]60-dick only said awkwardly , " Oh , [I]60-dick do n't know , [I]60-dick should like it . "[60-dick] " Well , any way , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " [you]60-dick certainly wo n't have it . It 's worth keeping , whatever it is , as the only thing [[your]60-dick uncle]2343-your uncle [Marmaduke]74-uncle marmaduke was ever known to give to [anybody]2344-anybody . "[57-paul] [Marmaduke Paradine]75-paradine , [[his]60-dick brother - in - law]318-his brother - in - law , was not a connection of whom [he]60-dick had much reason to feel particularly proud . One of [those persons endowed with what are known as " insinuating manners and address]2345-those persons endowed with what are known as " insinuating manners and address , "[60-dick] [he]60-dick had , after some futile attempts to enter [the army]319-the army , been sent out to [Bombay]8-bombay as [agent for [a Manchester firm]321-a manchester firm]320-agent for a manchester firm , and in that capacity had contrived to be mixed up in some more than shady transactions with [rival exporters]322-rival exporters and [native dealers up [the country]324-the country , which led to an unceremonious dismissal by [[his]60-dick employers]325-his employers]323-native dealers up the country , which led to an unceremonious dismissal by his employers . [He]60-dick had brought [home]296-home the stone from [India]7-india as a propitiatory token of remembrance , more portable and less expensive than the lacquered cabinets , brasses , stuffs and carved work which are expected from [friends]327-friends at such a distance , and [he]60-dick had been received with pardon and started once more , until certain other proceedings of [his]60-dick , shadier still , had obliged [Paul]57-paul to forbid [him]60-dick [the house at [Westbourne Terrace]3-westbourne terrace]328-the house at westbourne terrace . Since then little had been heard of [him]60-dick , and the reports which reached [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul of [[his]60-dick disreputable relative]329-his disreputable relative 's connection with the promotion of a series of companies of the kind affected by [the widow]330-the widow and [curate]331-curate , and exposed in money articles and law courts , gave [him]60-dick no desire to renew [his]60-dick acquaintance . " Is n't it a talisman , though ? "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , rather unfortunately for any hopes [he]60-dick might have of persuading [[his]60-dick father]242-his father to entrust [him]60-dick with the coveted treasure . " [I]57-paul 'm sure [I]57-paul ca n't tell [you]60-dick , "[57-paul] yawned [Paul]57-paul , " how do [you]60-dick mean ? "[57-paul] " [I]242-his father do n't know , only [Uncle Duke]72-uncle duke once said something about it . [Barbara]64-barbara heard [him]72-uncle duke tell [mamma]2339-mamma . [I]242-his father say , perhaps it 's like the one in [Scott]9-scott , and cures [people]2347-people of things , though [I]242-his father do n't think it 's that sort of talisman either , because [I]242-his father tried it once on [my]242-his father chilblains , and it was n't a bit of good . If [you]60-dick would only let [me]242-his father have it , perhaps [I]242-his father might find out , [you]60-dick know . "[242-his father] " [You]60-dick might , "[242-his father] said [[his]333-his father]242-his father drily , apparently not much influenced by this inducement , " but [you]60-dick wo n't have the chance . If it has a secret , [I]333-his will find it out for [myself]333-his "[333-his] ( [he]333-his little knew how literally [he]333-his was to be taken at [his]333-his word ) , " and , by the way , there 's [[your]60-dick cab]2337-your cab — at last . "[333-his] There was a sound of wheels outside , and , as [Dick]60-dick heard them , [he]60-dick grew desperate in [his]60-dick extremity ; a wish [he]60-dick had long secretly cherished unspoken , without ever hoping for courage to give it words , rose to [his]60-dick lips now ; [he]60-dick got up and moved timidly towards [[his]333-his father]242-his father . " [Father]2333-father , "[60-dick] [he]60-dick said , " there 's something [I]60-dick want to say to [you]2333-father so much before [I]60-dick go . Do let [me]60-dick ask [you]2333-father now . " Why , what do [you]2333-father mean ? It 's [an excellent school]2350-an excellent school — never saw a better expressed prospectus in [my]57-paul life . [I]57-paul 'm sure [I]57-paul do n't know what [you]2333-father would have . "[57-paul] " [I]60-dick 'd like to go to [Marlborough]11-marlborough , or [Harrow]12-harrow , or somewhere , "[60-dick] whimpered [Dick]60-dick . " [Jolland]78-jolland 's going to [Harrow]12-harrow at [Easter]13-easter . ( [[Jolland]78-jolland 's one of [the fellows at [Grimstone's]14-grimstone's]2358-the fellows at grimstone's]2357-jolland 's one of the fellows at grimstone's — [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's [I]57-paul mean . ) And what does [old Bangle]76-bangle know about it ? [He]76-bangle has n't got to go [there]2356-there [himself]76-bangle ! And — and [Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's jolly enough to [fellows]2360-fellows [he]62-dr. grimstone likes , but [he]62-dr. grimstone does n't like [me]57-paul — [he]62-dr. grimstone 's always sitting on [me]57-paul for something — and [I]57-paul hate [some of [the fellows there]2362-the fellows there]2361-some of the fellows there , and altogether it 's beastly . Do let [me]57-paul leave !
