"[57-paul] " It 's all ridiculous nonsense , [I]57-paul tell [you]57-paul , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul angrily , " ridiculous nonsense ! And , once for all , [I]57-paul 'll put a stop to it . [I]57-paul do n't approve of [public schools for [boys]2308-boys like [you]57-paul]2366-public schools for boys like you , and , what 's more , [I]57-paul ca n't afford it . As for [private tutors]2368-private tutors , that 's absurd ! So [you]57-paul will just make up [your]57-paul mind to stay at [Crichton House]4-crichton house as long as [I]57-paul think proper to keep [you]57-paul [there]2356-there , and there 's an end of that ! "[57-paul] At this final blow to all [his]57-paul hopes , [Dick]60-dick began to sob in a subdued hopeless kind of way , which was more than [[his]60-dick father]242-his father could bear . To do [Paul]57-paul justice , [he]57-paul had not meant to be quite so harsh when [the boy]246-the boy was about to set out for [school]226-school , and , a little ashamed of [his]57-paul irritation , [he]57-paul sought to justify [his]57-paul decision . [He]57-paul chose to do this by delivering a short homily on the advantages of school , by which [he]57-paul might lead [Dick]60-dick to look on the matter in the calm light of reason and common sense , and commonplaces on the subject began to rise to the surface of [his]60-dick mind , from the rather muddy depths to which they had long since sunk . [He]57-paul began to give [Dick]60-dick the benefit of all this stagnant wisdom , with a feeling of surprise as [he]57-paul went on , at [his]57-paul own powerful and original way of putting things .

" Now , [you]60-dick know , it 's no use to cry like that , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul began . " It's — ah — the usual thing for [[boys]2308-boys at [school]226-school]2371-boys at school , [I]57-paul 'm quite aware , to go about fancying [they]2308-boys 're very ill - used , and miserable , and all the rest of it , just as if [people in [my]57-paul position]2373-people in my position had [[their]2373-people in my position sons]2374-their sons educated out of spite ! It 's one of those petty troubles [all boys]2375-all boys have to go through . And [you]60-dick mark [my]57-paul words , [[my]57-paul boy]2376-my boy , when [they]2308-boys go out into [the world]2377-the world and have real trials to put up with , and [grow middle - aged men , like [me]57-paul]2378-grow middle - aged men , like me , why , [they]2308-boys see what fools [they]2308-boys 've been , [Dick]60-dick ; [they]2308-boys see what [fools]2379-fools [they]2308-boys 've been . All the — hum , the innocent games and delights of boyhood , and that sort of thing , [you]60-dick know — come back to [them]2308-boys — and then [they]2308-boys look back to those hours passed at school as the happiest , aye , the very happiest time of [their]2308-boys life ! "[57-paul] " Well , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , " then [I]60-dick hope it wo n't be the happiest time in [mine]60-dick , that 's all ! And [you]60-dick may have been happy at [the school [you]60-dick went to]2380-the school you went to , perhaps , but [I]60-dick do n't believe [you]60-dick would very much care about being [a boy]233-a boy again like [me]60-dick , and going back to [Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's , [you]60-dick know [you]60-dick would n't ! "[60-dick] This put [Paul]57-paul on [his]57-paul mettle ; [he]57-paul had warmed well to [his]57-paul subject , and could not let this open challenge pass unnoticed — it gave [him]57-paul such an opening for a cheap and easy effect . [He]57-paul still had the stone in [his]57-paul hand as [he]57-paul sank back into [his]57-paul chair , smiling with a tolerant superiority . " Perhaps [you]60-dick will believe [me]57-paul , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , impressively , " when [I]57-paul tell [you]60-dick , old as [I]57-paul am and much as [you]60-dick envy [me]57-paul , [I]57-paul only wish , at this very moment , [I]57-paul could be [a boy]233-a boy again , like [you]60-dick . Going back to [school]226-school would n't make [me]57-paul unhappy , [I]57-paul can tell [you]60-dick . "[57-paul] It is so fatally easy to say more than [we]339-we mean in the desire to make as strong an impression as possible . Well for most of [us]339-we that — more fortunate than [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul — [we]339-we can generally do so without fear of being taken too strictly at [our]339-we word . As [he]57-paul spoke these unlucky words , [he]57-paul felt a slight shiver , followed by a curious shrinking sensation all over [him]57-paul . It was odd , too , but the arm - chair in which [he]57-paul sat seemed to have grown so much bigger all at once . [He]57-paul felt a passing surprise , but concluded it must be fancy , and went on as comfortably as before . " [I]60-dick should like it , [[my]60-dick boy]2376-my boy , but what 's the good of wishing ? [I]60-dick only mention it to prove that [I]60-dick was not speaking at random . [I]60-dick 'm [an old man]2385-an old man and [you]2376-my boy 're [a young boy]2386-a young boy , and , that being so , why , of course — What the dooce are [you]2376-my boy giggling about ? "[60-dick] [For Dick]60-dick , after some seconds of half - frightened open - mouthed staring , had suddenly burst into a violent fit of almost hysterical giggling , which [he]57-paul seemed trying vainly to suppress . This naturally annoyed [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , and [he]57-paul went on with immense dignity , " [I]57-paul — ah — [I'm]57-paul not aware that [I]57-paul 've been saying anything particularly ridiculous . [You]60-dick seem to be amused ? "[57-paul] " Do n't ! "[60-dick] gasped [Dick]60-dick . " It , it is n't anything [you]2376-my boy 're saying — it 's , it's — oh , ca n't [you]60-dick feel any difference ? "[57-paul] " The sooner [you]60-dick go back to [school]226-school the better ! "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul angrily . " [I]57-paul wash [my]57-paul hands of [you]60-dick . When [I]57-paul do take the trouble to give [you]60-dick any advice , it 's received with ridicule . [You]60-dick always were [an ill - mannered little cub]2388-an ill - mannered little cub . [I]57-paul 've had quite enough of this . Leave [the room]213-the room , [sir]2329-sir ! "[57-paul] The wheels must have belonged to [some other cab]340-some other cab , for none had stopped at [the pavement]341-the pavement as yet ; but [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was justly indignant , and could stand the interview no longer . [Dick]60-dick , however , made no attempt to move ; [he]60-dick remained there , choking and shaking with laughter , while [[his]60-dick father]242-his father sat stiffly on [his]242-his father chair , trying to ignore [[his]242-his father son]225-his son 's unmannerly conduct , but only partially succeeding . [No one]2331-no one can calmly endure watching [other people]345-other people laughing at [him]60-dick like [idiots]346-idiots , while [he]60-dick is left perfectly incapable of guessing what [he]60-dick has said or done to amuse [them]345-other people . Even when this is known , it requires a peculiarly keen sense of humour to see the point of a joke against [oneself]347-oneself . At last [his]242-his father patience gave out , and [he]242-his father said coldly , " Now , perhaps , if [you]60-dick are quite [yourself]60-dick again , [you]60-dick will be good enough to let [me]242-his father know what the joke is ? "[242-his father] [Dick]60-dick , looking flushed and half - ashamed , tried again and again to speak , but each time the attempt was too much for [him]60-dick . After a time [he]60-dick did succeed , but [his]60-dick voice was hoarse and shaken with laughter as [he]60-dick spoke . " Have n't [you]60-dick found it out yet ? Go and look at [yourself]60-dick in the glass — it will make [you]60-dick roar ! "[60-dick] There was the usual narrow sheet of plate glass at the back of the sideboard , and to this [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul walked , almost under protest , and with a cold dignity . It occurred to [him]242-his father that [he]242-his father might have a smudge on [his]242-his father face or something wrong with [his]242-his father collar and tie — something to account to some extent for [[his]242-his father son]225-his son 's frivolous and insulting behaviour . No suspicion of the terrible truth crossed [his]242-his father mind as yet . Meanwhile [Dick]60-dick was looking on eagerly with a chuckle of anticipation , as [one who watches the dawning appreciation of an excellent joke]349-one who watches the dawning appreciation of an excellent joke . But no sooner had [Paul]57-paul met the reflection in the glass than [he]57-paul started back in incredulous horror — then returned and stared again and again . Surely , surely , this could not be [he]60-dick ! [He]57-paul had expected to see [his]57-paul own familiar portly bow - windowed presence there — but somehow , look as [he]57-paul would , the mirror insisted upon reflecting the figure of [[his]242-his father son]225-his son [Dick]60-dick . Could [he]57-paul possibly have become invisible and have lost the power of casting a reflection — or how was it that [Dick]60-dick , and only [Dick]60-dick , was to be seen [there]2356-there ? How was it , too , when [he]57-paul looked round , there was [the boy]246-the boy still sitting there ? It could not be [Dick]60-dick , evidently , that [he]57-paul saw in the glass . Besides , the reflection opposite [him]57-paul moved when [he]57-paul moved , returned when [he]57-paul returned , copied [his]57-paul every gesture ! [He]57-paul turned round upon [[his]242-his father son]225-his son with angry and yet hopeful suspicion . " [You]225-his son , [you]225-his son 've been playing some of [your]225-his son infernal tricks with this mirror , [sir]2329-sir , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul cried fiercely . " What have [you]225-his son done to it ? "[57-paul] " Done ! how could [I]57-paul do anything to it ? As if [you]225-his son did n't know that ! "[57-paul] " Then , "[57-paul] stammered [Paul]57-paul , determined to know the worst , " then do [you]225-his son , do [you]225-his son mean to tell [me]57-paul [you]225-his son can see any — alteration in [me]57-paul ? Tell [me]57-paul the truth now ! "[57-paul] " [I]60-dick should just think [I]60-dick could ! "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick emphatically . " It 's very queer , but just look here , "[57-paul] and [he]57-paul came up to the sideboard and placed [himself]57-paul by the side of [[his]57-paul horrified father]354-his horrified father . " Why , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , with another giggle , " [we're]2392-we're — [he]60-dick - [he]60-dick — as like as two peas ! "[57-paul] [They]355-they were indeed ; the glass reflected now [two small boys , each with chubby cheeks and auburn hair , both dressed , too , exactly alike]356-two small boys , each with chubby cheeks and auburn hair , both dressed , too , exactly alike , in Eton jackets and broad white collars ; the only difference to be seen between [them]356-two small boys , each with chubby cheeks and auburn hair , both dressed , too , exactly alike was that , while [one face]357-one face wore an expression of intense glee and satisfaction , the other — the one which [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was beginning to fear must belong to [him]57-paul — was lengthened and drawn with dismay and bewilderment . " [Dick]60-dick , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul faintly , " what is all this ? Who has been , been taking these liberties with [me]57-paul ? "[57-paul] " [I]60-dick 'm sure [I]60-dick do n't know , "[60-dick] protested [Dick]60-dick . " It was n't [me]60-dick . [I]60-dick believe [you]57-paul did it all [yourself]57-paul . "[60-dick] " Did it all [myself]57-paul ! "[57-paul] repeated [Paul]57-paul indignantly . " Is it likely [I]57-paul should ? It 's some trickery , [I]57-paul tell [you]57-paul , some villainous plot . The worst of it is , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul added plaintively , " [I]57-paul do n't understand who [I]57-paul 'm supposed to be now . [Dick]60-dick , who am [I]57-paul ? "[57-paul] " [You]57-paul ca n't be [me]60-dick , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , " because here [I]57-paul am , [you]57-paul know . And [you]57-paul 're not [yourself]57-paul , that 's very plain . [You]57-paul must be [somebody]2393-somebody , [I]57-paul suppose , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul added dubiously .

" Of course [I]57-paul am . What do [you]60-dick mean ? "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul angrily . " Never mind who [I]57-paul am . [I]57-paul feel just the same as [I]57-paul always did . Tell [me]57-paul when [you]57-paul first began to notice any change . Could [you]57-paul see it coming on at all , eh ? "[57-paul] " It was all at once , just as [you]57-paul were talking about [school]226-school and all that . [You]57-paul said [you]57-paul only wished — — Why of course ; look here , it must be the stone that did it ! "[57-paul] " Stone ! what stone ? "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul . " [I]57-paul do n't know what [you]57-paul 're talking about . "[57-paul] " Yes , [you]57-paul do — the Garudâ Stone ! [You]57-paul 've got it in [your]57-paul hand still . Do n't [you]57-paul see ? It 's a real talisman after all ! How jolly ! "[57-paul] " [I]57-paul did n't do anything to set it off ; and besides , oh , it 's perfectly absurd ! How can there be such things as talismans nowadays , eh ? Tell [me]57-paul that . "[57-paul] " Well , something 's happened to [you]57-paul , has n't it ? And it must have been done somehow , "[60-dick] argued [Dick]60-dick . " [I]57-paul was holding the confounded thing , certainly , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " here it is . But what could [I]57-paul have said to start it ? What has it done this to [me]57-paul for ? "[57-paul] " [I]60-dick know ! "[60-dick] cried [Dick]60-dick . " Do n't [you]57-paul remember ? [You]57-paul said [you]57-paul wished [you]57-paul were [a boy]233-a boy again , like [me]60-dick . So [you]57-paul are , [you]57-paul see , exactly like [me]60-dick ! What a lark it is , is n't it ? But , [I]60-dick say , [you]57-paul ca n't go up to business like that , [you]57-paul know , can [you]57-paul ? [I]60-dick tell [you]57-paul what , [you]57-paul 'd better come to [Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's with [me]60-dick now , and see how [you]57-paul like it . [I]60-dick should n't mind so much if [you]57-paul came too . [Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's face would be splendid when [he]62-dr. grimstone saw two of [us]2396-us . Do come ! "[60-dick] " That 's ridiculous nonsense [you]60-dick 're talking , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " and [you]60-dick know it . What should [I]57-paul do at [school]226-school at [my]57-paul age ? [I]57-paul tell [you]57-paul [I]57-paul 'm the same as ever inside , though [I]57-paul may have shrunk into [a little rascally boy to look at]2398-a little rascally boy to look at . And it 's simply an abominable nuisance , [Dick]60-dick , that 's what it is ! Why on earth could n't [you]60-dick let the stone alone ? Just see what mischief [you]60-dick 've done by meddling now — put [me]57-paul to all this inconvenience ! "[57-paul] " [You]60-dick should n't have wished , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick . " Wished ! "[60-dick] echoed [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul . " Why , to be sure , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , with a gleam of returning hopefulness , " of course — [I]57-paul never thought of that . The thing 's a wishing stone ; it must be ! [You]57-paul have to hold it , [I]57-paul suppose , and then say what [you]57-paul wish aloud , and there [you]57-paul are . If that 's the case , [I]57-paul can soon put it all right by simply wishing [myself]57-paul back again . [I]57-paul — [I]57-paul shall have a good laugh at all this by and by — [I]57-paul know [I]57-paul shall ! "[57-paul] [He]57-paul took the stone , and got into a corner by [himself]57-paul where [he]57-paul began repeating the words , " [I]57-paul wish [I]57-paul was back again , "[57-paul] " [I]57-paul wish [I]57-paul was [the man [I]57-paul was five minutes ago]2399-the man i was five minutes ago , "[57-paul] " [I]57-paul wish all this had not happened , "[57-paul] and so on , until [he]57-paul was very exhausted and red in the face . [He]57-paul tried with the stone held in [his]57-paul left hand , as well as [his]57-paul right , sitting and standing , under all the various conditions [he]57-paul could think of , but absolutely nothing came of it ; [he]57-paul was just as exasperatingly boyish and youthful as ever at the end of it . " [I]57-paul do n't like this , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said at last , giving it up with a rather crestfallen air . " It seems to [me]57-paul that this diabolical invention has got out of order somehow ; [I]57-paul ca n't make it work any more ! "[57-paul] " Perhaps , "[60-dick] suggested [Dick]60-dick , who had shown throughout the most unsympathetic cheerfulness , " perhaps it 's one of those talismans that only give [you]57-paul one wish , and [you]57-paul 've had it , [you]57-paul know ? "[60-dick] " Then it 's all over ! "[57-paul] groaned [Paul]57-paul . " What the dooce am [I]57-paul to do ? What shall [I]57-paul do ? Suggest something , for [Heaven]70-heaven 's sake ; do n't stand cackling there in that unfeeling manner . Ca n't [you]57-paul see what a terrible , mess [I]57-paul 've got into ? Suppose — only suppose [[your]57-paul sister]2321-your sister or [one of [the servants]2402-the servants]2401-one of the servants were to come in , and see [me]57-paul like this ! "[57-paul] This suggestion simply enchanted [Dick]60-dick . " Let 's have 'em all up , "[60-dick] [he]60-dick laughed ; " it would be such fun ! How [they]2403-they will laugh when [we]2404-we tell [them]2403-they ! "[60-dick] And [he]60-dick rushed to the bell . " Touch that bell if [you]60-dick dare ! "[57-paul] screamed [Paul]57-paul . " [I]57-paul wo n't be seen in this condition by [anybody]2344-anybody ! What on earth could have induced [that scoundrelly uncle of yours]2406-that scoundrelly uncle of yours to bring such a horrible thing as this over [I]57-paul ca n't imagine ! [I]57-paul never heard of such a situation as this in [my]57-paul life . [I]57-paul ca n't stay like this , [you]57-paul know — it 's not to be thought of ! [I]57-paul — [I]57-paul wonder whether it would be any use to send over to [Dr. Bustard]80-dr. bustard and ask [him]80-dr. bustard to step in ; [he]80-dr. bustard might give [me]57-paul something to bring [me]57-paul round . But then [the whole neighbourhood]2407-the whole neighbourhood would hear about it ! If [I]57-paul do n't see [my]57-paul way out of this soon , [I]57-paul shall go raving mad ! "[57-paul] And [he]57-paul paced restlessly up and down [the room]213-the room with [his]57-paul brain on fire . All at once , as [he]57-paul became able to think more coherently , there occurred to [him]57-paul a chance , slender and desperate enough , but still a chance , of escaping even yet the consequences of [his]57-paul folly . [He]57-paul was forced to conclude that , however improbable and fantastic it might appear in this rationalistic age , there must be some hidden power in this Garudâ Stone which had put [him]57-paul in [his]57-paul present very unpleasant position . It was plain too that the virtues of the talisman refused to exert themselves any more at [his]57-paul bidding . But it did not follow that in another 's hands the spell would remain as powerless . At all events , it was an experiment well worth the trial , and [he]57-paul lost no time in explaining the notion to [Dick]60-dick , who , by the sparkle in [his]60-dick eyes and suppressed excitement in [his]60-dick manner , seemed to think there might be something in it . " [I]60-dick may as well try , "[60-dick] [he]60-dick said , " give it to [me]60-dick . "[60-dick] " Take it , [[my]57-paul dear boy]2408-my dear boy , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , with a paternal air that sorely tried [Dick]60-dick 's recovered gravity , it contrasted so absurdly with [his]60-dick altered appearance . " Take it , and wish [[your]2408-my dear boy poor old father]2409-your poor old father [himself]2409-your poor old father again ! "[60-dick] [Dick]60-dick took it , and held it thoughtfully for some moments , while [Paul]57-paul waited in nervous impatience . " Is n't it any use ? "[60-dick] [he]60-dick said dolefully at last , as nothing happened . " [I]60-dick do n't know , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick calmly , " [I]60-dick have n't wished yet . "[60-dick] " Then do so at once , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul fussily , " do so at once . There 's no time to waste , every moment is of importance — [[your]2408-my dear boy cab]2337-your cab will be [here]2411-here directly . Although , although [I]57-paul 'm altered in this ridiculous way , [I]57-paul hope [I]57-paul still retain [my]57-paul authority as [a father]227-a father , and as [a father]227-a father , by [Gad]77-gad , [I]57-paul expect [you]57-paul to obey [me]57-paul , [sir]2329-sir ! "[57-paul] " Oh , all right , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick indifferently , " [you]60-dick may keep the authority if [you]60-dick like . "[60-dick] " Then do what [I]57-paul tell [you]57-paul . Ca n't [you]57-paul see how urgent it is that a scandal like this should n't get about ? [I]57-paul should be [the laughing - stock of [the city]2416-the city]2415-the laughing - stock of the city . [Not a soul]2417-not a soul must ever guess that such a thing has happened . [You]57-paul must see that [yourself]57-paul . "[57-paul] " Yes , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , who all this time was sitting on a corner of the table , swinging [his]60-dick legs , " [I]60-dick see that . It will be all right . [I]60-dick 'm going to wish in a minute , and [no one]2331-no one will guess there has been anything the matter . "[60-dick] " That 's [a good boy]2314-a good boy ! "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , much relieved , " [I]57-paul know [your]2314-a good boy heart is in the right place — only do make haste . "[57-paul] " [I]57-paul suppose , "[57-paul] [Dick]60-dick asked , " when [you]2314-a good boy are [yourself]2314-a good boy again , things would go on just as usual ? "[57-paul] " [I]57-paul — [I]57-paul hope so . "[57-paul] " [I]57-paul mean [you]2314-a good boy will go on sitting here , and [I]57-paul shall go off to [Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's ? "[57-paul] " Of course , of course , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul ; " do n't ask so many questions . [I]57-paul 'm sure [you]2314-a good boy quite understand what has to be done , so get on . [We]2420-we might be found like this any minute . "[57-paul] " That settles it , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , " [any fellow]2421-any fellow would do it after that . "[60-dick] " Yes , yes , but [you]60-dick 're so slow about it ! "[57-paul] " Do n't be in a hurry , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , " [you]2314-a good boy may n't like it after all when [I]60-dick 've done it . "[60-dick]

" Done what ? "[57-paul] asked [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul sharply , struck by something sinister and peculiar in [the boy]246-the boy 's manner . " Well , [I]60-dick do n't mind telling [you]57-paul , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , " it 's fairer . [You]57-paul see , [you]57-paul wished to be [a boy just like [me]60-dick]2422-a boy just like me , did n't [you]57-paul ? "[60-dick] " [I]57-paul did n't mean it , "[57-paul] protested [Paul]57-paul . " Ah , [you]2314-a good boy could n't expect a stone to know that ; at any rate , it made [you]2314-a good boy into [a boy like [me]57-paul]2423-a boy like me directly . Now , if [I]57-paul wish [myself]57-paul a man just like [you]2314-a good boy were ten minutes ago , before [you]2314-a good boy took the stone , that will put things all right again , wo n't it ? "[57-paul] " Is [the boy]246-the boy mad ? "[57-paul] cried [Paul]57-paul , horrified at this proposal . " Why , why , that would be worse than ever ! "[57-paul] " [I]60-dick do n't see that , "[60-dick] objected [Dick]60-dick , stubbornly . " [No one]2331-no one would know anything about it then . "[60-dick] " But , [[you]2314-a good boy little blockhead]2426-you little blockhead , ca n't [I]57-paul make [you]2314-a good boy understand ? It would n't do at all . [We]2427-we should both of [us]2427-we be wrong then — each with [the other]2428-the other 's personal appearance . "[57-paul] " Well , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick blandly , " [I]60-dick should n't mind that . "[60-dick] " But [I]57-paul should — [I]57-paul mind very much . [I]57-paul object strongly to such a — such a preposterous arrangement . And what 's more , [I]57-paul wo n't have it . Do [you]2314-a good boy hear , [I]57-paul forbid [you]2314-a good boy to think of any such thing . Give [me]57-paul back that stone . [I]57-paul ca n't trust [you]2314-a good boy with it after this . "[57-paul] " [I]60-dick ca n't help it , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick doggedly . " [You]2314-a good boy 've had [your]2314-a good boy wish , and [I]60-dick do n't see why [I]60-dick should n't have [mine]60-dick . [I]60-dick mean to have it , too . "[60-dick] " Why , [[you]60-dick unnatural little rascal]2429-you unnatural little rascal ! "[360-the justly - enraged father] cried [the justly - enraged father]360-the justly - enraged father , " do [you]60-dick mean to defy [me]360-the justly - enraged father ? [I]360-the justly - enraged father tell [you]60-dick [I]360-the justly - enraged father will have that stone ! Give it up this instant ! "[360-the justly - enraged father] and [he]360-the justly - enraged father made a movement towards [[his]360-the justly - enraged father son]225-his son , as if [he]360-the justly - enraged father meant to recover the talisman by main force . But [Dick]60-dick was too quick for [him]360-the justly - enraged father . Slipping off the table with great agility , [he]360-the justly - enraged father planted [himself]360-the justly - enraged father firmly on the hearth - rug , with the hand that held the stone clenched behind [his]360-the justly - enraged father back , and the other raised in self - defence . " [I]360-the justly - enraged father 'd much rather [you]60-dick would n't make [me]360-the justly - enraged father hit [you]60-dick , [you]60-dick know , "[360-the justly - enraged father] [he]360-the justly - enraged father said , " because , in spite of what 's happened , [you]60-dick 're still [[my]360-the justly - enraged father father]2430-my father , [I]360-the justly - enraged father suppose . But if [you]60-dick interfere with [me]360-the justly - enraged father before [I]360-the justly - enraged father 've done with this stone , [I]360-the justly - enraged father 'm afraid [I]360-the justly - enraged father shall have to punch [your]60-dick head . "[360-the justly - enraged father] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul retreated a few steps apprehensively , feeling [himself]57-paul no match for [[his]57-paul son]225-his son , except in size and general appearance ; and for some moments of really frightful intensity [they]363-they stood panting on the hearth - rug , each cautiously watching [the other]2428-the other , on [his]57-paul guard against stratagem and surprise . It was one of those painful domestic scenes which are fortunately rare between [father]2333-father and [son]366-son . Overhead , [the latest rollicking French polka]367-the latest rollicking french polka was being rattled out , with a savage irony of which [pianos , even by the best makers]368-pianos , even by the best makers , can at times be capable . Suddenly [Dick]60-dick drew [himself]60-dick up . " Stand out of [my]60-dick way ! "[60-dick] [he]60-dick cried excitedly , " [I]60-dick am going to do it . [I]60-dick wish [I]60-dick was [a man like [you]369-his unscrupulous son]2431-a man like you were just now ! "[60-dick] And as [he]60-dick spoke , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul had the bitterness of seeing [[his]57-paul unscrupulous son]369-his unscrupulous son swell out like the frog in the fable , till [he]60-dick stood there before [him]60-dick the exact duplicate of what [Paul]57-paul had so lately been ! The transformed [Dick]60-dick began to skip and dance round [the room]213-the room in high glee , with as much agility as [his]60-dick increased bulk would allow . " It 's all right , [you]369-his unscrupulous son see , "[60-dick] [he]60-dick said . " The old stone 's as good as ever . [You]369-his unscrupulous son ca n't say [anyone]2432-anyone would ever know , to look at [us]2433-us . "[60-dick] And then [he]60-dick threw [himself]60-dick panting into a chair , and began to laugh excitedly at the success of [his]60-dick unprincipled manœuvres . As for [Paul]57-paul , [he]60-dick was perfectly furious at having been so outwitted and overreached . It was a long time before [he]60-dick could command [his]60-dick voice sufficiently to say , savagely : " Well , [you]369-his unscrupulous son 've had [your]369-his unscrupulous son way , and a pretty mess [you]369-his unscrupulous son 've made of it . [We]2433-us 're both of [us]2433-us in false positions now . [I]60-dick hope [you]369-his unscrupulous son 're satisfied , [I]60-dick 'm sure . Do [you]369-his unscrupulous son think [you]369-his unscrupulous son 'll care about going back to [Crichton House]4-crichton house in [that state]2434-that state ? "[60-dick]

" No , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , very decidedly : " [I]60-dick 'm quite sure [I]60-dick should n't . "[60-dick] " Well , [I]57-paul ca n't help it . [You]369-his unscrupulous son 've brought it on [yourself]369-his unscrupulous son ; and , provided [the Doctor]248-the doctor sees no objection to take [you]369-his unscrupulous son back as [you]369-his unscrupulous son are and receive [you]369-his unscrupulous son as [one of [[his]248-the doctor pupils]2437-his pupils]2436-one of his pupils , [I]57-paul shall most certainly send [you]369-his unscrupulous son [there]2356-there . "[57-paul] [Paul]57-paul did not really mean this , [he]57-paul only meant to frighten [him]57-paul ; for [he]57-paul still trusted that , by letting [Boaler]67-boaler into the secret , the charm might be set in motion once more , and the difficulty comfortably overcome . But [his]57-paul threat had a most unfortunate effect upon [Dick]60-dick ; it hardened [him]60-dick to take a course [he]60-dick might otherwise have shrunk from . " Oh , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , " [you]60-dick 're going to do that ? But does n't it strike [you]60-dick that things are rather altered with [us]2439-us now ? "[57-paul] " They are , to a certain extent , of course , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " through [my]57-paul folly and [your]60-dick wicked cunning ; but a word or two of explanation from [me]57-paul — — "[57-paul] " [You]60-dick 'll find it will take more explanation than [you]60-dick think , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick ; " but , of course , [you]60-dick can try , if [you]60-dick think it worth while — when [you]60-dick get to [Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's . "[60-dick] " When [I,—I]57-paul do n't understand . When [I,—what]2440-i,—what did [you]57-paul say ? "[57-paul] gasped [Paul]57-paul . " Why , [you]60-dick see , "[60-dick] exclaimed [Dick]60-dick , " it would never have done for [us]2439-us both to go back ; [the chaps]2441-the chaps would have humbugged [us]2439-us so , and as [I]60-dick hate [the place]2442-the place and [you]60-dick seem so fond of being [a boy]233-a boy and going back to [school]226-school and that , [I]60-dick thought perhaps it would be best for [you]60-dick to go and see how [you]60-dick liked it ! "[60-dick] " [I]57-paul never will ! [I]57-paul 'll not stir from [this room]2445-this room ! [I]57-paul dare [you]60-dick to try to move [me]57-paul ! "[57-paul] cried [Paul]57-paul . And just then there was the sound of wheels outside once more . [They]371-they stopped before [the house]234-the house , the bell rang sharply — the long - expected cab had come at last . " [You]60-dick 've no time to lose , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , " get [your]60-dick coat on . "[60-dick] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul tried to treat the affair as a joke . [He]57-paul laughed a ghastly little laugh .

" Ha ! ha ! [you]60-dick 've fairly caught [[your]60-dick poor father]2446-your poor father this time ; [you]60-dick 've proved [him]2446-your poor father in the wrong . [I]57-paul admit [I]57-paul said more than [I]57-paul exactly meant . But that 's enough . Do n't drive a good joke too far ; shake hands , and let [us]371-they see if [we]371-they ca n't find a way out of this ! "[57-paul] But [Dick]60-dick only warmed [his]60-dick coat tails at the fire as [he]60-dick said , with a very ungenerous reminiscence of [[his]60-dick father]242-his father 's manner : " [You]60-dick are going back to [an excellent establishment]2447-an excellent establishment , where [you]60-dick will enjoy all the comforts of [home]296-home — [I]60-dick can specially recommend the stickjaw ; look out for it on Tuesdays and Fridays . [You]60-dick will once more take part in the games and lessons of happy boyhood . ( Did [you]60-dick ever play ' chevy ' when [you]60-dick were [a boy]233-a boy before ? [You]60-dick 'll enjoy chevy . ) And [you]60-dick will find [[your]60-dick companions]2327-your companions easy enough to get on with , if [you]60-dick do n't go giving [yourself]60-dick airs ; [they]2327-your companions wo n't stand airs . Now good - bye , [[my]60-dick boy]2376-my boy , and bless [you]60-dick ! "[60-dick] [Paul]57-paul stood staring stupidly at this outrageous assumption ; [he]57-paul could scarcely believe yet that it was meant in cruel earnest . Before [he]57-paul could answer , the door opened and [Boaler]67-boaler appeared . " Had a deal of trouble to find [a keb]2452-a keb , [sir]2329-sir , on a night like this , "[67-boaler] [he]67-boaler said to [the false Dick]374-the false dick , " but the luggage is all on top , and [the man]2317-the man says there 's plenty of time still . "[67-boaler] " Good - bye then , [[my]60-dick boy]2376-my boy , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , with well - assumed tenderness , but a rather dangerous light in [his]60-dick eye . " [My]57-paul compliments to [the Doctor]248-the doctor , remember . "[57-paul] [Paul]57-paul turned indignantly from [him]57-paul to [the butler]375-the butler ; [he]57-paul , at least , would stand by [him]57-paul . [Boaler]67-boaler would not see [a master who had always been fair , if not indulgent , to [him]67-boaler driven from [[his]67-boaler home]377-his home in this cold - blooded manner]376-a master who had always been fair , if not indulgent , to him driven from his home in this cold - blooded manner ! [He]67-boaler made two or three attempts to speak , for [his]67-boaler brain whirled so with scathing , burning things to say . [He]67-boaler would expose the fraud then and there , and defy [the impudent usurper]378-the impudent usurper ; [he]67-boaler would warn [every one]379-every one against this spurious pinchbeck imitation of [himself]67-boaler . [The whole household]380-the whole household should be summoned and called upon to judge between [the two]381-the two !

No doubt , if [he]67-boaler had had enough self - command to do all this effectually , while [Dick]60-dick had as yet not had the time thoroughly to adapt [himself]67-boaler to [his]67-boaler altered circumstances , [he]67-boaler might have turned the situation at the outset , and spared [himself]67-boaler some very painful experiences . But it is very often precisely those words which are the most vitally important to be said that refuse to pass [our]382-our lips on a sudden emergency . [We]382-our feel all the necessity of saying something at once , but the necessary words unaccountably desert [us]382-our at the critical moment . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul felt [himself]57-paul in this unfortunate position . [He]57-paul made more wild efforts to explain , but the sense of [his]57-paul danger only petrified [his]57-paul mind instead of stimulating it . Then [he]57-paul was spared further conflict . A dark mist rose before [his]57-paul eyes ; the walls of [the room]213-the room receded into infinite space ; and , with a loud singing in [his]57-paul ears , [he]57-paul fell , and seemed to [himself]57-paul to be sinking down , down , through the earth to the very crust of the antipodes . Then the blackness closed over [him]57-paul — and [he]57-paul knew no more . " [I]57-paul beseech [you]2457-you let [his]57-paul lack of years be no impediment to let [him]57-paul lack a reverend estimation , for [I]57-paul never knew so young a body with so old a head . "—Merchant[57-paul] of [Venice]15-venice , Act iv . When [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul recovered [his]57-paul senses , which was not for a considerable time , [he]57-paul found that [he]57-paul was being jolted along through [a broad well - lit thoroughfare]384-a broad well - lit thoroughfare , in [a musty four - wheeler]385-a musty four - wheeler . [His]57-paul head was by no means clear yet , and for some minutes [he]57-paul could hardly be said to think at all ; [he]57-paul merely lay back dreamily listening to the hard grinding jar of the cab windows vibrating in their grooves . [His]57-paul first distinct sensation was a vague wonder what [Barbara]64-barbara might be intending to give [him]57-paul for dinner , for , oddly enough , [he]57-paul felt far from hungry , and was conscious that [his]57-paul palate would require the adroitest witching . With the thought of dinner [[his]57-paul dining - room]386-his dining - room was almost inseparably associated , and then , with an instant rush of recollection , the whole scene there with the Garudâ Stone surged into [his]57-paul brain . [He]57-paul shuddered as [he]57-paul did so ; it had all been so real , so hideously vivid and coherent throughout . But all unpleasant impressions soon yielded to the delicious luxury of [his]57-paul present security . As [his]57-paul last conscious moment had been passed in [[his]57-paul own dining - room]387-his own dining - room , the fact that [he]57-paul opened [his]57-paul eyes in [a cab]2316-a cab , instead of confirming [his]57-paul worst fears , actually helped to restore [the unfortunate gentleman]389-the unfortunate gentleman 's serenity ; for [he]57-paul frequently drove [home]296-home from [the city]2416-the city in this manner , and believed [himself]57-paul now , instead of being , as was actually the case , in that marvellous region of cheap photography , rocking - horses , mild stone lions , and wheels and ladders — [the Euston Road]16-the euston road — to be bowling along [Holborn]17-holborn . Now that [he]57-paul was thoroughly awake [he]57-paul found positive amusement in going over each successive incident of [his]57-paul nightmare experience with the talisman , and smiling at the tricks [his]57-paul imagination had played [him]57-paul . " [I]57-paul wonder now how the dickens [I]57-paul came to dream such outrageous nonsense ! "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said to [himself]57-paul , for even [his]57-paul dreams were , as a rule , within the bounds of probability . But [he]57-paul was not long in tracing it to the devilled kidneys [he]57-paul had had at [the club]392-the club for lunch , and some curious old brown sherry [Robinson]81-robinson had given [him]57-paul afterwards at [[his]57-paul office]393-his office . " [Gad]77-gad , what a shock the thing has given [me]57-paul ! "[57-paul] [he]57-paul thought . " [I]57-paul can hardly shake off the feeling even now . "[57-paul] As a rule , after waking up on the verge of a fearful crisis , the effect of the horror fades swiftly away , as one detail after another evades a memory which is never too anxious to retain them , and each moment brings a deeper sense of relief and self - congratulation . But in [Paul]57-paul 's case , curiously enough , as [he]57-paul could not help thinking , the more completely roused [he]57-paul became , the greater grew [his]57-paul uneasiness . Perhaps the first indication of the truth was suggested to [him]57-paul by a lurking suspicion — which [he]57-paul tried to dismiss as mere fancy — that [he]57-paul filled rather less of [the cab]2315-the cab than [he]57-paul had always been accustomed to do . To reassure [himself]57-paul [he]57-paul set [his]57-paul thoughts to review all the proceedings of that day , feeling that if [he]57-paul could satisfactorily account for the time up to [his]57-paul taking [the cab]2315-the cab , that would be conclusive as to the unreality of any thing that appeared to have happened later in [[his]57-paul own house]396-his own house . [He]57-paul got on well enough till [he]57-paul came to the hour at which [he]57-paul had left [the office]397-the office , and then , search [his]57-paul memory as [he]57-paul would , [he]57-paul could not remember hailing [any cab]398-any cab ! Could it be another delusion , too , or was it the fact that [he]57-paul had found [himself]57-paul much pressed for time and had come [home]296-home by [the Underground]18-the underground to [Praed Street]19-praed street ? It must have been the day before , but that was Sunday . Saturday , then ? But the recollection seemed too recent and fresh ; and besides , on Saturday , [he]57-paul had left at two , and had taken [Barbara]64-barbara to see [Messrs. Maskelyne]82-messrs. maskelyne and [Cooke]83-cooke 's performance . Slowly , insidiously , but with irresistible force , the conviction crept upon [him]57-paul that [he]57-paul had dined , and dined well . " If [I]57-paul have dined already , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul told [himself]57-paul , " [I]57-paul ca n't be going [home]296-home to dinner ; and if [I]57-paul am not going [home]296-home to dinner , what — what am [I]57-paul doing in [this cab]2460-this cab ? "[57-paul] The bare idea that something might be wrong with [him]57-paul after all made [him]57-paul impatient to put an end to all suspense . [He]57-paul must knock this scotched nightmare once for all on the head by a deliberate appeal to [his]57-paul senses . [The cab]2315-the cab had passed [the lighted shops]401-the lighted shops now , and was driving between [squares]402-squares and [private houses]403-private houses , so that [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul had to wait until the sickly rays of a street lamp glanced into [the cab]2315-the cab for a moment , and , as [they]405-they did so , [he]57-paul put [his]57-paul feet up on the opposite seat and examined [his]57-paul boots and trousers with breathless eagerness . It was not to be denied ; they were not [his]57-paul ordinary boots , nor did [he]57-paul ever wear such trousers as [he]57-paul saw above them ! Always [a careful and punctiliously neat person]406-a careful and punctiliously neat person , [he]57-paul was more than commonly exacting concerning the make and polish of [his]57-paul boots and the set of [his]57-paul trousers . These boots were clumsy , square - toed , and thick - soled ; one was even patched on the side . The trousers were heavy and rough , of the kind advertised as " wear - resisting fabrics , suitable for [youths at school]2461-youths at school , "[57-paul] frayed at the ends , and shiny — shamefully shiny — about the knees ! In hot despair [he]57-paul rapidly passed [his]57-paul hands over [his]57-paul body . It felt unusually small and slim , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul being endowed with what is euphemistically termed a " presence , "[57-paul] and it was with an agony rarely felt at such a discovery that [he]57-paul realised that , for the first time for more than twenty years , [he]57-paul actually had a waist . Then , as a last resource , [he]57-paul took off [his]57-paul hat and felt for the broad , smooth , egg - like surface , garnished by scanty side patches of thin hair , which [he]57-paul knew [he]57-paul ought to find . It was gone — hidden under a crop of thick close curling locks ! This last disappointment completely overcame [him]57-paul ; [he]57-paul had a kind of short fit in [the cab]2315-the cab as the bitter truth was brought [home]296-home to [him]57-paul unmistakably . Yes , this was no dream of a distempered digestion , but sober reality . The whole of that horrible scene in [the dining - room]275-the dining - room had really taken place ; and now [he]57-paul , [Paul Bultitude]57-paul , [the widely - respected merchant of [Mincing Lane]2-mincing lane]410-the widely - respected merchant of mincing lane , [a man of means and position]411-a man of means and position , was being ignominiously packed off to [school]226-school as if [he]57-paul were actually [the schoolboy some hideous juggle]413-the schoolboy some hideous juggle had made [him]57-paul appear ! It was only with a violent effort that [he]57-paul could succeed in commanding [his]57-paul thoughts sufficiently to decide on some immediate action . " [I]57-paul must be cool , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul kept muttering to [himself]57-paul , with shaking lips , " quite cool and collected . Everything will depend on that now ! "[57-paul] It was some comfort to [him]57-paul in this extremity to recognise on the box the well - known broad back of [Clegg]84-clegg , [a cabman who stabled [his]84-clegg two horses in [some mews near [Praed Street]19-praed street , and whom [he]84-clegg had been accustomed to patronise in bad weather for several years]415-some mews near praed street , and whom he had been accustomed to patronise in bad weather for several years]414-a cabman who stabled his two horses in some mews near praed street , and whom he had been accustomed to patronise in bad weather for several years . [Clegg]84-clegg would know [him]84-clegg , in spite of [his]84-clegg ridiculous transformation . [His]84-clegg idea was to stop [the cab]2315-the cab , and turn round and drive [home]296-home again , when [they]418-they would find that [he]57-paul was not to be got rid of again quite so easily . If [Dick]60-dick imagined [he]60-dick meant to put up tamely with this kind of treatment , [he]60-dick was vastly mistaken ; [he]60-dick would return [home]296-home boldly and claim [his]60-dick rights ! [No reasonable person]420-no reasonable person could be perverse enough to doubt [his]60-dick identity when once matters came to the proof ; though at first , of course , [he]60-dick might find a difficulty in establishing it . [[His]60-dick children]421-his children , [[his]60-dick clerks]422-his clerks , and [[his]60-dick servants]423-his servants would soon get used to [his]60-dick appearance , and would learn to look below the mere surface , and then there was always the possibility of putting everything right by means of the magic stone . " [I]60-dick wo n't lose a minute ! "[60-dick] [he]60-dick said aloud ; and letting down the window , leaned out and shouted " Stop ! "[60-dick] till [he]60-dick was hoarse . But [Clegg]84-clegg either could not or would not hear ; [he]84-clegg drove on at full speed , a faster rate of progress than that adopted by [most drivers of [four - wheeled cabs]425-four - wheeled cabs]424-most drivers of four - wheeled cabs being one of [[his]84-clegg chief recommendations]426-his chief recommendations . [They]427-they were now passing [Euston]20-euston . It was a muggy , slushy night , with a thin brown fog wreathing [the houses]428-the houses and fading away above [their]428-the houses tops into a dull , slate - blue sky . [The wet street]429-the wet street looked like [a black canal]430-a black canal ; the blurred forms , less like [vehicles than nondescript boats]431-vehicles than nondescript boats , moving over [its]429-the wet street inky surface , were indistinctly reflected therein ; the gas - lights flared redly through the murky haze . It was not a pleasant evening in which to be out - of - doors . [Paul]57-paul would have opened [the cab]2315-the cab - door and jumped out had [he]57-paul dared , but [his]57-paul nerve failed [him]57-paul , and , indeed , considering the speed of [the cab]2315-the cab , the leap would have been dangerous to [a far more active person]434-a far more active person . So [he]84-clegg was forced to wait resignedly until [the station]280-the station should be reached , when [he]84-clegg determined to make [Clegg]84-clegg understand [his]84-clegg purpose with as little loss of time as possible . " [I]84-clegg must pay [him]84-clegg something extra , "[84-clegg] [he]84-clegg thought ; " [I]84-clegg 'll give [him]84-clegg a sovereign to take [me]84-clegg back . "[84-clegg] And [he]84-clegg searched [his]84-clegg pockets for the loose coin [he]84-clegg usually carried about with [him]84-clegg in such abundance ; there was no gold in any of them . [He]84-clegg found , however , a variety of minor and less negotiable articles , which [he]84-clegg fished out one by one from unknown depths — a curious collection . There was a stumpy German - silver pencil case , a broken prism from a crystal chandelier , a gilded Jew 's harp , a little book in which the leaves on being turned briskly , gave a semblance of motion to the sails of a black windmill drawn therein , [a broken tin soldier]436-a broken tin soldier , some Hong - Kong coppers with holes in them , and a quantity of little cogged wheels from the inside of a watch ; while a further search was rewarded by an irregular lump of toffee imperfectly enfolded in sticky brown paper . [He]84-clegg threw the whole of these treasures out of the window with indescribable disgust , and , feeling something like a purse in a side pocket , opened it eagerly . It held five shillings exactly , the coins corresponding to those [he]84-clegg had pushed across to [[his]84-clegg son]225-his son such a little while ago ! It did not seem to [him]84-clegg quite such a magnificent sum now as it had done then ; [he]84-clegg had shifted [his]84-clegg point of view .

It was too clear that the stone must have carried out [his]84-clegg thoughtless wish with scrupulous and conscientious exactness in every detail . [He]84-clegg had wanted , or said [he]84-clegg wanted , to be [a boy]233-a boy again like [Dick]60-dick , and accordingly [he]84-clegg had become [a perfect duplicate]439-a perfect duplicate , even to the contents of the pockets . Evidently nothing on the face of things showed the slightest difference . Yet — and here lay the sting of the metamorphosis — [he]84-clegg was conscious under it all of being [his]84-clegg old original self , in utter discordance with the youthful form in which [he]84-clegg was [an unwilling prisoner]440-an unwilling prisoner . By this time [the cab]2315-the cab had driven up [the sharp incline]442-the sharp incline , and under the high pointed archway of [St. Pancras terminus]25-st. pancras , and now drew up with a jerk against the steps leading to [the booking office]443-the booking office . [Paul]57-paul sprang out at once in a violent passion . " Here , [you]84-clegg , [Clegg]84-clegg ! "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , " why the devil did n't [you]84-clegg pull up when [I]57-paul told [you]84-clegg ? eh ? "[57-paul] [Clegg]84-clegg was [a burly , red - faced man , with a husky voice and a general manner]444-a burly , red - faced man , with a husky voice and a general manner which conveyed the impression that [he]84-clegg regarded teetotalism , as a principle , with something more than disapproval . " Why did n't [I]84-clegg pull up ? "[84-clegg] [he]84-clegg said , bending stiffly down from [his]84-clegg box . " 'Cause [I]84-clegg did n't want to lose [a good customer]2462-a good customer , that 's why [I]84-clegg did n't pull up ! "[84-clegg] " Do [you]84-clegg mean to say [you]84-clegg do n't know [me]84-clegg ? "[84-clegg] " Know [yer]84-clegg ? "[84-clegg] said [Clegg]84-clegg , with an approach to sentiment : " [I]84-clegg 've knowed [yer]84-clegg when [you]84-clegg was [a babby in frocks]2463-a babby in frocks . [I]84-clegg 've knowed [yer]84-clegg fust nuss ( and [a fine young woman]2464-a fine young woman [she]2464-a fine young woman were till [she]2464-a fine young woman took to drinking , as has been the ruin of many ) . [I]84-clegg 've knowed [yer]84-clegg in [Infancy]85-infancy 's hour and in [yer]84-clegg byhood 's bloom ! [I]84-clegg 've druv [yer]84-clegg to [this ' ere [werry]2466-werry station]2465-this ' ere werry station twice afore . Know [yer]84-clegg ! "[84-clegg] [Paul]57-paul saw the uselessness of arguing with [him]84-clegg . " Then , ah — drive [me]84-clegg back at once . Let those boxes alone . [I]84-clegg — [I've]84-clegg important business at [home]296-home which [I]84-clegg 'd forgotten . "[84-clegg] [Clegg]84-clegg gave a vinous wink . " Lor , [yer]84-clegg at it agin , "[84-clegg] [he]84-clegg said with admiration . " What [a artful young limb it]2468-a artful young limb it is ! But it ai n't what [yer]84-clegg may call good enough , so to speak , it ai n't . [Clegg]84-clegg do n't do that no more ! "[84-clegg] " Do n't do what ? "[57-paul] asked [Paul]57-paul . " Do n't drive [no young gents]2469-no young gents as is a - bein ' sent to school back agin into [[their]2469-no young gents family]2470-their family 's bosims , "[84-clegg] said [Clegg]84-clegg sententiously . " [You]84-clegg was took ill sudden in [my]84-clegg cab the larst time . The suddenness of the shock threw [him]57-paul completely off [his]57-paul balance . In an ordinary way the encounter would not of course have discomposed [him]57-paul , but now [he]57-paul would have given worlds for presence of mind enough either to rush past to [the cab]2315-the cab and secure [his]57-paul only chance of freedom before [the Doctor]248-the doctor had fully realised [his]57-paul intention , or else greet [him]57-paul affably and calmly , and , taking [him]57-paul quietly aside , explain [his]57-paul awkward position with an easy man - of - the - world air , which would ensure instant conviction . But both courses were equally impossible . [He]57-paul stood there , right in [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's path , with terrified starting eyes and quivering limbs , more like an unhappy guinea - pig expecting the advances of [a boa]497-a boa , than [a British merchant in the presence of [[his]57-paul son 's schoolmaster]494-his son 's schoolmaster]498-a british merchant in the presence of his son 's schoolmaster ! [He]57-paul was sick and faint with alarm , and the consciousness that appearances were all against [him]57-paul . There was nothing in the least extraordinary in the fact of [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's presence at [the station]280-the station . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul might easily have taken this into account as a very likely contingency and have provided accordingly , had [he]57-paul troubled to think , for it was [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's custom , upon the first day of the term , to come up to [town]502-town and meet as many of [[his]248-the doctor pupils]2437-his pupils upon [the platform]504-the platform as intended to return by [a train]505-a train previously specified at the foot of [the school]506-the school - bills ; and [Paul]57-paul had even expressly insisted upon [Dick]60-dick 's travelling under surveillance in this manner , thinking it necessary to keep [him]57-paul out of premature mischief . It makes a calamity doubly hard to bear when [one]271-one looks back and sees by what a trivial chance it has come upon [us]508-us , and how slight an effort would have averted it altogether ; and [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul cursed [his]57-paul own stupidity as [he]57-paul stood there , rooted to the ground , and saw the hansom ( a " patent safety "[57-paul] to [him]57-paul in sober earnest ) drive off and abandon [him]57-paul to [his]57-paul fate . " This is awful , "[57-paul] thought [Paul]57-paul , shrinking involuntarily ; " simply awful . [He]57-paul evidently has no idea who [I]57-paul really am . "[248-the doctor] When [they]515-our were alone [the Doctor]248-the doctor paced solemnly along in silence for some moments , while [Paul]57-paul , who had always been used to consider [himself]57-paul a fairly prominent object , whatever might be [his]57-paul surroundings , began to feel an altogether novel sensation of utter insignificance upon that immense brown plain of platform and under the huge span of the arches whose girders were lost in wreaths of mingled fog and smoke . Still [he]57-paul had some hope . Was it not possible , after all , that [the Doctor]248-the doctor had divined [his]248-the doctor secret and was searching for words delicate enough to convey [his]248-the doctor condolences ? " [I]248-the doctor wished to tell [you]57-paul , [Bultitude]57-paul , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor presently , and [his]248-the doctor first words dashed all [Paul]57-paul 's rising hopes , " that [I]248-the doctor hope [you]57-paul are returning this term with the resolve to do better things . "[57-paul] At any other time [Mr. Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude might have felt gratified by these eulogies , but just then [he]87-mr. bultitude was conscious that [he]87-mr. bultitude could lay no claim to them . " [I]62-dr. grimstone had a letter from [him]2521-your excellent father during the vacation , "[62-dr. grimstone] continued [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone , " a sweet letter , [Richard]87-mr. bultitude , breathing in every line [a father]227-a father 's anxiety and concern for [your]87-mr. bultitude welfare . "[57-paul] A few minutes ago , and it would have seemed to [Paul]57-paul so simple and easy a matter to point out to [the Doctor]248-the doctor the very excusable error into which [he]57-paul had fallen . "[57-paul] But in spite of [his]57-paul determination to unbosom [himself]57-paul without further delay , [he]57-paul knew that a kind of fascinated resignation was growing upon [him]57-paul and gaining firmer hold each minute . Something must be done to break the spell and burst the toils which were being woven round [him]57-paul before all effort became impossible . " And now , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , glancing up at the great clock - face on which a reflector cast a patch of dim yellow light , " [we]526-we must be thinking of starting . "[248-the doctor] And [they]526-we walked back towards [the book - stalls]527-the book - stalls with [their]527-the book - stalls cheery warmth of colour , past the glittering buffet , and on up [the platform]504-the platform , to a part where [six boys of various sizes]529-six boys of various sizes were standing huddled forlornly together under a gaslight . " [You]57-paul know [Tipping]71-tipping , of course ; [Coker]88-coker , too , [you]57-paul 've met before — and [Coggs]89-coggs . How are [you]57-paul , [Siggers]90-tipping ? [You]57-paul 're looking well . Ah , by the way , [I]248-the doctor see a new face — [Kiffin]91-kiffin , [I]248-the doctor think ? [Kiffin]91-kiffin , this is [Bultitude]71-tipping , who will make [himself]71-tipping [[your]57-paul mentor]2535-your mentor , [I]248-the doctor hope , and initiate [you]57-paul into [our]2536-our various manners and customs . "[248-the doctor] And , with a horrible dream - like sense of unreality , [Mr. Bultitude]71-tipping found [himself]71-tipping being greeted by [several entire strangers]535-several entire strangers with a degree of warmth embarrassing in the extreme . [He]71-tipping would have liked to protest and declare [himself]71-tipping there and then in [his]71-tipping true colours , but if this had been difficult alone with [the Doctor]248-the doctor under the clock , it was impossible now , and [he]71-tipping submitted ruefully enough to [their]535-several entire strangers unwelcome advances . [Tipping]71-tipping , [a tall , red - haired , raw - boned boy , with sleeves and trousers [he]71-tipping had outgrown , and immense boots , wrung [Paul]57-paul 's hand with misdirected energy , saying " how - de - do ? "[71-tipping] with a gruff superiority , mercifully tempered by a touch of sheepishness]537-a tall , red - haired , raw - boned boy , with sleeves and trousers he had outgrown , and immense boots , wrung paul 's hand with misdirected energy , saying " how - de - do ? " with a gruff superiority , mercifully tempered by a touch of sheepishness . [Coggs]89-coggs and [Coker]88-coker welcomed [him]57-paul with open arms as [an equal]538-an equal , while [Siggers]90-tipping , [a short , slight , sharp - featured boy , with a very fashionable hat and shirt - collars , and a horse - shoe pin]539-a short , slight , sharp - featured boy , with a very fashionable hat and shirt - collars , and a horse - shoe pin , drawled , " How are [you]57-paul , [old boy]2537-old boy ? "[90-tipping] with the languor of [a confirmed man about [town]502-town]540-a confirmed man about town .

[The other two]542-the other two were [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb , [a boy with a blooming complexion and a singularly sweet voice]543-a boy with a blooming complexion and a singularly sweet voice , and [the new - comer]544-the new - comer , [Kiffin]91-kiffin , who did not seem much more at home in the society of [other boys]545-other boys than [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul [himself]57-paul , for [he]57-paul kept nervously away from [them]542-the other two , shivering with the piteous self - abandonment of [an Italian greyhound]546-an italian greyhound . [Paul]57-paul was now convinced that unless [he]57-paul exerted [himself]57-paul considerably , [his]57-paul identity with [[his]57-paul son]225-his son would never even be questioned , and the danger roused [him]57-paul to a sudden determination . However [his]57-paul face and figure might belie [him]57-paul , nothing in [his]57-paul speech or conduct should encourage the mistake . Whatever it might cost [him]57-paul to overcome [his]57-paul fear of [the Doctor]248-the doctor , [he]57-paul would force [himself]57-paul to act and talk ostentatiously , as much like [his]57-paul own ordinary self as possible , during the journey down to [Market Rodwell]5-market rodwell , so as to prepare [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's mind for the disclosures [he]57-paul meant to make at the earliest opportunity . [He]57-paul was beginning to see that [the railway carriage]2530-the railway carriage , with [all those boys]551-all those boys sitting by and staring , would be an inconvenient place for so delicate and difficult a confession . [The guard]552-the guard having warned [intending passengers]553-intending passengers to take [their]553-intending passengers seats , and [Jolland]78-jolland , who had been unaccountably missing all this time , having appeared from the direction of [the refreshment buffet]554-the refreshment buffet , furtively brushing away some suspicious - looking flakes and crumbs from [his]78-jolland coat , and contrived to join [the party]555-the party unperceived , [they]551-all those boys all got into [a first - class compartment]556-a first - class compartment — [Paul]57-paul with the rest . [He]57-paul longed for moral courage to stand out boldly and refuse to leave [town]502-town , but , as [we]558-we have seen , it was beyond [his]57-paul powers , and [he]57-paul temporised . Very soon the whistle had sounded and [the train]2319-the train had begun to glide slowly out beyond [the platform]504-the platform and arch , past [the signal boxes]561-the signal boxes and [long low sheds]562-long low sheds and offices which are [the suburbs of [a large terminus]564-a large terminus]563-the suburbs of a large terminus — and then it was too late .

" [Boys]2308-boys are [capital fellows]2539-capital fellows in [their]2308-boys own way among [[their]2308-boys mates]2540-their mates ; but [they]2308-boys are [unwholesome companions for [grown people]2542-grown people]2541-unwholesome companions for grown people . "—Essays[93-elia] of [Elia]93-elia . For some time after [they]565-they were fairly started [the Doctor]248-the doctor read [his]248-the doctor evening paper with an air of impartial but severe criticism , and [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul as [he]57-paul sat opposite [him]57-paul next to the window , found [himself]57-paul overwhelmed with a new and very unpleasant timidity . [He]57-paul knew that , if [he]57-paul would free [himself]57-paul , this utterly unreasonable feeling must be wrestled with and overcome ; that now , if ever , was the time to assert [himself]57-paul , and prove that [he]57-paul was anything but the raw youth [he]57-paul was conscious of appearing . [He]57-paul had merely to speak and act , too , in [his]57-paul ordinary everyday manner ; to forget as far as possible the change that had affected [[his]57-paul outer man]567-his outer man , which was not so very difficult to do after all — and yet [his]57-paul heart sank lower and lower as each fresh telegraph post flitted past . " [I]57-paul will let [him]57-paul speak first , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul thought ; " then [I]57-paul shall be able to feel [my]57-paul way . "[57-paul] But there was more fear than caution in the resolve . At last , however , [the Doctor]248-the doctor laid down [his]248-the doctor paper , and , looking round with the glance of proprietorship on [[his]248-the doctor pupils]2437-his pupils , who had relapsed into a decorous and gloomy silence , observed : " Well , [boys]2308-boys , [you]2308-boys have had an unusually protracted vacation this time — owing to the unprecedented severity of the weather . [We]2544-we must try to make up for it by the zest and ardour with which [we]2544-we pursue [our]2544-we studies during the term . [I]248-the doctor intend to reduce the Easter holidays by a week by way of compensation . "[248-the doctor] This announcement ( which by no means relieved the general depression — [the boys]570-the boys receiving it with a sickly interest ) was good news to [Paul]57-paul , and even had the effect of making [him]57-paul forget [his]57-paul position for the time . " [I]57-paul 'm uncommonly glad to hear it , [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said heartily , " an excellent arrangement . [Boys]2308-boys have too many holidays as it is . There 's no reason , to [my]57-paul mind , why [parents]2546-parents should be [the sufferers by every snowstorm]2547-the sufferers by every snowstorm . It 's no joke , [I]57-paul can assure [you]2548-you , to have [a great idle boy]2549-a great idle boy hanging about the place eating [his]2549-a great idle boy empty head off ! "[57-paul] [A burglar enlarging upon the sanctity of the law of property]571-a burglar enlarging upon the sanctity of the law of property , or [a sheep exposing the fallacies of vegetarianism]572-a sheep exposing the fallacies of vegetarianism , could hardly have produced a greater sensation . [Every boy]573-every boy was roused from [his]573-every boy languor to stare and wonder at these traitorous sentiments , which , from the mouth of any but [a known and tried companion]574-a known and tried companion , would have roused bitter hostility and contempt . As it was , [their]570-the boys wonder became a rapturous admiration , and [they]570-the boys waited for the situation to develop with a fearful and secret joy . It was some time before [the Doctor]248-the doctor quite recovered [himself]248-the doctor ; then [he]248-the doctor said with a grim smile , " This is indeed finding [Saul]94-saul amongst [the prophets]2550-the prophets ; [your]2548-you sentiments , if sincere , [Bultitude]57-paul — [I]248-the doctor repeat , if sincere — are very creditable . But [I]248-the doctor am obliged to look upon [them]570-the boys with suspicion ! "[248-the doctor] Then , as if to dismiss a doubtful subject , [he]248-the doctor inquired generally , " And how have [you]2548-you all been spending [your]2548-you holidays , eh ! "[248-the doctor] There was no attempt to answer this question , it being felt probably that it was , like the conventional " How do [you]2548-you do ? "[248-the doctor] one to which an answer is neither desired nor expected , especially as [he]248-the doctor continued almost immediately , " [I]248-the doctor took [[my]248-the doctor boy]2376-my boy [Tom]95-tommy up to [town]502-town the week before Christmas to see the representation of the ' Agamemnon ' at [St. George 's Hall]23-st. george 's hall . The ' [Agamemnon]96-agamemnon , ' as most of [you]2548-you are doubtless aware , is a drama by [Æschylus]97-æschylus , [a Greek poet of established reputation]2553-a greek poet of established reputation . [I]248-the doctor was much pleased by the intelligent appreciation [Tom]95-tommy showed during the performance . [He]95-tommy distinctly recognised several words from [his]95-tommy Greek Grammar in the course of the dialogue . "[248-the doctor] [No one]2331-no one seemed capable of responding except [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , who dashed into the breach with an almost pathetic effort to maintain [his]57-paul accustomed stiffness .

" [I]57-paul may be old - fashioned , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , " very likely [I]57-paul am ; but [I]57-paul — ah — decidedly disapprove of taking [children]240-children to dramatic exhibitions of any kind . It unsettles [them]240-children , [sir]2329-sir — unsettles [them]240-children ! "[57-paul] [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone made no answer , but [he]62-dr. grimstone put a hand on each knee , and glared with pursed lips and a leonine bristle of the beard at [[his]62-dr. grimstone youthful critic]577-his youthful critic for some moments , after which [he]62-dr. grimstone returned to [his]62-dr. grimstone Globe with a short ominous cough . " [I]57-paul 've offended [him]57-paul now , "[57-paul] thought [Paul]57-paul . " [I]57-paul must be more careful what [I]57-paul say . But [I]57-paul 'll get [him]57-paul into conversation again presently . "[57-paul] So [he]62-dr. grimstone began at the first opportunity : " [You]248-the doctor have this evening 's paper , [I]62-dr. grimstone see . No telegrams of importance , [I]62-dr. grimstone suppose ? "[62-dr. grimstone] " No , [sir]2329-sir , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor shortly . " [I]57-paul saw a report in to - day 's Times , "[57-paul] said poor [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , with a desperate attempt at [his]57-paul most conversational and instructive manner , " [I]57-paul saw a report that the camphor crop was likely to be a failure this season . Now , it 's a very singular thing about camphor , that [the Japanese]2557-the japanese — — "[57-paul] ( [he]57-paul hoped to lead the conversation round to colonial produce , and thus open [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's eyes by the extent of [his]57-paul acquaintance with the subject ) . " [I]248-the doctor am already acquainted with the method of obtaining camphor , thank [you]2329-sir , [Bultitude]57-paul , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , with dangerous politeness . " [I]57-paul was about to observe , when [you]248-the doctor interrupted [me]57-paul , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " ( and this is really a fact that [I]57-paul doubt if [you]248-the doctor are aware of ) , that [the Japanese]2557-the japanese never — — "[57-paul] " Well , well , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , with some impatience , " probably [they]2557-the japanese never do , [sir]2329-sir , but [I]248-the doctor shall have other opportunities of finding out what [you]2329-sir have read about [the Japanese]98-the japanese . "[248-the doctor] But [he]248-the doctor glanced over the top of the paper at [the indignant [Paul]57-paul , who was not accustomed to have [his]57-paul information received in this manner , with less suspicion and a growing conviction that some influence during the holidays had changed [the boy]246-the boy from [a graceless young scapegrace]584-a graceless young scapegrace into [a prig of the first water]585-a prig of the first water]582-the indignant paul , who was not accustomed to have his information received in this manner , with less suspicion and a growing conviction that some influence during the holidays had changed the boy from a graceless young scapegrace into a prig of the first water . " [He]246-the boy 's most uncivil"—Mr[57-paul] . [Bultitude]57-paul told himself—"almost insulting , but [I]57-paul 'll go on . [I]57-paul 'm rousing [his]246-the boy curiosity . " If [I]248-the doctor did not know , [sir]2329-sir , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , now effectually roused , " that this was ill - timed buffoonery , and not an intentional insult , [I]248-the doctor should be seriously angry . "[57-paul] " That was [my]57-paul idea , certainly , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , much pleased . " [I]57-paul 'm very glad [you]57-paul take [me]57-paul , [Doctor]2564-doctor . " When the time comes [I]248-the doctor shall know how to deal with [you]57-paul .
