' [He]2735-the proctor could n't stand that , so [he]2735-the proctor called up [his]2735-the proctor bull - dogs . ' [I]109-mr. tinkler give [him]2735-the proctor in charge ! ' [he]2735-the proctor screamed out . ' [I]109-mr. tinkler 'll have [him]2735-the proctor sent down ! ' ' [I]109-mr. tinkler 'll send [you]2735-the proctor down first , ' said [I]109-mr. tinkler , and [I]109-mr. tinkler just gave [him]2735-the proctor a push — [I]109-mr. tinkler never meant to hurt [the fellow]2741-the fellow — and over [he]2735-the proctor went . [I]109-mr. tinkler rolled over a bull - dog to keep [him]2735-the proctor company , and , as [the other fellow]2742-the other fellow did n't want any more and stood aside to let [me]109-mr. tinkler pass , [I]109-mr. tinkler finished [my]109-mr. tinkler stroll and [my]109-mr. tinkler cigar . "[109-mr. tinkler] " Was [the Proctor]2735-the proctor hurt , [sir]2329-sir ? "[801-a small boy] inquired [a small boy]801-a small boy with great respect . " More frightened than hurt , [I]109-mr. tinkler always said , "[109-mr. tinkler] said [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler lightly , " but somehow [he]2735-the proctor never would proctorise any more — it spoilt [his]2735-the proctor nerve . [He]2735-the proctor was a good deal chaffed about it , but of course [no one]2331-no one ever knew [I]109-mr. tinkler 'd had anything to do with it ! "[109-mr. tinkler] With such tales of Homeric exploit did [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler inculcate a spirit of discipline and respect for authority . But although [he]109-mr. tinkler had indeed once encountered [a Proctor]2733-a proctor , and at night , [he]109-mr. tinkler did [himself]109-mr. tinkler great injustice by this version of the proceedings , which were , as a matter of fact , of a most peaceable and law - abiding character , and though followed by a pecuniary transaction the next day in which six - and - eightpence changed pockets , [the Proctors]803-the proctors continued [their]803-the proctors duties much as before , while [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler 's feelings towards [them]803-the proctors , which had ever been reverential in the extreme , were , if anything , intensified by the experience .

Upon this incident , however , [he]109-mr. tinkler had gradually embroidered the above exciting episode , until [he]109-mr. tinkler grew to believe at intervals that [he]109-mr. tinkler really had been [a devil of [a fellow]2500-a fellow in [his]109-mr. tinkler time]804-a devil of a fellow in his time , which , to do [him]109-mr. tinkler justice , was far from the case . [He]109-mr. tinkler might have gone on still further to calumniate [himself]109-mr. tinkler , and excite general envy and admiration thereby , if at that moment [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone had not happened to appear at the head of the cast - iron staircase that led down into [the playground]648-the playground ; whereupon [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler affected to be intensely interested in the game , which , as a kind of involuntary compliment to [the principal]807-the principal , about this time was galvanised into a sort of vigour . But [the Doctor]248-the doctor , after frowning gloomily down upon [them]803-the proctors for a minute or so , suddenly called " All in ! "[248-the doctor] [He]248-the doctor had several ways of saying this . Sometimes [he]248-the doctor would do so in a half - regretful tone , as [one]271-one [himself]248-the doctor obeying the call of duty ; sometimes [he]248-the doctor would appear for some minutes , [a benignant spectator]810-a benignant spectator , upon [the balcony]811-the balcony , and summon [them]803-the proctors to work at length with a lenient pity — for [he]248-the doctor was by no means [a hard - hearted man]812-a hard - hearted man ; but at other times [he]248-the doctor would step sharply and suddenly out and shout the word of command with a grim and ominous expression . On these last occasions [the school]506-the school generally prepared [itself]506-the school for a rather formidable quarter of an hour . This was the case now and , as a further portent , [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn was observed to come down and , after a few words with [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler , withdrew with [him]108-mr. blinkhorn through [the school]506-the school gate . " [He]62-dr. grimstone 's sent [them]2746-them out for a walk , "[90-tipping] said [Siggers]90-tipping , who was skilled in omens . " It 's a row ! "[90-tipping] Rows at [Crichton House]4-crichton house , although periodical , and therefore things to be forearmed against in some degree , were serious matters . [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone was [a quick - tempered man]815-a quick - tempered man , with a copious flow of words and a taste for indulging it . [He]62-dr. grimstone was also strongly prejudiced against many breaches of discipline which [others]2595-others might have considered trifling , and whenever [he]62-dr. grimstone had discovered any such breach [he]62-dr. grimstone could not rest until by all the means in [his]62-dr. grimstone power [he]62-dr. grimstone had ascertained exactly how many were implicated in the offence , and to what extent . [His]62-dr. grimstone usual method of doing this was to summon [the school]506-the school formally together and deliver an elaborate harangue , during which [he]62-dr. grimstone worked [himself]62-dr. grimstone by degrees into such a state of indignation that [[his]62-dr. grimstone hearers]818-his hearers were most of [them]818-his hearers terrified out of [their]818-his hearers senses , and very often [conscience - stricken offenders]819-conscience - stricken offenders would give [themselves]819-conscience - stricken offenders up as hopelessly detected and reveal transgressions altogether unsuspected by [him]62-dr. grimstone — much as a net brings up fish of all degrees of merit , or as heavy firing will raise drowned corpses to the surface . [Paul]57-paul naturally knew nothing of this peculiarity ; [he]57-paul had kept [himself]57-paul as usual apart from [the others]627-the others , and was now trying to compel [himself]57-paul to brave the terrors of [an avowal]821-an avowal at the first opportunity . [He]57-paul followed [the others]627-the others up the steps with an uneasy wonder whether , after all , [he]57-paul would not find [himself]57-paul ignominiously set down to learn lessons . [The boys]570-the boys filed into [the schoolroom]2641-the schoolroom in solemn silence , and took [their]570-the boys seats at the desks and along the brown tables . [The Doctor]248-the doctor was there before [them]570-the boys , standing up with one elbow resting upon a reading - stand , and with a suggestion of coming thunder in [his]248-the doctor look and attitude that , combined with the oppressive silence , made [some of [the boys]570-the boys]826-some of the boys feel positively ill . Presently [he]248-the doctor began . [He]248-the doctor said that , since [they]570-the boys had come together again , [he]248-the doctor had made a discovery concerning one among [them]570-the boys which , astounding as it was to [him]248-the doctor , and painful as [he]248-the doctor felt it to be compelled to make it known , concerned [them]570-the boys all to be aware of . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul could scarcely believe [his]57-paul ears . [His]57-paul secret was discovered , then ; the injury done [him]57-paul by [Dick]60-dick about to be repaired , and open restitution and apology offered [him]57-paul ! It was not perhaps precisely delicate on [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's part to make so public an affair of it , but so long as it ended well , [he]248-the doctor could afford to overlook that .

So [he]248-the doctor settled [himself]248-the doctor comfortably on a form with [his]248-the doctor back against a desk and [his]248-the doctor legs crossed , [his]248-the doctor expression indicating plainly that [he]248-the doctor knew what was coming and , on the whole , approved of it . " Ever since [I]248-the doctor have devoted [myself]248-the doctor to the cause of tuition , "[248-the doctor] continued [the Doctor]248-the doctor , " [I]248-the doctor have made it [my]248-the doctor object to provide [[boys]2308-boys under [my]248-the doctor roof]2748-boys under my roof with fare so abundant and so palatable that [they]2308-boys should have no excuse for obtaining extraneous luxuries . [I]248-the doctor have presided [myself]248-the doctor at [their]831-their meals , [I]248-the doctor have superintended [their]831-their very sports with a fatherly eye — — "[248-the doctor] Here [he]248-the doctor paused , and fixed [one or two of those nearest [him]248-the doctor]830-one or two of those nearest him with the fatherly eye in such a manner that [they]831-their writhed with confusion . " [He]248-the doctor 's wandering from the point , "[57-paul] thought [Paul]57-paul , a little puzzled . " [I]57-paul have done all this on one understanding — that the robustness of [your]2749-your constitutions , acquired by the plain , simple , but abundant regimen of [my]57-paul table , shall not be tampered with by the indulgence in any of the pampering products of confectionery . They are absolutely and unconditionally prohibited — as [every boy who hears [me]57-paul now knows perfectly well]2750-every boy who hears me now knows perfectly well ! "[57-paul] And yet " ( here [he]248-the doctor began gradually to relax [his]248-the doctor self - restraint and lash [himself]248-the doctor into a frenzy of indignation ) , "[57-paul] what do [I]0-i find ? There are some natures so essentially base , so incapable of being affected by kindness , so dead to honour and generosity , that [they]832-they will not scruple to conspire or set [themselves]832-they individually to escape and baffle the wise precautions undertaken for [their]832-they benefit . [I]0-i will not name [the dastards]833-the dastards at present — [they]833-the dastards [themselves]833-the dastards can look into [their]833-the dastards hearts and see [their]833-the dastards guilt reflected there — — " At this [every boy]573-every boy , beginning to see the tendency of [his]573-every boy denunciations , tried hard to assume an air of conscious innocence and grieved interest , the majority achieving conspicuous failure . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not like to think , " said [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone , "[0-i] that the evil has a wider existence than [I]0-i yet know of . It may be so ; nothing will surprise [me]0-i now . There may be some before [me]0-i trembling with the consciousness of secret guilt . If so , let [those boys]834-those boys make the only reparation in [their]834-those boys power , and give [themselves]834-those boys up in an honourable and straightforward manner ! " To this invitation , which indeed resembled that of the duck - destroying [Mrs. Bond]113-mrs. bond , [no one]2331-no one made any response . [They]834-those boys had grown too wary , and now preferred to play a waiting game . "[835-the being] Then let [the being]835-the being — for [I]0-i will not call [him]835-the being [boy]836-boy — who is known to [me]0-i , step forth and confess [his]835-the being fault publicly , and sue for pardon ! " thundered [the Doctor]248-the doctor , now warmed to [his]0-i theme . But the being declined from a feeling of modesty , and a faint hope that [somebody else]2754-somebody else might , after all , be [the person aimed at]2755-the person aimed at . "[0-i] Then [I]0-i name [him]835-the being ! " stormed [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone ; "[0-i] [Cornelius Coggs]89-coggs — stand up ! " [Coggs]89-coggs half rose in a limp manner , whimpering feebly , "[0-i] [Me]0-i , [sir]2329-sir ? Oh , please [sir]2329-sir — no , not [me]0-i , [sir]2329-sir ! " "[2329-sir] Yes , [you]2329-sir , [sir]2329-sir , and let [[your]2329-sir companions]2327-your companions regard [you]2329-sir with the contempt and abhorrence [you]2329-sir so richly merit ! " Here , needless to say , [the whole school]2673-the whole school glared at [poor Coggs]89-coggs with as much virtuous indignation as [they]2673-the whole school could summon up at such short notice ; for contempt is very infectious when communicated from high quarters . "[89-coggs] So , [Coggs]89-coggs , " said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , with a slow and withering scorn , "[89-coggs] so [you]89-coggs thought to defy [me]0-i ; to smuggle compressed illness and concentrated unhealthiness into [this school]2589-this school with impunity ? [You]89-coggs flattered [yourself]89-coggs that after [I]0-i had once confiscated [your]89-coggs contraband poisons , [you]89-coggs would hear no more of it ! [You]89-coggs deceived [yourself]89-coggs , [sir]2329-sir ! [I]0-i tell [you]89-coggs , once for all , that [I]0-i will not allow [you]89-coggs to contaminate [[your]89-coggs innocent schoolmates]844-your innocent schoolmates with [your]89-coggs gifts of surreptitious sweetmeats ; they shall not be perverted with [your]89-coggs pernicious peppermints , [sir]2329-sir ; [you]89-coggs shall not deprave [them]844-your innocent schoolmates by jujubes , or enervate [them]844-your innocent schoolmates with Turkish Delight ! [I]0-i will not expose [myself]0-i or [them]844-your innocent schoolmates to the inroads of disease invited here by [a hypocritical inmate of [[my]0-i walls]847-my walls]846-a hypocritical inmate of my walls . [The traitor]848-the traitor shall have [his]848-the traitor reward ! " All of which simply meant that [the Doctor]248-the doctor , having once had [a small boy]801-a small boy taken seriously ill from the effects of overeating [himself]0-i , was naturally anxious to avoid such an inconvenience for the future . "[848-the traitor] Thanks to the fearless honesty of [a youth]849-a youth , " continued [the Doctor]248-the doctor , "[849-a youth] who , in an eccentric manner , certainly , but with , [I]0-i do not doubt , the best of motives , opened [my]0-i eyes to the fell evil , [I]0-i am enabled to cope with it at its birth . [Richard Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude , [I]0-i take this occasion of publicly thanking and commending [you]87-mr. bultitude ; [your]87-mr. bultitude conduct was noble ! " [Mr. Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude was too angry and disappointed to speak . [He]87-mr. bultitude had thought [his]87-mr. bultitude path was going to be made smooth , and now all this ridiculous fuss was being made about a few peppermint lozenges . [He]87-mr. bultitude wished [he]87-mr. bultitude had never mentioned them . It was not the last time [he]87-mr. bultitude breathed that wish . "[87-mr. bultitude] As for [you]87-mr. bultitude , [Coggs]89-coggs , " said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , suddenly producing a lithe brown cane , "[87-mr. bultitude] [I]0-i shall make a public example of [you]87-mr. bultitude . " [Coggs]89-coggs stared idiotically and protested , but after a short and painful scene , was sent off up to [[his]89-coggs bedroom]2762-his bedroom , yelping like a kicked puppy . "[87-mr. bultitude] One word more , " said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , now almost calm again . "[87-mr. bultitude] [I]0-i know that [you]87-mr. bultitude all think with [me]0-i in [your]87-mr. bultitude horror of the treachery [I]0-i have just exposed . [I]0-i know that [you]87-mr. bultitude would scorn to participate in it . " ( A thrill and murmur , expressive of intense horror and scorn , went round the benches . ) "[87-mr. bultitude] [You]87-mr. bultitude are anxious to prove that [you]87-mr. bultitude do so beyond a doubt . " ( Again a murmur of assent . ) "[87-mr. bultitude] [I]0-i give [you]87-mr. bultitude all that opportunity . [I]0-i have implicit trust and confidence in [you]87-mr. bultitude — let [every boarder]850-every boarder go down into [the box - room]851-the box - room and fetch up [his]850-every boarder playbox , just as it is , and open it here before [me]0-i . " There was a general fall of jaws at this very unexpected conclusion ; but contriving to overcome [their]2764-their dismay , [they]2764-their went outside and down through [the playground]648-the playground into [the box - room]851-the box - room , [Paul]57-paul amongst [the rest]694-the rest , and amidst universal confusion , [everyone]680-everyone opened [his]680-everyone box , and , with a consideration especially laudable in heedless boyhood , thoughtfully and carefully removed from it all such dainties as might be calculated to shock or pain [their]2764-their preceptor . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul found a key which was labelled "[850-every boarder] playbox , " and began to open a box which bore [Dick]60-dick 's initials cut upon the lid ; without any apprehensions , however , for [he]57-paul had given too strict orders to [[his]57-paul daughter]2769-his daughter , to fear that any luxuries would be concealed there . But no sooner had [he]57-paul raised the lid than [he]57-paul staggered back with disgust . It was crammed with cakes , butterscotch , hardbake , pots of jam , and even a bottle of ginger wine — enough to compromise [a chameleon]2770-a chameleon ! [He]57-paul set [himself]57-paul to pitch them all out as soon as possible with feverish haste , but [Tipping]90-tipping was too quick for [him]57-paul . "[114-hallo] [Hallo]114-hallo ! " [he]0-i cried : "[0-i] oh , [I]0-i say , [[you]852-you fellows]2659-you fellows , come here ! Just look at this ! Here 's [this impudent young beggar , who sneaked of [poor old Coggs]89-coggs for sucking jujubes]854-this impudent young beggar , who sneaked of poor old coggs for sucking jujubes , and very nearly got [us]855-us all into a jolly good row , with [his]854-this impudent young beggar , who sneaked of poor old coggs for sucking jujubes own box full all the time ; butterscotch , if [you]852-you please , and jam , and ginger wine ! [You]852-you 'll just put ['em]856-'em all back again , will [you]852-you , [[you]852-you young humbug]857-you young humbug ! " "[852-you] Do [you]0-i use those words to [me]0-i , [sir]2329-sir ? " said [Paul]57-paul angrily , for [he]0-i did not like to be called [a humbug]2771-a humbug . "[0-i] Yes , [sir]2329-sir , please , [sir]2329-sir , " jeered [Tipping]90-tipping ; "[0-i] [I]0-i did venture to take such a liberty , [sir]2329-sir . " "[0-i] Then it was like [your]0-i infernal impudence , " growled [Paul]57-paul . "[0-i] [You]0-i be kind enough to leave [my]0-i affairs alone . Upon [my]0-i word , what [boys]2308-boys are coming to nowadays ! " "[0-i] Are [you]0-i going to put that tuck back ? " said [Tipping]90-tipping impatiently . "[0-i] No , [sir]2329-sir , [I]0-i 'm not . Do n't interfere with what [you]2329-sir 're not expected to understand ! " "[92-biddlecomb] Well , if [you]0-i wo n't , " said [Tipping]90-tipping easily , "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose [we]864-we must . This was neatly and quickly done . [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb tripped [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul up , and sat firmly on [him]92-biddlecomb , while [Tipping]90-tipping carefully replaced the good things in [Dick]60-dick 's box , after which [he]90-tipping locked it , and courteously returned the key . " As the box is heavy , "[90-tipping] [he]90-tipping said , with a wicked wink , " [I]90-tipping 'll carry it up for [you]57-paul [myself]90-tipping , "[90-tipping] which [he]90-tipping did , [Paul]57-paul following , more dead than alive , and too shaken even to expostulate . " [[Bultitude]57-paul 's box]2772-bultitude 's box was rather too heavy for [him]57-paul , [sir]2329-sir , "[90-tipping] [he]90-tipping explained as [he]90-tipping came in ; and [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone , who had quite recovered [his]62-dr. grimstone equanimity , smiled indulgently , and remarked that [he]62-dr. grimstone " liked to see the strong assisting the weak . "[62-dr. grimstone] All the boxes had by this time been brought up , and were ranged upon the tables , while [the Doctor]248-the doctor went round , making an almost formal inspection , like [a Custom House officer searching [compatriots]867-compatriots]866-a custom house officer searching compatriots , and becoming milder and milder as box after box opened to reveal a fair and innocent interior . [Paul]57-paul 's turn was coming very near , and [his]57-paul heart seemed to shrivel like a burst bladder . [He]57-paul fumbled with [his]57-paul key , and tried hard to lose it . It was terrible to have [oneself]868-oneself to apply the match which is to blow one to the winds . If — if — the idea was almost too horrible — but if [he]57-paul , [a blameless and respectable city merchant]869-a blameless and respectable city merchant , were actually to find [himself]57-paul served like [the miserable Coggs]89-coggs ! At last [the Doctor]248-the doctor actually stood by [him]57-paul . " Well , [[my]248-the doctor boy]2376-my boy , "[248-the doctor] [he]248-the doctor said , not unkindly , " [I]248-the doctor 'm not afraid of anything wrong here , at any rate . "[248-the doctor] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , who had the best reasons for not sharing [his]57-paul confidence , made some inarticulate sounds , and pretended to have a difficulty in turning the key . " Eh ? Come , open the box , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor with an altered manner . " What are [you]57-paul fumbling at it for in this — this highly suspicious manner ? [I]248-the doctor 'll open it [myself]248-the doctor . "[248-the doctor] [He]248-the doctor took the key and opened the lid , when the cakes and wine stood revealed in all their damning profusion . [The Doctor]248-the doctor stepped back dramatically . " Hardbake ! "[248-the doctor] [he]248-the doctor gasped ; " wine , pots of strawberry jam ! Oh , [Bultitude]57-paul , this is a revelation indeed ! So [I]248-the doctor have nourished [one more viper]2775-one more viper in [my]248-the doctor bosom , have [I]248-the doctor ? A crawling reptile which curries favour by denouncing the very crime it conceals in its playbox ! [Bultitude]57-paul , [I]248-the doctor was not prepared for such duplicity as this ! "[248-the doctor] " [I]57-paul — [I]57-paul swear [I]57-paul never put them in ! "[57-paul] protested the unhappy [Paul]57-paul . " [I]57-paul — [I]57-paul never touch such things : they would bring on [my]57-paul gout in half - an - hour . It 's ridiculous to punish [me]57-paul . [I]57-paul never knew [they]2776-they were there ! "[57-paul] " Then why were [you]57-paul so anxious to avoid opening the box ? "[248-the doctor] rejoined [the Doctor]248-the doctor . " No , [sir]2329-sir , [you]57-paul 're too ingenious ; [your]57-paul guilt is clear . Go to [[your]57-paul dormitory]2680-your dormitory , and wait there till [I]57-paul come to [you]57-paul ! "[57-paul] [Paul]57-paul went [upstairs]264-upstairs , feeling utterly abandoned and helpless . Though a word as to [his]57-paul real character might have saved [him]57-paul , [he]57-paul could not have said it , and , worse still , knew now that [he]57-paul could not . " [I]57-paul shall be caned , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul told [himself]57-paul , and the thought nearly drove [him]57-paul mad . " [I]57-paul know [I]57-paul shall be caned ! What on earth shall [I]57-paul do ? "[57-paul] [He]57-paul opened the door of [[his]57-paul bedroom]2762-his bedroom . "[877-my] [They]877-my were revolving slowly round the chair , watching [each other]878-each other 's eyes like [gladiators]879-gladiators , when [Paul]57-paul noticed a sudden blankness and fixity in [[his]57-paul antagonist]880-his antagonist 's expression , and , looking round , saw [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's awful form framed in the doorway , and gave [himself]57-paul up for lost . " [I]57-paul subscribe to [Lucian]115-lucian : ' tis an elegant thing which cheareth up the mind , exerciseth the body , delights [the spectators]2785-the spectators , which teacheth many comely gestures , equally affecting the ears , eyes and soul itself . "—Burton[57-paul] , on Dancing . " What is this ? "[62-dr. grimstone] asked [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone in [his]62-dr. grimstone most blood - curdling tone , after a most impressive pause at the dormitory door . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul held [his]57-paul tongue , but kept fast hold of [his]57-paul chair , which [he]57-paul held before [him]57-paul as a defence against [either party]881-either party , while [Coggs]89-coggs remained motionless in the centre of [the room]213-the room , with crooked knees and hands dangling impotently . " Will one of [you]2786-you be good enough to explain how [you]2786-you come to be found struggling in this unseemly manner ? [I]89-coggs sent [you]2786-you up here to meditate on [your]2786-you past behaviour . "[89-coggs] " [I]57-paul should be most happy to meditate , [sir]2329-sir , "[57-paul] protested [Paul]57-paul , lowering [his]57-paul chair on discovering that there was no immediate danger , " if that — [that bloodthirsty young ruffian there]2788-that bloodthirsty young ruffian there would allow [me]57-paul to do so . [I]57-paul am going about in bodily fear of [him]57-paul , [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone . [I]57-paul want [him]57-paul bound over to keep the peace . [I]57-paul decline to be left alone with [him]57-paul — [he]57-paul 's not safe ! "[57-paul] " Is that so , [Coggs]89-coggs ? "[89-coggs] " [He]57-paul can fight when [he]57-paul chooses , [sir]2329-sir , "[89-coggs] said [Coggs]89-coggs ; " [he]57-paul blacked [my]89-coggs eye last term , [sir]2329-sir ! "[89-coggs] " [I]57-paul assure [you]2329-sir , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , with the convincing earnestness of truth , " that [I]57-paul never blacked [anybody]2344-anybody 's eye in the whole course of [my]57-paul life . "[62-dr. grimstone] " If [you]2329-sir would allow [me]57-paul an opportunity of explaining [my]57-paul position , [sir]2329-sir , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " [I]57-paul would undertake to clear [your]2329-sir mind directly of such a monstrous idea . [I]57-paul am trying to assert [my]57-paul rights , [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone — [my]57-paul rights as [a citizen]2798-a citizen , as [a householder]2799-a householder ! This is no place for [me]57-paul , and [I]57-paul appeal to [you]2329-sir to set [me]57-paul free . If [you]2329-sir only knew one tenth — — "[57-paul] " Let [us]2800-us understand [one another]2508-one another , [Bultitude]57-paul , "[248-the doctor] interrupted [the Doctor]248-the doctor . " [You]2329-sir may think it an excellent joke to talk nonsense to [me]248-the doctor like this . But let [me]248-the doctor tell [you]2329-sir there is a point where a jest becomes an insult . [I]248-the doctor 've spared [you]2329-sir hitherto out of consideration for the feelings of [[your]2329-sir excellent father]2521-your excellent father , who is so anxious that [you]2329-sir should become an object of pride and credit to [him]2521-your excellent father ; but if [you]2329-sir dare to treat [me]248-the doctor to any more of this bombast about ' explaining [your]2329-sir rights , ' [you]2329-sir will force [me]248-the doctor to exercise one of [mine]248-the doctor — the right to inflict corporal punishment , [sir]2329-sir — which [you]2329-sir have just seen in operation upon another . "[248-the doctor] " Oh ! "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul faintly , feeling utterly crestfallen — and [he]57-paul could say nothing more . " As for those illicit luxuries in [your]2329-sir playbox , "[248-the doctor] continued [the Doctor]248-the doctor , " the fact that [you]2329-sir brought the box up as it was is in [your]2329-sir favour ; and [I]248-the doctor am inclined on reflection to overlook the affair , if [you]2329-sir can assure [me]248-the doctor that [you]2329-sir were [no party]2804-no party to [their]2805-their being put [there]2356-there ? "[248-the doctor] " On the contrary , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " [I]57-paul gave the strictest orders that there was to be no such useless extravagance . [I]57-paul objected to have [the kitchen]2807-the kitchen and [[housekeeper]2808-housekeeper 's room]2809-housekeeper 's room ransacked to make a set of [rascally boys]2810-rascally boys ill for a fortnight at [my]57-paul expense ! "[57-paul] [The Doctor]248-the doctor stared slightly at this creditable but unnatural view of the subject . However , as [he]248-the doctor could not quarrel with the sentiment , [he]248-the doctor let the manner of expressing it pass unrebuked for the present , and , after sentencing [Coggs]89-coggs to two days ' detention and the copying of innumerable French verbs , [he]248-the doctor sent [the ill - matched pair]886-the ill - matched pair down to [the schoolroom]2641-the schoolroom to join [their]886-the ill - matched pair respective classes . [Paul]57-paul went resignedly [downstairs]268-downstairs and into [the room]213-the room , where [he]57-paul found [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn at the head of one of the long tables , taking a class of about [a dozen boys]890-a dozen boys . " Take [your]57-paul Livy and Latin Primer , Bultitude , "[108-mr. blinkhorn] said [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn mildly , " and sit down . "[108-mr. blinkhorn] [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn was [a tall angular man , with a long neck and slightly drooping head]891-a tall angular man , with a long neck and slightly drooping head . [He]108-mr. blinkhorn had thin wiry brown hair , and a plain face , with shortsighted kind brown eyes . In character [he]108-mr. blinkhorn was mild and reserved , too conscientious to allow [himself]108-mr. blinkhorn the luxury of either favourites or aversions among [the boys]570-the boys , all of whom in [his]108-mr. blinkhorn secret soul [he]108-mr. blinkhorn probably disliked about equally , though [he]108-mr. blinkhorn neither said nor did anything to show it . [Paul]57-paul took a book — any book , for [he]57-paul did not know or care to know one from another — and sat down at the end furthest from [the master]893-the master , inwardly rebelling at having education thus forced upon [him]57-paul at [his]57-paul advanced years , but seeing no escape . " At dinner time , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul resolved desperately , " [I]57-paul will insist on speaking out , but just now it is simply prudent to humour [them]894-the rest of the class . "[57-paul] [The rest of the class]894-the rest of the class drew away from [him]57-paul with marked coldness and occasionally saluted [him]57-paul ( when [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn 's attention was called away ) with terms and grimaces which [Paul]57-paul , although [he]57-paul failed thoroughly to understand them , felt instinctively were not intended as compliments . [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn 's notions of discipline were qualified by a sportsmanlike instinct which forbade [him]108-mr. blinkhorn to harass [a boy already in trouble]895-a boy already in trouble , as [he]108-mr. blinkhorn understood [young Bultitude]57-paul had been , and so [he]108-mr. blinkhorn forbore from pressing [him]57-paul to take any share in the class work . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul therefore was saved from any necessity of betraying [his]57-paul total ignorance of [[his]57-paul author]896-his author , and sat gloomily on the hard form , impatiently watching the minute - hand skulk round the mean dull face of the clock above the chimney - piece , while around [him]57-paul [one boy]671-one boy after another droned out a listless translation of the work before [him]57-paul , interrupted by mild corrections and comments from [the master]893-the master . What a preposterous change from all [his]57-paul ordinary habits ! At this very time , only twenty - four hours since , [he]57-paul was stepping slowly and majestically towards [[his]57-paul accustomed omnibus]899-his accustomed omnibus , which was waiting with deference for [him]57-paul to overtake it ; [he]57-paul was taking [his]57-paul seat , saluted respectfully by [the conductor]900-the conductor and cheerily by [[his]57-paul fellow - passengers]901-his fellow - passengers , as [a man of recognised mark and position]902-a man of recognised mark and position . Now that omnibus would halt at [the corner of [Westbourne Terrace]3-westbourne terrace]903-the corner of westbourne terrace in vain , and go on its way Bankwards without [him]57-paul . [He]57-paul was many miles away — in the very last place where [anyone]2432-anyone would be likely to look for [him]57-paul , occupying the post of " [whipping - boy "[57-paul] to [[his]893-the master miserable son]905-his miserable son]2811-whipping - boy " to his miserable son ! Was ever [an inoffensive and respectable gentleman]906-an inoffensive and respectable gentleman placed in a more false and ridiculous position ? If [he]57-paul had only kept [his]57-paul drawer locked , and hidden the abominable Garudâ Stone away from [Dick]60-dick 's prying eyes ; if [he]57-paul had let the moralising alone ; if [Boaler]67-boaler had not been so long fetching [that cab]2328-that cab , or if [he]67-boaler had not happened to faint at the critical moment — what an immense difference any one of these apparent trifles would have made . And now what was [he]57-paul to do to get out of [this incongruous and distasteful place]908-this incongruous and distasteful place ? It was all very well to say that [he]57-paul had only to insist upon a hearing from [the Doctor]248-the doctor , but what if , as [he]57-paul had very grave reason to fear , [the Doctor]248-the doctor should absolutely refuse to listen , should even proceed to carry out [his]57-paul horrible threat ? Must [he]57-paul remain [there]2356-there till the holidays came to release [him]57-paul ? Suppose [Dick]60-dick — as [he]60-dick certainly would unless [he]60-dick was quite [a fool]591-a fool — declined to receive [him]57-paul during the holidays ? It was absolutely necessary to return [home]296-home at once ; every additional hour [he]57-paul passed in imprisonment made it harder to regain [his]57-paul lost self . Now and then [he]57-paul roused [himself]57-paul from all these gloomy thoughts to observe [[his]57-paul companions]2323-his companions . [The boys at the upper end]915-the boys at the upper end , near [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn , were fairly attentive , and [he]57-paul noticed [one small smug - faced boy about half - way up]916-one small smug - faced boy about half - way up , who , while [a class - mate]917-a class - mate was faltering and blundering over some question , would cry " [I]916-one small smug - faced boy about half - way up know , [sir]2329-sir . Let [me]916-one small smug - faced boy about half - way up tell [him]918-one wild - eyed long - haired boy . Ask [me]916-one small smug - faced boy about half - way up , [sir]2329-sir ! "[916-one small smug - faced boy about half - way up] in a restless agony of superior information . Down by [Paul]57-paul , however , the discipline was relaxed enough , as perhaps could only be expected on the first day of term . [One wild - eyed long - haired boy]918-one wild - eyed long - haired boy had brought out a small china figure with which , and the assistance of [his]918-one wild - eyed long - haired boy right hand draped in a pocket handkerchief , and wielding a penholder , [he]918-one wild - eyed long - haired boy was busy enacting a drama based on the lines of [Punch]116-punch and [Judy]117-judy , to the breathless amusement of [[his]918-one wild - eyed long - haired boy neighbours]707-his neighbours . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul might have hoped to escape notice by a policy of judicious self - effacement , but unhappily [his]57-paul long , blank , uninterested face was held by [[his]57-paul companions]2323-his companions to bear an implied reproach ; and being delicately sensitive on this point , [they]2323-his companions kicked [his]57-paul legs viciously , which made [him]57-paul extremely glad when dinnertime came , although [he]57-paul felt too faint and bilious to be tempted by anything but the lightest and daintiest luncheon . But at dinner [he]57-paul found , with a shudder , that [he]57-paul was expected to swallow a thick ragged section of boiled mutton which had been carved and helped so long before [he]57-paul sat down to it , that the stagnant gravy was chilled and congealed into patches of greasy white . [He]57-paul managed to swallow it with many pauses of invincible disgust — only to find it replaced by a solid slab of pale brown suet pudding , sparsely bedewed with unctuous black treacle . This , though a plentiful , and by no means unwholesome fare for [growing boys]921-growing boys , was not what [he]57-paul had been accustomed to , and feeling far too heavy and unwell after it to venture upon an encounter with [the Doctor]248-the doctor , [he]57-paul wandered slow and melancholy round [the bare gravelled playground]923-the bare gravelled playground during the half - hour after dinner devoted to the inevitable " chevy , "[248-the doctor] until [the Doctor]248-the doctor appeared at the head of the staircase . It is always sad for [the historian]925-the historian to have to record a departure from principle , and [I]0-i have to confess with shame on [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's account that , feeling [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's eye upon [him]57-paul , and striving to propitiate [him]57-paul , [he]57-paul humiliated [himself]57-paul so far as to run about with an elaborate affection of zest , and [his]57-paul exertions were rewarded by hearing [himself]57-paul cordially encouraged to further efforts . It cheered and emboldened [him]57-paul . " [I]57-paul 've put [him]57-paul in a good temper , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul told [himself]57-paul ; " if [I]57-paul can only keep [him]57-paul in one till the evening , [I]57-paul really think [I]57-paul might be able to go up and tell [him]57-paul what a ridiculous mess [I]57-paul 've got into . Why should [I]57-paul care , after all ? At least [I]57-paul 've done nothing to be ashamed of . It 's an accident that might have happened to [any man]2814-any man ! "[57-paul] It is a curious and unpleasant thing that , however reassuring and convincing the arguments may be with which [we]927-we succeed in bracing [ourselves]927-we to meet or disregard unpleasantness , the force of those arguments seldom or never outlasts the frame of mind in which they are composed , and when the unpleasantness is at hand , there [we]927-we are , just as unreasonably alarmed at it as ever . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's confidence faded away almost as soon as [he]57-paul found [himself]57-paul in [the schoolroom]2641-the schoolroom again . [He]57-paul found [himself]57-paul assigned to [a class at one end of [the room]213-the room]929-a class at one end of the room , where [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler presently introduced a new rule in [Algebra]31-algebra to [them]931-them , in such a manner as to procure for it a lasting unpopularity with [all those who were not too much engaged in drawing duels]932-all those who were not too much engaged in drawing duels and [railway trains]933-railway trains upon [their]932-all those who were not too much engaged in drawing duels slates to attend . Although [Paul]57-paul did not draw upon [his]57-paul slate , [his]57-paul utter ignorance of [Algebra]31-algebra prevented [him]57-paul from being much edified by the cabalistic signs on the blackboard , which [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler seemed to chalk up dubiously , and rub out again as soon as possible , with an air of being ashamed of [them]931-them . So [he]57-paul tried to nerve [himself]57-paul for the coming ordeal by furtively watching and studying [the Doctor , who was taking a Xenophon class at the upper end of [the room]213-the room]934-the doctor , who was taking a xenophon class at the upper end of the room , and , being in fairly good humour , was combining instruction with amusement in a manner peculiarly [his]57-paul own . [He]57-paul stopped the construing occasionally to illustrate some word or passage by an anecdote ; [he]57-paul condescended to enliven the translation here and there by a familiar and colloquial paraphrase ; [he]57-paul magnanimously refrained from pressing any obviously inconvenient questions ; and [his]57-paul manner generally was marked by a geniality which was additionally piquant from its extreme uncertainty . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul could not help thinking it a rather ghastly form of gaiety , but [he]57-paul hoped it might last . Presently , however , [some one]260-some one brought [him]57-paul a blue envelope on a tray . [He]57-paul read it , and a frown gathered on [his]57-paul face . [The boy who was translating at the time]937-the boy who was translating at the time went on again in [his]937-the boy who was translating at the time former slipshod manner ( which had hitherto provoked only jovial criticism and correction ) with complete self - complacency , but found [himself]937-the boy who was translating at the time sternly brought to book , and burdened by a heavy imposition , before [he]937-the boy who was translating at the time quite realised that [his]937-the boy who was translating at the time blunders had ceased to amuse . Then began a season of sore trial and tribulation for [the class]938-the class . [The Doctor]248-the doctor suddenly withdrew the light of [his]248-the doctor countenance from [them]938-the class , and sunshine was succeeded by blackest thunderclouds . The wind was no longer tempered to the more closely shorn of the flock ; [the weakest vessels]940-the weakest vessels were put on unexpectedly at crucial passages , and , coming hopelessly to grief , were denounced as [impostors and idlers]941-impostors and idlers , till half [the class]938-the class was dissolved in tears . [A few of [the better grounded]944-the better grounded]943-a few of the better grounded stood the fire , like [a remnant of [the Old Guard]946-the old guard]945-a remnant of the old guard . With faces pale from alarm , and trembling voices , but perfect accuracy , [they]938-the class answered all [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's searching inquiries after the paradigms of Greek verbs that seemed irregular to the verge of impropriety . [Paul]57-paul saw it all with renewed misgiving . " If [I]57-paul were there , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul thought , " [I]57-paul should have been run out and flogged long ago ! How angry [those stupid young idiots]2815-those stupid young idiots are making [him]57-paul ! How can [I]57-paul go up and speak to [him]57-paul when [he]57-paul 's like that ? And yet [I]57-paul must . [I]57-paul 'm sitting on dynamite as it is . The very first time [they]2815-those stupid young idiots want [me]57-paul to answer any questions from some of [their]2815-those stupid young idiots books , [I]57-paul shall be ruined ! Why was n't [I]57-paul better educated when [I]57-paul was [a boy]233-a boy , or why did n't [I]57-paul make a better use of [my]57-paul opportunities ! It will be a bitter thing if [they]2815-those stupid young idiots thrash [me]57-paul for not knowing as much as [Dick]60-dick . [Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's coming this way now ; it 's all over with [me]57-paul ! "[57-paul] [The Greek class]948-the greek class had managed to repel [the enemy]949-the enemy , with some loss to [themselves]948-the greek class , and [the Doctor]248-the doctor now left [his]248-the doctor place for a moment , and came down towards the bench on which [Paul]57-paul sat trembling . The storm , however , had passed over for the present , and [he]248-the doctor only said with restored calmness , " Who were [the boys who learnt dancing last term]2817-the boys who learnt dancing last term ? "[248-the doctor] [One or two of [them]948-the greek class]951-one or two of them said [they]951-one or two of them had done so , and [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone continued : " [Mr. Burdekin]119-mr. burdekin was unable to give [you]57-paul the last lesson of [his]119-mr. burdekin course last term , and has arranged to take [you]57-paul to - day , as [he]119-mr. burdekin will be in [the neighbourhood]2818-the neighbourhood . So be off at once to [Mrs. Grimstone]100-mrs. grimstone and change [your]57-paul shoes . [Bultitude]57-paul , [you]57-paul learnt last term , too . Go with [the others]627-the others . "[62-dr. grimstone] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was too overcome by this unexpected attack to contradict it , though of course [he]57-paul was quite able to do so ; but then , if [he]57-paul had , [he]57-paul must have explained all , and [he]57-paul felt strongly that just then was neither the time nor the place for particulars . It would have been wiser perhaps , it would certainly have brought matters to a crisis , if [he]57-paul could have forced [himself]57-paul to tell everything — the whole truth in all its outrageous improbability — but [he]57-paul could not . Let those who feel inclined to blame [him]57-paul for lack of firmness consider how difficult and delicate a business it must almost of necessity be for [anyone]2432-anyone to declare openly , in the teeth of common sense and plain facts , that there has been a mistake , and , in point of fact , [he]57-paul is not [[his]57-paul own son]2355-his own son , but [[his]57-paul own father]954-his own father . " [I]57-paul suppose [I]57-paul must go , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul thought . " [I]57-paul need n't dance . Have n't danced since [I]57-paul was [a young man]2820-a young man . But [I]57-paul ca n't afford to offend [him]57-paul just now . "[57-paul] And so [he]57-paul followed [the rest]694-the rest into [a sort of cloak - room , where the tall hats which [the boys]570-the boys wore on Sundays]956-a sort of cloak - room , where the tall hats which the boys wore on sundays were all kept on shelves in white bandboxes ; and there [his]57-paul hair was brushed , [his]57-paul feet were thrust into very shiny patent leather shoes , and a pair of kid gloves was given out to [him]57-paul to put on . The dancing lesson was to be held in the " [Dining Hall]2713-dining hall , "[92-biddlecomb] from which the savour of mutton had not altogether departed . When [Paul]57-paul came in [he]57-paul found the floor cleared and the tables and forms piled up on one side of [the room]213-the room . [Siggers]90-tipping was telling stories of the dances [he]90-tipping had been to in [town]502-town , and [the fine girls whose step had exactly suited [his]90-tipping own]963-the fine girls whose step had exactly suited his own , and [Tipping]90-tipping was leaning gloomily against the wall listening to something [Chawner]101-chawner was whispering in [his]90-tipping ear . [The Miss Mutlows]120-the miss mutlows sat stiffly down on a form , one on each side of [[her]120-the miss mutlows governess]971-her governess , and [all three]972-all three stared solemnly at [the boys , who began to blush vividly under the inspection]973-the boys , who began to blush vividly under the inspection , to unbutton and rebutton [their]973-the boys , who began to blush vividly under the inspection gloves with great care , and to shift from leg to leg in an embarrassed manner . [Dulcie]110-dulcie soon singled out [poor [Mr. Bultitude]71-tipping , who , mindful of [Tipping]71-tipping 's warning , was doing [his]71-tipping very best to avoid [her]110-dulcie]71-tipping . [She]110-dulcie ran straight to [him]71-tipping , laid [her]110-dulcie hand on [his]71-tipping arm and looked into [his]71-tipping face pleadingly . " [Dick]60-dick , "[110-dulcie] [she]110-dulcie said , " [you]60-dick 're not sulky still , are [you]60-dick ? "[110-dulcie]

[Mr. Bultitude]71-tipping had borne a good deal already , and , not being remarkably sweet - natured , [he]71-tipping shook the little hand away , half petulant and half alarmed . " [I]71-tipping do wish [you]110-dulcie would n't do this sort of thing in public . [You]110-dulcie 'll compromise [me]71-tipping , [you]110-dulcie know ! "[71-tipping] [he]71-tipping said nervously . [Dulcie]110-dulcie opened [her]110-dulcie grey eyes wide , and then a flush came into [her]110-dulcie cheeks , and [she]110-dulcie made a little disdainful upward movement of [her]110-dulcie chin . " [You]60-dick did n't mind it once , "[110-dulcie] [she]110-dulcie said . " [I]110-dulcie thought [you]60-dick might want to dance with [me]110-dulcie . [You]60-dick liked to last term . But [I]110-dulcie 'm sure [I]110-dulcie do n't care if [you]60-dick choose to be disagreeable . Go and dance with [Mary Mutlow]121-miss mutlow if [you]60-dick want to , though [you]60-dick did say [she]121-miss mutlow danced like a pair of compasses , and [I]110-dulcie shall tell [her]121-miss mutlow [you]60-dick said so , too . "[110-dulcie] [Paul]57-paul stamped . " [I]57-paul tell [you]110-dulcie [I]57-paul never dance , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said . " [I]57-paul ca n't dance any more than a lamp - post . "[57-paul] [Dulcie]110-dulcie 's eyes flashed . "[110-dulcie] And [she]110-dulcie turned proudly away , though anyone who looked might have seen the fire in [her]110-dulcie eyes extinguished as [she]110-dulcie did so . Perhaps [Tipping]71-tipping did see it , for [he]71-tipping scowled at [them]974-them from [his]71-tipping corner . There was another sound outside , as of fiddlestrings being twanged by the finger , and , as [the boys]570-the boys hastily formed up in two lines down the centre of [the room]213-the room and [the Miss Mutlows]120-the miss mutlows and [Dulcie]110-dulcie prepared [themselves]974-them for the curtsey of state , there came in [a little fat man]977-a little fat man , with mutton - chop whiskers and a white face , upon which was written an unalterable conviction that [his]977-a little fat man manner and deportment were perfection itself . [The two rows of boys]978-the two rows of boys bent [themselves]978-the two rows of boys stiffly from the back , and [Mr. Burdekin]119-mr. burdekin returned the compliment by an inclusive and stately inclination . " Good afternoon , [madam]2827-madam . [Young ladies]2828-young ladies , [I]977-a little fat man trust [I]977-a little fat man find [you]2828-young ladies well . ( The curtsey just a leetle lower , [Miss Mutlow]121-miss mutlow — the right foot less drawn back . Beautiful ! Feet closer at the recovery . Perfect ! ) [Young gentlemen]2829-young gentlemen , good evening . Take [your]2828-young ladies usual places , please , all of [you]2828-young ladies , for [our]2830-our preliminary exercises . Now , the chassée round [the room]213-the room . Will [you]2828-young ladies lead off , please , [Dummer]122-dummer ; the hands just lightly touching the shoulders , the head thrown negligently back to balance [the figure]2832-the figure ; the whole deportment easy , but not careless . Now , please ! "[977-a little fat man] And , talking all the time with a metrical fluency , [he]977-a little fat man scraped a little jig on the violin , while [Dummer]122-dummer led off a procession which solemnly capered round [the room]213-the room in sundry stages of conscious awkwardness . [Mr. Bultitude]71-tipping shuffled along somehow after the rest , with rebellion at [his]71-tipping heart and a deep sense of degradation . " If [[my]71-tipping clerks]2833-my clerks were to see [me]71-tipping now ! "[71-tipping] [he]71-tipping thought . "[119-mr. burdekin] " [Bultitude]71-tipping , "[119-mr. burdekin] said [Mr. Burdekin]119-mr. burdekin , " [you]71-tipping will take [Miss Mutlow]121-miss mutlow , please . "[119-mr. burdekin] " Thank [you]119-mr. burdekin , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " but — ah — [I]57-paul do n't dance . "[57-paul] " Nonsense , nonsense , [sir]2329-sir , [you]71-tipping are [one of [[my]57-paul most promising pupils]2836-my most promising pupils]2835-one of my most promising pupils . [You]71-tipping must n't tell [me]57-paul that . Not another word ! Come , select [[your]71-tipping partners]2837-your partners . "[57-paul] [Paul]57-paul had no option . [He]57-paul was paired off with [the tall and rather angular young lady]981-the tall and rather angular young lady mentioned , while [Dulcie]110-dulcie looked on pouting , and snubbed [Tipping]71-tipping , who humbly asked for the pleasure of dancing with [her]110-dulcie , by declaring that [she]110-dulcie meant to dance with [Tom]95-tommy . The dance began to a sort of rhythmical accompaniment by [Mr. Burdekin]119-mr. burdekin , who intoned " Tops advance , retire and cross . Balance at corners . ( Very nice , [Miss Grimstone]124-miss grimstone ! ) More ' abandon , ' Chawner ! Lift the feet more from the floor . Not so high as that ! Oh , dear [me]119-mr. burdekin ! [that last figure]2838-that last figure over again . And slide the feet , oh , slide the feet ! ( [Bultitude]71-tipping , [you]71-tipping 're leaving out all the steps ! "[119-mr. burdekin] ) [Paul]57-paul was dragged , unwilling but unresisting , through it all by [[his]57-paul partner]982-his partner , who jerked and pushed [him]57-paul into [his]57-paul place without a word , being apparently under strict orders from [the governess]983-the governess not on any account to speak to [the boys]570-the boys . After the dance [the couples]985-the couples promenaded in a stiff but stately manner round [the room]213-the room to a dirge - like march scraped upon the violin , [the boys]570-the boys taking the parts of [ladies]988-ladies jibbing away from [[their]570-the boys partners]989-their partners in a highly unlady - like fashion , and [the boy]246-the boy burdened with the companionship of the younger [Miss Mutlow]121-miss mutlow walking along in a very agony of bashfulness . " [I]57-paul suppose , "[57-paul] thought [Paul]57-paul , as [he]57-paul led the way with [Miss Mary Mutlow]121-miss mutlow , " if [Dick]60-dick were ever to hear of this , [he]60-dick 'd think it funny . Oh , if [I]57-paul ever get the upper hand of [him]60-dick again——. How much longer , [I]57-paul wonder , shall [I]57-paul have to play [the fool]2839-the fool to this infernal fiddle ! "[57-paul] But , if this was bad , worse was to come . There was another pause , in which [Mr. Burdekin]119-mr. burdekin said blandly , " [I]119-mr. burdekin wonder now if [we]2840-we have forgotten [[our]2840-we [sailor]2842-sailor]2841-our sailor 's hornpipe . Perhaps [Bultitude]57-paul will prove the contrary . If [I]119-mr. burdekin remember right , [he]57-paul used to perform it with singular correctness . And , let [me]119-mr. burdekin tell [you]57-paul , there are a great number of spurious hornpipe steps in circulation . Come , [sir]2329-sir , oblige [me]119-mr. burdekin by dancing it alone ! "[119-mr. burdekin] This was the final straw . It was not to be supposed for one moment that [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul would lower [his]57-paul dignity in such a preposterous manner . Besides , [he]57-paul did not know how to dance the hornpipe . So [he]57-paul said , " [I]57-paul shall do nothing of the sort . [I]57-paul 've had quite enough of this — ah — tomfoolery ! "[57-paul] " That is a very impolite manner of declining , [Bultitude]57-paul ; highly discourteous and unpolished . [I]57-paul must insist now — really , as a personal matter — upon [your]57-paul going through [the sailor]2844-the sailor 's hornpipe . Come , [you]57-paul wo n't make a scene , [I]57-paul 'm sure . [You]57-paul 'll oblige [me]57-paul , as [a gentleman]2332-a gentleman ? "[57-paul]

" [I]57-paul tell [you]57-paul [I]57-paul ca n't ! "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul sullenly . " [I]57-paul never did such a thing in [my]57-paul life ; it would be enough to kill [me]57-paul at [my]57-paul age ! "[57-paul] " This is untrue , [sir]2329-sir . Do [you]57-paul mean to say [you]57-paul will not dance the hornpipe ? "[57-paul] " No , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " [I]57-paul 'll be damned if [I]57-paul do ! "[57-paul] There was unfortunately no possible doubt about the nature of the word used — [he]57-paul said it so very distinctly . [The governess]983-the governess screamed and called [her]983-the governess charges to [her]983-the governess . [Dulcie]110-dulcie hid [her]110-dulcie face , and [some of [the boys]570-the boys]826-some of the boys tittered . [Mr. Burdekin]119-mr. burdekin turned pink . " After that disgraceful language , [sir]2329-sir , in the presence of [the fairer sex]2848-the fairer sex , [I]119-mr. burdekin have no more to do with [you]2329-sir . [You]2329-sir will have the goodness to stand in the centre of that form . [Gentlemen]2849-gentlemen , select [[your]2329-sir partners for the Highland schottische]2850-your partners for the highland schottische ! "[119-mr. burdekin] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , by no means sorry to be freed from the irksome necessity of dancing with a heart ill - attuned for enjoyment , got up on the form and stood looking , sullenly enough , upon the proceedings . [The governess]983-the governess glowered at [him]57-paul now and then as [a monster of youthful depravity]995-a monster of youthful depravity ; [the Miss Mutlows]120-the miss mutlows glanced up at [him]57-paul as [they]996-they tripped past , with curiosity not unmixed with admiration , but [Dulcie]110-dulcie steadily avoided looking in [his]57-paul direction . [Paul]57-paul was just congratulating [himself]57-paul upon [his]57-paul escape when the door opened wide , and [the Doctor]248-the doctor marched slowly and imposingly into [the room]213-the room . [He]57-paul did this occasionally , partly to superintend matters , and partly as an encouraging mark of approbation . [He]57-paul looked round [the class]938-the class at first with benignant toleration , until [his]57-paul glance took in the bench upon which [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was set up . Then [his]57-paul eye slowly travelled up to the level of [Paul]57-paul 's head , [his]57-paul expression changing meanwhile to a petrifying glare . It was not , as [Paul]57-paul instinctively felt , exactly the position in which [a gentleman who wished to stand well with those in authority over [him]57-paul]1000-a gentleman who wished to stand well with those in authority over him would prefer to be found . [He]57-paul felt [his]57-paul heart turn to water within [him]57-paul , and stared limp and helpless at [the Doctor]248-the doctor .

There was an awful silence ( [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone was addicted to awful silences ; and , indeed , if seldom strictly " golden , "[57-paul] silence may often be called " iron "[57-paul] ) , but at last [he]57-paul inquired , " And pray what may [you]57-paul be doing up there , [sir]2329-sir ? "[57-paul] " Upon [my]57-paul soul [I]57-paul ca n't say , "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul feebly . " Ask [that gentleman there with the fiddle]2852-that gentleman there with the fiddle — [he]2852-that gentleman there with the fiddle knows . "[57-paul] [Mr. Burdekin]119-mr. burdekin was [a good - natured , easy - tempered little man]1002-a good - natured , easy - tempered little man , and had already forgotten the affront to [his]119-mr. burdekin dignity . [He]119-mr. burdekin was anxious not to get [the boy]246-the boy into more trouble . " [Bultitude]57-paul was a little inattentive and , [I]119-mr. burdekin may say , wanting in respect , [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone , "[119-mr. burdekin] [he]119-mr. burdekin said , putting it as mildly as [he]119-mr. burdekin could with any accuracy ; " so [I]119-mr. burdekin ventured to place [him]246-the boy [there]2356-there as a punishment . "[119-mr. burdekin] " Quite right , [Mr. Burdekin]119-mr. burdekin , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor : " quite right . [I]248-the doctor am sorry that [any boy of [mine]248-the doctor]2854-any boy of mine should have caused [you]119-mr. burdekin to do so . [You]119-mr. burdekin are again beginning [your]119-mr. burdekin career of disorder and rebellion , are [you]119-mr. burdekin , [sir]2329-sir ? Go up into [the schoolroom]2641-the schoolroom at once , and write a dozen copies before tea - time ! A very little more eccentricity and insubordination from [you]119-mr. burdekin , [Bultitude]57-paul , and [you]119-mr. burdekin will reap a full reward — a full reward , [sir]2329-sir ! "[248-the doctor] So [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was driven out of [the dancing class]1005-the dancing class in dire disgrace — which would not have distressed [him]57-paul particularly , being only one more drop in [his]57-paul bitter cup — but that [he]57-paul recognised that now [his]57-paul hopes of approaching [the Doctor]248-the doctor with [his]57-paul burden of woe were fallen like a card castle . [They]1007-they were fiddled and danced away for at least twenty - four hours — perhaps for ever ! Bitterly did [he]57-paul brood over this as [he]57-paul slowly and laboriously copied out sundry vain repetitions of such axioms as , " Cultivate Habits of Courtesy and Self - control , "[57-paul] and " True Happiness is to be sought in Contentment . "[57-paul] [He]57-paul saw the prospect of a tolerably severe flogging growing more and more distinct , and felt that [he]57-paul could not present [himself]57-paul to [[his]57-paul family]1008-his family with the consciousness of having suffered such an indelible disgrace . [[His]57-paul family]1008-his family ! What would become of [them]1008-his family in [his]57-paul absence ? Would [he]57-paul ever see [[his]57-paul comfortable home in [Bayswater]32-bayswater]1010-his comfortable home in bayswater again ? Tea - time came , and after it evening preparation , when [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler presided in a feeble and ineffective manner , perpetually suspecting that the faint sniggers [he]57-paul heard were indulged in at [his]57-paul own expense , and calling [perfectly innocent victims]1011-perfectly innocent victims to account for [them]1007-they . [Paul]57-paul sat next to [Jolland]78-jolland and , in [his]57-paul desperate anxiety to avoid further unpleasantness , found [himself]57-paul , as [he]57-paul could not for [his]57-paul life have written a Latin or a German composition , reduced to copy down [[his]57-paul neighbour]1012-his neighbour 's exercises . This [Jolland]78-jolland ( who had looked forward to an arrangement of a very opposite kind ) nevertheless cheerfully allowed [him]57-paul to do , though [he]78-jolland expressed doubts as to the wisdom of a servile imitation — more , perhaps , from prudence than conscientiousness . [Jolland]78-jolland , in the intervals of study , was deeply engaged in the production of a small illustrated work of fiction , which [he]78-jolland was pleased to call The Adventures of [Ben Buterkin]125-ben buterkin at [Scool]33-scool . It was in a great measure an autobiography , and the cuts depicting [the hero]1013-the hero 's flagellations — which were frequent in the course of the narrative — were executed with much vigour and feeling . [He]57-paul turned out a great number of these works in the course of the term , as well as faces in pen and ink with moving tongues and rolling eyes , and these [he]57-paul would present to [a few favoured friends with a secretive and self - depreciatory giggle]1014-a few favoured friends with a secretive and self - depreciatory giggle . Amidst scenes and [companions]1015-companions like these , [Paul]57-paul sat out the evening hours on [his]57-paul hard seat , which was just at the junction of two forms — an exquisitely uncomfortable position , as all who have tried it will acknowledge — until the time for going to bed came round again . [He]57-paul dreaded the hours of darkness , but there was no help for it — to protest would have been madness just then , and , once more , [he]57-paul was forced to pass a night under the roof of [Crichton House]4-crichton house .

It was even worse than the first , though this was greatly owing to [his]57-paul own obstinacy . [The boys]570-the boys , if less subdued , were in better temper than the evening before , and found it troublesome to keep up a feud when the first flush of resentment had died out . There was a general disposition to forget [his]57-paul departure from the code of schoolboy honour , and give [him]57-paul an opportunity of retrieving the past . But [he]57-paul would not meet [them]570-the boys half - way ; [his]57-paul repeated repulses by [the Doctor]248-the doctor and all the difficulties that beset [his]57-paul return to freedom had made [him]57-paul very sulky and snappish . [He]57-paul had not patience or adaptability enough to respond to [their]570-the boys advances , and only shrank from [their]570-the boys rough good nature — which naturally checked the current of good feeling . Then , when the lights were put out , [some one]260-some one demanded a story . [Most of [the bedrooms]728-the bedrooms]1019-most of the bedrooms possessed [a professional story - teller]1021-a professional story - teller , and in one there was [a young romancist who began a stirring history the very first night of the term , which always ran on until the night before the holidays , and , if [[his]1022-a young romancist who began a stirring history the very first night of the term , which always ran on until the night before the holidays , and , if his hearers hearers]818-his hearers]1022-a young romancist who began a stirring history the very first night of the term , which always ran on until the night before the holidays , and , if his hearers were apt to yawn at the sixth week of it , [he]1022-a young romancist who began a stirring history the very first night of the term , which always ran on until the night before the holidays , and , if his hearers [himself]1022-a young romancist who began a stirring history the very first night of the term , which always ran on until the night before the holidays , and , if his hearers enjoyed and believed in it keenly from beginning to end . [Dick Bultitude]60-dick had been [a valued raconteur]1024-a valued raconteur , it appeared , and [[his]60-dick father]242-his father found accordingly , to [his]242-his father disgust , that [he]60-dick was expected to amuse [them]570-the boys with a story . When [he]242-his father clearly understood the idea , [he]242-his father rejected it with so savage a snarl , that [he]242-his father soon found it necessary to retire under the bedclothes to escape the general indignation that followed . Finding that [he]242-his father did not actively resent it ( [the real Dick]60-dick would have had [the occupant of the nearest bed]1026-the occupant of the nearest bed out by the ears in a minute ! ) , [they]570-the boys profited by [his]60-dick prudence to come to [his]60-dick bedside , where [they]570-the boys pillowed [his]60-dick weary head ( with [their]570-the boys own pillows ) till the slight offered [them]570-the boys was more than avenged . After that , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , with the breath half beaten out of [his]57-paul body , lay writhing and spluttering on [his]57-paul hard , rough bed till long after silence had fallen over the adjoining beds , and the sleepy hum of talk in [the other bedrooms]1027-the other bedrooms had died away . Then [he]60-dick , too , drifted off into wild and troubled dreams , which , at [their]570-the boys maddest , were scattered into blankness by a sudden and violent shock , which jerked [him]60-dick , clutching and grasping at nothing , on to the cold , bare boards , where [he]60-dick rolled , shivering . " An earthquake ! "[60-dick] [he]60-dick thought , " an explosion ... gas — or dynamite ! [He]60-dick must go and call [the children]2858-the children ... [Boaler]67-boaler ... the plate ! "[60-dick] But the reality to which [he]60-dick woke was worse still . [Tipping]71-tipping and [Coker]88-coker had been patiently pinching [themselves]570-the boys to keep awake until [[their]570-the boys enemy]1028-their enemy should be soundly asleep , in order to enjoy the exquisite pleasure of letting down the mattress ; and , too dazed and frightened even to swear , [Paul]57-paul gathered up [his]57-paul bedclothes and tried to draw them about [him]57-paul as well as [he]57-paul might , and seek sleep , which had lost its security . [The Garudâ Stone]73-the stone had done one grim and cruel piece of work at least in its time . Once more [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul rose betimes , dressed noiselessly , and stole down to [the cold schoolroom]1029-the cold schoolroom , where one gas - jet was burning palely — for the morning was raw and foggy . This time , however , [he]60-dick was not alone . [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn was sitting at [his]108-mr. blinkhorn little table in the corner , correcting exercises , with [his]108-mr. blinkhorn chilly hands cased in worsted mittens . [He]108-mr. blinkhorn looked up as [Paul]57-paul came in , and nodded kindly . [Paul]57-paul went straight to the fire , and stood staring into [it]1030-it with lack - lustre eye , too apathetic even to be hopeless , for the work of enlightening [the Doctor]248-the doctor seemed more terrible and impossible than ever , and [he]57-paul began to see that , if the only way of escape lay there , [he]57-paul had better make up [his]57-paul mind with what philosophy [he]57-paul could to adapt [himself]57-paul to [his]57-paul altered circumstances , and stay on for the rest of the term . But the prospect was so doleful and so blank , that [he]57-paul drew a heavy sigh as [he]57-paul thought of it . [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn heard it , and rose awkwardly from the rickety little writing - table , knocking over a pile of marble - covered copy - books as [he]108-mr. blinkhorn did so . Then [he]108-mr. blinkhorn crossed over to [Paul]57-paul and laid a hand gently on [his]57-paul shoulder . "[57-paul] " No , no , "[108-mr. blinkhorn] said [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn , " this extreme self - depreciation is morbid , very morbid . There was no actual vice . "[108-mr. blinkhorn] " No actual vice ! [You]246-the boy may be [a very excellent young man]2876-a very excellent young man , but if [you]246-the boy gloss over things in that fashion , [your]246-the boy moral sense must be perverted , [sir]2329-sir — strangely perverted . "[57-paul]

" There were faults on both sides , [I]108-mr. blinkhorn fear , "[108-mr. blinkhorn] said [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn , growing a little scandalised by [the boy]246-the boy 's odd warmth of expression . " [I]57-paul have heard something of what [you]57-paul had to bear with . On the one hand , [a father]227-a father , undemonstrative , stern , easily provoked ; on the other , [a son]2879-a son , thoughtless , forgetful , and at times it may be even wilful . But [you]57-paul are too sensitive ; [you]57-paul think too much of what seems to [me]57-paul a not unnatural ( although of course improper ) protest against coldness and injustice . "[108-mr. blinkhorn] And [he]108-mr. blinkhorn went back to [his]108-mr. blinkhorn exercises , looking puzzled and pained . The fact was , [he]108-mr. blinkhorn was an ardent believer in [the Good Boy of a certain order of school tales]1037-the good boy of a certain order of school tales — [the boy who is seized with a sudden conviction of the intrinsic baseness of boyhood]1038-the boy who is seized with a sudden conviction of the intrinsic baseness of boyhood , and does all in [his]108-mr. blinkhorn power to get rid of the harmful taint ; [the boy who renounces [[his]108-mr. blinkhorn old comrades]1040-his old comrades and [his]108-mr. blinkhorn natural tastes ( which after all seldom have any serious harm in [them]1041-them ) , to don a panoply of priggishness which is too often kick - proof . [This kind of boy]1042-this kind of boy is rare enough at [most English schools]1043-most english schools]1039-the boy who renounces his old comrades and his natural tastes ( which after all seldom have any serious harm in them ) , to don a panoply of priggishness which is too often kick - proof . this kind of boy is rare enough at most english schools , but [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn had been educated at [a large Nonconformist College]1044-a large nonconformist college , where " Revivals "[108-mr. blinkhorn] and " Awakenings "[108-mr. blinkhorn] were periodical , and undoubtedly did produce changes of character violent enough , but sadly short in duration . [He]108-mr. blinkhorn was always waiting for [some such boy]1045-some such boy to come to [him]108-mr. blinkhorn with [his]108-mr. blinkhorn confession of moral worthlessness and vows of unnatural perfection , and was too simple and earnest and good [himself]108-mr. blinkhorn to realise that such states of the youthful mind are not unfrequently merely morbid and hysterical , and too often degenerate into Pharisaism , or worse still , hypocrisy . So when [he]108-mr. blinkhorn noticed [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's silence and depression , [his]57-paul studied withdrawal from [the others]627-the others and [his]57-paul evident want of sympathy with [them]627-the others , [he]108-mr. blinkhorn believed [he]108-mr. blinkhorn saw the symptoms of a conscience at work , and that [he]108-mr. blinkhorn had found [[his]108-mr. blinkhorn reformed boy]1047-his reformed boy at last . It was a very unfortunate misunderstanding , for it separated [Paul]57-paul from , perhaps , [the only person who would have had the guilelessness to believe [his]57-paul incredible story , and the good nature to help [him]57-paul to find escape from [his]57-paul misfortunes]1048-the only person who would have had the guilelessness to believe his incredible story , and the good nature to help him to find escape from his misfortunes . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul on [his]57-paul part was more angry and disgusted than ever . [He]57-paul began to see that there was a muddle somewhere , and that [his]57-paul identity was unsuspected still . [This young man]1032-this young man , for all [his]1032-this young man fair speaking and pretended shrewdness , was [no conjurer]1050-no conjurer after all . [He]57-paul was left to rely on [his]57-paul own resources , and [he]57-paul had begun to lose all confidence in [their]1051-their power to extricate [him]57-paul . As [he]57-paul brooded over this , [the boys]570-the boys straggled down as before , and looked over [their]570-the boys lessons for the day in a dull , lifeless manner . The cold , unsatisfying breakfast , and the half - hour assigned to " chevy , "[130-herr stohwasser] followed in due course , and after that [Paul]57-paul found [himself]57-paul set down with a class to await [the German master]1053-the german master , [Herr Stohwasser]130-herr stohwasser . [He]57-paul had again tried to pull [himself]57-paul together and approach [the Doctor]248-the doctor with [his]57-paul protest , but no sooner did [he]57-paul find [himself]57-paul near [his]248-the doctor presence than [his]57-paul heart began to leap wildly and then retired down towards [his]57-paul boots , leaving [him]57-paul hoarse , palpitating , and utterly blank of ideas . It was no use — and [he]57-paul resigned [himself]57-paul for yet another day of unwelcome instruction . [The class]938-the class was in [a little room on [the basement floor]765-the basement floor]1056-a little room on the basement floor , with a linen - press taking up one side , some bare white deal tables and forms , and , on the walls , a few coloured German prints . [They]570-the boys sat there talking and laughing , taking no notice of [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , until [the German master]1053-the german master made [his]1053-the german master appearance . [He]1053-the german master was by no means [a formidable person]1059-a formidable person , though stout and tall . [He]1053-the german master wore big round owlish spectacles , and [his]1053-the german master pale broad face and long nose , combined with a wild crop of light hair and a fierce beard , gave [him]1053-the german master the incongruous appearance of a sheep looking out of a gun - port . [He]1053-the german master took [his]1053-the german master place with an air of tremendous determination to enforce a hard morning 's work on the book [they]570-the boys were reading — a play of [Schiller]131-schiller 's , of the plot of which , it is needless to say , [no one of [[his]1053-the german master pupils]2437-his pupils]1060-no one of his pupils had or cared to have the vaguest notion , having long since condemned the whole subject , with insular prejudice , as " rot . "[130-herr stohwasser] But [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb was in a conversational mood , and willing to postpone the task of translation , so [he]92-biddlecomb merely inquired , with an air of extreme interest , how [Herr Stohwasser]130-herr stohwasser 's German Grammar was getting on .

This was a subject on which ( as [he]92-biddlecomb perhaps knew ) [the German]136-the german never could resist enlarging , for in common with [most German masters]1062-most german masters , [he]92-biddlecomb was giving birth to a new Grammar , which , from the daring originality of its plan , and its extreme simplicity , was destined to supersede all other similar works . "[92-biddlecomb] As a matter of fact this joke , in all its lights , was tolerably familiar to most of [them]1064-them by this time , but , either on its individual merits , or perhaps because it compared favourably with the sterner alternative of translating , it was periodically in request , and always met with evergreen appreciation . [Herr Stohwasser]130-herr stohwasser beamed with the pride of authorship .
