"[71-tipping] All this , of course , had no interest for [Mr. Bultitude]71-tipping , but it left [him]71-tipping free to pursue [his]71-tipping own thoughts in peace , and indeed this lesson would never have been recorded here , but for two circumstances which will presently appear , both of which had no small effect on [his]71-tipping fortunes . [He]71-tipping sat nearest the window , and looked out on the pinched and drooping laurels in [the enclosure]1067-the enclosure , which were damp with frost melting in the sunshine . Over the wall [he]71-tipping could see the tops of [passing vehicles]1068-passing vehicles , [[the country carrier]1069-the country carrier 's cart]1070-the country carrier 's cart , [the railway parcels van]1071-the railway parcels van , the fly from [the station]280-the station . [He]71-tipping envied even [the drivers]1073-the drivers ; [their]1073-the drivers lot was happier than [his]71-tipping ! [His]71-tipping thoughts were busy with [Dick]60-dick . Oddly enough , it had scarcely occurred to [him]71-tipping before to speculate on what [he]60-dick might be doing in [his]60-dick absence ; [he]71-tipping had thought chiefly about [himself]71-tipping . But now [he]71-tipping gave [his]71-tipping attention to the subject , what new horrors it opened up ! What might not become of [[his]71-tipping well - conducted household]1074-his well - conducted household under the rash rule of [a foolish schoolboy]1075-a foolish schoolboy ! [The office]397-the office , too — who could say what mischief [Dick]60-dick might not be doing [there]2356-there , under the cover of [his]60-dick own respectable form ? Then it might seem good to [him]71-tipping any day to smash the Garudâ Stone , and after that there would be no hope of matters being ever set right again ! And yet , miserable coward and fool that [he]71-tipping was , with everything depending upon [his]71-tipping losing no time to escape , [he]71-tipping could not screw up [his]71-tipping courage , and say the words that were to set [him]71-tipping free . All at once — and this is one of the circumstances that make the German lesson an important stage in this story — an idea suggested itself to [him]71-tipping quite dazzling by its daring and brilliancy . [Some]749-some may wonder , when [they]749-some hear what it was , why [he]71-tipping never thought of it before , and it is somewhat surprising , but by no means without precedent . [Artemus Ward]137-artemus ward has told [us]1079-us somewhere of [a ferocious bandit who was confined for sixteen years in solitary captivity]1080-a ferocious bandit who was confined for sixteen years in solitary captivity , before the notion of escape ever occurred to [him]71-tipping . When it did , [he]71-tipping opened the window and got out . Perhaps a similar passiveness on [Mr. Bultitude]71-tipping 's part was due to a very natural and proper desire to do everything without scandal , and in a legitimate manner ; to march out , as it were , with the honours of war . Perhaps it was simple dullness . The fact remains that it was not till then that [he]71-tipping saw a way of recovering [his]71-tipping lost position , without the disagreeable necessity of disclosing [his]71-tipping position to [anyone at [Crichton House]4-crichton house]1081-anyone at crichton house . [He]71-tipping had still — thank [Heaven]70-heaven — the five shillings [he]71-tipping had given [Dick]60-dick . [He]71-tipping had not thrown them away with the other articles in [his]71-tipping mad passion . Five shillings was not much , but it was more than enough to pay for a third - class fare to [town]502-town . [He]71-tipping had only to watch [his]71-tipping opportunity , slip away to [the station]280-the station , and be at [home]296-home again , defying [the usurper]1085-the usurper , before [anyone at [Crichton House]4-crichton house]1081-anyone at crichton house had discovered [his]71-tipping absence . [He]71-tipping might go that very day , and the delight of this thought — the complete reaction from blank despair to hope — was so intense that [he]71-tipping could not help rubbing [his]71-tipping hands stealthily under the table , and chuckling with glee at [his]71-tipping own readiness of resource . When [we]1087-we are most elated , however , there is always a counteracting agent at hand to bring [us]1087-we down again to [our]1087-we proper level , or below it . [The Roman general in the triumph]1088-the roman general in the triumph never really needed [the slave]1089-the slave in [the chariot]1090-the chariot to dash [his]1088-the roman general in the triumph spirits — [he]1088-the roman general in the triumph had [[his]1088-the roman general in the triumph friends]1091-his friends [there]2356-there already ; [the guests at an Egyptian dinner]1093-the guests at an egyptian dinner must have brought [their]1093-the guests at an egyptian dinner own skeletons . There was [a small flaxen - haired little boy]1094-a small flaxen - haired little boy sitting next to [Mr. Bultitude]71-tipping , seemingly a quite inoffensive being , who at this stage served to sober [him]1094-a small flaxen - haired little boy by furnishing another complication . " Oh , [I]1094-a small flaxen - haired little boy say , [Bultitude]71-tipping , "[1094-a small flaxen - haired little boy] [he]1094-a small flaxen - haired little boy piped shrilly in [Paul]57-paul 's ear , " [I]1094-a small flaxen - haired little boy forgot all about it . "[86-porter] At the other end of the table [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb had again dexterously allured [Herr Stohwasser]130-herr stohwasser into the meshes of conversation ; this time upon the question ( à propos de bottes ) of [street performances]1096-street performances . " [I]130-herr stohwasser vill tell [you]2329-sir a gurious thing , "[130-herr stohwasser] [he]130-herr stohwasser was saying , " vat happened to [me]130-herr stohwasser de oder day ven [I]130-herr stohwasser vas valking down de Strandt . [I]130-herr stohwasser saw [a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on [him]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road , and [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road stand in [a side street]2915-a side street right out in [de road]2916-de road]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road , and [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road take off [his]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road tall round hat , and [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road put it on de ground , and [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road stand still and look zo at it . So [I]130-herr stohwasser shtop too , to see vat [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road vould do next . And bresently [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road take out a large sheet of baper and tear it in four pieces very garefully , and stick zem round de tall round hat , and put it on [his]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road head again , and zen [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road set it down on de grount and look at it vonce more , and all de time [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road never speak von vort . And [I]130-herr stohwasser look and look and vonder vat [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road would do next . And [a great growd of beoples com]2917-a great growd of beoples com , and zey look and vonder too . And zen all at once [de leedle dirty boy]2918-de leedle dirty boy [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road take out all de paper and put on de hat , and [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road valk avay , laughing altogetter foolishly at zomzing [I]130-herr stohwasser did not understand at all . [I]130-herr stohwasser haf been thinking efer since vat in the vorldt [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road do all zat nonsence for . And zere is [von ozer gurious thing [I]130-herr stohwasser see in [[your]2920-your [London]36-london streets]2921-your london streets]2919-von ozer gurious thing i see in your london streets zat very same day . [Zere]138-zere vas [a poor house cat]2922-a poor house cat dat had been by [a cab]2316-a cab overrun as [I]130-herr stohwasser passed by , and von man vith a kind varm heart valk up and stamp it on [de]2918-de leedle dirty boy head for to end its pain . And anozer man vith anozer kind heart , [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road gom up directly and had not seen de cat overrun , but [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road see [de first man]2924-de first man stamping and [he]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road knock [him]2914-a leedle gommon dirty boy with a tall round hat on him , and he stand in a side street right out in de road down for ill - treating animals ; it was quite gurious to see ; till [de policeman]2925-de policeman arrest [dem]2918-de leedle dirty boy both for fighting . [Goggs]139-goggs , degline ' Katze , ' and gif [me]130-herr stohwasser [ze]139-goggs berfect and [bast barticiple of ' kampfen]2926-bast barticiple of ' kampfen , ' to fight . "[130-herr stohwasser] This last relapse into duty was caused by the sudden entrance of [the Doctor]248-the doctor , who stood at the door looking on for some time with a general air of being intimately acquainted with [Schiller]131-schiller as [an author]1098-an author , before suggesting graciously that it was time to dismiss [the class]938-the class . Wednesday was a half - holiday at [Crichton House]4-crichton house , and so , soon after dinner , [Paul]57-paul found [himself]57-paul marshalled with the rest in a procession bound for [the football field]1100-the football field . [They]1101-they marched two and two , [Chawner]101-chawner and three of [the other elder boys]1102-the other elder boys leading with the ball and four goal - posts ornamented with coloured calico flags , and [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn and [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler bringing up the rear . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was paired with [Tom Grimstone]95-tommy , who , after eyeing [him]57-paul askance for some time , could control [his]95-tommy curiosity no longer . " [I]57-paul say , [Dick]60-dick , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul began , " what 's the matter with [you]60-dick this term ? "[57-paul] " [My]57-paul name is not [Dick]60-dick , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul stiffly . " [You]60-dick 've come back what [I]57-paul call a beastly sneak , [you]60-dick know , this term . " Perhaps it does n't concern [you]2329-sir what [pa]2948-pa thinks either ? [Dad]143-dad told [Mums]141-mums last night that [he]143-dad was altogether at a loss to know how to deal with [you]2329-sir , [you]2329-sir had come back so queer and unruly . And [he]143-dad said , let [me]95-tommy see , oh , [he]143-dad said that ' if [he]143-dad did n't see an alteration very soon [he]143-dad should resort to more drastic measures'—drastic measures is Latin for a whopping . "[95-tommy] " Good gracious ! "[57-paul] thought [Paul]57-paul , " [I]57-paul have n't a moment to lose ! [he]143-dad might ' resort to drastic measures ' this very evening . "[57-paul] Then [he]57-paul said aloud to [Tom]95-tommy , " Can [you]95-tommy tell [me]57-paul , [my]57-paul — [[my]57-paul young friend]2949-my young friend , if , supposing [a boy]233-a boy were to ask to leave [the field]2951-the field — saying for instance that [he]233-a boy was not well and thought [he]233-a boy should be better at [home]296-home — whether [he]233-a boy would be allowed to go ? "[57-paul] " Of course [he]233-a boy would , "[95-tommy] said [Tom]95-tommy , " [you]95-tommy ought to know that by this time . "[95-tommy] [Paul]57-paul saw [his]57-paul course quite clearly now , and was overcome with relief and gratitude . [He]57-paul wrung the astonished [Tom]95-tommy 's hand warmly ; " Thank [you]95-tommy , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , briskly and cheerfully , " thank [you]95-tommy . [I]57-paul 'm really uncommonly obliged to [you]95-tommy . [You]95-tommy 're [a very intelligent boy]2954-a very intelligent boy . [I]57-paul should like to give [you]95-tommy sixpence . "[57-paul] But although [Tom]95-tommy used no arguments to dissuade [him]57-paul , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul remembered [his]57-paul position in time , and prudently refrained from such ill - judged generosity . Sixpences were of vital importance now , when [he]57-paul expected to be starting so soon on [his]57-paul perilous journey . And so [they]1104-they reached the field where the game was to be played , and where [Paul]57-paul was resolved to have one desperate throw for liberty and [home]296-home . [He]57-paul was more excited than anxious as [he]57-paul thought of it , and it certainly did seem as if all the chances were in [his]57-paul favour , and that fortune must have forsaken [him]57-paul indeed , if anything were allowed to prevent [his]57-paul escape .

[The football field]1100-the football field was [a large one , bounded on two sides by tall wooden palings , and on the other two by a hedge and [a new shingled road]1108-a new shingled road , separated from [the field]2951-the field by a post and rails]1107-a large one , bounded on two sides by tall wooden palings , and on the other two by a hedge and a new shingled road , separated from the field by a post and rails . [Two of [the younger boys]1111-the younger boys , proud of [[their]1110-two of the younger boys , proud of their office office]1112-their office]1110-two of the younger boys , proud of their office , raced down to the further end to set up the goal - posts . [The rest]694-the rest lounged idly about without attempting to begin operations , except [the new boy [Kiffin]91-kiffin , who was seen walking apart from [the rest]694-the rest , diligently studying the " rules of the game of football , "[91-kiffin] as laid down in [a small Boy]801-a small boy 's Own Pocket Book and Manual of Outdoor Sports , with which [he]91-kiffin had been careful to provide [himself]91-kiffin]1114-the new boy kiffin , who was seen walking apart from the rest , diligently studying the " rules of the game of football , " as laid down in a small boy 's own pocket book and manual of outdoor sports , with which he had been careful to provide himself . At last [Tipping]71-tipping suggested that [they]1117-they had better begin , and proposed that [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn and [himself]108-mr. blinkhorn should toss up for the choice of sides , and this being done , [Mr. Bultitude]71-tipping presently , to [his]91-kiffin great dismay , heard [his]71-tipping name mentioned . " [I]71-tipping 'll have [young Bultitude]71-tipping , "[71-tipping] said [Tipping]71-tipping ; " [he]71-tipping used to play up decently . Look here , [[you]57-paul young beggar]2955-you young beggar , [you]57-paul 're on [my]71-tipping side , and if [you]57-paul do n't play up it will be the worse for [you]57-paul ! "[71-tipping] It was not worth while , however , to protest , since [he]91-kiffin would so soon be rid of [the whole crew]1118-the whole crew for ever , and so [Paul]57-paul followed [Tipping]71-tipping and [[his]71-tipping train]1119-his train with dutiful submission , and the game began . It was not a spirited performance . [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler , who was not [an athlete]1120-an athlete , retired at once to the post and rails , on which [he]109-mr. tinkler settled [himself]109-mr. tinkler to enjoy a railway novel with a highly stimulating cover . [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn , who had more conscientious views of [[his]108-mr. blinkhorn office]393-his office , charged about vigorously , performing all kinds of wonders with the ball , though evidently more from a sense of duty than with any idea of enjoyment . [Tipping]71-tipping occasionally took the trouble to oppose [him]108-mr. blinkhorn , but as a concession merely , and with a parade of being under no necessity to do so ; and these two , with a very small following of [enthusiasts on either side]1122-enthusiasts on either side , waged a private and confidential kind of warfare in different parts of [the field]2951-the field , while the others made no pretence of playing for the present , but strolled about in knots , exchanging and bartering the treasures valuable in the sight of [schoolboys]1124-schoolboys , and gossiping generally . As for [Paul]57-paul , [he]57-paul did not clearly understand what " playing up "[57-paul] might mean . [He]57-paul had not indulged in football since [he]57-paul was [a genuine boy]1125-a genuine boy , and then only in a rudimentary and primitive form , and without any particular fondness for the exercise . But being now , in spirit at all events , [a precise elderly person]1126-a precise elderly person , with a decided notion of taking care of [himself]57-paul , [he]57-paul was resolved that not even [Tipping]71-tipping should compel [him]57-paul to trust [[his]57-paul person]701-his person within range of that dirty brown globe , which whistled past [his]57-paul ear or seemed spinning towards [his]57-paul stomach with such a hideous suggestion of a cannon - ball about it . All the ghastly instances , too , of accidents to life and limb in [the football field]1100-the football field came unpleasantly into [his]57-paul memory , and [he]57-paul saw the inadvisability of mingling with [the crowd]1129-the crowd and allowing [himself]57-paul to be kicked violently on the shins . So [he]57-paul trotted industriously about at a safe distance in order to allay suspicion , while waiting for a good opportunity to put [his]57-paul scheme of escape into execution . At last [he]57-paul could wait no longer , for the fearful thought occurred to [him]57-paul , that if [he]57-paul remained there much longer , [the Doctor]248-the doctor — who , as [he]57-paul knew from [Dick]60-dick , always came to superintend , if not to share the sports of [[his]57-paul pupils]2437-his pupils — might make [his]57-paul appearance , and then [his]57-paul chance would be lost for the present , for [he]57-paul knew too well that [he]57-paul should never find courage to ask permission from [him]248-the doctor .

With a beating heart [he]57-paul went up to [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler , who was still on the fence with [his]109-mr. tinkler novel , and asked as humbly as [he]109-mr. tinkler could bring [himself]109-mr. tinkler to do : " If [you]109-mr. tinkler please , [sir]2329-sir , will [you]109-mr. tinkler allow [me]109-mr. tinkler to go [home]296-home ? [I'm]109-mr. tinkler — [I'm]109-mr. tinkler not feeling at all well . "[109-mr. tinkler] " Not well ! What 's the matter with [you]109-mr. tinkler ? "[109-mr. tinkler] said [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler , without looking up . [Paul]57-paul had not prepared [himself]57-paul for details , and the sudden question rather threw [him]57-paul off [his]57-paul guard . " A slight touch of liver , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said at length . " It takes [me]57-paul after meals sometimes . "[57-paul] " [Liver]144-liver ! "[109-mr. tinkler] said [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler , " [you]109-mr. tinkler 've no right to such a thing at [your]109-mr. tinkler age ; it 's all nonsense , [you]109-mr. tinkler know . Run in and play , that 'll set [you]109-mr. tinkler up again . "[109-mr. tinkler] " It 's fatal , [sir]2329-sir , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul . " [[My]57-paul doctor]2573-my doctor expressly warned [me]57-paul against taking any violent exercise soon after luncheon . If [you]109-mr. tinkler knew what liver is , [you]109-mr. tinkler would n't say so ! "[57-paul] [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler stared , as well [he]109-mr. tinkler might , but making nothing of it , and being chiefly anxious not to be interrupted any longer , only said , " Oh , well , do n't bother [me]57-paul ; [I]57-paul daresay it 's all right . Cut along ! "[57-paul] So [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was free ; the path lay open to [him]57-paul now . [He]57-paul knew [he]57-paul would have little difficulty in finding [his]57-paul way to [the station]280-the station , and , once [there]2356-there , [he]57-paul would have the whole afternoon in which to wait for [a train]505-a train to [town]502-town . " [I]57-paul 've managed that excellently , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul thought , as [he]57-paul ran blithely off , almost like [the boy]246-the boy [he]57-paul seemed . " Not the slightest hitch . [I]57-paul defy the fates [themselves]988-ladies to stop [me]57-paul now ! "[57-paul] But the fates are [ladies]988-ladies , and — not of course that it follows — occasionally spiteful . It is very rash indeed to be ungallant enough to defy [them]988-ladies — [they]988-ladies have such an unpleasant habit of accepting the challenge . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul had hardly got clear of the groups scattered about [the field]2951-the field , when [he]57-paul met [a small flaxen - haired boy , who was just coming down to join the game]1139-a small flaxen - haired boy , who was just coming down to join the game . It was [Porter]86-porter , [[his]57-paul neighbour of [the German lesson]1141-the german lesson]1140-his neighbour of the german lesson .

" There [you]57-paul are , [Bultitude]57-paul , then , "[86-porter] [he]86-porter said in [his]86-porter squeaky voice : " [I]86-porter want [you]57-paul . "[86-porter] " [I]57-paul ca n't stop , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " [I]57-paul 'm in a hurry — another time . "[57-paul] " Another time wo n't do , "[86-porter] said [little Porter]86-porter , laying hold of [him]57-paul by [his]86-porter jacket . " [I]86-porter want that rabbit . "[86-porter] This outrageous demand took [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's breath away . [He]57-paul had no idea what rabbit was referred to , or why [he]57-paul should be required to produce such an animal at a moment 's notice . This was the second time [an inconvenient small boy]1142-an inconvenient small boy had interfered between [him]57-paul and liberty . [He]57-paul would not be baffled twice . [He]57-paul tried to shake off [[his]57-paul persecutor]1143-his persecutor . " [I]57-paul tell [you]86-porter , [[my]57-paul good boy]2781-my good boy , [I]57-paul have n't such a thing about [me]57-paul . [I]57-paul have n't indeed . [I]57-paul do n't even know what [you]86-porter 're talking about . "[57-paul] This denial enraged [Porter]86-porter . " [I]86-porter say , [[you]86-porter fellows]2659-you fellows , "[86-porter] [he]86-porter called out , " come here ! Do make [Bultitude]57-paul give [me]86-porter [my]86-porter rabbit . [He]57-paul says [he]57-paul does n't know anything about it now ! "[86-porter] At this [several of [the loungers]1145-the loungers]1144-several of the loungers came up , glad of a distraction . " What 's the matter ? "[1146-some of them] [some of [them]1145-the loungers]1146-some of them asked . " Why , "[86-porter] whined [Porter]86-porter , " [he]57-paul promised to bring [me]86-porter back a rabbit this term , and now [he]57-paul pretends [he]57-paul does not know anything about it . Make [him]57-paul say what [he]57-paul 's done with it ! "[86-porter] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was not usually ready of resource , but now [he]57-paul had what seemed a happy thought . " Gad ! "[57-paul] [he]57-paul cried , pretending to recollect it , " so [I]57-paul did — to be sure , a rabbit , of course , how could [I]57-paul forget [it]2962-it ? It's — it 's a splendid rabbit . [I]57-paul 'll go and fetch it ! "[57-paul] " Will [you]57-paul ? "[86-porter] cried [Porter]86-porter , half relieved . " Where is it , then ? "[86-porter] " Where ? "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul sharply ( [he]57-paul was growing positively brilliant ) . " Why , in [[my]57-paul playbox]2963-my playbox to be sure ; where should it be ? "[57-paul] " It is n't in [[your]57-paul playbox]2964-your playbox , [I]86-porter know , "[86-porter] put in [Siggers]90-tipping : " because [I]86-porter saw it turned out yesterday and there was no rabbit then . Besides , how could [a rabbit]2965-a rabbit live in [a playbox]2966-a playbox ? [He]2965-a rabbit 's telling lies . [I]86-porter can see it by [his]2965-a rabbit face . [He]2965-a rabbit has n't any rabbit ! "[86-porter] " Of course [I]57-paul have n't ! "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul . " How should [I]57-paul ? [I]57-paul 'm not [a conjurer]2651-a conjurer . It 's not a habit of [mine]57-paul to go about with rabbits concealed on [my]57-paul person . What 's the use of coming to [me]57-paul like this ? "[57-paul] [The crowd]1129-the crowd increased until there was quite a ring formed round [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul and [the indignant claimant]1148-the indignant claimant , and presently [Tipping]90-tipping came bustling up . "[57-paul] " [He]2965-a rabbit had a rabbit [he]2965-a rabbit said [he]2965-a rabbit was keeping for [me]86-porter , "[86-porter] explained [little Porter]86-porter : " and now [he]2965-a rabbit wo n't give it up or tell [me]86-porter what [he]2965-a rabbit 's done with it . "[86-porter] " [He]2965-a rabbit has some mice [he]2965-a rabbit ought to give [us]1149-one or two new - comers , too , "[1149-one or two new - comers] said [one or two new - comers]1149-one or two new - comers , edging [their]1149-one or two new - comers way to the front . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was of course exceedingly annoyed by this unlooked - for interruption , and still more by such utterly preposterous claims on [him]57-paul for animals ; however , it was easy to explain that [he]57-paul had no such things in [his]57-paul possession , and after that of course no more could be said . [He]57-paul was beginning to disclaim all liability , when [Siggers]90-tipping stopped [him]57-paul . " Keep that for the present , "[90-tipping] [he]90-tipping said . " [I]57-paul say , [we]1149-one or two new - comers ought to have a regular trial over this , and get at the truth of it properly . "[57-paul] [He]57-paul fixed upon the goal - posts as being somehow more formal , and , as [his]57-paul proposal was well received , [two of [them]1150-two of them]1150-two of them grasped [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul by the collar and dragged [him]57-paul along in procession to the appointed spot between the two flags , while [Siggers]90-tipping followed in what [he]90-tipping conceived to be a highly judicial manner , and evidently enjoying [himself]90-tipping prodigiously . [Paul]57-paul , though highly indignant , allowed [himself]57-paul to be led along without resistance . It was safest to humour [them]1150-two of them , for after all it would not last long , and when [they]1150-two of them were tired of baiting [him]57-paul [he]57-paul could watch [his]57-paul time and slip quietly away . When [they]1150-two of them reached the goal - posts [Siggers]90-tipping arranged [them]1150-two of them in a circle , placing [himself]90-tipping , the hapless [Paul]57-paul , and [[his]90-tipping accusers]1151-his accusers in the centre . " [[You]1150-two of them chaps]2661-you chaps had better all be [jurymen]2970-jurymen , "[90-tipping] [he]90-tipping said . " [I]90-tipping 'll be [judge]2971-judge , and unless [he]90-tipping makes a clean breast of it , "[90-tipping] [he]90-tipping added with judicial impartiality , " [the court]2972-the court will jolly well punch [his]90-tipping ugly young head off . "[90-tipping] [[Siggers]90-tipping ' father]1152-siggers ' father was [an Old Bailey barrister]1153-an old bailey barrister in good and rather sharp practice , so that it was clearly [the son]253-the son 's mission to preside on this occasion . But unfortunately [his]90-tipping hour of office was doomed to be a brief one , for [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn , becoming aware that the game was being still more scantily supported , and noticing [the crowd at the goal]1155-the crowd at the goal , came up to know the reason of it at a long camel - like trot , [his]90-tipping hat on the back of [his]90-tipping head , [his]90-tipping mild face flushed with exertion , and [his]90-tipping pebble glasses gleaming in the winter sunshine . "[86-porter] To [Paul]57-paul 's horror [two or three other boys]1159-two or three other boys came forward with much the same tale . [He]57-paul remembered now that during the holidays [he]57-paul had discovered that [Dick]60-dick was maintaining a sort of amateur menagerie in [[his]60-dick bedroom]2762-his bedroom , and that [he]60-dick had ordered the whole of the livestock to be got rid of or summarily destroyed . Now it seemed that [the wretched Dick]60-dick had already disposed of it to [these clamorous boys]1161-these clamorous boys , and , what was worse , had stipulated with considerable forethought for payment in advance . For the first time [he]60-dick repented [his]60-dick paternal harshness . Like the netted lion , a paltry white mouse or two would have set [him]60-dick free ; but , less happy than the beast in the fable , [he]60-dick had not one ! [He]60-dick tried to stammer out excuses . " It 's extremely unfortunate , "[60-dick] [he]60-dick said , " but the fact is [I]60-dick 'm not in a position to meet this — this sudden call upon [me]60-dick . "[108-mr. blinkhorn] " Because , "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , wriggling with embarrassment , " [I]57-paul — that is [[my]57-paul father]2430-my father — found out that [[my]57-paul young rascal of [a son]2879-a son]2993-my young rascal of a son — [I]57-paul mean [[his]2430-my father young rascal of [a son]2879-a son]2995-his young rascal of a son ( [me]57-paul , [you]57-paul know ) was , contrary to [my]57-paul express orders , keeping a couple of abominable rabbits in [[his]2430-my father bedroom]2762-his bedroom , and a quantity of filthy little white mice which [he]2430-my father tried to train to climb up the banisters . And [I]57-paul kept finding [the brutes]2998-the brutes running about [[my]57-paul bath - room]2999-my bath - room , and — well , of course , [I]57-paul put a stop to it ; and — no , what am [I]57-paul saying?—my father , of course , [he]2430-my father put a stop to it ; and , in point of fact , had [them]2998-the brutes all drowned in a pail of water . "[57-paul] It might be thought that [he]1163-he had an excellent opportunity here of avowing [himself]1163-he , but there was the risk that [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn would disbelieve [him]1163-he , and , with [the boys]570-the boys , [he]1163-he felt that the truth would do anything but increase [his]1163-he popularity . But dissembling fails sometimes outside the copy - books , and [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's rather blundering attempt at it only landed [him]1163-he in worse difficulties . And as contempt is a frame of mind highly stimulating to [one]271-one 's self - esteem , even [those who had no personal interest in the matter]1168-those who had no personal interest in the matter joined in the execrations with hearty goodwill and sympathy . " Why did [you]57-paul let [him]57-paul do it ? [They]1166-them were [ours]3000-ours , not [his]57-paul . "[108-mr. blinkhorn] [One boy]671-one boy after another brought forward [his]671-one boy claim . [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn , naturally enough , saw no reason why the money , being clearly due , should not be paid at once . " Give [me]57-paul any money [you]57-paul have about [you]57-paul , [Bultitude]57-paul , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , " and [I]57-paul 'll satisfy [your]57-paul debts with it , as far as it goes . "[108-mr. blinkhorn] " [I]57-paul tell [you]108-mr. blinkhorn [I]57-paul wo n't ! "[57-paul] cried [Paul]57-paul ; " do [you]108-mr. blinkhorn hear ? Not one sixpence . Oh , if [you]108-mr. blinkhorn knew ! That infernal Garudâ Stone ! What [fools people]3014-fools people are ! "[57-paul] Then in [his]57-paul despair [he]57-paul did the most fatal thing possible . [He]57-paul tried to save [himself]57-paul by flight , and with a violent plunge broke through the circle and made for [the road]1174-the road which led towards [the station]280-the station . Instantly [the whole school]2673-the whole school , only too glad of the excitement , was at [his]57-paul heels . [The unhappy Colonial Produce merchant]1177-the unhappy colonial produce merchant ran as [he]1177-the unhappy colonial produce merchant had not run for a quarter of a century , faster even than [he]1177-the unhappy colonial produce merchant had on [his]1177-the unhappy colonial produce merchant first experience of [Coggs]89-coggs ' and [[Coker]88-coker 's society]1178-coker 's society on that memorable Monday night . But in spite of [his]1177-the unhappy colonial produce merchant efforts the chase was a short one . [Chawner]101-chawner and [Tipping]90-tipping very soon had [him]1177-the unhappy colonial produce merchant by the collar , and brought [him]1177-the unhappy colonial produce merchant back , struggling and kicking out viciously , to [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn , whose good opinion [he]1177-the unhappy colonial produce merchant had now lost for ever . " Please , [sir]2329-sir , "[101-chawner] said [Chawner]101-chawner , " [I]101-chawner can feel something like a purse in [his]1177-the unhappy colonial produce merchant pocket . Shall [I]101-chawner take it out , [sir]2329-sir ? "[101-chawner] " As [he]1177-the unhappy colonial produce merchant refuses to act with common honesty — yes , "[108-mr. blinkhorn] said [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn . It was [Dick]60-dick 's purse , of course ; and in spite of [Paul]57-paul 's frantic efforts to retain it , it was taken from [him]1177-the unhappy colonial produce merchant , its contents equitably divided amongst [the claimants]1179-the claimants , and the purse itself returned to [him]1177-the unhappy colonial produce merchant — empty . " Now , [Bultitude]57-paul , "[108-mr. blinkhorn] said [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn , " if [you]57-paul really wish to leave [the field]2951-the field , [you]57-paul may . "[108-mr. blinkhorn] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul lost what little temper [he]57-paul had yet to lose ; [he]57-paul flung the useless purse from [him]57-paul and broke away from [them]1180-them all in a condition little removed from insanity . Leave [the field]2951-the field ! What a mockery the permission was now . How was [he]57-paul to get [home]296-home , a distance of more than fifty miles , without a penny in [his]57-paul pocket ? Ten minutes before , and freedom was within [his]57-paul grasp , and now it had eluded [him]57-paul and was as hopelessly out of reach as ever ! [No one]2331-no one pitied [him]57-paul ; [no one]2331-no one understood the real extent of [his]57-paul loss . [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn and [the few enthusiasts]1185-the few enthusiasts went back to [their]1180-them unobtrusive game , while [the rest of [the school]506-the school]1186-the rest of the school discussed the affair in groups , the popular indignation against [young Bultitude]57-paul 's hitherto unsuspected meanness growing more marked every instant . It might have even taken some decided and objectionable form before long , but when it was at its height there was a sudden cry of alarm . " Cave , [[you]2437-his pupils fellows]2659-you fellows , here 's [Grim]107-grim ! "[248-the doctor] and indeed in the far distance [[the Doctor]248-the doctor 's portly and imposing figure]1189-the doctor 's portly and imposing figure could be seen just turning the corner into [the field]2951-the field . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul felt almost cheered . This coming to join [[his]57-paul pupils]2437-his pupils ' sports showed a good heart ; [the Doctor]248-the doctor would almost certainly be in a good humour , and [he]248-the doctor cheated [himself]248-the doctor into believing that , at some interval in the game , [he]248-the doctor might perhaps find courage to draw near and seek to interest [him]248-the doctor in [his]248-the doctor incredible woes . It was quite extraordinary to see how the game , which had hitherto decidedly languished and hung fire , now quickened into briskness and became positively spirited . [Everyone]680-everyone developed a hearty interest in it , and it would almost seem as if [the boys]570-the boys , with more delicacy than [they]570-the boys are generally credited with , were unwilling to let [[their]570-the boys master]1195-their master guess how little [his]1195-their master indulgence was really appreciated . Even [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler , whose novel had kept [him]57-paul spell - bound on [his]57-paul rail all through the recent excitement , now slipped it hurriedly into [his]57-paul pocket and rushed energetically into the fray , shouting encouragement rather indiscriminately to either side , till [he]57-paul had an opportunity of finding out privately to which leader [he]57-paul had been assigned . [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone came down [the field]2951-the field at a majestic slow trot , calling out to [the players]1197-the players as [he]62-dr. grimstone came on—"Well done , Mutlow ! Finely played , [sir]2329-sir ! Dribble it along now . Ah , [you]2329-sir 're afraid of it ! Run into it , [sir]2329-sir , run into it ! No running with the ball now , [Siggers]90-tipping ; play without those petty meannesses , or leave the game ! There , leave the ball to [me]62-dr. grimstone , will [you]2329-sir — leave it to [me]62-dr. grimstone ! "[62-dr. grimstone] And , as the ball had rolled in [his]62-dr. grimstone direction , [he]62-dr. grimstone punted it up in an exceedingly dignified manner , [the whole school]2673-the whole school keeping respectfully apart , until [he]62-dr. grimstone had brought it to a reasonable distance from the goal , when [he]62-dr. grimstone kicked it through with great solemnity , amidst faint , and it is to be feared somewhat sycophantic applause , and turned away with the air of [a man surfeited of success]1199-a man surfeited of success . " For which side did [I]62-dr. grimstone win that ? "[62-dr. grimstone] [he]62-dr. grimstone asked presently , whereupon [Tipping]90-tipping explained that [his]62-dr. grimstone side had been [the favoured one]1200-the favoured one . " Well then , "[62-dr. grimstone] [he]62-dr. grimstone said , " [[you]2329-sir fellows]2659-you fellows must all back [me]62-dr. grimstone up , or [I]62-dr. grimstone shall not play for [you]2329-sir any more ; "[62-dr. grimstone] and [he]62-dr. grimstone kicked off the ball for the next game . It was noticeable that [the party thus distinguished]1201-the party thus distinguished did not seem precisely overwhelmed with pleasure at the compliment , which , as [they]1201-the party thus distinguished knew from experience , implied considerable exertion on [their]1201-the party thus distinguished part , and even disgrace if [they]1201-the party thus distinguished were unsuccessful . [The other side]1202-the other side too looked unhappy , feeling [themselves]1202-the other side in a position of extreme delicacy and embarrassment . For if [they]1202-the other side played [their]1202-the other side best , [they]1202-the other side ran some risk of offending [the Doctor]248-the doctor , or , what was worse , drawing [him]248-the doctor over into [their]1202-the other side ranks ; while if , on the other hand , [they]1202-the other side allowed [themselves]1202-the other side to be too easily worsted , [they]1202-the other side might be suspected of sulkiness and temper — offences which [he]248-the doctor was very ready to discover and resent . [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone for [his]62-dr. grimstone part enjoyed the exercise , and had no idea that [he]62-dr. grimstone was not [a thoroughly welcome and valued playmate]1204-a thoroughly welcome and valued playmate . But though it was pleasant to [outsiders]1205-outsiders to see [a schoolmaster]1206-a schoolmaster permitting [himself]1206-a schoolmaster to share in the recreation of [[his]1206-a schoolmaster pupils]2437-his pupils , it must be owned that to the latter the advantages of the arrangement seemed something more than dubious . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , being on the side adopted by [the Doctor]248-the doctor , found too soon that [he]57-paul was expected to bestir [himself]57-paul . More than ever anxious now to conciliate , [he]57-paul did [his]57-paul very best to conquer [his]57-paul natural repugnance and appear more interested than alarmed as the ball came in [his]57-paul way ; but although ( in boating slang ) [he]57-paul " sugared "[57-paul] with some adroitness , [he]57-paul was promptly found out , for [[his]57-paul son]225-his son had been [a dashing and plucky player]1210-a dashing and plucky player . It was bitter for [him]57-paul to run meekly about while scathing sarcasms and comments on [his]57-paul want of courage were being hurled at [his]57-paul head . It shattered the scanty remnants of [his]57-paul self - respect , but [he]57-paul dared not protest or say a single word to open [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's eyes to the injustice [he]248-the doctor was doing [him]57-paul . [He]57-paul was unpleasantly reminded , too , of the disfavour [he]57-paul had acquired amongst [[his]57-paul companions]2323-his companions , by [some one or other of [them]2323-his companions]1213-some one or other of them running up to [him]57-paul every moment when [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's attention was called elsewhere , and startling [his]57-paul nerves by a sly jog or pinch , or an abusive epithet hissed viciously into [his]57-paul ears — [Chawner]101-chawner being especially industrious in this respect . And in this unsatisfactory way the afternoon dragged along until the dusk gathered and the lamps were lighted , and it became too dark to see goal - posts or ball . By the time play was stopped and [the school]506-the school reformed for the march [home]296-home , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul felt that [he]57-paul was glad even to get back to [labour]1217-labour as a relief from such a form of enjoyment . It was perhaps the most miserable afternoon [he]57-paul had ever spent in [his]57-paul whole easy - going life . In the course of it [he]57-paul had passed from brightest hope to utter despair ; and now nothing remained to [him]57-paul but to convince [the Doctor]248-the doctor , which [he]57-paul felt quite unequal to do , or to make [his]57-paul escape without money — which would inevitably end in a recapture . May [no one who reads this]1219-no one who reads this ever be placed upon the horns of such a dilemma ! If it were not that it was so absolutely essential to the interest of this story , [I]0-i think [I]0-i should almost prefer to draw a veil over the sufferings of [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul during the rest of that unhappy week at [Crichton House]4-crichton house ; but it would only be false delicacy to do so . Things went worse and worse with [him]57-paul . [The real Dick]60-dick in [his]57-paul most objectionable moods could never have contrived to render [himself]57-paul one quarter so disliked and suspected as [his]57-paul substitute was by [the whole school]2673-the whole school — [masters]1221-masters and [boys]2308-boys . It was in a great measure [his]57-paul own fault , too ; for to [an ordinary boy]1223-an ordinary boy the life there would not have had any intolerable hardships , if it held out no exceptional attractions . But [he]57-paul would not accommodate [himself]57-paul to circumstances , and try , during [his]57-paul enforced stay , to get as much instruction and enjoyment as possible out of [his]57-paul new life . Perhaps , in [his]57-paul position , it would be too much to expect such a thing and , at all events , it never even occurred to [him]57-paul to attempt it . [He]57-paul consumed [himself]57-paul instead with inward raging and chafing at [his]57-paul hard lot , and [his]57-paul utter powerlessness to break the spell which bound [him]57-paul .

Sometimes , indeed , [he]57-paul would resolve to bear it no longer , and would start up impulsively to impart [his]57-paul misfortunes to [some one in minor authority]1224-some one in minor authority — not [the Doctor]248-the doctor , [he]57-paul had given that up in resigned despair long since . But as surely as ever [he]57-paul found [himself]57-paul coming to the point , the words would stick fast in [his]57-paul throat , and [he]57-paul was only too thankful to get away , with [his]57-paul tale untold , on any frivolous pretext that first suggested itself . This , of course , brought [him]57-paul into suspicion , for such conduct had the appearance of a systematic course of practical joking , and [even the most impartial teachers]1226-even the most impartial teachers will sometimes form an unfavourable opinion of [a particular boy]1227-a particular boy on rather slender grounds , and then find fresh confirmation of it in [his]57-paul most insignificant actions . As for [the school]506-the school generally , [his]57-paul scowls and [his]57-paul sullenness , [his]57-paul deficiency in the daring and impudence that had warmed [their]1229-their hearts towards [Dick]60-dick , and , above all , [his]57-paul strange knack of getting [them]1229-their into trouble — for [he]57-paul seldom received what [he]57-paul considered an indignity without making a formal complaint — all this brought [him]57-paul as much hearty dislike and contempt as , perhaps , [the most unsympathetic boy ever earned since boarding - schools]1230-the most unsympathetic boy ever earned since boarding - schools were first invented . [The only boy who still seemed to retain a secret tenderness for [him]57-paul , as the Dick [he]57-paul had once looked up to and admired]1231-the only boy who still seemed to retain a secret tenderness for him , as the dick he had once looked up to and admired , was [Jolland]78-jolland , who persisted in believing , and in stating [his]78-jolland belief , that this apparent change of demeanour was a perverted kind of joke on [Bultitude]60-dick 's part , which [he]78-jolland would condescend to explain some day when it had gone far enough , and [he]78-jolland wearied and annoyed [Paul]57-paul beyond endurance by perpetually urging [him]57-paul to abandon [his]78-jolland ill - judged experiment and discover the point of the jest . But for [Jolland]78-jolland 's help , which [he]78-jolland persevered in giving in spite of the opposition and unpopularity it brought upon [himself]78-jolland , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul would have found it impossible to make any pretence of performing the tasks required of [him]57-paul .

[He]57-paul found [himself]57-paul expected , as a matter of course , to have a certain familiarity with Greek paradigms and German conversation scraps , propositions in Euclid and Latin gerunds , of all of which , having had a strict commercial education in [his]57-paul young days , [he]57-paul had not so much as heard before [his]57-paul metamorphosis . But by carefully copying [Jolland]78-jolland 's exercises , and introducing enough mistakes of [his]57-paul own to supply the necessary local colour , [he]57-paul was able to escape to a great degree the discovery of [his]57-paul blank ignorance on all these subjects — an ignorance which would certainly have been put down as mere idleness and obstinacy . But it will be readily believed that [he]57-paul lived in constant fear of such discovery , and as it was , [his]57-paul dependence on [a little scamp like [[his]57-paul son]225-his son 's friend]1232-a little scamp like his son 's friend was a sore humiliation to [one who had naturally supposed hitherto that any knowledge [he]57-paul had not happened to acquire]1234-one who had naturally supposed hitherto that any knowledge he had not happened to acquire could only be meretricious and useless . [He]57-paul led a nightmare sort of existence for some days , until something happened which roused [him]57-paul from [his]57-paul state of passive misery into one more attempt at protest . It was Saturday morning , and [he]57-paul had come down to breakfast , after being knocked about as usual in [the dormitory]1235-the dormitory over night , with a dull wonder how long this horrible state of things could possibly be going to last , when [he]57-paul saw on [his]57-paul plate a letter with the Paddington post - mark , addressed in a familiar hand — [[his]57-paul daughter]2769-his daughter [Barbara]64-barbara 's . For an instant [his]57-paul hopes rose high . Surely [the impostor]1237-the impostor had been found out at last , and the envelope would contain an urgent invitation to [him]57-paul to come back and resume [his]57-paul rights — an invitation which [he]57-paul might show to [the Doctor]248-the doctor as [his]57-paul best apology . But when [he]57-paul looked at the address , which was " [Master Richard Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude , "[64-barbara] [he]57-paul felt a misgiving . It was unlikely that [Barbara]64-barbara would address [him]57-paul thus if [she]64-barbara knew the truth ; [he]57-paul hesitated before tearing it open . Then [he]57-paul tried to persuade [himself]57-paul that of course [she]64-barbara would have the sense to keep up appearances for [his]57-paul own sake on the outside of the letter , and [he]57-paul compelled [himself]57-paul to open the envelope with fingers that trembled nervously . The very first sentences scattered [his]57-paul faint expectations to the winds . [He]57-paul read on with staring eyes , till [the room]213-the room seemed to rock with [him]57-paul like a packet - boat and [the sprawling school - girl]1240-the sprawling school - girl handwriting , crossed and recrossed on the thin paper , changed to letters of scorching flame . But perhaps it will be better to give the letter in full , so that [the reader]1241-the reader may judge for [himself]1241-the reader whether it was calculated or not to soothe and encourage [the exiled one]1242-the exiled one . Here it is : " [[My]0-i dearest]3022-my dearest darling [Dick,—I]146-dick,—i hope [you]146-dick,—i have not been expecting a letter from [me]0-i before this , but [I]0-i had such lots to tell [you]146-dick,—i that [I]0-i waited till [I]0-i had time to tell it all at once . For [I]0-i have such news for [you]146-dick,—i ! [You]146-dick,—i ca n't think how pleased [you]146-dick,—i will be when [you]146-dick,—i hear it . Where shall [I]0-i begin ? [I]0-i hardly know , for it still seems so funny and strange — almost like a dream — only [I]0-i hope [we]1245-we shall never wake up . "[0-i] [I]0-i think [I]0-i must tell [you]1243-you anyhow , just as it comes . Well , ever since [you]1243-you went away , [dear Father]1244-dear father has been completely changed ; [you]1243-you would hardly believe it unless [you]1243-you saw [him]1244-dear father . [He]1244-dear father is quite jolly and boyish — only fancy ! and [we]1245-we are always telling [him]1244-dear father [he]1244-dear father is [the biggest baby of [us]1245-we all]1246-the biggest baby of us all , but it only makes [him]1244-dear father laugh . Once , [you]1243-you know , [he]1244-dear father would have been awfully angry if [we]1245-we had even hinted at it . " Do [you]1243-you know , [I]1244-dear father really think that the real reason [he]1244-dear father was so cross and sharp with [us]1245-we that last week was because [you]1243-you were going away ; for now the wrench of parting is over , [he]1244-dear father is quite light - hearted again . [You]1243-you know how [he]1244-dear father always hates showing [his]1244-dear father feelings . "[1244-dear father] [He]1244-dear father is so altered now , [you]1243-you ca n't think . [He]1244-dear father has actually only once been up to [the city]2416-the city since [you]1243-you left , and then [he]1244-dear father came [home]296-home at four o'clock , and [he]1244-dear father seems to quite like to have [us]1245-we all about [him]1244-dear father . Generally [he]1244-dear father stays at [home]296-home all the morning and plays at [soldiers]1250-soldiers with [baby]1251-baby in [the dining - room]275-the dining - room . [You]1243-you would laugh to see [him]1244-dear father loading the cannons with real powder and shot , and [he]1244-dear father did n't care a bit when some of it made holes in the sideboard and smashed the looking - glass . " [We]1245-we had such fun the other afternoon ; [we]1245-we played at brigands — [papa]3023-papa and [all of [us]1245-we]3024-all of us . [Papa]147-papa had the upper conservatory for a robber - cave , and stood there keeping guard with [your]1243-you pop - gun ; and [he]147-papa would n't let [the servants]2402-the servants go by without a kiss , unless [they]2402-the servants showed a written pass from [us]1245-we ! [Miss McFadden]148-miss mcfadden called in the middle of it , but [she]148-miss mcfadden said [she]148-miss mcfadden would n't come in , as [papa]3023-papa seemed to be enjoying [himself]3023-papa so . [Boaler]67-boaler has given warning , but [we]1245-we ca n't think why . [We]1245-we have been out nearly every evening — once to [Hengler]3027-hengler 's and once to the Christy Minstrels , and last night to the Pantomime , where [papa]3023-papa was so pleased with [the clown]3029-the clown that [he]3023-papa sent round afterwards and asked [him]3029-the clown to dine [here]2411-here on Sunday , when [Sir Benjamin]76-bangle and [Lady Bangle]149-bangle and [Alderman Fishwick]150-alderman fishwick are coming . Wo n't it be jolly to see [a clown]3031-a clown close to ? Should [you]3032-you think [he]3029-the clown 'd come in [his]3029-the clown evening dress ? [Miss Mangnall]151-miss mangnall has been given a month 's holiday , because [papa]3023-papa did n't like to see [us]1253-we always at lessons . Think of that ! "[1244-dear father] [We]1253-we are going to have [the whole house]1254-the whole house done up and refurnished at last . [Papa]147-papa chose the furniture for [the drawing - room]2342-the drawing - room yesterday . It is all in yellow satin , which is rather bright , [I]0-i think . [I]0-i have n't seen the carpet yet , but it is to match the furniture ; and there is a lovely hearthrug , with a lion - hunt worked on it . " But that is n't the best of it ; [we]1253-we are going to have [the big children]3034-the big children 's party after all ! [No one]2331-no one but [children]240-children invited , and [everyone]680-everyone to do exactly what [they]680-everyone like . [I]0-i wanted so much to have [you]3032-you [home]296-home for it , but [papa]3023-papa says it would only unsettle [you]3032-you and take [you]3032-you away from [your]3032-you work .[0-i]

" Had [Dulcie]110-dulcie forgotten [you]3032-you ? [I]1257-your affectionate sister should like to see [her]110-dulcie so much . Now [I]1257-your affectionate sister really must leave off , as [I]1257-your affectionate sister am going to [the Aquarium]3040-the aquarium with [papa]3023-papa . Mind [you]3032-you write [me]1257-your affectionate sister as good a letter as this is , if [that old Doctor]3042-that old doctor lets [you]3032-you . [Minnie]152-maria and [Roly]65-roly send love and kisses , and [papa]3023-papa sends [his]3023-papa kind regards , and [I]1257-your affectionate sister am to say [he]3023-papa hopes [you]3032-you are settling down steadily to work . "[1257-your affectionate sister] With best love , [[your]1256-your affectionate sister]1257-your affectionate sister , " [Barbara Bultitude]153-barbara . "[1257-your affectionate sister] " [P.S.—I]154-p.s.—i nearly forgot to say that [Uncle Duke]72-uncle duke came the other day and has stayed [here]2411-here ever since . [He]72-uncle duke is going to make [papa]3023-papa 's fortune ! [I]0-i believe by a gold mine [he]72-uncle duke knows about somewhere , and [a steam tramway in [Lapland]38-lapland]3046-a steam tramway in lapland . But [I]0-i do n't like [him]72-uncle duke very much — [he]72-uncle duke is so polite . "[0-i] It would be nothing short of an insult to [the reader]1241-the reader 's comprehension , if [I]0-i were to enter into an elaborate explanation of the effect this letter had upon [Mr. Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude . [He]87-mr. bultitude took it in by degrees , trying to steady [his]87-mr. bultitude nerves at each additional item of poor [Barbara]153-barbara 's well - meant intelligence by a sip at [his]87-mr. bultitude tin - flavoured coffee . But when [he]87-mr. bultitude came to the postscript , in spite of its purport being mercifully broken to [him]87-mr. bultitude gradually by the extreme difficulty of making it out from two undercurrents of manuscript , [he]87-mr. bultitude choked convulsively and spilt [his]87-mr. bultitude coffee . [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone visited this breach of etiquette with stern promptness . " This conduct at table is disgraceful , [sir]2329-sir — perfectly disgraceful — unworthy of [a civilised being]3048-a civilised being . [I]62-dr. grimstone have been [a teacher of youth]3049-a teacher of youth for many years , and never till now did [I]62-dr. grimstone have the pain of seeing [a pupil of mine]3050-a pupil of mine choke in [his]3050-a pupil of mine breakfast - cup with such deplorable ill - breeding . It 's pure greediness , [sir]2329-sir , and [you]2329-sir will have the goodness to curb [your]2329-sir indecent haste in consuming [your]2329-sir food for the future . [[Your]2329-sir excellent father]2521-your excellent father has frequently complained to [me]62-dr. grimstone , with tears in [his]2521-your excellent father eyes , of the impossibility of teaching [you]2329-sir to behave at meals with common propriety ! "[62-dr. grimstone]

There was a faint chuckle along the tables , and [several]678-several drank coffee with studied elegance and self - repression either as a valuable example to [Dick]60-dick , or as a personal advertisement . But [Paul]57-paul was in no mood for reproof and instruction . [He]57-paul stood up in [his]57-paul excitement , flourishing [his]57-paul letter wildly . " [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone ! "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said ; " never mind [my]57-paul behaviour now . [I]57-paul 've something to tell [you]62-dr. grimstone . [I]57-paul ca n't bear it any longer . [I]57-paul must go [home]296-home at once — at once , [sir]2329-sir ! "[57-paul] There was a general sensation at this , for [his]57-paul manner was peremptory and almost dictatorial . [Some]749-some thought [he]57-paul would get a licking on the strength of it , and most hoped so . But [the Doctor]248-the doctor dismissed [them]1262-them to [the playground]648-the playground , keeping [Paul]57-paul back to be dealt with in privacy . [Mrs. Grimstone]100-mrs. grimstone played nervously with [her]100-mrs. grimstone dry toast at the end of the table , for [she]100-mrs. grimstone could not endure to see [the boys]570-the boys in trouble and dreaded a scene , while [Dulcie]110-dulcie looked on with wide bright eyes . " Now , [sir]2329-sir , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , looking up from [his]248-the doctor marmalade , " why must [you]2329-sir go [home]296-home at once ? "[248-the doctor] " [I]57-paul 've just had a letter , "[57-paul] stammered [Paul]57-paul . " [No one]2331-no one ill at [home]296-home , [I]57-paul hope ? "[57-paul] " No , no , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul . " It 's not that ; it 's worse ! [She]110-dulcie does n't know what horrible things [she]110-dulcie tells [me]57-paul ! "[57-paul] " Who is ' [she]110-dulcie ' ? "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor — and [Dulcie]110-dulcie 's eyes were larger still and [her]110-dulcie face paled . " [I]57-paul decline to say , "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul . It would have been absurd to say ' [[my]0-i daughter]1267-my daughter , ' and [he]57-paul had not presence of mind just then to transpose the relationships with neatness and success . " But indeed [I]57-paul am wanted most badly ! "[57-paul] " What are [you]57-paul wanted for , pray ? "[57-paul] " Everything ! "[57-paul] declared [Paul]57-paul ; " it 's all going to rack and ruin without [me]57-paul ! "[57-paul] " That 's absurd , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor ; " [you]57-paul 're not such [an important individual]3059-an important individual as all that , [Bultitude]57-paul . But let [me]248-the doctor see the letter . "[248-the doctor] Show [him]57-paul the letter — lay bare all those follies of [Dick]60-dick 's , the burden of which [he]57-paul might have to bear [himself]57-paul very shortly — never ! Besides , what would be the use of it ? It would be no argument in favour of sending [him]57-paul [home]296-home — rather the reverse — so [Paul]57-paul was obliged to say , " Excuse [me]57-paul , [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone , it is — ah — of a private nature . [I]57-paul do n't feel at liberty to show it to [anyone]2432-anyone . "[57-paul] " Then , [sir]2329-sir , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , with some reason , " if [you]2329-sir ca n't tell [me]248-the doctor who or what it is that requires [your]2329-sir presence at [home]296-home , and decline to show [me]248-the doctor the letter which would presumably give [me]248-the doctor some idea on the subject , how do [you]2329-sir expect that [I]248-the doctor am to listen to such a preposterous demand — eh ? Just tell [me]248-the doctor that ! "[248-the doctor] Once more would [Paul]57-paul have given worlds for the firmness and presence of mind to state [his]57-paul case clearly and effectively ; and [he]57-paul could hardly have had a better opportunity , for [schoolmasters]1271-schoolmasters can not always be playing [the tyrant]1272-the tyrant , and [the Doctor]248-the doctor was , in spite of [his]248-the doctor attempts to be stern , secretly more amused than angry at what seemed a peculiarly precocious piece of effrontery . But [Paul]57-paul felt the dismal absurdity of [his]57-paul position . Nothing [he]57-paul had said , nothing [he]57-paul could say , short of the truth , would avail [him]57-paul , and the truth was precisely what [he]57-paul felt most unable to tell . [He]57-paul hung [his]57-paul head resignedly , and held [his]57-paul tongue in confusion . " Pooh ! "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor at last ; " let [me]248-the doctor have no more of this tomfoolery , [Bultitude]57-paul . It 's getting to be a positive nuisance . Do n't come to [me]248-the doctor with any more of these ridiculous stories , or some day [I]248-the doctor shall be annoyed . There , go away , and be contented where [you]57-paul are , and try to behave like [other people]345-other people . "[248-the doctor] " ' Contented ! ' "[57-paul] muttered [Paul]57-paul , when out of hearing , as [he]57-paul went [upstairs]264-upstairs and through [the empty schoolroom]1276-the empty schoolroom into [the playground]648-the playground . " ' Behave like [other people]345-other people ! ' Ah , yes , [I]57-paul suppose [I]57-paul shall have to come to that in time . But that letter — — Everything upside down — — [Bangle]149-bangle asked to meet [a common clown]3065-a common clown ! [That fellow Duke]3066-that fellow duke letting [me]57-paul in for [gold - mines]3067-gold - mines and [tramways]3068-tramways ! It 's all worse than [I]57-paul ever dreamed of ; and [I]57-paul must stay [here]2411-here and be ' contented ! ' It's — it 's perfectly damnable ! "[57-paul] All through that morning [his]57-paul thoughts ran in the same doleful groove , until the time for work came to an end , and [he]57-paul found [himself]57-paul in [the playground]648-the playground , and free to indulge [his]57-paul melancholy for a few minutes in solitude ; for [the others]627-the others were still loitering about in [the schoolroom]2641-the schoolroom , and [a glass outhouse originally intended for [a conservatory]1282-a conservatory , but now devoted to boots and slates]1281-a glass outhouse originally intended for a conservatory , but now devoted to boots and slates , and the books liberally besmeared with gilt , and telling of the exploits of [[boy]836-boy - heroes so beloved of [boys]2308-boys]1284-boy - heroes so beloved of boys . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , only too delighted to get away from [them]627-the others for a little while , was leaning against the parallel bars in dull despondency , when [he]57-paul heard a rustling in the laurel hedge which cut off [the house garden]1286-the house garden from [the gravelled playground]1287-the gravelled playground , and looking up , saw [Dulcie]110-dulcie slip through the shrubs and come towards [him]57-paul with an air of determination in [her]110-dulcie proud little face . [She]110-dulcie looked prettier and daintier than ever in [her]110-dulcie grey hat and warm fur tippet ; but of course [Paul]57-paul was not of the age or in the mood to be much affected by such things — [he]57-paul turned [his]57-paul head pettishly away . " It 's no use doing that , [Dick]60-dick , "[110-dulcie] [she]110-dulcie said : " [I]110-dulcie 'm tired of sulking . [I]110-dulcie sha n't sulk any more till [I]110-dulcie have an explanation . "[110-dulcie] [Paul]57-paul made the sound generally written " Pshaw ! "[57-paul] " [You]60-dick ought to tell [me]110-dulcie everything . [I]110-dulcie will know it . " [I]57-paul ca n't do anything for [you]60-dick . "[57-paul] " Yes , [you]57-paul can ; [you]57-paul know [you]57-paul can ! "[110-dulcie] said [Dulcie]110-dulcie impulsively . " [You]57-paul can tell [me]110-dulcie what was in that letter [you]57-paul had at breakfast — and [you]57-paul shall too ! "[110-dulcie] " What [an inquisitive little girl]3071-an inquisitive little girl [you]60-dick are , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul sententiously . " It 's not nice for [little girls]3072-little girls to be so inquisitive — it does n't look well . "[57-paul] " [I]110-dulcie knew it ! "[110-dulcie] " Upon [my]57-paul word , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " this is very forward ; at [your]57-paul age too . " No , no , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , retreating a step or two , " it 's all a mistake ; there 's nothing to get into such a passion about — there is n't indeed ! "[57-paul] [Paul]57-paul thought for a moment . After all , why should n't [he]57-paul ? It was much pleasanter to tell [his]57-paul sorrows to [her]110-dulcie little ear and hear [her]110-dulcie childish wonder and pity than face [[her]110-dulcie terrible father]1288-her terrible father — [he]57-paul had tried that . And then [she]110-dulcie might tell [[her]110-dulcie mother]1289-her mother ; and so [his]57-paul story might reach [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's ears after all , without further effort on [his]57-paul part . "[57-paul] So [he]57-paul sat down on the bench by the wall , and [Dulcie]110-dulcie , quite happy again now at this proof of good faith , nestled up against [him]57-paul confidingly , waiting for [his]57-paul first words with parted lips and eager sparkling eyes .

" Not many days ago , "[57-paul] began [Paul]57-paul , " [I]57-paul was [somebody]2393-somebody very different from — — "[57-paul] " Oh , indeed , "[110-dulcie] said a jarring , sneering voice close by ; " was [you]57-paul ? "[110-dulcie] And [he]57-paul looked up and saw [Tipping]90-tipping standing over [him]57-paul with a plainly hostile intent . [I]110-dulcie do n't care what [he]60-dick says ! "[110-dulcie] It was a most unpleasant situation for [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , but [he]57-paul did not like to offend [Tipping]90-tipping .
