" [I]57-paul should n't think of such a thing ! "[57-paul] and [he]57-paul rose from the bench and was about to walk away , when [Tipping]90-tipping suddenly pulled off [his]90-tipping coat and began to make sundry demonstrations of a martial nature , such as dancing aggressively towards [[his]90-tipping rival]1291-his rival and clenching [his]90-tipping fists .

By this time [most of [the other boys]592-the other boys]1292-most of the other boys had come down into [the playground]648-the playground , and were looking on with great interest . There was an element of romance in this promised combat which gave it additional attractions . It was like one of the struggles between [knightly champions]1295-knightly champions in the Waverley novels . [Several of [them]592-the other boys]795-several of them would have fought till [they]795-several of them could n't see out of [their]795-several of them eyes if it would have given [them]795-several of them the least chance of obtaining favour in [Dulcie]110-dulcie 's sight , and [they]795-several of them all envied [Dick]60-dick , who was [the only boy that was not unmercifully snubbed by [[their]795-several of them capricious little princess]1298-their capricious little princess]1297-the only boy that was not unmercifully snubbed by their capricious little princess . [Paul]57-paul alone was blind to the splendour of [his]57-paul privileges . [He]57-paul examined [Tipping]90-tipping carefully , as [the latter]446-the latter was still assuming a hostile attitude and chanting a sort of war - cry supposed to be an infallible incentive to strife . " [Yah]3087-yah , [you]57-paul 're afraid ! "[57-paul] [he]57-paul sang very offensively . " [I]57-paul would n't be a funk ! "[57-paul] " Pooh ! "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul at last ; " go away , [sir]2329-sir , go away ! "[57-paul] " Go away , eh ? "[90-tipping] jeered [Tipping]90-tipping . " Who are [you]57-paul to tell [me]90-tipping to go away ? Go away [yourself]57-paul ! "[90-tipping] " Certainly , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , only too happy to oblige . But [he]57-paul found [himself]57-paul prevented by [a ring of [excited backers]1301-excited backers]1300-a ring of excited backers . " Do n't funk it , [Dick]60-dick ! "[749-some] cried [some]749-some , forgetting recent ill - feeling in the necessity for partisanship . " Go in and settle [him]60-dick as [you]60-dick did that last time . [I]749-some 'll second [you]60-dick . [You]60-dick can do it ! "[749-some] " Do n't hit each other in the face , "[110-dulcie] pleaded [Dulcie]110-dulcie , who had got upon a bench and was looking down into the ring — not , if the truth must be told , without a certain pleasurable excitement in the feeling that it was all about [her]110-dulcie . And now [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul discovered that [he]57-paul was seriously expected to fight [this great hulking boy]1303-this great hulking boy , and that the sole reason for any disagreement was an utterly unfounded jealousy respecting [this little girl]1304-this little girl [Dulcie]110-dulcie . [He]57-paul had not a grain of chivalry in [his]57-paul disposition — chivalry being an eminently unpractical virtue — and naturally [he]57-paul saw no advantage in letting [himself]57-paul be mauled for the sake of [a child younger than [[his]57-paul own daughter]1306-his own daughter]1305-a child younger than his own daughter . [Dulcie]110-dulcie 's appeal enraged [Tipping]90-tipping , who took it as addressed solely to [himself]90-tipping . " [You]90-tipping ought to be glad to stick up for [her]1304-this little girl , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said between [his]57-paul teeth . " [I]57-paul 'll mash [you]90-tipping for this — see if [I]57-paul do n't ! "[57-paul] [Paul]57-paul thought [he]57-paul saw [his]57-paul way clear to disabuse [Tipping]90-tipping of [his]57-paul mistaken idea . " Are [you]90-tipping proposing , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul asked politely , " to — to ' mash ' [me]57-paul on account of [that little girl there on the seat]3089-that little girl there on the seat ? "[57-paul] " [You]57-paul 'll soon see , "[90-tipping] growled [Tipping]90-tipping . " Shut [your]57-paul head , and come on ! "[90-tipping] " No , but [I]57-paul want to know , "[57-paul] persisted [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul . " Because , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said with a sickly attempt at jocularity which delighted none , " [you]90-tipping see , [I]57-paul do n't want to be mashed . [I]57-paul 'm not a potato . If [I]57-paul understand [you]90-tipping aright , [you]90-tipping want to fight [me]57-paul because [you]90-tipping think [me]57-paul likely to interfere with [your]90-tipping claim to that little girl's — ah — affections ? "[57-paul] " That 's it , "[90-tipping] said [Tipping]90-tipping gruffly ; " so [you]90-tipping 'd better waste no more words about it , and come on . "[90-tipping] " But [I]57-paul do n't care about coming on , "[57-paul] protested [Paul]57-paul earnestly . " It 's all a mistake . [I]57-paul 've no doubt [she]3090-she 's [a very nice little girl]3091-a very nice little girl , but [I]57-paul assure [you]90-tipping , [[my]57-paul good boy]2781-my good boy , [I]57-paul 've no desire to stand in [your]90-tipping way for one instant . [She]3090-she 's nothing to [me]57-paul — nothing at all ! [I]57-paul give [her]3090-she up to [you]90-tipping . Take [her]3090-she , [young fellow]3093-young fellow , with [my]57-paul blessing ! There , now , that 's all settled comfortably — eh ? "[57-paul] [He]57-paul was just looking round with a self - satisfied and relieved air , when [he]57-paul began to be aware that [his]57-paul act of frank unselfishness was not as much appreciated as it deserved . [Tipping]90-tipping , indeed , looked baffled and irresolute for one moment , but a low murmur of disgust arose from [the bystanders]1307-the bystanders , and even [Jolland]78-jolland declared that it was " too beastly mean . "[78-jolland] As for [Dulcie]110-dulcie , [she]110-dulcie had been looking on incredulously at [[her]110-dulcie champion]1308-her champion 's unaccountable tardiness in coming to the point . But this public repudiation was too much for [her]110-dulcie . [She]110-dulcie gave a little low wail as [she]110-dulcie heard the shameless words of recantation , and then , without a word , jumped lightly down from [her]110-dulcie bench and ran away to hide [herself]110-dulcie somewhere and cry . Even [Paul]57-paul , though [he]57-paul knew that [he]57-paul had done nothing but what was strictly right , and had acted purely in self - protection , felt unaccountably ashamed of [himself]57-paul as [he]57-paul saw this effect of [his]57-paul speech . But it was too late now . " Accelerated by ignominious shovings — nay , as it is written , by smitings , twitchings , spurnings à posteriori not to be named . "—French[155-revolution] [Revolution]155-revolution . " This letter being so excellently ignorant will breed no terror in [the youth]3094-the youth . "—Twelfth[156-night] [Night]156-night . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul had meant to achieve a double stroke of diplomacy — to undeceive [Dulcie]110-dulcie and conciliate [the lovesick Tipping]1309-the lovesick tipping . But whatever [his]57-paul success may have been in the former respect , the latter object failed conspicuously . " [You]110-dulcie sha n't get off by a shabby trick like that , "[90-tipping] said [Tipping]90-tipping , exasperated by the sight of [Dulcie]110-dulcie 's emotion ; " [you]110-dulcie 've made [her]110-dulcie cry now , and [you]110-dulcie shall smart for it . So , now , are [you]110-dulcie going to stand up to [me]90-tipping like [a man]2944-a man , or will [you]110-dulcie take a licking ? "[90-tipping] " [I]57-paul 'm not going to help [you]110-dulcie to commit a breach of the peace , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul with great dignity . " Go away , [[you]110-dulcie quarrelsome young ruffian]3096-you quarrelsome young ruffian ! Get one of [[your]110-dulcie schoolfellows]2885-your schoolfellows to fight [you]110-dulcie , if [you]110-dulcie must fight . [I]57-paul do n't want to be mixed up with [you]110-dulcie in any way . "[57-paul] But at [this Tipping , whose blood was evidently at boiling point]1310-this tipping , whose blood was evidently at boiling point , came prancing down on [him]57-paul in a Zulu - like fashion , swinging [his]57-paul long arms like a windmill , and finding that [[his]57-paul enemy]1311-his enemy made no attempt at receiving [him]57-paul , but only moved away apprehensively , [he]57-paul seized [him]57-paul by the collar as a prelude to dealing [him]57-paul a series of kicks behind .

Although [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , as [we]1312-we have seen , was opposed to fighting as a system [he]57-paul could not submit to this sort of thing without at least some attempt to defend [himself]57-paul ; and judging it of the highest importance to disable [[his]57-paul adversary]1313-his adversary in the most effectual manner before [the latter]446-the latter had time to carry out [his]57-paul offensive designs , [he]57-paul turned sharply round and hit [him]57-paul a very severe blow in the lower part of [his]57-paul waistcoat . The result fulfilled [his]57-paul highest expectations . [Tipping]90-tipping collapsed like a pocket - rule , and staggered away speechless , and purple with pain , while [Paul]57-paul stood calm and triumphant . [He]57-paul had shown [these fellows]1315-these fellows that [he]57-paul was n't going to stand any nonsense . [They]1315-these fellows would leave [him]57-paul alone after this , perhaps . But once more there were cries and murmurs of " Shame ! "[1315-these fellows] " No hitting below the belt ! "[1315-these fellows] " [Cad — coward]3098-cad — coward ! "[57-paul] It appeared that , somehow , [he]57-paul had managed to offend [their]1315-these fellows prejudices even in this . " It 's very odd , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul thought ; " when [I]57-paul did n't fight [they]1315-these fellows called [me]57-paul [a coward]3084-a coward , and now , when [I]57-paul do , [I]57-paul do n't seem to have pleased [them]1315-these fellows much . [I]57-paul do n't care , though . [I]57-paul 've settled [him]90-tipping . "[57-paul] But after a season of protracted writhing by the parallel bars , [Tipping]90-tipping came out , still gasping and deadly pale , leaning on [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb 's shoulder , and was met with universal sympathy and condolence . " Thanks ! "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said with considerable effort . " Of course — [I'm]57-paul not going — to fight [him]90-tipping after a low trick like that ; but perhaps [[you]1315-these fellows [fellows]2360-fellows]2659-you fellows will see that [he]90-tipping does n't escape quite as easily as [he]90-tipping fancies ? "[57-paul] There was a general shout . " No ; [he]90-tipping shall pay for it ! [We]1316-we 'll teach [him]90-tipping to fight fair ! [We]1316-we 'll see if [he]90-tipping tries that on again ! "[57-paul] [Paul]57-paul heard it with much uneasiness . What new devilry were [they]1316-we about to practise upon [him]57-paul ? [He]57-paul was not left long in doubt . " [I]92-biddlecomb vote , "[92-biddlecomb] suggested [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb , as if [he]92-biddlecomb were proposing a testimonial , " [we]1316-we make [him]90-tipping run the gauntlet . [Grim]107-grim wo n't come out and catch [us]1316-we . [I]92-biddlecomb saw [him]90-tipping go out for a drive an hour ago . "[92-biddlecomb] And the idea was very favourably entertained . [Paul]57-paul had heard of " running the gauntlet , "[92-biddlecomb] and dimly suspected that it was not an experience [he]57-paul was likely to enjoy , particularly when [he]57-paul saw [everyone]680-everyone busying [himself]680-everyone with tying the end of [his]680-everyone pocket - handkerchief into a hard knot . [He]57-paul tried in vain to excuse [himself]57-paul , declaring again and again that [he]57-paul had never meant to injure [the boy]246-the boy . [He]57-paul had only defended [himself]57-paul , and was under the impression that [he]57-paul was at perfect liberty to hit [him]246-the boy wherever [he]57-paul could , and so on . But [they]1319-they were in no mood for excuses . With a stern magisterial formality worthy of [a Vehm - Gericht]157-a vehm - gericht , [they]1319-they formed in two long lines down the centre of [the playground]648-the playground ; and while [Paul]57-paul was still staring in wonder at what [this strange manœuvre]1321-this strange manœuvre might mean , [somebody]2393-somebody pounced upon [him]57-paul and carried [him]57-paul up to one end of the ranks , where [Tipping]90-tipping had by this time sufficiently recovered to be able to " set [him]57-paul going , "[2393-somebody] as [he]90-tipping chose to call it , with a fairly effective kick . After that [he]57-paul had a confused sense of flying madly along the double line of avengers under a hail of blows which caught [him]57-paul on every part of [his]57-paul head , shoulders , and back till [he]57-paul reached the end , where [he]57-paul was dexterously turned and sent spinning up to [Tipping]90-tipping again , who in [his]90-tipping turn headed [him]57-paul back on [his]57-paul arrival , and forced [him]57-paul to brave [the terrible lane]1323-the terrible lane once more . Never before had [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul felt so sore and insulted . But [they]1324-they kept it up long after the thing had lost its first freshness — until at last exhaustion made [them]1324-they lean to mercy , and [they]1324-they cuffed [him]57-paul ignominiously into a corner , and left [him]57-paul to lament [his]57-paul ill - treatment there till the bell rang for dinner , for which , contrary to precedent , [his]57-paul recent violent exercise had excited little appetite . " [I]57-paul shall be killed soon if [I]57-paul stay [here]2411-here , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul moaned ; " [I]57-paul know [I]57-paul shall . [These young brigands]3103-these young brigands would murder [me]57-paul cheerfully , if [they]3103-these young brigands were not afraid of being caned for it . [I]57-paul 'm [a miserable man]3104-a miserable man , and [I]57-paul wish [I]57-paul was dead ! "[57-paul] Although that afternoon , being Saturday , was a half - holiday , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was spared the ordeal of another game at football ; for a smart storm of rain and sleet coming on about three o'clock kept [the school]506-the school — [not altogether unwilling prisoners]1326-not altogether unwilling prisoners — within doors for the day . [The boys]570-the boys sat in [their]570-the boys places in [[their]570-the boys schoolroom]1328-their schoolroom , amusing [themselves]570-the boys after [their]570-the boys several fashions — some reading , some making libellous copies of drawings that took [their]570-the boys fancy in the illustrated papers , [some playing games]1329-some playing games ; [others , too listless to play]1330-others , too listless to play and too dull to find pleasure in the simplest books , filled up the time as well as [they]570-the boys could by quarrelling and getting into various depths of hot water . [Paul]57-paul sat in a corner pretending to read a story relating the experiences of [certain infants of phenomenal courage and coolness]1331-certain infants of phenomenal courage and coolness in [the Arctic regions]1332-the arctic regions . [They]1331-certain infants of phenomenal courage and coolness killed bears and tamed walruses all through the book ; but for the first time , perhaps , since [their]1331-certain infants of phenomenal courage and coolness appearance in print [their]1331-certain infants of phenomenal courage and coolness exploits fell flat . Not , however , that this reflected any discredit upon [the author]1333-the author 's powers , which are justly admired by [all healthy - minded boys]1334-all healthy - minded boys ; but it was beyond the power of literature just then to charm [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's thoughts from the recollection of [his]57-paul misfortunes . As [he]57-paul took in all the details of [his]57-paul surroundings — [the warm close room]1335-the warm close room ; the raw - toned desks and tables at which a rabble of [unsympathetic boys]1336-unsympathetic boys were noisily whispering and chattering , with occasional glances in [his]57-paul direction , from which , taught by experience , [he]57-paul augured no good ; the high uncurtained windows , blurred with little stars of half - frozen rain , and the bare , bleak branches of the trees outside tossing drearily against a low leaden sky — [he]57-paul tried in vain to cheat [himself]57-paul into a dreamy persuasion that all this misery could not be real , but would fade away as suddenly and mysteriously as it had stolen upon [him]57-paul . Towards the close of the afternoon [the Doctor]248-the doctor came in and took [his]57-paul place at the writing - table , where [he]57-paul was apparently very busy with the composition of some sort of document , which [he]57-paul finished at last with evident satisfaction at the result of [his]57-paul labour . Then [he]57-paul observed that , according to [their]1338-their custom of a Saturday afternoon , the hour before tea - time should be devoted to " writing [home]296-home . "[57-paul] So the books , chess - boards , and dominoes were all put away , and a new steel pen and a sheet of notepaper , neatly embossed with the heading " [Crichton House School]39-crichton house school "[57-paul] in old English letters , having been served out to [everyone]680-everyone , [each boy]1340-each boy prepared [himself]1340-each boy to write down such things as filial affection , strict truthfulness , and the desire of imparting information might inspire between [them]1338-their . [Paul]57-paul felt , as [he]57-paul clutched [his]57-paul writing materials , much as [a shipwrecked mariner]1341-a shipwrecked mariner might be expected to do at finding on [[his]1341-a shipwrecked mariner desolate island]1342-his desolate island a good - sized flag and a case of rockets . [His]57-paul hopes revived once more ; [he]57-paul forgot the smarts left by the knots in the handkerchiefs , [he]57-paul had a whole hour before [him]57-paul — it was possible to set several wires in motion for [his]57-paul release in an hour . Yes , [he]57-paul must write several letters . First , one to [[his]57-paul solicitor]1343-his solicitor detailing , as calmly and concisely as [his]57-paul feelings would allow , the shameful way in which [he]57-paul had been treated , and imploring [him]57-paul to take measures of some sort for getting [him]57-paul out of [his]57-paul false and awkward position ; one to [[his]57-paul head clerk]1344-his head clerk , to press upon [him]57-paul the necessity of prudence and caution in dealing with [the impostor]1237-the impostor ; notes to [Bangle]149-bangle and [Fishwick]150-alderman fishwick putting them off — [they]1346-they should not be outraged by an introduction to a vulgar pantomime clown under [his]57-paul roof ; and lastly ( this was an outburst [he]57-paul could not deny [himself]57-paul ) , a solemn impressive appeal to the common humanity , if not to the ordinary filial instincts , of [[his]57-paul undutiful son]1347-his undutiful son . [His]57-paul fingers tingled to begin . Sentences of burning , indignant eloquence crowded confusedly into [his]57-paul head — [he]57-paul would write such letters as would carry instant conviction to [the most practical and matter - of - fact minds]1348-the most practical and matter - of - fact minds . The pathos and dignity of [his]57-paul remonstrances should melt even [Dick]60-dick 's selfish , callous heart . Perhaps [he]57-paul overrated the power of [his]57-paul pen — perhaps it would have required more than mere ink to persuade [[his]57-paul friends]1091-his friends to disbelieve [their]1091-his friends own senses , and see [a portly citizen of over fifty packed into the frame of a chubby urchin of fourteen]1350-a portly citizen of over fifty packed into the frame of a chubby urchin of fourteen . But , at all events , [no one]2331-no one 's faith was put to so hard a test — those letters were never written . " Do n't begin to write yet , any of [you]3106-you , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor ; " [I]248-the doctor have a few words to say to [you]3106-you first . In most cases , and as a general rule , [I]248-the doctor think it wisest to let [every boy]573-every boy commit to paper whatever [his]573-every boy feelings may dictate to [him]573-every boy . [I]248-the doctor wish to claim no censorship over the style and diction of [your]3106-you letters . But there have been so many complaints lately from [the parents of [some of the less advanced of [you]3106-you]3109-some of the less advanced of you]3108-the parents of some of the less advanced of you , that [I]248-the doctor find [myself]248-the doctor obliged to make a change . [[Your]3106-you father]2566-your father particularly , [Richard Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude , "[248-the doctor] [he]248-the doctor added , turning suddenly upon the unlucky [Paul]57-paul , " has complained bitterly of the slovenly tone and phrasing of [your]3106-you correspondence ; [he]87-mr. bultitude said very justly that [they]3111-them would disgrace [a stable - boy]3112-a stable - boy , and unless [I]248-the doctor could induce [you]3106-you to improve [them]3111-them , [he]87-mr. bultitude begged [he]87-mr. bultitude might not be annoyed by [them]3111-them in future . "[248-the doctor] It was by no means the least galling part of [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's trials , that former forgotten words and deeds of [his]57-paul in [his]57-paul original condition were constantly turning up at critical seasons , and plunging [him]57-paul deeper into the morass just when [he]57-paul saw some prospect of gaining firm ground . So , on this occasion , [he]57-paul did remember that , being in a more than usually bad temper one day last year , [he]57-paul had , on receiving a sprawling , ill - spelt application from [Dick]60-dick for more pocket - money , to buy fireworks for the 5th of November , written to make some such complaint to [the schoolmaster]522-the schoolmaster . [He]57-paul waited anxiously for [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's next words ; [he]57-paul might want to read the letters before they were sent off , in which case [Paul]57-paul would not be displeased , for it would be an easier and less dangerous way of putting [the Doctor]248-the doctor in possession of the facts . But [his]57-paul complaints were to be honoured by a much more effectual remedy , for it naturally piqued [the Doctor]248-the doctor to be told that [[boys]2308-boys instructed under [his]57-paul auspices]1358-boys instructed under his auspices wrote like [stable - boys]1359-stable - boys . " However , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul went on , " [I]57-paul wish [[your]57-paul people]3113-your people at [home]296-home to be assured from time to time of [your]57-paul welfare , and to prevent [them]3113-your people from being shocked and distressed in future by the crudity of [your]57-paul communications , [I]57-paul have drawn up a short form of letter for the use of [the lower boys]3115-the lower boys in the second form — which [I]57-paul shall now proceed to dictate . Of course [all boys in the first form]3116-all boys in the first form , and all in the second above [Bultitude]57-paul and [Jolland]78-jolland , will write as [they]3116-all boys in the first form please , as usual . [Richard]87-mr. bultitude , [I]57-paul expect [you]87-mr. bultitude to take particular pains to write this out neatly . Are [you]87-mr. bultitude all ready ? Very well then , ... now ; "[57-paul] and [he]57-paul read out the following letter , slowly — " [[My]57-paul dear]2692-my dear Parents ( or [parent]239-parent according to circumstances ) comma "[57-paul] ( all of which [several took down most industriously)—"You]3119-several took down most industriously)—"you will be rejoiced to hear that , having arrived with safety at [our]3120-our destination , [we]3120-our have by this time fully resumed [our]3120-our customary regular round of earnest work relieved and sweetened by hearty play . ( ' Have [you]87-mr. bultitude all got "[57-paul] hearty play " down ? ' "[248-the doctor] inquired [the Doctor]248-the doctor rather suspiciously , while [Jolland]78-jolland observed in an undertone that it would take some time to get that down . ) " [I]57-paul hope , [I]57-paul trust [I]57-paul may say without undue conceit , to have made considerable progress in [my]57-paul school - tasks before [I]57-paul rejoin the family circle for the Easter vacation , as [I]57-paul think [you]87-mr. bultitude will admit when [I]57-paul inform [you]87-mr. bultitude of the programme [we]3120-our intend "[57-paul] ( ' D.V. in brackets and capital letters'—as before , this was taken down verbatim by [Jolland]78-jolland , who probably knew very much better ) , " intend to work out during the term . "[57-paul] In Latin , the class of which [I]0-i am a member propose to thoroughly master the first book of [Virgil]158-virgil 's magnificent Epic , need [I]0-i say [I]0-i refer to the soul - moving story of [the Pious Æneas]159-the pious æneas ? " ( [Jolland]78-jolland was understood by [[his]78-jolland near neighbours]3121-his near neighbours to remark that [he]78-jolland thought the explanation distinctly advisable ) , "[0-i] whilst , in Greek , [we]1361-we have already commenced the thrilling account of the ' Anabasis ' of [Xenophon]160-xenophon , [that master of strategy]1362-that master of strategy ! nor shall [we]1361-we , of course , neglect in either branch of study the syntax and construction of those two noble languages"—("noble languages , "[1363-the writers] echoed [the writers]1363-the writers mechanically , contriving to insinuate a touch of irony into the words ) . " In German under the able tutelage of [Herr Stohwasser]130-herr stohwasser , who , as [I]1363-the writers may possibly have mentioned to [you]87-mr. bultitude in casual conversation , is [a graduate of [the University of [Heidelberg]41-heidelberg]40-the university of heidelberg]3122-a graduate of the university of heidelberg "[1363-the writers] ( " and [a silly old hass]3123-a silly old hass , "[78-jolland] added [Jolland]78-jolland parenthetically ) , " [we]1361-we have resigned [ourselves]1361-we to the spell of the Teutonian Shakespeare "[1363-the writers] ( there was much difference of opinion as to the manner of spelling the " Teutonian Shakespeare "[1363-the writers] ) , " as , in [my]1363-the writers opinion , [Schiller]131-schiller may be not inaptly termed , and [our]1361-we French studies comprise such exercises , and short poems and tales , as are best calculated to afford an insight into the intricacies of the Gallic tongue . "[1363-the writers] But [I]0-i would not have [you]1364-you imagine , [[my]0-i dear parents]1365-my dear parents ( or [parent]239-parent , as before ) , that , because the claims of the intellect have been thus amply provided for , the requirements of the body are necessarily overlooked ! " [I]1363-the writers have no intention of becoming [a mere bookworm]3124-a mere bookworm , and , on the contrary , [we]1368-we have had one excessively brisk and pleasant game at football already this season , and should , but for the unfortunate inclemency of the weather , have engaged again this afternoon in the mimic warfare . "[1363-the writers] In [the playground]648-the playground [our]1368-we favourite diversion is the game of ' chevy , ' so called from the engagement famed in ballad and history ( [I]0-i allude to the battle of [Chevy Chase]42-chevy chase ) , and indeed , [[my]0-i dear parents]1365-my dear parents , in the rapid alternations of its fortunes and the diversity of its incident , the game ( to [my]0-i mind ) bears a striking resemblance to the accounts of that ever - memorable contest .

" [I]0-i fear [I]0-i must now relinquish [my]0-i pen , as the time allotted for correspondence is fast waning to its close , and tea - time is approaching . Pray give [my]0-i kindest remembrance to all [[my]0-i numerous [friends]327-friends]3125-my numerous friends and [relatives]3127-relatives , and accept [my]0-i fondest love and affection for [yourselves]3128-yourselves , and [the various other members of the family circle]3129-the various other members of the family circle . "[0-i] [I]0-i am , [I]0-i am rejoiced to say , in the enjoyment of excellent health , and surrounded as [I]0-i am by [congenial companions]1370-congenial companions , and employed in interesting and agreeable pursuits , it is superfluous to add that [I]0-i am happy . " And now , [[my]248-the doctor dear parents]1365-my dear parents , believe [me]248-the doctor , [[your]248-the doctor dutiful and affectionate son]3131-your dutiful and affectionate son , so and so . "[248-the doctor] [The Doctor]248-the doctor finished [his]248-the doctor dictation with a roll in [his]248-the doctor voice , as much as to say , " [I]248-the doctor think that will strike [[your]3131-your dutiful and affectionate son respective parents]3132-your respective parents as a chaste and classical composition ; [I]248-the doctor think so ! "[248-the doctor] But unexceptionable as its tone and sentiments undoubtedly were , it was far from expressing the feelings of [Mr. Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude . [The rest]694-the rest accepted it not unwillingly as an escape from the fatigue of original composition , but to [him]248-the doctor the neat , well - balanced sentences seemed a hollow mockery . As [he]248-the doctor wrote down each successive phrase , [he]248-the doctor wondered what [Dick]60-dick would think of it , and when at last it was finished , the precious hour had gone for another week ! In speechless disgust but without protest , for [his]248-the doctor spirit was too broken by this last cruel disappointment , [he]248-the doctor had to fold , put into an envelope and direct this most misleading letter under [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's superintending eye , which of course allowed [him]248-the doctor no chance of introducing a line or even a word to counteract the tone of self - satisfaction and contentment which breathed in every sentence of it . [He]248-the doctor saw it stamped , and put into the postbag , and then [his]248-the doctor last gleam of hope flickered out ; [he]248-the doctor must give up struggling against the Inevitable ; [he]248-the doctor must resign [himself]248-the doctor to be educated , and perhaps flogged [here]2411-here , while [Dick]60-dick was filling [[his]60-dick house]1375-his house with clowns and pantaloons , destroying [his]60-dick reputation and damaging [his]60-dick credit at [home]296-home . Perhaps , in course of time , [he]248-the doctor would grow accustomed to it , and , meanwhile , [he]248-the doctor would be as careful as possible to do and say nothing to make [himself]248-the doctor remarkable in any way , by which means [he]248-the doctor trusted , at least , to avoid any fresh calamity . And with this resolution [he]248-the doctor went to bed on Saturday night , feeling that this was a dreary finish to a most unpleasant week . " There was a letter indeed to be intercepted by [[a man]2944-a man 's father]3134-a man 's father to do [him]248-the doctor good with [him!"—Every[60-dick] Man in [his]60-dick Humour]3135-him!"—every man in his humour . Sunday came — a day which was to begin a new week for [Mr. Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude , and , of course , for the rest of the Christian world as well . Whether that week would be better or worse than the one which had just passed away [he]248-the doctor naturally could not tell — it could hardly be much worse . But the Sunday itself , [he]248-the doctor anticipated , without , however , any very firm grounds for such an assumption , would be a day of brief but grateful respite ; a day on which [he]248-the doctor might venture to claim much the same immunity as was enjoyed in former days by [the insolvent]1377-the insolvent ; a day , in short , which would glide slowly by with the rather drowsy solemnity peculiar to the British sabbath as observed by [all truly respectable persons]1378-all truly respectable persons . And yet that very Sunday , could [he]248-the doctor have foreseen it , was destined to be the most eventful day [he]248-the doctor had yet spent at [Crichton House]4-crichton house , where none had proved wanting in incident . During the next twelve hours [he]248-the doctor was to pass through every variety of unpleasant sensation . Embarrassment , suspense , fear , anxiety , dismay , and terror were to follow each other in rapid succession , and to wind up , strangely enough , with a delicious ecstasy of pure relief and happiness — a fatiguing programme for [any middle - aged gentleman who had never cultivated [his]248-the doctor emotional faculties]1379-any middle - aged gentleman who had never cultivated his emotional faculties . Let [me]0-i try to tell how this came about . The getting - up bell rang an hour later than on week - days , but [the boys]570-the boys were expected to prepare certain tasks suitable for the day before [they]570-the boys rose . [Mr. Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude found that [he]87-mr. bultitude was required to learn by heart a hymn in which the rhymes " join "[87-mr. bultitude] and " divine , "[87-mr. bultitude] " throne "[87-mr. bultitude] and " crown , "[87-mr. bultitude] were so happily wedded that either might conform to the other — a graceful concession to individual taste which is not infrequent in this class of poetry . Trivial as such a task may seem in these days of School Boards , it gave [him]87-mr. bultitude infinite trouble and mental exertion , for [he]87-mr. bultitude had not been called upon to commit anything of the kind to memory for many years , and after mastering that , there still remained a long chronological list ( the dates approximately computed ) of the leading events before and immediately after the Deluge , which was to be repeated " without looking at the book . "[87-mr. bultitude] While [he]87-mr. bultitude was wrestling desperately with these , for [he]87-mr. bultitude was determined , as [I]0-i have said before , to do all in [his]87-mr. bultitude power to keep [himself]87-mr. bultitude out of trouble , [Mrs. Grimstone]100-mrs. grimstone , in [her]100-mrs. grimstone morning wrapper , paid a visit to [the dormitories]1381-the dormitories and , in spite of all [Paul]57-paul 's attempts to excuse [himself]57-paul , insisted upon pomatuming [his]57-paul hair — an indignity which [he]87-mr. bultitude felt acutely . " When [she]100-mrs. grimstone knows who [I]87-mr. bultitude really am , "[87-mr. bultitude] [he]87-mr. bultitude thought , " [she]100-mrs. grimstone 'll be sorry [she]100-mrs. grimstone made such a point of it . If there 's one thing upon earth [I]87-mr. bultitude loathe more than another , it 's marrow - oil pomade ! "[87-mr. bultitude] Then there was breakfast , at which [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone appeared , resplendent in glossy broadcloth , and dazzling shirt - front and semi - clerical white tie , and after breakfast , an hour in [the schoolroom]2641-the schoolroom , during which [the boys]570-the boys ( by the aid of repeated references to the text ) wrote out " from memory "[570-the boys] the hymn [they]570-the boys had learnt , while [Paul]57-paul managed somehow to stumble through [his]57-paul dates and events to the satisfaction of [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler , who , to increase [his]109-mr. tinkler popularity , made a point of being as easily satisfied with such repetitions as [he]109-mr. tinkler decently could . After that came the order to prepare for [church]1384-church . There was a general rush to [the little room]1385-the little room with the shelves and bandboxes , where church books were procured , and great - coats and tight kid gloves put on . When [they]570-the boys were almost ready [the Doctor]248-the doctor came in , wearing [his]248-the doctor blandest and most paternal expression . " A — it 's a collection Sunday to - day , [boys]2308-boys , "[248-the doctor] [he]248-the doctor said . " Have [you]2308-boys all got [your]2308-boys threepenny - bits ready ? [I]248-the doctor like to see [[my]248-the doctor boys]3137-my boys give cheerfully and liberally of [their]3137-my boys abundance . If [any boy]3138-any boy does not happen to have any small change , [I]248-the doctor can accommodate [him]3138-any boy if [he]3138-any boy comes to [me]248-the doctor . "[248-the doctor] And this [he]248-the doctor proceeded to do from [a store [he]248-the doctor had with [him]248-the doctor of that most convenient coin — the chosen expression of [a congregation]1388-a congregation 's gratitude]1387-a store he had with him of that most convenient coin — the chosen expression of a congregation 's gratitude — the common silver threepence , for [the school]506-the school occupied a prominent position in [the church]1390-the church , and had acquired a great reputation amongst [the churchwardens]1391-the churchwardens for the admirable uniformity with which [one young gentleman]1392-one young gentleman after another " put into the plate "[57-paul] ; and this reputation [the Doctor]248-the doctor was naturally anxious that [they]1394-they should maintain . [I]0-i am sorry to say that [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , fearing lest [he]57-paul should be asked if [he]57-paul had the required sum about [him]57-paul , and thus [his]57-paul penniless condition might be discovered and bring [him]57-paul trouble , got behind the door at the beginning of the money - changing transactions and remained there till it was over — it seemed to [him]57-paul that it would be too paltry to be disgraced for want of threepence . Now , being thus completely furnished for [their]1394-they devotions , [the school]506-the school formed in couples in [the hall]259-the hall and filed solemnly out for the march to [church]1384-church . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul walked nearly last with [Jolland]78-jolland , whose facile nature had almost forgotten [[his]78-jolland friend]1398-his friend 's shortcomings on the previous day . [He]78-jolland kept up a perpetual flow of chatter which , as [he]78-jolland never stopped for an answer , permitted [Paul]57-paul to indulge [his]57-paul own thoughts unrestrained . " Are [you]57-paul going to put [your]57-paul threepenny - bit in ? "[78-jolland] said [Jolland]78-jolland ; " [I]78-jolland wo n't if [you]57-paul do n't . Sometimes , [you]57-paul know , when the plate comes round , [old Grim]107-grim squints down the pews to see [we]3139-we do n't shirk . Then [I]78-jolland put in sixpence . Have [you]57-paul done [your]57-paul hymn ? [I]78-jolland do hate a hymn . What 's the use of learning hymns ? [They]3140-they wo n't mark [you]57-paul for them , [you]57-paul know , in any exam . [I]78-jolland ever heard of , and it ca n't save [you]57-paul the expense of a hymnbook unless [you]57-paul learnt all the hymns in it , and that would take [you]57-paul years . Oh , [I]78-jolland say , look ! there 's [young Mutlow]121-miss mutlow and [[his]3141-he governor]3142-his governor and [mater]3143-mater . [I]78-jolland wonder what [[Mutlow]121-miss mutlow 's governor]3144-mutlow 's governor does ? [Mutlow]121-miss mutlow says [he]3141-he 's [a ' gentleman]3145-a ' gentleman ' if [you]57-paul ask [him]3141-he , but [I]78-jolland believe [he]3141-he lies . See that fly driving past ? [Mother Grim]107-grim "[78-jolland] ( [the irreverent youth]1399-the irreverent youth always spoke of [Mrs. Grimstone]100-mrs. grimstone in this way ) " and [Dulcie]110-dulcie are in it . [I]78-jolland saw [Dulcie]110-dulcie look at [you]57-paul , [Dick]60-dick . It 's a shame to treat [her]110-dulcie as [you]57-paul did yesterday . There 's [young Tom]95-tommy on the box ; do n't [his]95-tommy ears stick out rummily ? [I]78-jolland wonder if [the ' ugly family]3146-the ' ugly family ' will be at [church]1384-church to - day ? [You]57-paul know [the ugly family]3148-the ugly family ; all with [their]3148-the ugly family mouths open and [their]3148-the ugly family eyes goggling , like a jolly old row of pantomime heads . And oh , [Dick]60-dick , suppose [[Connie Davenant]161-connie davenant 's people]3149-connie davenant 's people have changed [their]3149-connie davenant 's people pew — that'll be a sell for [you]57-paul rather , wo n't it ? "[78-jolland] " [I]57-paul do n't understand [you]57-paul , "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul stiffly ; " and , if [you]57-paul do n't object , [I]57-paul prefer not to be called upon to talk just now . "[57-paul] " Oh , all right ! "[78-jolland] said [Jolland]78-jolland , " there are n't so many fellows who will talk to [you]57-paul ; but just as [you]57-paul please — [I]78-jolland do n't want to talk . "[78-jolland] And so [the pair]632-the pair walked on in silence ; [Jolland]78-jolland with [his]78-jolland nose in the air , determined that after this [he]78-jolland really must cut [[his]78-jolland former friend]1401-his former friend as [the other fellows]2927-the other fellows had done , since [his]78-jolland devotion was appreciated so little , and [Paul]57-paul watching the ascending double line of tall chimney - pot hats as [they]1403-they surged before [him]78-jolland in regular movement , and feeling a dull wonder at finding [himself]57-paul setting out to [church]1384-church in such ill - assorted company . [They]632-the pair entered [the church]1390-the church , and [Paul]57-paul was sent down to the extreme end of a pew next to the one reserved for [the Doctor]248-the doctor and [[his]248-the doctor family]1008-his family . [Dulcie]110-dulcie was sitting there already on the other side of the partition ; but [she]110-dulcie gave no sign of having noticed [his]57-paul arrival , being apparently absorbed in studying the rose - window over the altar . [He]57-paul sat down in [his]57-paul corner with a sense of rest and almost comfort , though the seat was not a cushioned one . [He]57-paul had the inoffensive Kiffin for [a neighbour]1408-a neighbour , [[his]57-paul chief tormentors]1409-his chief tormentors were far away from [him]57-paul in one of the back pews , and here at least [he]57-paul thought no harm could come to [him]57-paul . [He]57-paul could allow [himself]57-paul safely to do what [I]0-i am afraid [he]57-paul generally did do under the circumstances — snatch a few intermittent but sweet periods of dreamless slumber . But , while the service was proceeding , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was suddenly horrified to observe that [a young lady]1410-a young lady , who occupied a pew at right angles to and touching that in which [he]57-paul sat , was deliberately making furtive signals to [him]57-paul in a most unmistakable manner . [She]1410-a young lady was [a decidedly pretty girl of about fifteen , with merry and daring blue eyes and curling golden hair]1411-a decidedly pretty girl of about fifteen , with merry and daring blue eyes and curling golden hair , and was accompanied by [two small brothers ( who shared the same book and dealt each other stealthy and vicious kicks throughout the service]1412-two small brothers ( who shared the same book and dealt each other stealthy and vicious kicks throughout the service ) , and by [[her]1410-a young lady father]1413-her father , [a stout , short - sighted old gentleman in gold spectacles]1414-a stout , short - sighted old gentleman in gold spectacles , who was perpetually making the wrong responses in a loud and confident tone . To be signalled to in a marked manner by [a strange young lady of great personal attractions]1415-a strange young lady of great personal attractions might be a coveted distinction to [other schoolboys]1416-other schoolboys , but it simply gave [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul cold thrills . " [I]57-paul suppose that 's ' [Connie Davenant]161-connie davenant , ' "[57-paul] [he]57-paul thought , shocked beyond measure as [she]1410-a young lady caught [his]57-paul eye and coughed demurely for about the fourth time . " [A very forward young person]3150-a very forward young person ! [I]1410-a young lady think [somebody]2393-somebody ought to speak seriously to [[her]1410-a young lady father]1413-her father . "[1410-a young lady] " Good gracious ! [she]1410-a young lady 's writing something on the flyleaf of [her]1410-a young lady prayer - book , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said to [himself]57-paul presently . " [I]57-paul hope [she]1410-a young lady 's not going to send it to [me]57-paul . [I]57-paul wo n't take it . [She]1410-a young lady ought to be ashamed of [herself]1410-a young lady ! "[57-paul] [Miss Davenant]162-miss davenant was indeed busily engaged in pencilling something on a blank sheet of paper ; and , having finished , [she]162-miss davenant folded it deftly into a cocked - hat , wrote a few words on the outside , and placed it between the leaves of [her]162-miss davenant book . Then , as [the congregation]1417-the congregation rose for the Psalms , [she]162-miss davenant gave a meaning glance at the blushing and scandalised [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul and by dexterous management of [her]162-miss davenant prayer - book shot the little cocked - hat , as if unconsciously , into the next pew . By a very unfortunate miscalculation , however , the note missed its proper object , and , clearing the partition , fluttered deliberately down on the floor by [Dulcie]110-dulcie 's feet . [Paul]57-paul saw this with alarm ; [he]57-paul knew that at all hazards [he]57-paul must get that miserable note into [his]57-paul own possession and destroy it . It might have [his]57-paul name somewhere about it ; it might seriously compromise [him]57-paul . So [he]57-paul took advantage of the noise [the congregation]1417-the congregation made in repeating a verse aloud ( it was not [a high church]1419-a high church ) to whisper to [Dulcie]110-dulcie : " [Little Miss Grimstone]124-miss grimstone , excuse [me]57-paul , but there 's a — a note in the pew down by [your]110-dulcie feet . [I]57-paul believe it 's intended for [me]57-paul . "[57-paul] [Dulcie]110-dulcie had seen the whole affair and had been not a little puzzled by it , a clandestine correspondence being a new thing in [her]110-dulcie short experience ; but [she]110-dulcie understood that in [this golden - haired girl , [[her]110-dulcie elder]1421-her elder by several years]1420-this golden - haired girl , her elder by several years , [she]110-dulcie saw [[her]110-dulcie rival]1422-her rival , for whom [Dick]60-dick had so basely abandoned [her]110-dulcie yesterday , and [she]110-dulcie was old enough to feel the slight and the sweetness of revenge . So [she]110-dulcie held [her]110-dulcie head rather higher than usual , with [her]110-dulcie firm little chin projecting wilfully , and waited for the next verse but one before retorting , " [Little Master Bultitude]57-paul , [I]110-dulcie know it is . "[110-dulcie] " Could [you]110-dulcie — can [you]110-dulcie manage to reach it ? "[57-paul] whispered [Paul]57-paul entreatingly . " Yes , "[110-dulcie] said [Dulcie]110-dulcie , " [I]110-dulcie could . "[110-dulcie] " Then will [you]110-dulcie — when [they]3153-they sit down ? "[110-dulcie] " No , "[110-dulcie] said [Dulcie]110-dulcie firmly , " [I]110-dulcie sha n't . "[110-dulcie] [The other girl]3074-the other girl , [she]110-dulcie noticed with satisfaction , had become aware of the situation and was evidently uneasy . [She]3074-the other girl looked as imploringly as [she]3074-the other girl dared at [remorseless little Dulcie]110-dulcie , as if appealing to [her]3074-the other girl not to get [her]3074-the other girl into trouble ; but [Dulcie]110-dulcie bent [her]110-dulcie eyes obstinately on [her]110-dulcie book and would not see [her]3074-the other girl . If the letter had been addressed to [any other boy in [the school]506-the school]1424-any other boy in the school , [she]3074-the other girl would have done [her]3074-the other girl best to shield [the culprits]1426-the culprits ; but this [she]3074-the other girl could not bring [herself]3074-the other girl to do here . [She]3074-the other girl found a malicious pleasure in remaining absolutely neutral , which of course was very wrong and ill - natured of [her]3074-the other girl . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul began now to be seriously alarmed . The fatal paper must be seen by some one in [[the Doctor]248-the doctor 's pew]1428-the doctor 's pew as soon as [the congregation]1417-the congregation sat down again ; and , if it reached [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's hands , it was impossible to say what misconstruction [he]57-paul might put upon it or what terrible consequences might not follow . [He]57-paul was innocent , perfectly innocent ; but though the consciousness of innocence is frequently a great consolation , [he]57-paul felt that unless [he]57-paul could imbue [the Doctor]248-the doctor with it as well , it would not save [him]57-paul from a flogging . So [he]57-paul made one more desperate attempt to soften [Dulcie]110-dulcie 's resolution : " Do n't be [a naughty little girl]3154-a naughty little girl , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , very injudiciously for [his]57-paul purpose , " [I]57-paul tell [you]110-dulcie [I]57-paul must have it . [You]110-dulcie 'll get [me]57-paul into a terrible mess if [you]110-dulcie 're not careful ! "[57-paul] But although [Dulcie]110-dulcie had been extremely well brought up , [I]0-i regret to say that the only answer [she]110-dulcie chose to make to this appeal was that slight contortion of the features , which with [a pretty girl]1432-a pretty girl is euphemised as a " moue , "[1432-a pretty girl] and with a plain one is called " making a face . "[57-paul] When [he]57-paul saw it [he]57-paul knew that all hope of changing [her]110-dulcie purpose must be abandoned . Then [they]1433-they all sat down , and , as [Paul]57-paul had foreseen , there the white cocked - hat lay on the dark pew - carpet , hideously distinct , with billet doux in every fold of it ! It could only be a question of time now . [The curate]1434-the curate was reading the first lesson for the day , but [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul heard not a verse of it . [He]57-paul was waiting with bated breath for the blow to fall . [It]1435-it fell at last . [Dulcie]110-dulcie , either with the malevolent idea of hastening the crisis , or ( which [I]0-i prefer to believe for [my]0-i own part ) finding that [[her]110-dulcie ex - lover]1436-her ex - lover 's visible torments were too much for [her]110-dulcie desire of vengeance , was softly moving a heavy hassock towards the guilty note . The movement caught [[her]110-dulcie mother]1289-her mother 's eye , and in an instant the compromising paper was in [her]110-dulcie watchful hands . [She]110-dulcie read it with incredulous horror , and handed it at once to [the Doctor]248-the doctor . [The golden - haired one]1439-the golden - haired one saw it all without betraying [herself]1439-the golden - haired one by any outward confusion . [She]1439-the golden - haired one had probably had some experience in such matters , and felt tolerably certain of being able , at the worst , to manage [the old gentleman in the gold spectacles]1440-the old gentleman in the gold spectacles . But [she]1439-the golden - haired one took an early opportunity of secretly conveying [her]1439-the golden - haired one contempt for the traitress Dulcie , who continued to meet [her]1439-the golden - haired one angry glances with the blandest unconsciousness . [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone examined the cocked - hat through [his]62-dr. grimstone double eyeglasses , with a heavy thunder - cloud gathering on [his]62-dr. grimstone brows . When [he]62-dr. grimstone had mastered it thoroughly , [he]62-dr. grimstone bent forward and glared indignantly past [[his]62-dr. grimstone wife]770-his wife and [daughter]1442-daughter for at least half a minute into the pew where [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was cowering , until [he]62-dr. grimstone felt that [he]62-dr. grimstone was coming all to pieces under the piercing gaze . The service passed all too quickly after that . [Paul]57-paul sat down and stood up almost unconsciously with [the rest]694-the rest ; but for the first time in [his]57-paul life [he]57-paul could have wished the sermon many times longer . The horror of [his]57-paul position quite petrified [him]57-paul . After all [his]57-paul prudent resolutions to keep out of mischief and to win the regard and confidence of [[his]57-paul gaoler]1444-his gaoler by [his]57-paul good conduct , like [the innocent convict in a melodrama]1445-the innocent convict in a melodrama , this came as nothing less than a catastrophe . [He]57-paul walked [home]296-home in a truly dismal state of limp terror . Fortunately for [him]57-paul [none of [the others]627-the others]1447-none of the others seemed to have noticed [his]57-paul misfortune , and [Jolland]78-jolland made no further advances . But even the weather tended to increase [his]57-paul depression , for it was a bleak , cheerless day , with a bitter and searching wind sweeping [the gritty roads]1449-the gritty roads where yesterday 's rain was turned to black ice in the ruts , and the sun shone with a dull coppery glitter that had no warmth or geniality about it . The nearer [they]1450-they came to [Crichton House]4-crichton house the more abjectly miserable became [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's state of mind . It was as much as [he]57-paul could do to crawl up the steps to the front door , and [his]57-paul knees positively clapped together when [the Doctor]248-the doctor , who had driven [home]296-home , met [them]1450-they in [the hall]259-the hall and said in a still grave voice , " [Bultitude]57-paul , when [you]57-paul have taken off [your]57-paul coat , [I]57-paul want [you]57-paul in [the study]3155-the study . "[57-paul] [He]57-paul was as long about taking off [his]57-paul coat as [he]57-paul dared , but at last [he]57-paul went trembling into [the study]3155-the study , which [he]57-paul found empty . [He]57-paul remembered [the room]213-the room well , with [its]213-the room ebony - framed etchings on the walls , bookcases and blue china over the draped mantelpiece , even to a large case of elaborately carved Indian chessmen in [bullock - carts]1456-bullock - carts and palanquins , on horses and elephants , which stood in the window - recess . It was [the very room to which [he]57-paul had been shown when [he]57-paul first called]1457-the very room to which he had been shown when he first called about sending [[his]57-paul son]225-his son to [the school]506-the school . [He]57-paul had little thought then that the time would come when [he]57-paul would attend [there]2356-there for the purpose of being flogged ; few things would have seemed less probable . Yet here [he]57-paul was . But [his]57-paul train of thought was abruptly broken by the entrance of [the Doctor]248-the doctor . [He]57-paul marched solemnly in , holding out the offending missive . " Look at this , [sir]2329-sir ! "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , shaking it angrily before [Paul]57-paul 's eyes . " Look at this ! what do [you]2329-sir mean by receiving a flippant communication like this in [a sacred edifice]3157-a sacred edifice ? What do [you]2329-sir mean by it ? "[57-paul] " There 's something about [you]57-paul this term , [Richard Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor slowly , " that [I]248-the doctor confess [I]248-the doctor do n't understand . But [I]248-the doctor ca n't be annoyed with it now . Come to [me]248-the doctor after supper to - night , and [I]248-the doctor shall be willing to hear anything [you]57-paul may have to say . "[248-the doctor] [Paul]57-paul was too overcome at this unexpected favour to speak [his]57-paul thanks . [He]57-paul got away as soon as [he]57-paul could . [His]57-paul path was smoothed at last ! That afternoon [the boys]570-the boys , or [all of [them]570-the boys who had disposed of the work set [them]570-the boys for the day]1469-all of them who had disposed of the work set them for the day , were sitting in [the schoolroom]2641-the schoolroom , after a somewhat chilly dinner of cold beef , cold tarts , and cold water , passing the time with that description of literature known as " Sunday reading . "[0-i] And here , at the risk of being guilty of a digression , [I]0-i must pause to record [my]0-i admiration for this exceedingly happy form of compromise , which is , [I]0-i think , peculiar to [the British]163-the british and , to a certain extent , [the American nations]1471-the american nations . It has many developments ; ranging from the mild Transatlantic compound of cookery and [camp - meetings]1472-camp - meetings , to the semi - novel , redeemed and chastened by an arrangement which sandwiches a sermon or a biblical lecture between each chapter of the story — a great convenience for the race of skippers . Then there are one or two illustrated magazines which it is always allowable to read on the Sabbath without fear of rebuke from the strictest — though it is not quite easy to see why . Open any one of the monthly numbers , and the chances are that [you]1473-you may possibly find at one part a neat little doctrinal essay by [a literary bishop]1474-a literary bishop ; the rest of the contents will consist of nothing more serious than a paper upon " cockroaches and [their]1476-popular authors habits "[1475-an eminent savant] by [an eminent savant]1475-an eminent savant ; a description of foreign travel , done in a brilliant and wholly secular vein ; and , further on again , an article on æsthetic furniture — while the balance of the number will be devoted to instalments of two thrilling novels by [popular authors]1476-popular authors , whose theology is seldom [their]1476-popular authors strongest point . Oddly enough , too , when these very novels come out later in three - volume form , with the " mark of the beast "[57-paul] in the shape of a circulating library ticket upon them , [they]1477-they will be fortunate if [they]1477-they are not interdicted altogether by some of [the serious families who take in the magazines]1478-the serious families who take in the magazines as being " so suitable for Sundays . "[57-paul] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , at all events , had reason to be grateful for this toleration , for in one of the bound volumes supplied to [him]57-paul [he]57-paul found a most interesting and delightfully unsectarian novel , which appealed to [his]57-paul tastes as [a business man]1479-a business man , for it was all about commerce and making fortunes by blockade - running ; and though [he]57-paul was [no novel reader as a rule]1480-no novel reader as a rule , [his]57-paul mind was so relieved and set at rest by the prospect of seeing the end of [his]57-paul trouble at last , that [he]57-paul was able to occupy [his]57-paul mind with the fortunes of [the hero]1013-the hero . [He]57-paul naturally detected technical errors here and there . But that pleased [him]57-paul , and [he]57-paul was becoming so deeply absorbed in the tale that [he]57-paul felt seriously annoyed when [Chawner]101-chawner came softly up to the desk at which [he]57-paul was sitting , and sat down close to [him]57-paul , crossing [his]101-chawner arms before [him]101-chawner , and leaning forward upon [them]1482-them with [his]101-chawner sallow face towards [Paul]57-paul . " [Dickie]164-dickie , "[101-chawner] [he]101-chawner began , in a cautious , oily tone , " did [I]101-chawner hear [the Doctor]248-the doctor say before dinner that [he]248-the doctor would hear anything [you]164-dickie have to tell [him]248-the doctor after supper ? Did [I]101-chawner ? [I]101-chawner know . "[101-chawner] " Good heavens ! " Yes , "[101-chawner] repeated [Chawner]101-chawner . " [I]101-chawner know , and [I]101-chawner tell [you]164-dickie what — [I]101-chawner wo n't have it ! "[101-chawner] " Wo n't have it ! and why ? "[101-chawner] " Never mind why . Perhaps [I]101-chawner do n't choose that [the Doctor]248-the doctor shall be told just yet ; perhaps [I]101-chawner mean to go up and tell [him]248-the doctor [myself]101-chawner some other day . "[101-chawner] " But — but , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " [[you]101-chawner young ghoul]3178-you young ghoul , do [you]101-chawner mean to say that all [you]101-chawner care for is to see [other people]345-other people 's sufferings ? "[57-paul]

"[101-chawner] " Who do [you]101-chawner mean by [them]3182-them , [sir]2329-sir ? "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , growing puzzled . " As if [you]101-chawner did n't know ! Oh , [you]101-chawner 're too clever for [me]101-chawner , [Dickie]164-dickie , [I]101-chawner can see , "[101-chawner] sniggered [Chawner]101-chawner . " [I]57-paul tell [you]101-chawner [I]57-paul do n't know ! "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul . " Look here , [Chawner]101-chawner — [your]101-chawner confounded name is [Chawner]101-chawner , is n't it?—there 's a mistake somewhere , [I]57-paul 'm sure of it . Listen to [me]57-paul . [I]57-paul 'm not going to tell [the Doctor]248-the doctor what [you]101-chawner think [I]57-paul am ! "[57-paul] " What do [I]101-chawner think [you]101-chawner are going to tell [him]248-the doctor ? "[101-chawner] " [I]57-paul have n't the slightest idea ; but , whatever it is , [you]101-chawner 're wrong . "[57-paul] " Ah , [you]101-chawner 're too clever , [Dickie]164-dickie ; [you]101-chawner wo n't betray [yourself]101-chawner ; but [other people]345-other people want to pay [Coker]88-coker and [Tipping]90-tipping out as well as [you]101-chawner , and [I]57-paul say [you]101-chawner must wait . "[57-paul] " [I]57-paul sha n't say anything to affect [anyone]2432-anyone but [myself]57-paul , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul ; " if [you]101-chawner know all about it , [you]101-chawner must know that — it wo n't interfere with [your]101-chawner amusement that [I]57-paul can see . "[57-paul] " Yes , it will , "[101-chawner] said [Chawner]101-chawner irritably , " it will — [you]101-chawner may n't mean to tell of [anyone]2432-anyone but [yourself]101-chawner ; but directly [Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone asks [you]101-chawner questions , it all comes out . "[101-chawner] " And who the dooce are [you]101-chawner ? "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , nettled at this assumption of authority . " How are [you]101-chawner going to prevent [me]57-paul , may [I]57-paul ask ? "[57-paul]

" S'sh ! here 's [the Doctor]248-the doctor , "[101-chawner] whispered [Chawner]101-chawner hurriedly . " [I]101-chawner 'll tell [you]101-chawner after tea . What am [I]101-chawner doing out of [[my]101-chawner place]3189-my place , [sir]2329-sir ? Oh , [I]101-chawner was only asking [Bultitude]57-paul what was the collect for to - day , [sir]2329-sir . Fourth Sunday after the Epiphany ? thank [you]101-chawner , [Bultitude]57-paul . "[101-chawner] And [he]57-paul glided back to [his]57-paul seat , leaving [Paul]57-paul in a state of vague uneasiness . Why did [this fellow]1484-this fellow , with the infernal sly face and glib tongue , want to prevent [him]57-paul from righting [himself]57-paul with [the world]2377-the world , and how could [he]1484-this fellow possibly prevent [him]57-paul ? It was absurd ; [he]1484-this fellow would take no notice of [the young scoundrel]1486-the young scoundrel — [he]1484-this fellow would defy [him]1486-the young scoundrel . But [he]1484-this fellow could not banish the uneasy feeling ; the cup had slipped so many times before at the critical moment that [he]1484-this fellow could not be sure whose hand would be the next to jog [his]1484-this fellow elbow . And so [he]1484-this fellow went down to tea with renewed misgivings . " There is [a kind of Followers]3192-a kind of followers likewise , which are dangerous , being indeed [Espials]165-espials ; which enquire the Secrets of [the House]234-the house and beare Tales of them . "—Bacon[1484-this fellow] . Very possibly [Chawner]101-chawner 's interference in [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's private affairs has surprised [others]2595-others besides [the victim of it]1488-the victim of it ; but the fact is that there was a most unfortunate misunderstanding between [them]1489-them from the very first , which prevented [the one]1490-the one from seeing , [the other]2428-the other from explaining , the real state of the case . [Chawner]101-chawner , of course , no more guessed [Paul]57-paul 's true name and nature than [anyone else who had come in contact with [him]57-paul in [his]57-paul impenetrable disguise]1492-anyone else who had come in contact with him in his impenetrable disguise , and [his]101-chawner motive for attempting to prevent an interview with [the Doctor]248-the doctor can only , [I]0-i fear , be explained by another slight digression . [The Doctor]248-the doctor , from a deep sense of [his]248-the doctor responsibility for the morals of [those under [his]248-the doctor care]1495-those under his care , was perhaps a trifle over - anxious to clear [his]248-the doctor moral garden of every noxious weed , and too constant in [his]248-the doctor vigilant efforts to detect the growing shoot of evil from the moment it showed above the surface . As [he]248-the doctor could not be everywhere , however , it is evident that many offences , trivial or otherwise , must have remained unsuspected and unpunished , but for a theory which [he]248-the doctor had originated and took great pains to propagate amongst [[his]248-the doctor pupils]2437-his pupils . The theory was that [every right - minded boy]1497-every right - minded boy ought to feel [himself]1497-every right - minded boy in such a fiduciary position towards [[his]1497-every right - minded boy master]1498-his master , that it became a positive duty to acquaint [him]1497-every right - minded boy with any delinquencies [he]1497-every right - minded boy might happen to observe among [[his]1497-every right - minded boy fellows]597-his fellows ; and if , at the same time , [he]1497-every right - minded boy was oppressed by a secret burden on [his]1497-every right - minded boy own conscience , it was understood that [he]1497-every right - minded boy might hope that the joint revelation would go far to mitigate [his]1497-every right - minded boy own punishment . It is doubtful whether this system , though [I]0-i believe it is found successful in [Continental colleges]1500-continental colleges , can be usefully applied to [English boys]1501-english boys ; whether it may not produce a habit of mutual distrust and suspicion , and a tone the reverse of healthy . For [myself]0-i , [I]0-i am inclined to think that [a schoolmaster]1206-a schoolmaster will find it better in the long run , for both the character and morals of [[his]1206-a schoolmaster school]249-his school , if [he]1206-a schoolmaster is not too anxious to play [the detective]1504-the detective , and refrains from encouraging [the more weak - minded or cowardly boys]1505-the more weak - minded or cowardly boys to save [themselves]1505-the more weak - minded or cowardly boys by turning " [schoolmaster]3194-schoolmaster 's evidence . "[1206-a schoolmaster] [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone thought otherwise ; but it must be allowed that the system , as in vogue at [Crichton House]4-crichton house , did not work well . There were [boys]2308-boys , of course , who took a sturdier view of [their]2308-boys own rights and duties , and despised [the talebearers]1507-the talebearers as [they]2308-boys deserved ; there were [others]2595-others , also , too timid and too dependent on the good opinion of [others]2595-others to risk the loss of it by becoming [informers]1510-informers ; but there were always one or two whose consciences were unequal to the burden of [[their]1511-their neighbour]1512-their neighbour 's sin , and could only be relieved by frank and full confession .

Unhappily [they]1511-their had , as a general rule , contributed largely to the sum of guilt [themselves]1511-their , and did not resort to disclosure until detection seemed reasonably imminent . [Chawner]101-chawner was [the leader of [this conscientious band]1514-this conscientious band]1513-the leader of this conscientious band ; [he]101-chawner revelled in the system . It gave [him]101-chawner the means at once of gratifying the almost universal love of power and of indulging a catlike passion for playing with the feelings of [others]2595-others , which , it is to be hoped , is more uncommon . [He]101-chawner knew [he]101-chawner was not popular , but [he]101-chawner could procure most of the incidents of popularity ; [he]101-chawner could have [[his]101-chawner little court of [cringing toadies]1517-cringing toadies]1516-his little court of cringing toadies ; [he]101-chawner could levy [his]101-chawner tribute of conciliatory presents , and vent many private spites and hatreds into the bargain — and [he]101-chawner generally did . Having [himself]101-chawner a tendency to acts of sly disobedience , [he]101-chawner found it a congenial pastime to set the fashion from time to time in some one of the peccadilloes to which boyhood is prone , and to which [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's somewhat restrictive code added a large number , and as soon as [he]101-chawner saw a sufficient number of [[his]101-chawner companions]2323-his companions satisfactorily implicated , [his]101-chawner opportunity came . [He]101-chawner would take [the chief culprits]1520-the chief culprits aside , and profess , in strict confidence , certain qualms of conscience which [he]101-chawner feared could only be appeased by unburdening [his]101-chawner guilt - laden soul . To this [none]1521-none would have had any right to object — had it not necessarily , or at least from [Chawner]101-chawner 's point of view , involved a full , true , and particular account of the misdoings of [each and every one]1522-each and every one ; and consequently , for some time after these professions of misgivings , [Chawner]101-chawner would be surrounded by [a little crowd of [anxiously obsequious friends]1524-anxiously obsequious friends]1523-a little crowd of anxiously obsequious friends , all trying hard to overcome [his]101-chawner scruples or persuade [him]101-chawner at least to omit [their]1523-a little crowd of anxiously obsequious friends names from [his]101-chawner revelations . Sometimes [he]101-chawner would affect to be convinced by [their]1523-a little crowd of anxiously obsequious friends arguments and send [them]1523-a little crowd of anxiously obsequious friends away reassured ; at others [his]101-chawner scruples would return in an aggravated form ; and so [he]101-chawner would keep them on tenterhooks of suspense for days and weeks , until [he]101-chawner was tired of the amusement — for this practising on the fears of weaker natures is a horribly keen delight to [some]749-some — or until some desperate little dog , unable to bear [his]101-chawner torture any longer , would threaten to give [himself]101-chawner up and make an end of it . Then [Chawner]101-chawner , to do [him]101-chawner justice , always relieved [him]101-chawner from so disagreeable a necessity , and would go softly into [[the Doctor]248-the doctor 's study]1527-the doctor 's study , and , in a subdued and repentant tone , pour out [his]101-chawner general confession for the public good . Probably [the Doctor]248-the doctor did not altogether respect the instruments [he]248-the doctor saw fit to use in this way ; [some]749-some would have declined to hear [the informer]1530-the informer out , flogged [him]101-chawner well , and forgotten it ; but [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone — though [he]62-dr. grimstone was hardly likely to be impressed by these exhibitions of noble candour , and did not fail to see that the prospect of obtaining better terms for [the penitent]1531-the penitent [himself]62-dr. grimstone had something to do with them — yet encouraged the system as a matter of policy , went thoroughly into the whole affair , and made it the cause of an explosion which [he]62-dr. grimstone considered would clear the moral atmosphere for some time to come . [I]0-i hope that , after this explanation , [Chawner]101-chawner 's opposition to [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's plans will be better understood . After tea , [he]101-chawner made [Paul]57-paul a little sign to follow [him]101-chawner , and [the two]381-the two went out together into [the little glass - house beyond [the schoolroom]2641-the schoolroom]1533-the little glass - house beyond the schoolroom ; it was dark , but there was light enough from [the room inside]1535-the room inside for [them]381-the two to see [each other]878-each other 's face . " Now , [sir]2329-sir , "[57-paul] began [Paul]57-paul , with dignity , when [he]57-paul had closed the glass door behind [him]57-paul , " perhaps [you]2329-sir 'll be good enough to tell [me]57-paul how [you]2329-sir mean to prevent [me]57-paul from seeing [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone , and telling [him]62-dr. grimstone — telling [him]62-dr. grimstone what [I]57-paul have to tell [him]62-dr. grimstone ? "[57-paul] " [I]101-chawner 'll tell [you]2329-sir , [Dickie]164-dickie , "[101-chawner] said [Chawner]101-chawner , with an evil smirk . " [You]2329-sir shall know soon enough . "[101-chawner]

The note was too evidently genuine ; [Dick]60-dick must have written it ( as a matter of fact [he]60-dick had ; in a moment of pique , no doubt , at some caprice of [his]60-dick real enslaver Dulcie's — but [his]60-dick fickleness brought fatal results on [[his]60-dick poor father]1538-his poor father 's undeserving head)—if [this diabolical Chawner]1539-this diabolical chawner carried out [his]1539-this diabolical chawner threats [he]1539-this diabolical chawner would indeed be " done for "[1539-this diabolical chawner] ; [he]1539-this diabolical chawner did not yet fully understand [the other]2428-the other 's motive , but [he]1539-this diabolical chawner thought that [he]1539-this diabolical chawner feared lest [Paul]57-paul , in declaring [his]57-paul own sorrows , might also accuse [Tipping]90-tipping and [Coker]88-coker of acts of cruelty and oppression , which [Chawner]101-chawner proposed to denounce [himself]101-chawner at some more convenient opportunity ; [he]1539-this diabolical chawner hesitated painfully . " Well ? "[101-chawner] said [Chawner]101-chawner , " make up [your]57-paul mind ; are [you]57-paul going to tell [him]57-paul , or not ? "[101-chawner] " [I]57-paul must ! "[101-chawner] And [they]1541-they went back to [the schoolroom]2641-the schoolroom again , where [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , boiling with rage and seriously alarmed as well , tried to sit down and appear as if nothing had happened . [Chawner]101-chawner sat down too , in a place from which [he]101-chawner could see all [Paul]57-paul 's movements , and [they]1541-they both watched [one another]2508-one another anxiously from the corners of [their]1541-they eyes till [the Doctor]248-the doctor came in . " It 's a foggy evening , "[248-the doctor] [he]248-the doctor said as [he]248-the doctor entered : " [the younger boys]1111-the younger boys had better stay in . [Chawner]101-chawner , [you]101-chawner and [the rest of the first form]3208-the rest of the first form can go to [church]1384-church ; get ready at once . "[248-the doctor] [Paul]57-paul 's heart leaped with triumph ; with [[his]57-paul enemy]1311-his enemy out of the way , [he]57-paul could carry out [his]57-paul purpose unhindered . The same thing apparently occurred to [Chawner]101-chawner , for [he]101-chawner said mildly , " Please , [sir]2329-sir , may [Richard Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude come too ? "[101-chawner] " Ca n't [Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude ask leave for [himself]87-mr. bultitude ? "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor . " [I]57-paul , [sir]2329-sir ! "[57-paul] " Then [you]57-paul see , [Chawner]101-chawner , [you]57-paul misunderstood [him]87-mr. bultitude .
