"[101-chawner] [Chawner]101-chawner 's small glittering eyes were fixed on [Paul]57-paul menacingly as [he]101-chawner managed to stammer that [he]101-chawner did want to say something in private . " Very well , [I]101-chawner am going out to see [a friend]3212-a friend for an hour or so — when [I]101-chawner come back [I]101-chawner will hear [you]57-paul , "[101-chawner] and [he]101-chawner left [the room]213-the room abruptly . [Chawner]101-chawner would very probably have petitioned to stay in that evening as well , had [he]101-chawner had time and presence of mind to do so ; as it was , [he]101-chawner was obliged to go away and get ready for [church]1384-church , but when [his]101-chawner preparations were made [he]101-chawner came back to [Paul]57-paul , and leaning over [him]57-paul said with an unpleasant scowl , " If [I]101-chawner get back in time , [Bultitude]57-paul , [we]3213-we 'll see whether [you]57-paul baulk [me]101-chawner quite so easily . If [I]101-chawner come back and find [you]57-paul 've done it — [I]101-chawner shall take in that letter ! "[101-chawner] " [You]57-paul may do what [you]57-paul please then , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , in a high state of irritation , " [I]57-paul shall be well out of [your]57-paul reach by that time . Now have the goodness to take [yourself]57-paul off . "[57-paul] As [he]101-chawner went , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul thought , " [I]57-paul never in all [my]57-paul life saw [such a fellow as that]3214-such a fellow as that , never ! It would give [me]57-paul real pleasure to hire [someone]3215-someone to kick [him]3214-such a fellow as that . "[57-paul] The evening passed quietly ; [the boys]570-the boys left at [home]296-home sat in [their]570-the boys places , reading or pretending to read . [[Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn , left in charge of [them]570-the boys]1551-mr. blinkhorn , left in charge of them , was at [his]108-mr. blinkhorn table in the corner noting up [his]108-mr. blinkhorn diary . [Paul]57-paul was free for a time to think over [his]57-paul position .

At first [he]57-paul was calm and triumphant ; [his]57-paul dearest hopes , [his]57-paul long - wished - for opportunity of a fair and unprejudiced hearing , were at last to be fulfilled — [Chawner]101-chawner was well out of the way for the best part of two hours — [the Doctor]248-the doctor was very unlikely to be detained nearly so long over one call ; [his]57-paul one anxiety was lest [he]57-paul might not be able , after all , to explain [himself]57-paul in a thoroughly effective manner — [he]57-paul planned out a little scheme for doing this . [He]57-paul must begin gradually of course , so as not to alarm [the schoolmaster]522-the schoolmaster or raise doubts of [his]57-paul sincerity or , worse still , [his]57-paul sanity . Perhaps a slight glance at instances of extraordinary interventions of the supernatural from the earliest times , tending to show the extreme probability of [their]570-the boys survival on rare occasions even to the present day , might be a prudent and cautious introduction to the subject — only [he]57-paul could not think of any , and , after all , it might weary [the Doctor]248-the doctor . [He]57-paul would start somewhat in this manner : " [You]1555-his hearer can not , [[my]57-paul dear sir]2599-my dear sir , have failed to observe since [our]3217-our meeting this year , a certain difference in [my]57-paul manner and [bearing"—one]166-bearing"—one[57-paul] 's projected speeches are somehow generally couched in finer language than , when it comes to the point , the tongue can be prevailed upon to utter . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul learned this opening sentence by heart , [he]57-paul thought it taking and neat , the sort of thing to fix [[his]57-paul hearer]1555-his hearer 's attention from the first . After that [he]57-paul found it difficult to get any further ; [he]57-paul knew [himself]57-paul that all [he]57-paul was about to describe was plain , unvarnished fact — but how would it strike [a stranger]1556-a stranger 's ear ? [He]57-paul found [himself]57-paul seeking ways in which to tone down the glaring improbability of the thing as much as possible , but in vain ; " [I]57-paul do n't know how [I]57-paul shall ever get it all out , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul told [himself]57-paul at last ; " if [I]57-paul think about it much longer [I]57-paul shall begin to disbelieve in it [myself]57-paul . "[57-paul] Here [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb came up in a confidential manner and sat down by [Paul]57-paul ; " [Dick]60-dick , "[92-biddlecomb] [he]92-biddlecomb began , in rather a trembling voice , " did [I]92-biddlecomb hear [the Doctor]248-the doctor say something about [your]60-dick having something to tell [him]248-the doctor ? "[92-biddlecomb] " Oh [Lord]3219-lord , here 's another of [them]3220-them now ! "[57-paul] thought [Paul]57-paul . " [You]57-paul are right , [young sir]3221-young sir , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said : " have [you]3221-young sir any objection ? mention it , [you]3221-young sir know , if [you]3221-young sir have , pray mention it . It 's a matter of life and death to [me]57-paul , but if [you]3221-young sir at all disapprove , of course that ought to be final ! "[57-paul] " No , but , "[92-biddlecomb] protested [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb , " [I]92-biddlecomb , [I]92-biddlecomb daresay [I]92-biddlecomb 've not treated [you]3221-young sir very well lately , [I]92-biddlecomb — — "[92-biddlecomb] " [You]92-biddlecomb were kind enough to suggest several very uncommonly unpleasant ways of annoying [me]57-paul , [sir]2329-sir , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul resentfully , " if [you]92-biddlecomb mean that . [You]92-biddlecomb 've kicked [me]57-paul more than once , and [your]92-biddlecomb handkerchief , unless [I]57-paul am very much mistaken , had the biggest and the hardest knot in it yesterday . If that gives [you]3221-young sir the right to interfere and dictate to [me]57-paul now , like [[your]3221-young sir amiable friend]3223-your amiable friend , [Master Chawner]101-chawner , [I]57-paul suppose [you]3221-young sir have it . "[57-paul] " Now [you]3221-young sir 're angry , "[92-biddlecomb] said [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb humbly ; " [I]92-biddlecomb do n't wonder at it . [I]92-biddlecomb 've behaved like [a cad]3224-a cad , [I]92-biddlecomb know , but , and this is what [I]92-biddlecomb wanted to say , [I]92-biddlecomb was sorry for [you]3221-young sir all the time . "[92-biddlecomb] " That 's very comforting , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul drily ; " thank [you]92-biddlecomb . [I]57-paul 'm vastly obliged to [you]92-biddlecomb . "[57-paul] " [I]92-biddlecomb was , though , "[92-biddlecomb] said [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb . " [I]92-biddlecomb , [I]92-biddlecomb was led away by [the other fellows]2927-the other fellows — [I]92-biddlecomb always liked [you]3221-young sir , [you]3221-young sir know , [Bultitude]57-paul . "[92-biddlecomb] " [You]3221-young sir 've a very odd way of showing [your]3221-young sir affection , "[57-paul] remarked [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul ; " but go on , let [me]57-paul hear all [you]3221-young sir have to say . "[57-paul] " It is n't much , "[92-biddlecomb] said [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb , quite broken down ; " only do n't sneak of [me]57-paul this time , [Dick]60-dick , let [me]57-paul off , there 's [a good fellow]3226-a good fellow . [I]57-paul 'll stick up for [you]3221-young sir after this , [I]57-paul will really . [You]3221-young sir used not to be [a fellow]2500-a fellow for sneaking once . It 's caddish to sneak ! "[57-paul] " Do n't be alarmed , [[my]57-paul good friend]3228-my good friend , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul ; " [I]57-paul wo n't poach on [that excellent young man]3229-that excellent young man [Chawner]101-chawner 's preserves . What [I]57-paul am going to tell [the Doctor]248-the doctor has nothing to do with [you]3221-young sir . "[57-paul] " On [your]3221-young sir honour ? "[92-biddlecomb] said [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb eagerly . " Yes , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul testily , " on [my]57-paul honour . Now , perhaps , [you]3221-young sir 'll let [me]57-paul alone . No , [I]57-paul wo n't shake hands , [sir]2329-sir . [I]57-paul 've had to accept [your]2329-sir kicks , but [I]57-paul do n't want [your]2329-sir friendship . "[57-paul] [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb went off , looking slightly ashamed of [himself]92-biddlecomb but visibly relieved from a haunting fear . " Thank goodness ! "[57-paul] thought [Paul]57-paul , " [he]92-biddlecomb was n't as obstinate as [the other fellow]2742-the other fellow . What a set [they]1559-they are ! [I]57-paul knew it , there 's [another boy]683-another boy coming up now ! "[57-paul] And indeed [one boy]671-one boy after another came up in the same way as [Biddlecomb]92-biddlecomb had done , some cringing more than [others]2595-others , but all vowing that [they]1559-they had never intended to do any harm , and entreating [him]671-one boy to change [his]671-one boy mind about complaining of [his]671-one boy ill - treatment . [They]1559-they brought little offerings to propitiate [him]671-one boy and prove the depth of [their]1559-they unaltered regard — pencil - cases and pocket - knives , and so forth , until [they]1559-they drove [Paul]57-paul nearly to desperation . However , [he]57-paul succeeded in dispelling [their]1559-they fears after some hot arguments , and had just sent away [the last suppliant]1560-the last suppliant , when [he]57-paul saw [Jolland]78-jolland too rise and come towards [him]57-paul . [Jolland]78-jolland leaned across [Paul]57-paul 's desk with folded arms and looked [him]57-paul full in the face with [his]78-jolland shallow light green eyes . " [I]57-paul do n't know what [you]57-paul 've said to [all those chaps]3234-all those chaps , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul began ; " [they]3234-all those chaps 've come back looking precious glum , but [they]3234-all those chaps wo n't tell [me]57-paul what [you]57-paul said , "[57-paul] ( [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul had in satisfying [their]1559-they alarm taken care to let [them]1559-they know [his]57-paul private opinion of [them]1559-they , which was not flattering ) , " but [I]57-paul 've got something to say to [you]57-paul , and it 's this . [I]57-paul never thought [you]57-paul would quite come down to this sort of thing ! "[57-paul] " What sort of thing ? "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , who was beginning to have enough of it . " Why , going up and letting on against [all of [us]3024-all of us]3024-all of us — it 's mean , [you]57-paul know . If [you]57-paul have got bashed about pretty well since [you]57-paul came back , it 's been all [your]57-paul own fault , and [you]57-paul know it . Last term [you]57-paul got on well enough — this time [you]57-paul began to be queer and nasty the very first day [you]57-paul came . [I]57-paul thought it was one of [your]57-paul larks at first , but [I]57-paul do n't know what it is now , and [I]57-paul do n't care . [I]57-paul stood up for [you]57-paul as long as [I]57-paul could , till [you]57-paul acted like a funk yesterday . Then [I]57-paul took [my]57-paul share in lamming [you]57-paul , and [I]57-paul 'd do it again . But if [you]57-paul are cad enough to pay [us]3236-us all out in this way , [I]57-paul 'll have no more to do with [you]57-paul — mind that . That 's all [I]57-paul came to say . "[57-paul] This was an unpalatable way of putting things , but [Paul]57-paul could not help seeing that there was some truth in it . [Jolland]78-jolland had been kind to [him]57-paul , too , in a careless sort of way , and at some cost to [himself]78-jolland ; so it was with more mildness than temper that [he]78-jolland answered [him]57-paul . " [You]57-paul 're on the wrong tack , [[my]78-jolland boy]2376-my boy , the wrong tack . [I]78-jolland 've no wish to tell tales of [anyone]2432-anyone , as [I]78-jolland 've been trying to explain to [[your]57-paul friends]3239-your friends . There 's something the matter with [me]78-jolland which [you]57-paul would n't understand if [I]78-jolland told [you]57-paul . "[78-jolland] " Oh , [I]78-jolland did n't know , "[78-jolland] said [Jolland]78-jolland , mollified ; " if it 's only physic [you]57-paul want . "[78-jolland] " Whatever it is , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , not caring to undeceive [him]57-paul , " it wo n't affect [you]57-paul or [anyone here]3240-anyone here , but [myself]57-paul . [You]57-paul 're not [a bad young fellow]3241-a bad young fellow , [I]57-paul believe . [I]57-paul do n't want to get [you]57-paul into trouble , [sir]2329-sir ; [you]57-paul do n't want much assistance , [I]57-paul 'm afraid , in [that department]3243-that department . So be off , like [a good fellow]3226-a good fellow , and leave [me]57-paul in peace . "[57-paul] All these interviews had taken time . [He]57-paul was alarmed on looking at the clock to see that it was nearly eight ; [the Doctor]248-the doctor was a long time over that call — for the first time [he]57-paul began to feel uneasy — [he]57-paul made hurried mental calculations as to the probability of [the Doctor]248-the doctor or [Chawner]101-chawner being the first to return . The walk to [church]1384-church took about twenty minutes ; say the service took an hour , allowing for the return , [he]57-paul might expect [Chawner]101-chawner by about half - past eight ; it was striking the hour now — half an hour only in which [he]57-paul could hope for any favourable result from the interview !

For [he]57-paul saw this plainly , that if [Chawner]101-chawner were once permitted to get [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's ear first and show [him]57-paul that infamous love - note , no explanation of [his]101-chawner ( even if [he]57-paul had nerve to make it then , which [he]57-paul doubted ) could possibly seem anything more than a desperate and far - fetched excuse ; if [he]57-paul could anticipate [Chawner]101-chawner , on the other hand , and once convince [the Doctor]248-the doctor of the truth of [his]57-paul story , [the informer]1530-the informer 's malice would fall flat . And still the long hand went rapidly on , as [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul sat staring stupidly at it with a faint sick feeling — it had passed the quarter now — why did [the Doctor]248-the doctor delay in this unwarrantable manner ? What a farce social civilities were — if [he]57-paul had allowed [himself]57-paul to be prevailed on to stay to supper ! Twenty minutes past ; [Chawner]101-chawner and [the others]627-the others might return at any moment — a ring at the bell ; [they]1569-they were there ! all was over now — no , [he]57-paul was saved , that was [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's voice in [the hall]259-the hall — what an unconscionable time [he]62-dr. grimstone was taking off [his]62-dr. grimstone greatcoat and gloves . But all comes to [the man who waits]1571-the man who waits . In another moment [the Doctor]248-the doctor looked in , singled out [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul with a sharp glance , and a , " Now , [Bultitude]57-paul , [I]248-the doctor will hear [you]57-paul ! "[248-the doctor] and led the way to [[his]248-the doctor study]1573-his study . [Paul]57-paul staggered rather than walked after [him]248-the doctor : as usual at the critical moment [his]57-paul carefully prepared opening had deserted [him]57-paul — [his]57-paul head felt heavy and crowded — [he]57-paul wanted to run away , but forced [himself]57-paul to overcome such a suicidal proceeding and follow to [the study]3155-the study . There was a lighted reading - lamp with a green glass shade upon the table . [The Doctor]248-the doctor sat down by it in an armchair by the fire , crossed [his]248-the doctor legs , and joined the tops of [his]248-the doctor fingers together . " Now , [Bultitude]57-paul , "[248-the doctor] [he]248-the doctor said again . " Might [I]57-paul — might [I]57-paul sit down ? "[57-paul] said poor [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul in a thick voice ; it was all that occurred to [him]57-paul to say . " Sit by all means , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor blandly . So [Paul]57-paul drew a chair opposite [the Doctor]248-the doctor and sat down . [He]57-paul tried desperately to clear [his]57-paul head and throat and begin ; but the only distinct thought in [his]57-paul mind just then was that the green lamp - shade lent a particularly ghastly hue to [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's face . " Take [your]57-paul time , [Bultitude]57-paul , "[446-the latter] said [the latter]446-the latter , after a long minute , in which a little skeleton clock on the mantelpiece ticked loudly—"there 's no hurry , [[my]446-the latter boy]2376-my boy . "[446-the latter] But this only reminded [Paul]57-paul that there was every need for hurry — [Chawner]101-chawner might come in , and follow [him]57-paul here , unless [he]57-paul made haste . Still , [he]57-paul could only say , " [You]248-the doctor see [me]57-paul in a very agitated state , [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone — a very agitated state , [sir]2329-sir . "[57-paul] [The Doctor]248-the doctor gave a short , dry cough . " Well , [Bultitude]57-paul , "[248-the doctor] [he]248-the doctor said . " The fact is , [sir]2329-sir , [I]248-the doctor 'm in a most unfortunate position , and — and the worst of it is , [I]248-the doctor do n't know how to begin . "[248-the doctor] Here [he]248-the doctor made another dead stop , while [the Doctor]248-the doctor raised [his]248-the doctor heavy eyebrows , and looked at the clock . " Do [you]2329-sir see any prospect of [your]2329-sir finding [yourself]2329-sir able to begin soon ? "[57-paul] [he]57-paul inquired at last , with rather suspicious suavity . " Perhaps if [you]248-the doctor came to [me]57-paul later on — — "[57-paul] " Not for [the world]2377-the world ! "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , in a highly nervous condition . " [I]57-paul shall begin very soon , [Doctor]2564-doctor , [I]57-paul shall begin directly . [Mine]57-paul is such a very singular case ; it 's difficult , as [you]2564-doctor see , to , to open it ! "[57-paul] " Have [you]57-paul anything on [your]57-paul mind ? "[248-the doctor] asked [the Doctor]248-the doctor suddenly . [Paul]57-paul could hear steps and voices in [the adjoining cloakroom]1583-the adjoining cloakroom — [the churchgoers]1584-the churchgoers had returned . " Yes — no ! "[57-paul] [he]57-paul answered , losing [his]57-paul head completely now . " That 's a somewhat extraordinary , not to say an ambiguous , reply , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor ; " what am [I]248-the doctor to understand by — — "[248-the doctor] There was a tap at the door . [Paul]57-paul started to [his]57-paul feet in a panic . " Do n't let [him]3250-him in ! "[57-paul] [he]57-paul shrieked , finding [his]57-paul voice at last . " Hear [me]57-paul first — [you]2564-doctor shall hear [me]57-paul first ! Say that [other rascal]3251-other rascal is not to come in . [He]3250-him wants to ruin [me]57-paul ! "[57-paul]

" [I]248-the doctor was going to say [I]248-the doctor was engaged , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor ; " but there 's something under this [I]248-the doctor must understand . Come in , whoever [you]57-paul are . "[248-the doctor] And the door opened softly , and [Chawner]101-chawner stepped meekly in ; [he]101-chawner was rather pale and breathed hard , but was otherwise quite composed . " Now , then , [Chawner]101-chawner , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor impatiently , " what is it ? Have [you]101-chawner something on [your]101-chawner mind , too ? "[248-the doctor] " Please , [sir]2329-sir , "[101-chawner] said [Chawner]101-chawner , " has [Bultitude]57-paul told [you]2329-sir anything yet ? "[101-chawner] " No , why ? Hold [your]101-chawner tongue , [Bultitude]57-paul . [I]248-the doctor shall hear [Chawner]101-chawner now — not [you]101-chawner ! "[248-the doctor] " Because , [sir]2329-sir , "[101-chawner] explained [Chawner]101-chawner , " [he]101-chawner knew [I]101-chawner had made up [my]101-chawner mind to tell [you]2329-sir something [I]101-chawner thought [you]2329-sir ought to know about [him]101-chawner , and so [he]101-chawner threatened to come first and tell some falsehood ( [I]101-chawner 'm sure [I]101-chawner do n't know what ) about [me]101-chawner , [sir]2329-sir . [I]101-chawner think [I]101-chawner ought to be here too . "[101-chawner] " It 's a lie ! "[57-paul] shouted [Paul]57-paul , " What [a villain]3255-a villain [that boy]3256-that boy is ! Do n't believe a word [he]101-chawner says , [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone ; it 's all false — all ! "[57-paul] " This is very suspicious , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor ; " if [your]2329-sir conscience were good , [Bultitude]57-paul , [you]2329-sir could have no object in preventing [me]248-the doctor from hearing [Chawner]101-chawner . [Chawner]101-chawner , in spite of some obvious defects in [his]101-chawner character , "[248-the doctor] [he]248-the doctor went on , with a gulp ( [he]248-the doctor never could quite overcome a repulsion to [the boy]246-the boy ) , " is , on the whole , [a right - minded and , ah , conscientious boy]3257-a right - minded and , ah , conscientious boy . [I]248-the doctor hear [Chawner]101-chawner first . "[248-the doctor] " Then , [sir]2329-sir , if [you]2329-sir please , "[101-chawner] said [Chawner]101-chawner , with an odious side smirk of triumph at [Paul]57-paul , who , quite crushed by the horror of the situation , had collapsed feebly on [his]57-paul chair again , " [I]248-the doctor thought it was [my]248-the doctor duty to let [you]2329-sir see this . [I]248-the doctor found it to - day in [Bultitude]57-paul 's prayerbook , [sir]2329-sir . "[248-the doctor] And [he]248-the doctor handed [Dick]60-dick 's unlucky scrawl to [the Doctor]248-the doctor , who took it to the lamp and read it hurriedly through . After that there was a terrible moment of dead silence ; then [the Doctor]248-the doctor looked up and said shortly , " [You]57-paul did well to tell [me]248-the doctor of this , [Chawner]101-chawner ; [you]57-paul may go now . "[248-the doctor] When [they]1592-they were alone once more [he]248-the doctor turned upon the speechless [Paul]57-paul with furious scorn and indignation . " [Contemptible liar and hypocrite]3260-contemptible liar and hypocrite , "[248-the doctor] [he]248-the doctor thundered , pacing restlessly up and down [the room]213-the room in [his]248-the doctor excitement , till [Paul]57-paul felt very like [Daniel]167-daniel , without [his]57-paul sense of security , " [you]57-paul are unmasked — unmasked , [sir]2329-sir ! [You]57-paul led [me]167-daniel to believe that [you]57-paul were as much shocked and pained at [this girl]3262-this girl 's venturing to write to [you]57-paul as [I]167-daniel could be [myself]167-daniel . [You]57-paul called it , quite correctly , ' forward and improper ' ; [you]57-paul pretended [you]57-paul had never given [her]3262-this girl the least encouragement — had not heard [her]3262-this girl name even — till to - day . And here is a note , written , as [I]167-daniel should imagine , some time since , in which [you]57-paul address [her]3262-this girl as ' [Connie Davenant]161-connie davenant , ' and have the impudence to admire the hat [she]3262-this girl wore the Sunday before ! [I]167-daniel shudder , [sir]2329-sir , to think of such duplicity , such precocious and shameless depravity . It astounds [me]167-daniel . It deprives [me]167-daniel of all power to think ! "[167-daniel] [Paul]57-paul made some faint and inarticulate remark about being [a family man]753-a family man — always most particular , and so forth — luckily it passed unheard . " What shall [I]248-the doctor do with [you]57-paul ? "[248-the doctor] continued [the Doctor]248-the doctor ; " how shall [I]248-the doctor punish such monstrous misconduct ? "[248-the doctor] " Do n't ask [me]57-paul , [sir]2329-sir , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , desperately—"only , for heaven 's sake , get it over as soon as possible . "[57-paul] " If [I]248-the doctor linger , [sir]2329-sir , "[248-the doctor] retorted [the Doctor]248-the doctor , " it is because [I]248-the doctor have grave doubts whether [your]57-paul offence can be expiated by a mere flogging — whether that is not altogether too light a retribution . "[248-the doctor] " [He]2329-sir ca n't want to torture [me]57-paul , "[57-paul] thought [Paul]57-paul . " Yes , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor again , " the doubt has prevailed . On a mind so hardened the cane would leave no lasting impression . [I]248-the doctor can not allow [[your]57-paul innocent companions]3266-your innocent companions to run the risk of contamination from [[your]57-paul society]3267-your society . [I]248-the doctor must not permit this serpent to glide uncrushed , this cockatrice to practise [his]2329-sir epistolary wiles , within [my]248-the doctor peaceful fold . [My]248-the doctor mind is made up — at whatever cost to [myself]248-the doctor — however it may distress and grieve [[your]57-paul good father]3268-your good father , who is so pathetically anxious for [you]57-paul to do [him]3268-your good father credit , [sir]2329-sir . [I]248-the doctor must do [my]248-the doctor duty to [the parents of [the boys entrusted to [my]248-the doctor care]3271-the boys entrusted to my care]3270-the parents of the boys entrusted to my care . [I]248-the doctor shall not flog [you]57-paul , [sir]2329-sir , for [I]248-the doctor feel it would be useless . [I]248-the doctor shall expel [you]57-paul . "[248-the doctor] " What ! "[57-paul] [Paul]57-paul leaped up incredulous . " Expel [me]57-paul ? Do [I]57-paul hear [you]57-paul aright , [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone ? Say it again — [you]57-paul will expel [me]57-paul ? "[57-paul] " [I]248-the doctor have said it , "[248-the doctor] [the Doctor]248-the doctor said sternly ; " no expostulations can move [me]248-the doctor now "[248-the doctor] ( as if [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was likely to expostulate ! ) " [Mrs. Grimstone]100-mrs. grimstone will see that [your]57-paul boxes are packed the first thing to - morrow morning , and [I]248-the doctor shall take [you]57-paul [myself]248-the doctor to [the station]280-the station and consign [you]57-paul to [the home]3274-the home [you]57-paul have covered with blushes and shame , by [the 9.15 train]3275-the 9.15 train , and [I]248-the doctor shall write a letter to - night explaining the causes for [your]57-paul dismissal . "[248-the doctor] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul covered [his]57-paul face with [his]57-paul hands , to hide , not [his]57-paul shame and distress , but [his]57-paul indecent rapture . It seemed almost too good to be true ! [He]57-paul saw [himself]57-paul about to be provided with every means of reaching [home]296-home in comfort and safety . [He]57-paul need dread no pursuit now . There was no chance , either , of [his]57-paul being forced to return to [the prison - house]1600-the prison - house — [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's letter would convince even [Dick]60-dick of the impossibility of that . And , best of all , this magnificent stroke of good luck had been obtained without the ignominy and pain of a flogging , without even the unpleasant necessity of telling [his]57-paul strange secret . But ( having gained some experience during [his]57-paul short stay at [the school]506-the school ) [he]57-paul had the duplicity to pretend to sob bitterly . " But one night more , [sir]2329-sir , "[248-the doctor] continued [the Doctor]248-the doctor , " shall [you]2329-sir pass beneath this roof , and that apart from [[your]2329-sir fellows]3277-your fellows . [You]2329-sir will occupy [the spare bedroom]3278-the spare bedroom until the morning , when [you]2329-sir quit [the school]506-the school in disgrace — for ever . "[0-i] [I]0-i said in another chapter that [this Sunday]1604-this sunday would find [Paul]57-paul , at [its]1605-its close , after a trying course of emotions , in a state of delicious ecstasy of pure relief and happiness — and really that scarcely seems too strong an expression for [his]57-paul feelings . When [he]57-paul found [himself]57-paul locked securely into [a comfortable , warm bedroom]1606-a comfortable , warm bedroom , with curtains and a carpet in [it]1606-a comfortable , warm bedroom , safe from the persecutions of [all those terrible boys]1607-all those terrible boys , and when [he]57-paul remembered that this was actually the last night of [his]57-paul stay [here]2411-here — that [he]57-paul would certainly see [[his]57-paul own [home]296-home]1609-his own home before noon next day , the reaction was so powerful that [he]57-paul could not refrain from skipping and leaping about [the room]213-the room in a kind of hysterical gaiety . And as [he]57-paul laid [his]57-paul head down on a yielding lavender - scented pillow , [his]57-paul thoughts went back without a pang to the varied events of the day ; they had been painful , very painful , but it was well worth while to have gone through them to appreciate fully the delightful intensity of the contrast . [He]57-paul freely forgave all [[his]57-paul tormentors]641-his tormentors , even [Chawner]101-chawner — for had not [Chawner]101-chawner procured [his]57-paul release?—and [he]57-paul closed [his]57-paul eyes at last with a smile of Sybaritic satisfaction and gentle longing for the Monday 's dawn to break . And yet some , after [his]57-paul experiences , would have had [their]1613-their misgivings . " Discipulorum inter jubeo plorare cathedras . "[1613-their] Blithe and gay was [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul when [he]57-paul opened [his]57-paul eyes on Monday morning and realised [his]57-paul incredible good fortune ; in a few hours [he]57-paul would be travelling safely and comfortably [home]296-home , with every facility for regaining [his]57-paul rights . [He]57-paul chuckled — though [his]57-paul sense of humour was not large — [he]57-paul chuckled , as [he]57-paul lay snugly in bed , to think of [Dick]60-dick 's discomfiture on seeing [him]57-paul return so unexpectedly ; [he]57-paul began to put it down , quite unwarrantably , to [his]57-paul own cleverness , as having conceived and executed such a stroke of genius as procuring [his]57-paul own expulsion . [He]57-paul remained in bed until long after the getting - up bell had rung , feeling that [his]57-paul position ensured [him]57-paul perfect impunity in this , and when [he]57-paul rose at length it was in high spirits , and [he]57-paul dressed [himself]57-paul with a growing toleration for things in general , very unlike [his]57-paul ordinary frame of mind . When [he]57-paul had finished [his]57-paul toilet , [the Doctor]248-the doctor entered [the room]213-the room . " [Bultitude]60-dick , "[248-the doctor] [he]248-the doctor said gravely , " before sending [you]60-dick from [us]3280-us , [I]248-the doctor should like to hear from [your]60-dick own lips that [you]60-dick are not altogether without contrition for [your]60-dick conduct . "[248-the doctor] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul considered that such an acknowledgment could not possibly do any harm , so [he]248-the doctor said — as , indeed , [he]248-the doctor might with perfect truth — that " [he]248-the doctor very much regretted what had passed . "[248-the doctor] " [I]248-the doctor am glad to hear that , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , more briskly , " very glad ; it relieves [me]248-the doctor from a very painful responsibility . It may not impossibly induce [me]248-the doctor to take a more lenient view of [your]60-dick case . "[248-the doctor] " Oh ! "[57-paul] gasped [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , feeling very uncomfortable all at once . " Yes ; it is a serious step to ruin [a boy]233-a boy 's career at its outset by unnecessary harshness . Nothing , of course , can palliate the extreme baseness of [your]60-dick behaviour . Still from certain faint indications in [your]60-dick character of better things , [I]57-paul do not despair even yet ( after [you]60-dick have received a public lesson at [my]57-paul hands , which [you]60-dick will never forget ) of rearing [you]60-dick to become in time an ornament to the society in which it will be [your]60-dick lot to move . [I]57-paul will not give up in despair — [I]57-paul will persevere a little longer . "[57-paul] " Thank [you]248-the doctor ! "[57-paul] [Paul]57-paul faltered , with a sudden sinking sensation . " [Mrs. Grimstone]100-mrs. grimstone , too , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , " has been interceding for [you]60-dick ; [she]100-mrs. grimstone has represented to [me]248-the doctor that a public expression of [my]248-the doctor view of [your]60-dick conduct , together with a sharp , severe dose of physical pain , would be more likely to effect a radical improvement in [your]60-dick character , and to soften [your]60-dick perverted heart , than if [I]248-the doctor sent [you]60-dick away in hopeless disgrace , without giving [you]60-dick an opportunity of showing a desire to amend . "[248-the doctor] " It's — very kind of [Mrs. Grimstone]100-mrs. grimstone , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul faintly . " Then [I]57-paul hope [you]60-dick will show [your]60-dick appreciation of [her]100-mrs. grimstone kindness . Yes , [I]57-paul will not expel [you]60-dick . [I]57-paul will give [you]60-dick one more chance to retrieve [your]60-dick lost reputation . But , for [your]60-dick own sake , and as a public warning , [I]57-paul shall take notice of [your]60-dick offence in public . [I]57-paul shall visit it upon [you]60-dick by a sound flogging before [the whole school]2673-the whole school at eleven o'clock . [You]60-dick need not come down till then — [your]60-dick breakfast will be sent up to [you]60-dick . "[57-paul] [Paul]57-paul made a frantic attempt to dissuade [him]57-paul from [his]57-paul terrible determination . " [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , " [I]57-paul — [I]57-paul should much prefer being expelled , if it is all the same to [you]62-dr. grimstone . "[57-paul] " It is not all the same to [me]248-the doctor , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor . " This is mere pride and obstinacy , [Bultitude]57-paul ; [I]248-the doctor should do wrong to take any notice of it . "[248-the doctor] " [I]57-paul — [I]57-paul tell [you]62-dr. grimstone [I]57-paul have great objection to — to being flogged , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul eagerly ; " it would n't improve [me]57-paul at all ; it would harden [me]57-paul , sir,—harden [me]57-paul . [I]57-paul — [I]57-paul can not allow [you]62-dr. grimstone to flog [me]57-paul , [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone . [I]57-paul have strong prejudices against the system of corporal punishment . [I]57-paul object to it on principle . Expulsion would make [me]57-paul quite a different being , [I]57-paul assure [you]62-dr. grimstone ; it would reform [me]57-paul — save [me]57-paul — it would indeed . "[57-paul] " So , to escape a little personal inconvenience , [you]62-dr. grimstone would be content to bring sorrow upon [[your]62-dr. grimstone worthy father]3283-your worthy father 's grey head , would [you]62-dr. grimstone , [sir]2329-sir ? "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor . " [I]248-the doctor shall not oblige [you]62-dr. grimstone in this . Nor , [I]248-the doctor may add , will [your]62-dr. grimstone cowardice induce [me]248-the doctor to spare [you]62-dr. grimstone in [your]62-dr. grimstone coming chastisement . [I]248-the doctor leave [you]62-dr. grimstone , [sir]2329-sir — [we]3286-we shall meet again at eleven ! "[248-the doctor] And [he]248-the doctor stalked out of [the room]213-the room . Perhaps , though [he]248-the doctor did not admit this even to [himself]248-the doctor , there were more considerations for commuting the sentence of expulsion than those [he]248-the doctor had mentioned . [Boys]2308-boys are not often expelled from [private schools]1623-private schools , except for especially heinous offences , and in this case there was no real reason why [the Doctor]248-the doctor should be Quixotic enough to throw up a portion of [his]248-the doctor income — particularly if [he]248-the doctor could produce as great a moral effect by other means . But [his]248-the doctor clemency was too much for [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul ; [he]248-the doctor threw [himself]248-the doctor on the bed and raved at the hideous fate in store for [him]248-the doctor ; ten short minutes ago , and [he]248-the doctor had been so happy — so certain of release — and now , not only was [he]248-the doctor as far from all hope of escape as ever , but [he]248-the doctor had the certainty before [him]248-the doctor of a sound flogging in less than two hours ! Just after something has befallen [us]1625-us which , for good or ill , will make a great change in [our]1625-us lives , what a totally new aspect the common everyday things about [us]1625-us are apt to wear — the book [we]1625-us were reading , the letter [we]1625-us had begun , the picture [we]1625-us knew — what a new and tender attraction they may have for [us]1625-us , or what a grim and terrible irony ! Something of this [Paul]57-paul felt dimly , as [he]57-paul finished dressing , in a dazed , unconscious manner . [The comfortable bedroom]1626-the comfortable bedroom , with [its]1626-the comfortable bedroom delicately - toned wall - paper and flowery cretonnes , had become altogether hateful in [his]57-paul eyes now . Instead of feeling grateful ( as [he]57-paul surely ought to have been ) for the one night of perfect security and comfort [he]57-paul had passed [there]2356-there , [he]57-paul only loathed it for the delusive peace it had brought [him]57-paul . There was a gentle tap at the door , and [Dulcie]110-dulcie came in , bearing a tray with [his]57-paul breakfast , and looking like [a little Royalist]1628-a little royalist bearing food to [a fugitive Cavalier]1629-a fugitive cavalier ; though [Paul]57-paul did not quite carry out [his]57-paul share of the simile . " There ! "[110-dulcie] [she]110-dulcie said , almost cheerfully ; " [I]110-dulcie got [Mummy]168-mummy to let [me]110-dulcie take up [your]57-paul breakfast ; and there 's an egg for [you]57-paul , and muffins . "[110-dulcie] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul sat on a chair and groaned .

" [You]57-paul might say ' thank [you]57-paul , ' "[110-dulcie] said [Dulcie]110-dulcie , pouting . " [That other girl]3287-that other girl would n't have brought [you]57-paul up much breakfast if [she]3287-that other girl 'd been in [[my]110-dulcie place]3189-my place . " But [you]57-paul do n't seem to care whether [I]110-dulcie do or not . "[110-dulcie] " [I]57-paul feel so miserable ! "[57-paul] sighed [Paul]57-paul . " Then [you]57-paul must drink some coffee , "[57-paul] prescribed [Dulcie]110-dulcie decidedly ; " and [you]57-paul must eat some breakfast . " Do n't talk about the — the flogging , [I]57-paul ca n't bear it . "[57-paul] " But it 's not [papa]3023-papa 's new cane , [you]57-paul know , [Dick]60-dick , "[110-dulcie] said [Dulcie]110-dulcie consolingly . " [I]110-dulcie 've hidden that ; it 's only the old one , and [you]57-paul always said that did n't hurt so very much , after a little while . It is n't as if it was the horsewhip , either . [Daddy]169-daddy lost that out riding in the holidays . "[110-dulcie] " Oh , the horsewhip 's worse , is it ? "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , with a sickly smile . " [Tom]95-tommy says so , "[110-dulcie] said [Dulcie]110-dulcie . " After all , [Dick]60-dick , it will be all over in five minutes , or , perhaps , a little longer , and [I]110-dulcie do think [you]60-dick ought n't to mind that so much , now , after [mamma]2339-mamma and [I]110-dulcie have begged [you]60-dick off from being expelled . [We]3291-we might never have seen [one another]2508-one another again , [Dick]60-dick ! "[110-dulcie] " [You]57-paul begged [me]57-paul off ! "[57-paul] cried [Paul]57-paul . " Yes , "[110-dulcie] said [Dulcie]110-dulcie ; " [Daddy]169-daddy would n't change [his]3293-his mind for ever so long — till [I]110-dulcie coaxed [him]3293-his . "[57-paul]

[Dulcie]110-dulcie set down the tray , and , putting [her]110-dulcie hands behind [her]110-dulcie , leaned against a corner of a wardrobe . " And is that all [you]57-paul say to [me]110-dulcie ! "[57-paul] [Dulcie]110-dulcie shook out [her]110-dulcie long brown hair , and clenched [her]110-dulcie small fist in an undeniable passion , for [she]110-dulcie had something of [[her]110-dulcie father]1413-her father 's hot temper when roused . " Very well , then , "[110-dulcie] [she]110-dulcie said , moving with great dignity towards the door . " [I]110-dulcie 'm very sorry [I]110-dulcie ever did interfere . "[110-dulcie] And with this parting shot [she]1631-she was gone . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul wandered disconsolately about [the upper part of [the house]234-the house]1632-the upper part of the house after this , not daring to go down , and not able to remain in [any one place]1634-any one place . [The maids who came up to make the beds]1635-the maids who came up to make the beds looked at [him]57-paul with pitiful interest , but [he]57-paul was too proud to implore help from [them]1635-the maids who came up to make the beds . To hide would only make matters worse , for , as [he]57-paul had not a penny in [his]57-paul pocket , and no probability of being able to borrow one , [he]57-paul must remain in [the house]234-the house till hunger forced [him]57-paul from [his]57-paul hiding - place — supposing [they]1635-the maids who came up to make the beds did not hunt [him]57-paul out long before that time . The shouts of [the boys in [the playground]648-the playground during [their]1637-the boys in the playground during their half - hour 's play half - hour 's play]1637-the boys in the playground during their half - hour 's play had long since died away ; [he]57-paul heard the clock in [the hall]259-the hall strike eleven — time for [him]57-paul to seek [his]57-paul awful rendezvous . [The Doctor]248-the doctor had not forgotten [him]57-paul , [he]57-paul found , for presently [the butler]375-the butler came up and ceremoniously announced that [the Doctor]248-the doctor " would see [him]57-paul now , if [he]57-paul pleased . "[375-the butler] [He]57-paul stumbled [downstairs]268-downstairs in a half - unconscious condition , [the butler]375-the butler threw open the two doors which led to [the schoolroom]2641-the schoolroom , and [Paul]57-paul tottered in , more dead than alive with shame and fear . [The whole school]2673-the whole school were at [[their]2673-the whole school places]1647-their places , with no books before [them]2673-the whole school , and arranged as if to hear a lecture . [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn alone was absent , for , not liking these exhibitions , [he]108-mr. blinkhorn had taken an opportunity of slipping out into [the playground]648-the playground , round which [he]108-mr. blinkhorn was now solemnly trotting at the " double "[108-mr. blinkhorn] with elbows squared and head up ; an exercise which [he]108-mr. blinkhorn said was an excellent thing for the back and lungs . [He]108-mr. blinkhorn had a habit of suddenly leaving the class [he]108-mr. blinkhorn was taking to indulge in it for a few minutes , returning breathless but refreshed . [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler was at [his]109-mr. tinkler seat , wearing that faint grin on [his]109-mr. tinkler face with which [he]109-mr. tinkler might have prepared to see a pig killed or a bull - fight , and all [the boys]570-the boys fixed [their]570-the boys eyes expectantly on [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul as [he]57-paul appeared at the doorway . " Stand there , [sir]2329-sir , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , who was standing at [his]248-the doctor writing - table in an attitude ; " out there in the middle , where [[your]2329-sir schoolfellows]2885-your schoolfellows can see [you]2329-sir . "[248-the doctor] [Paul]57-paul obeyed and stood where [he]57-paul was told , looking , as [he]57-paul felt , absolutely boneless . " Some of those here , "[248-the doctor] began [the Doctor]248-the doctor in an impressive bass , " may wonder why [I]248-the doctor have called [you]1652-your all together on this , the first day of the week ; most of [those who reside under [my]248-the doctor roof]3300-those who reside under my roof are acquainted with , and [I]248-the doctor trust execrate , the miserable cause of [my]248-the doctor doing so . "[248-the doctor] If there is one virtue which [I]0-i have striven to implant more than any other in [your]1652-your breasts , " [he]0-i continued , "[248-the doctor] it is the cultivation of a modest and becoming reserve in [your]1652-your intercourse with [those of the opposite sex]1653-those of the opposite sex . " With the majority [I]1654-his have , [I]1654-his hope , been successful , and it is as painful for [me]1654-his to tell as for [you]1652-your to hear , that there exists in [your]1652-your midst a youthful reprobate , trained in all the arts of ensnaring the vagrant fancies of innocent but giddy girlhood . "[1654-his] See [him]1654-his as [he]1654-his cowers there before [your]1652-your gaze , in all the bared hideousness of [his]1654-his moral depravity " ( [the Doctor]248-the doctor on occasions like these never spared [his]0-i best epithets , and [Paul]57-paul soon began to feel [himself]57-paul [a very villain]3302-a very villain ) ; "[1654-his] [a libertine , young in years , but old in — in everything else]1655-a libertine , young in years , but old in — in everything else , who has not scrupled to indite an amatory note , so appalling in its familiarity , and so outrageous in the warmth of its sentiments , that [I]0-i can not bring [myself]0-i to shock [your]1652-your ears with its contents . " [You]1652-your do well to shun [him]1654-his as [a moral leper]3303-a moral leper ; but how shall [I]0-i tell [you]1652-your that , not satisfied with pressing [his]1654-his effusions upon the shrinking object of [his]1654-his precocious affections , [the impious wretch]3304-the impious wretch has availed [himself]1654-his of the shelter of [a church]3305-a church to cloak [his]1654-his insidious advances , and even force a response to them from [a heedless and imprudent girl]3306-a heedless and imprudent girl ! "[0-i] If , " continued [the Doctor]248-the doctor , now allowing [his]248-the doctor powerful voice to boom to its full compass—"if[0-i] [I]0-i can succeed in bringing [this coward]1656-this coward , this unmanly dallier in a sentiment which the healthy mind of [boyhood]1657-boyhood rejects as premature , to a sense of [his]1656-this coward detestable conduct ; if [I]0-i can score the lesson upon [his]1656-this coward flesh so that some faint notion of its force and purport may be conveyed to what has been supplied to [him]1656-this coward as a heart , then [I]0-i shall not have lifted this hand in vain ! " [He]248-the doctor shall see whether [he]248-the doctor will be allowed to trail the fair name of [the school]506-the school for propriety and correctness of deportment in the dust of a pew - floor , and spurn [my]0-i reputation as a preceptor like [a church]3305-a church hassock beneath [his]1656-this coward feet ! "[0-i] [I]0-i shall say no more ; [I]0-i will not prolong these strictures , deserved though they be , beyond their proper limits .... [I]0-i shall now proceed to act . [Richard Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude , remain there till [I]0-i return to mete out to [you]87-mr. bultitude with no sparing hand the punishment [you]87-mr. bultitude have so richly merited . "[0-i]

With these awful words [the Doctor]248-the doctor left [the room]213-the room , leaving [Paul]57-paul in a state of abject horror and dread which need not be described . Never , never again would [he]57-paul joke , as [he]57-paul had been wo nt to do with [Dick]60-dick in lighter moods , on the subject of corporal punishment under any circumstances — it was no fit theme for levity ; if this — this outrage were really done to [him]57-paul , [he]57-paul could never be able to hold up [his]57-paul head again . What if it were to get about in [the city]2416-the city ! [The boys]570-the boys , who had sunk , as [they]570-the boys always did , into a state of torpid awe under [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's eloquence , now recovered spirits enough to rally [Paul]57-paul with much sprightly humour . " [He]57-paul 's gone to fetch [his]57-paul cane , "[749-some] said [some]749-some , and imitated for [Paul]57-paul 's instruction the action of caning by slapping a ruler upon a copy - book with a dreadful fidelity and resonance ; [others]2595-others sought to cross - examine [him]57-paul upon the love - letter , it appearing from [their]2595-others casual remarks that not a few had been also honoured by communications from [the artless Miss Davenant]162-miss davenant . It is astonishing how unfeeling even [ordinary good - natured boys]1665-ordinary good - natured boys can be at times . [Chawner]101-chawner sat at [his]101-chawner desk with raised shoulders , rubbing [his]101-chawner hands , and grinning like some malevolent ape : " [I]101-chawner told [you]57-paul , [Dickie]164-dickie , [you]57-paul know , "[101-chawner] [he]101-chawner murmured , " that it was better not to cross [me]101-chawner . "[101-chawner] And still [the Doctor]248-the doctor lingered . Some kindly suggested that [he]57-paul was " waxing the cane . "[57-paul] But the more general opinion was that [he]57-paul had been detained by [some visitor]1667-some visitor ; for it appeared that ( though [Paul]57-paul had not noticed it ) [several]678-several had heard a ring at the bell . The suspense was growing more and more unbearable . At last the door opened in a slow ominous manner , and [the Doctor]248-the doctor appeared . There was a visible change in [his]248-the doctor manner , however . The white heat of [his]248-the doctor indignation had died out : [his]248-the doctor expression was grave but distinctly softened — and [he]248-the doctor had nothing in [his]248-the doctor hand . " [I]248-the doctor want [you]57-paul outside , [Bultitude]57-paul , "[248-the doctor] [he]248-the doctor said ; and [Paul]57-paul , still uncertain whether the scene of [his]248-the doctor disgrace was only about to be shifted , or what else this might mean , followed [him]248-the doctor into [the hall]259-the hall . " If anything can strike shame and confusion into [your]57-paul soul , [Richard]87-mr. bultitude , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , when [they]1672-they were outside , " it will be what [I]57-paul have to tell [you]57-paul now . [[Your]57-paul unhappy father]3310-your unhappy father is [here]2411-here , in [the dining - room]275-the dining - room . "[57-paul] [Paul]57-paul staggered . Had [Dick]60-dick the brazen effrontery to come here to taunt [him]57-paul in [his]57-paul slavery ? What was the meaning of it ? What should [he]57-paul say to [him]60-dick ? [He]57-paul could not answer [the Doctor]248-the doctor but by a vacant stare . " [I]248-the doctor have not seen [him]3310-your unhappy father yet , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor . " [He]3310-your unhappy father has come at a most inopportune moment "[248-the doctor] ( here [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul could not agree with [him]248-the doctor ) . " [I]248-the doctor shall allow [you]57-paul to meet [him]3310-your unhappy father first , and give [you]57-paul the opportunity of breaking [your]57-paul conduct to [him]3310-your unhappy father . [I]248-the doctor know how it will wring [his]3310-your unhappy father paternal heart ! "[248-the doctor] and [the Doctor]248-the doctor shook [his]248-the doctor head sadly , and turned away . With a curious mixture of shame , anger , and impatience , [Paul]57-paul turned the handle of the dining - room door . [He]57-paul was to meet [Dick]60-dick face to face once more . The final duel must be fought out between [them]1676-them here . Who would be [the victor]1677-the victor ? It was a strange sensation on entering to see the image of what [he]57-paul had so lately been standing by the mantelpiece . It gave a shock to [his]57-paul sense of [his]57-paul own identity . It seemed so impossible that that stout substantial frame could really contain [Dick]60-dick . For an instant [he]57-paul was totally at a loss for words , and stood pale and speechless in the presence of [[his]57-paul unprincipled son]1678-his unprincipled son . [Dick]60-dick on [his]57-paul side seemed at least as much embarrassed . [He]57-paul giggled uneasily , and made a sheepish offer to shake hands , which was indignantly declined . As [Paul]57-paul looked [he]57-paul saw distinctly that [[his]57-paul son]225-his son 's fraudulent imitation of [[his]225-his son father]242-his father 's personal appearance had become deteriorated in many respects since that unhappy night when [he]57-paul had last seen it . It was then a copy , faultlessly accurate in every detail . [It]1681-it was now almost a caricature , a libel ! The complexion was nearly sallow , with the exception of the nose , which had rather deepened in colour . The skin was loose and flabby , and the eyes dull and a little bloodshot . But perhaps the greatest alteration was in the dress . [Dick]60-dick wore an old light tweed shooting - coat of [his]60-dick , and a pair of loose trousers of blue serge ; while , instead of the formally tied black neckcloth [[his]60-dick father]242-his father had worn for a quarter of a century , [he]60-dick had a large scarf round [his]60-dick neck of some crude and gaudy colour ; and the conventional chimney - pot hat had been discarded for a shabby old wide - brimmed felt wideawake . Altogether , it was by no means the costume which [a British merchant]1683-a british merchant , with any self - respect whatever , would select , even for a country visit . And thus [they]1684-they met , as perhaps never , since [this world]1685-this world was first set spinning down the ringing grooves of change , met [father]2333-father and [son]366-son before ! " [The Survivorship of [a worthy Man in [his]3314-a worthy man in his son Son]3314-a worthy man in his son]3313-the survivorship of a worthy man in his son is a Pleasure scarce inferior to the Hopes of [the Continuance of [his]3314-a worthy man in his son own Life]3315-the continuance of his own life . "[170-spectator . paul] [Spectator . Paul]170-spectator . paul was the first to break a very awkward silence . " [[You]60-dick young scoundrel]3316-you young scoundrel ! " Well , [sir]2329-sir , "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , with ponderous sarcasm , " [you]2329-sir 'll be delighted to hear that [I]57-paul 'm getting on uncommonly well — oh , uncommonly ! [[Your]2329-sir high - spirited young friends]3322-your high - spirited young friends batter [me]57-paul to sleep with slippers on most nights , and , as a general thing , kick [me]57-paul about during the day like a confounded football ! "[60-dick] This suggestion almost maddened [Paul]57-paul . [He]57-paul made one stride forward , and faced [[his]57-paul son]225-his son with blazing eyes . " [You]57-paul know it , [I]60-dick see , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , as [Paul]57-paul was about to move towards [him]57-paul — with what object [he]57-paul scarcely knew [himself]57-paul . Now [you]57-paul can have them all up and fire away . "[60-dick] There was a pause , in which the conversation seemed about to flag hopelessly , but at last [Dick]60-dick said , almost as if [he]60-dick felt some compunction for [his]60-dick present unfilial attitude : " Now , [you]57-paul know , it 's much better to take things quietly . It ca n't be altered now , can it ? And it 's not such bad fun being [a boy]233-a boy after all — for some things . [You]57-paul 'll get into it by - and - by , [you]57-paul see if [you]57-paul do n't , and be as jolly as [a sandboy]3350-a sandboy . [We]3351-we shall get along all right together , too . [I]60-dick sha n't be hard on [you]57-paul . It is n't [my]60-dick fault that [you]57-paul happen to be at [this particular school]3352-this particular school — [you]57-paul chose it ! And after this term [you]57-paul can go to [any other school [you]57-paul like]3353-any other school you like — Eton or Rugby , or anywhere . [I]60-dick do n't mind the expense . Of , if [you]57-paul 'd rather , [you]57-paul can have [a private tutor]2365-a private tutor . And [I]60-dick 'll buy [you]57-paul a pony , and [you]57-paul can ride in [the Row]3355-the row . [You]57-paul shall have a much better time of it than [I]60-dick ever had , as long as [you]57-paul let [me]60-dick go on [my]60-dick own way . "[60-dick] But these dazzling bribes had no influence upon [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul ; nothing short of complete restitution would ever satisfy [him]57-paul , and [he]57-paul was too proud and too angry at [his]57-paul crushing defeat to even pretend to be in the least pacified . " [I]57-paul do n't want [your]57-paul pony , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said bitterly ; " [I]57-paul might as well have a white elephant , and [I]57-paul do n't suppose [I]57-paul should enjoy [myself]57-paul much more at [a public school]2363-a public school than [I]57-paul do [here]2411-here . Let 's have no humbug , [sir]2329-sir . [You]2329-sir 're up and [I]57-paul 'm down — there 's no more to be said — [I]57-paul shall tell [the Doctor]248-the doctor nothing , but [I]57-paul warn [you]2329-sir , if ever the time comes — — "[57-paul] " Oh , of course , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , feeling tolerably secure , now [he]60-dick had disposed of the main difficulty . " If [you]2329-sir can turn [me]57-paul out , [I]57-paul suppose [you]2329-sir will — that 's only fair . [I]57-paul shall take care not to give [you]2329-sir the chance . "[57-paul] " [I]60-dick say , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , " [you]57-paul are [a fellow]2500-a fellow ; [you]57-paul must have been going it . How did [you]57-paul get rid of it all in a week ? "[60-dick] " It went , as far as [I]57-paul can understand , "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , " in rabbits and mice . [Some boys]3361-some boys claimed it as money [they]3361-some boys paid [you]57-paul to get [them]3361-some boys , [I]57-paul believe . "[57-paul] " All [your]57-paul own fault , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , " [you]57-paul would have [them]3361-some boys drowned . But [you]57-paul 'd better have some tin to get along with . How much do [you]57-paul want ? Will half - a - crown do ? "[60-dick] " Half - a - crown is not much , [Dick]60-dick , "[242-his father] said [[his]60-dick father]242-his father , almost humbly . " It's — ahem — a handsome allowance for [a young fellow like [you]57-paul]2338-a young fellow like you , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , rather unkindly ; " but [I]60-dick have n't any half - crowns left .
