" [You]57-paul do n't happen to know , [Richard]87-mr. bultitude , [[my]60-dick boy]2376-my boy , if [[your]57-paul father]2566-your father has had any business troubles lately — anything to disturb [him]2566-your father ? "[60-dick] And [Mr. Bultitude]87-mr. bultitude 's feelings prevented [him]60-dick from making any intelligible reply . [Paul]57-paul never quite knew how the remainder of that day passed at [Crichton House]4-crichton house . [He]57-paul was ordered to join [a class which was more or less engaged with some kind of work]1724-a class which was more or less engaged with some kind of work : [he]57-paul had a hazy idea that it was Latin , though it may have been Greek ; but [he]57-paul was spared the necessity of taking any active part in the proceedings , as [Mr. Blinkhorn]108-mr. blinkhorn was not disposed to be too exacting with [a boy who in one short morning had endured a sentence of expulsion , a lecture , the immediate prospect of a flogging , and a paternal visit]1725-a boy who in one short morning had endured a sentence of expulsion , a lecture , the immediate prospect of a flogging , and a paternal visit , and , as before , mercifully left [him]57-paul alone . [[His]57-paul classmates]1726-his classmates , however , did not show the same chivalrous delicacy ; and [Paul]57-paul had to suffer many unmannerly jests and gibes at [his]57-paul expense , frequent and anxious inquiries as to the exact nature of [his]57-paul treatment in [the dining - room]275-the dining - room , with sundry highly imaginative versions of the same , while there was much candid and unbiassed comment on the appearance and conduct of [himself]57-paul and [[his]57-paul son]225-his son . But [he]57-paul bore it unprotesting — or , rather , [he]57-paul scarcely noticed it ; for all [his]57-paul thoughts were now entirely taken up by one important subject — the time and manner of [his]57-paul escape . Thanks to [Dick]60-dick 's thoughtless liberality , [he]57-paul had now ample funds to carry [him]57-paul safely [home]296-home . It was hardly likely that any more unexpected claims could be brought against [him]57-paul now , particularly as [he]57-paul had no intention of publishing [his]57-paul return to solvency . [He]57-paul might reasonably consider [himself]57-paul in a position to make [his]57-paul escape at the very first favourable opportunity . When would that opportunity present itself ? It must come soon . [He]57-paul could not wait long for it . Any hour might yet see [him]57-paul pounced upon and flogged heartily for some utterly unknown and unsuspected transgression ; or the golden key which would unlock [his]57-paul prison bars might be lost in some unlucky moment ; for [his]57-paul long series of reverses had made [him]57-paul loth to trust to [Fortune]173-fortune , even when [she]1730-she seemed to look smilingly once more upon [him]57-paul . [Fortune]173-fortune 's countenance is apt to be so alarmingly mobile with [some unfortunates]1731-some unfortunates . But in spite of the new facilities given [him]57-paul for escape , and [his]57-paul strong motives for taking advantage of [them]1732-them , [he]57-paul soon found to [his]57-paul utter dismay that [he]57-paul shrank from committing [himself]57-paul to so daring and dangerous a course , just as much as when [he]57-paul had tried to make [a confidant of [the Doctor]248-the doctor]1733-a confidant of the doctor . For , after all , could [he]57-paul be sure of [himself]57-paul ? Would [his]57-paul ill - luck suffer [him]57-paul to seize the one propitious moment , or would that fatal self - distrust and doubt that had paralysed [him]57-paul for the past week seize [him]57-paul again just at the crisis ? Suppose [he]57-paul did venture to take the first irrevocable step , could [he]57-paul rely on [himself]57-paul to go through the rest of [his]57-paul hazardous enterprise ? Was [he]57-paul cool and wary enough ? [He]57-paul dared not expect an uninterrupted run . Had [he]57-paul ruses and expedients at command on any sudden check ? If [he]57-paul could not answer all these doubts favourably , was it not sheer madness to take to flight at all ? [He]57-paul felt a dismal conviction that [his]57-paul success would have to depend , not on [his]57-paul own cunning , but on the forbearance or blindness of [others]2595-others . The slightest contretemps must infallibly upset [him]57-paul altogether . The fact was , [he]57-paul had all [his]57-paul life been engaged in the less eventful and contentious branches of commerce . [His]57-paul will had seldom had to come in contact with [others]2595-others , and when it did so , [he]57-paul had found means , being of a prudent and cautious temperament , of avoiding disagreeable personal consequences by timely compromises or judicious employment of [delegates]1737-delegates . [He]57-paul had generally found [[his]57-paul fellow - men]1738-his fellow - men ready to meet [him]57-paul reasonably as [an equal]538-an equal or [a superior]1740-a superior . But now [he]57-paul must be prepared to see in [everyone]680-everyone [he]57-paul met [a possible enemy , who would hand [him]57-paul over to [the tyrant]1272-the tyrant on the faintest suspicion]1742-a possible enemy , who would hand him over to the tyrant on the faintest suspicion . [They]1738-his fellow - men were [spies]1744-spies to be baffled or disarmed , [pursuers]1745-pursuers to be eluded . The smallest slip in [his]57-paul account of [himself]57-paul would be enough to undo [him]57-paul . No wonder that , as [he]57-paul thought over all this , [his]57-paul heart quailed within [him]57-paul . [They]1738-his fellow - men say — [the paradox - mongers]1746-the paradox - mongers say — that it requires a far higher degree of moral courage for [a soldier in action]1747-a soldier in action to leave the ranks under fire and seek a less distinguished position towards the rear , than would carry [him]1747-a soldier in action on with [the rest to charge a battery]1748-the rest to charge a battery . This may be true , though it might not prove a very valuable defence at a court - martial ; but , at all events , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul found , when it came to the point , that it was almost impossible for [him]57-paul to screw up [his]57-paul courage to run away . It is not a pleasant state , this indecision whether to stay passively and risk the worst or avoid it by flight , and the worst of it is that , whatever course is eventually forced upon [us]1749-us , it finds [us]1749-us equally unprepared , and more liable from such indecision to bungle miserably in the sequel . [Paul]57-paul might never have gained heart to venture , but for an unpleasant incident that took place during dinner and a discovery [he]57-paul made after it . [They]1738-his fellow - men happened to have a particularly unpopular pudding that day ; a pallid preparation of suet , with an infrequent currant or two embalmed in it , and [Paul]57-paul was staring at [his]57-paul portion of this delicacy disconsolately enough , wondering how [he]57-paul should contrive to consume and , worse still , digest it , when [his]57-paul attention was caught by [Jolland]78-jolland , who sat directly opposite [him]57-paul . [That young gentleman , who evidently shared the general prejudice against the currant pudding]1750-that young gentleman , who evidently shared the general prejudice against the currant pudding , was inviting [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's attention to a little contrivance of [his]1750-that young gentleman , who evidently shared the general prejudice against the currant pudding own for getting rid of it , which consisted in delicately shovelling the greater part of what was on [his]1750-that young gentleman , who evidently shared the general prejudice against the currant pudding plate into a large envelope held below the table to receive it . This struck [Paul]57-paul as a heaven - sent method of avoiding the difficulty , and [he]57-paul had just got the envelope which had held [Barbara]153-barbara 's letter out of [his]57-paul pocket , intending to follow [Jolland]78-jolland 's example , when [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's voice made [him]57-paul start guiltily and replace the envelope in [his]57-paul pocket . " [Jolland]78-jolland , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , " what have [you]78-jolland got there ? "[248-the doctor] " An envelope , [sir]2329-sir , "[78-jolland] explained [Jolland]78-jolland , who had now got the remains of [his]78-jolland pudding safely bestowed . " What is in that envelope ? "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , who happened to have been watching [him]78-jolland . " In the envelope , [sir]2329-sir ? Pudding , [sir]2329-sir , "[78-jolland] said [Jolland]78-jolland , as if it were the most natural thing in [the world]2377-the world to send bulky portions of pudding by post . " And why did [you]78-jolland place pudding in the envelope ? "[248-the doctor] inquired [the Doctor]248-the doctor in [his]248-the doctor deepest tone . [Jolland]78-jolland felt a difficulty in explaining that [he]78-jolland had done so because [he]78-jolland wished to avoid eating it , and with a view to interring it later on in the playground : [he]78-jolland preferred silence . " Shall [I]248-the doctor tell [you]78-jolland why [you]78-jolland did it , [sir]2329-sir ? "[248-the doctor] thundered [the Doctor]248-the doctor . " [You]78-jolland did it , because [you]78-jolland were scheming to obtain a second portion — because [you]78-jolland did not feel [yourself]78-jolland able to eat both portions at [your]78-jolland leisure here , and thought to put by a part to devour in secret at a future time . It 's a most painful exhibition of pure piggishness . There shall be no pocketing at this table , [sir]2329-sir . [You]78-jolland will eat that pudding under [my]248-the doctor eye at once , and [you]78-jolland will stay in and write out French verbs for two days . That will put an end to any more gorging in [the garden]3417-the garden for a time , at least . "[248-the doctor] [Jolland]78-jolland seemed stupefied , though relieved , by the unexpected construction put upon [his]78-jolland conduct , as [he]78-jolland gulped down the intercepted fragments of pudding , while [the rest]694-the rest diligently cleared [their]694-the rest plates with as much show of appreciation as [they]694-the rest could muster . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul shuddered at this one more narrow escape . If [he]57-paul had been detected — as [he]57-paul must have been in another instant — in smuggling pudding in an envelope [he]57-paul might have incautiously betrayed [his]57-paul real motives , and then , as [the Doctor]248-the doctor was morbidly sensitive concerning all complaints of the fare [he]248-the doctor provided , [he]248-the doctor would have got into worse trouble than [the unfortunate Jolland]78-jolland , to say nothing of the humiliation of being detected in such an act . It was a solemn warning to [him]78-jolland of the dangers [he]78-jolland was exposed to hourly , while [he]78-jolland lingered within those walls ; but [his]78-jolland position was still more strongly brought home to [him]78-jolland by the terrible discovery [he]78-jolland made shortly afterwards . [He]78-jolland was alone in [the schoolroom]2641-the schoolroom , for [the others]627-the others had all gone down into [the playground]648-the playground , except [Jolland]78-jolland , who was confined in [one of [the class - rooms below]1763-the class - rooms below]1762-one of the class - rooms below , when the thought came over [him]78-jolland to test the truth of [Dick]60-dick 's hint about a name cut on [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's writing - table . [He]78-jolland stole up to it guiltily , and , lifting the slanting desk which stood there , examined the surface below . [Dick]60-dick had been perfectly correct . There it was , glaringly fresh and distinct , not large but very deeply cut and fearfully legible . " [R. Bultitude]174-r. bultitude . "[60-dick] It might have been done that day . [Dick]60-dick had probably performed it out of bravado , or under the impression that [he]60-dick was not going to return after the holidays . [Paul]57-paul dropped the desk over the fatal letters with a shudder . The slightest accidental shifting of it must disclose them — nothing but a miracle could have kept them concealed so long . When they did come to light , [he]57-paul knew from what [he]57-paul had seen of [the Doctor]248-the doctor , that the act would be considered as an outrage of the blackest and most desperate kind . [He]57-paul would most unquestionably get a flogging for it ! [He]57-paul fetched a large pewter ink - pot , and tried nervously to blacken the letters with the tip of a quill , to make them , if possible , rather less obtrusive than they were . All in vain ; they only stood out with more startling vividness when picked out in black upon the brown - stained deal . [He]57-paul felt very like [a conscience - stricken murderer trying to hide a corpse that would n't be buried]1766-a conscience - stricken murderer trying to hide a corpse that would n't be buried . [He]57-paul gave it up at last , having only made a terrible mess with the ink . That settled it . [He]57-paul must fly . The flogging must be avoided at all hazards . If an opportunity delayed its coming , why , [he]57-paul must do without the opportunity — [he]57-paul must make one . For good or ill , [his]57-paul mind was made up now for immediate flight . All that afternoon , while [he]57-paul sat trying to keep [his]57-paul mind upon long sums in Bills of Parcels , which disgusted [him]57-paul as [a business man]1479-a business man , by the glaring improbability of [their]1768-their details , [his]57-paul eye wandered furtively down the long tables to where [the Doctor]248-the doctor sat at the head of [the class]938-the class . Every chance movement of [the principal]807-the principal 's elbow filled [him]57-paul with a sickening dread . A hundred times did those rudely carved letters seem about to start forth and denounce [him]57-paul . It was a disquieting afternoon for [Paul]57-paul . But the time dragged wearily on , and still the desk loyally kept its secret . The dusk drew on and the gas - burners were lit . [The younger boys]1111-the younger boys came up from [the lower class - room]1773-the lower class - room and were sent out to play ; [the Doctor]248-the doctor shortly afterwards dismissed [[his]248-the doctor own class]1775-his own class to follow [them]1111-the younger boys , and [Paul]57-paul and [[his]57-paul companions]2323-his companions had [the room]213-the room to [themselves]1778-themselves . [He]57-paul sat there on the rough form with [his]57-paul slate before [him]57-paul , hearing half - unconsciously the shouts , laughter , and ring of feet coming up from the darkness outside , and the faint notes of a piano , which filtered through the double doors from [one of [the rooms]300-the rooms]1779-one of the rooms , where [a boy]233-a boy was practising [Haydn]175-haydn 's " Surprise , "[175-haydn] from [Hamilton]176-hamilton 's exercise book , a surprise which [he]57-paul rendered as a mildly interjectional form of astonishment . All the time [Paul]57-paul was racked with an intense burning desire to get up and run for it then , before it became too late ; but cold fits of doubt and fear preserved [him]57-paul from such lunacy — [he]57-paul would wait , [his]57-paul chance might come before long . [His]57-paul patience was rewarded ; [the Doctor]248-the doctor came in , looking at [his]248-the doctor watch , and said , " [I]248-the doctor think [these boys]3010-these boys have had enough of it , [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler , eh ? [You]57-paul can send [them]3010-these boys out now till tea - time . "[248-the doctor] [Mr. Tinkler]109-mr. tinkler , who had been entangling [himself]109-mr. tinkler frightfully in intricate calculations upon the blackboard , without making a single convert , was only too glad to take advantage of the suggestion , and [Paul]57-paul followed [the rest]694-the rest into [the playground]648-the playground with a sense of relief . The usual " chevy "[248-the doctor] was going on there , with more spirit than usual , perhaps , because the darkness allowed of practical jokes and surprises , and offered great facilities for paying off old grudges with secrecy and despatch , and as [the Doctor]248-the doctor had come to the door of [the greenhouse]1786-the greenhouse , and was looking on , [the players]1197-the players exerted [themselves]1197-the players still more , till the " prison "[248-the doctor] to which [most of one side had been consigned by being run down and touched by [[their]1197-the players fleeter enemies]1789-their fleeter enemies]1788-most of one side had been consigned by being run down and touched by their fleeter enemies was filled with a long line of [captives holding hands and calling out to be released]1790-captives holding hands and calling out to be released . [Paul]57-paul , who had run out vaguely from [[his]57-paul base]1791-his base , was promptly pursued and made prisoner by an unnecessarily vigorous thump in the back , after which [he]57-paul took [his]57-paul place at the bottom of the line of [imprisoned ones]1792-imprisoned ones . But [the enemy]949-the enemy 's spirit began to slacken ; one after another of [the players still left to the opposite side]1794-the players still left to the opposite side succeeded in outrunning pursuit and touching [the foremost prisoner]1795-the foremost prisoner for the time being , so as to set [him]57-paul free by the rules of the game . [The Doctor]248-the doctor went in again , and [the enemy]949-the enemy relapsed as usual into total indifference , so that [Paul]57-paul , without exactly knowing how , soon found [himself]57-paul [the only one left in [gaol]1799-gaol]1798-the only one left in gaol , unnoticed and apparently forgotten . [He]57-paul could not see anything through the darkness , but [he]57-paul heard the voices of [the boys]570-the boys disputing at the other side of [the playground]648-the playground ; [he]57-paul looked round ; at [his]57-paul right was the indistinct form of a large laurel bush , behind that [he]57-paul knew was [the playground]648-the playground gate . Could it be that [his]57-paul chance had come at last ? [He]57-paul slipped behind the laurel and waited , holding [his]57-paul breath ; the dispute still went on ; [no one]2331-no one seemed to have noticed [him]57-paul , probably the darkness prevented all chance of that ; [he]57-paul went on tip - toe to the gate — it was not locked . [He]57-paul opened [it]1804-it very carefully a little way ; it was forbearing enough not to creak , and the next moment [he]57-paul was outside , free to go where [he]57-paul would ! Escape , after all , was simple enough when [he]57-paul came to try it ; [he]57-paul could hardly believe at first that [he]57-paul really was free at last ; free with money enough in [his]57-paul pocket to take [him]57-paul [home]296-home , with the friendly darkness to cover [his]57-paul retreat ; free to go back and confront [Dick]60-dick on [his]57-paul own ground , and , by force , or fraud , get the Garudâ Stone into [his]57-paul own hands once more . As yet [he]57-paul never doubted that it would be easy enough to convince [[his]57-paul household]1806-his household , if necessary , of the truth of [his]57-paul story , and enlist [them]1806-his household one and all on [his]57-paul side ; all that [he]57-paul required , [he]57-paul thought , was caution ; [he]57-paul must reach [the house]234-the house unobserved , and wait and watch , and the deuce would be in [it]234-the house if the stone were not safe in [his]57-paul pocket again before twelve hours had gone by . All this time [he]57-paul was still within a hundred yards or so of the playground wall ; [he]57-paul must decide upon some particular route , some definite method of ordering [his]57-paul flight ; to stay where [he]57-paul was any longer would clearly be unwise , yet , where should [he]57-paul go first ? If [he]57-paul went to [the station]280-the station at once , how could [he]57-paul tell that [he]57-paul should be lucky enough to catch [a train]505-a train without having to wait long for it , and unless [he]57-paul did that , [he]57-paul would almost certainly be sought for first on [the station platform]1810-the station platform , and might be caught before [a train]505-a train was due ? At last , with an astuteness [he]57-paul had not suspected [himself]57-paul of possessing , which was probably the result of the harrowing experiences [he]57-paul had lately undergone , [he]57-paul hit upon a plan of action . " [I]57-paul 'll go to [a shop]3419-a shop , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul thought , " and change this sovereign , and ask to look at a timetable — then , if [I]57-paul find [I]57-paul can catch [a train]505-a train at once , [I]57-paul 'll run for it ; if one is not due for some time , [I]57-paul can hang about near [the station]280-the station till it comes in . "[57-paul] With this intention [he]57-paul walked on towards [the town]1812-the town till [he]57-paul came to [a small terrace of shops]1813-a small terrace of shops , when [he]57-paul went into the first , which was [[a stationer]1814-a stationer 's and [toy - dealer]1816-toy - dealer 's]1815-a stationer 's and toy - dealer 's , with a stock in trade of cheap wooden toys and incomprehensible games , drawing slates , penny packets of stationery and cards of pen and pencil - holders , and a particularly stuffy atmosphere ; [the proprietor]1817-the proprietor , [a short man with a fat white face with a rich glaze all over it and a fringe of ragged brown whisker]1818-a short man with a fat white face with a rich glaze all over it and a fringe of ragged brown whisker meeting under [his]1817-the proprietor chin , was sitting behind the counter posting up [his]1817-the proprietor ledger . [Paul]57-paul looked round [the shop]1819-the shop in search of something to purchase , and at last said , more nervously than [he]57-paul expected to do , " [I]57-paul want a pencil - case , one which screws up and down . "[57-paul] [He]57-paul thought a pencil - case would be an innocent , unsuspicious thing to ask for . [The man]2317-the man set rows of cards containing pencil - cases of every imaginable shape on the counter before [him]2317-the man , and when [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul had chosen and paid for one , [the stationer]1821-the stationer asked if there would be anything else , and if [he]2317-the man might send it for [him]2317-the man . " [You]57-paul 're [one of [[Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone 's young gentlemen]3423-dr. grimstone 's young gentlemen up at [Crichton House]4-crichton house]3422-one of dr. grimstone 's young gentlemen up at crichton house , are n't [you]57-paul , [sir]2329-sir ? "[2317-the man] [he]2317-the man added .

A guilty dread of discovery made [Paul]57-paul anxious to deny this at once . " No , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said ; " oh no ; no connection with [the place]2442-the place . Ah , could [you]2317-the man allow [me]57-paul to look at a time - table ? "[57-paul] " Certainly , [sir]2329-sir ; expectin ' some one to - night or to - morrow p'raps . "[57-paul] " Ah , "[2317-the man] said [the man]2317-the man , with a rather peculiar intonation , " [I]2317-the man thought maybe [your]57-paul par or mar was comin ' down . "[57-paul] " Did [he]62-dr. grimstone though ? "[1821-the stationer] said [the stationer]1821-the stationer . "[1821-the stationer] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul saw what a fearful trap [he]57-paul had fallen into and stood speechless . " Go along with [you]57-paul ! "[1824-the little stationer] said [the little stationer]1824-the little stationer at last , with a not unkindly grin . " Lor bless [you]57-paul , [I]1824-the little stationer knew [your]57-paul face the minnit [you]57-paul come in . To go and tell [me]1824-the little stationer a brazen story like that ! [You]57-paul 're [a young pickle]3432-a young pickle , [you]57-paul are ! "[1824-the little stationer] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul began to shuffle feebly towards the door . " [Pickle]177-pickle , eh ? "[57-paul] [he]57-paul protested in great discomposure . " No , no . [Heaven]70-heaven knows [I]57-paul 'm [no pickle]3433-no pickle . It 's of no consequence about [those trains]3434-those trains . Do n't trouble . Good evening to [you]57-paul . "[57-paul] " Stop , "[2317-the man] said [the man]2317-the man , " do n't be in such a nurry now . Do n't be afraid of [my]2317-the man telling no tales . [I]2317-the man 've bin [a schoolboy]3435-a schoolboy [myself]2317-the man in [my]2317-the man time , bless [your]57-paul ' art . "[2317-the man] " No , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul ; for something in [the man]2317-the man 's manner inspired confidence . " [I]2317-the man do want to make a bolt of it . [I]2317-the man 've been most abominably treated . "[2317-the man] " Well , look here , [I]2317-the man ai n't got no right to interfere ; and if [you]57-paul 're caught , [I]2317-the man look to [you]57-paul not to bring [my]2317-the man name in . [I]2317-the man do n't want to get into trouble up at [Crichton House]4-crichton house and lose [good customers]3436-good customers , [you]57-paul see . But [I]2317-the man like the looks of [you]57-paul , and [you]57-paul 've always dealt ' ere pretty regular . [I]2317-the man do n't mind if [I]2317-the man give [you]57-paul a lift . Just see here . [You]57-paul want to get off to [London]36-london , do n't [you]57-paul ? What for is [your]57-paul business , not [mine]2317-the man . Well , there 's [a train]505-a train , express , stops at only [one station on the way]3438-one station on the way , in at 5.50 . It 's twenty minnits to six now . If [you]57-paul take [that road]3439-that road just [oppersite]3440-oppersite , it 'll bring [you]57-paul out at the end of [the Station Road]3441-the station road ; [you]57-paul can do it easy in ten minnits and have time to spare . So cut away , and good luck to [you]57-paul ? "[2317-the man] " [I]57-paul 'm vastly obliged to [you]57-paul , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , and [he]57-paul meant it . It was a new experience to find anyone offering [him]57-paul assistance . [He]57-paul left [the close little shop]1827-the close little shop , crossed [the road]1174-the road , and started off in the direction indicated to [him]57-paul at a brisk trot . [His]57-paul steps rang out cheerfully on [the path]1829-the path ironbound with frost . [He]57-paul was almost happy again under the exhilarating glow of unusual exercise and the excitement of escape and regained freedom . [He]57-paul ran on , past [a series of villa residences enclosed in varnished palings and adorned with that mediæval abundance of turrets , balconies , and cheap stained - glass , which is accepted nowadays as a guarantee of [the tenant]1831-the tenant 's culture]1830-a series of villa residences enclosed in varnished palings and adorned with that mediæval abundance of turrets , balconies , and cheap stained - glass , which is accepted nowadays as a guarantee of the tenant 's culture , and a satisfactory substitute for effective drainage . After [the villas]1832-the villas came [a church]3305-a church , and a few yards farther on [the road]1174-the road turned with a sharp curve into [the main thoroughfare leading to [the station]280-the station]1835-the main thoroughfare leading to the station . [He]57-paul was so near [it]280-the station that [he]57-paul could hear the shrill engine whistles , and the banging of [trucks]469-trucks on [the railway sidings]1838-the railway sidings echoed sharply from [the neighbouring houses]1839-the neighbouring houses . [He]57-paul was saved , in sight of [haven]1840-haven at last ! Full of delight at the thought , [he]57-paul put on a still greater pace , and turning the corner without looking , ran into [a little party of three]1841-a little party of three , which was coming in the opposite direction . [Fate]178-fate 's vein of irony was by no means worked out yet . As [he]57-paul was recovering from the collision , and preparing to offer or accept an apology , as the case might be , [he]57-paul discovered to [his]57-paul horror that [he]57-paul had fallen amongst [no strangers]1842-no strangers . [The three]652-the three were [[his]57-paul old acquaintances]1844-his old acquaintances , [Coker]88-coker , [Coggs]89-coggs , and [the virtuous Chawner]1845-the virtuous chawner — of whom [he]57-paul had fondly hoped to have seen the last for ever ! The moral and physical shock of such an encounter took all [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's remaining breath away . [He]57-paul stood panting under the sickly rays of a street - lamp , the very incarnation of helpless , hopeless dismay . " [Hallo]114-hallo ! "[88-coker] said [Coker]88-coker , " it 's [young Bultitude]57-paul ! "[88-coker] " What do [you]88-coker mean by cannoning into [a fellow like this]3442-a fellow like this ? "[89-coggs] said [Coggs]89-coggs . " What are [you]88-coker up to out here , eh ? "[89-coggs] " If it comes to that , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , casting about for some explanation of [his]57-paul appearance , " what are [you]88-coker up to here ? "[57-paul] " Why , "[101-chawner] said [Chawner]101-chawner , " if [you]88-coker want to know , [Dick]60-dick , [we]3443-we 've been to fetch [the St. James ' Gazette]3444-the st. james ' gazette for [the Doctor]248-the doctor . [He]248-the doctor said [I]89-coggs might go if [I]89-coggs liked , and [I]89-coggs asked for [Coker]88-coker and [Coggs]89-coggs to come too ; because there was something [I]89-coggs wanted to tell [them]3446-them , very important , and [I]89-coggs have told [them]3446-them , have n't [I]89-coggs , [Corny]89-coggs ? "[89-coggs] [Coggs]89-coggs growled sulkily ; [Coker]88-coker gave a tragic groan , and said : " [I]88-coker do n't care when [you]57-paul tell , [Chawner]101-chawner . Do it to - night if [you]57-paul like . Let 's talk about something else . [Bultitude]60-dick has n't told [us]3447-we yet how [he]60-dick came out here after [us]3447-we . "[88-coker] [His]88-coker last words suggested a pretext to [Paul]57-paul , of which [he]57-paul hastened to make use . " Oh , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , " [I]57-paul ? [I]57-paul came out here , after [you]57-paul , to say that [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone will not require [the St. James ' Gazette]3444-the st. james ' gazette . [He]60-dick wants the Globe and , ah , the Star instead . "[57-paul] It did not sound a very probable combination ; but [Paul]57-paul used the first names that occurred to [him]57-paul , and , as it happened , aroused no suspicions , for [the boys]570-the boys read no newspapers . " Well , [we]3447-we 've got the other now , "[88-coker] said [Coker]88-coker . " [We]3447-we shall have to go back and get [the fellow at the bookstall]3449-the fellow at the bookstall to change it , [I]88-coker suppose . Come on , [[you]652-the three fellows]2659-you fellows ! "[88-coker] This was at least a move in the right direction ; for [the three]652-the three began at once to retrace [their]652-the three steps . But , unfortunately , all these explanations had taken time , and before [they]652-the three had gone many yards , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was horrified to hear the station - bell ring loudly , and immediately after a cloud of white steam rose above [the station]280-the station roof as [the London train]1849-the london train clanked cumbrously in , and was brought to with a prolonged screeching of brakes . [The others]627-the others were walking very slowly . At the present pace it would be almost impossible to reach [the train]2319-the train in time . [He]57-paul looked round at [them]627-the others anxiously . " H - hadn't [we]3447-we better run , do n't [you]88-coker think ? "[57-paul] [he]57-paul asked . " Run ! "[88-coker] said [Coker]88-coker scornfully . " What for ? [I]88-coker 'm not going to run . [You]88-coker can , if [you]88-coker like . "[88-coker] " Why , ah , really , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul briskly , very grateful for the permission ; " do [you]88-coker know , [I]57-paul think [I]57-paul will ! "[57-paul] And run [he]57-paul did , with all [his]57-paul might , rushing headlong through the gates , threading [his]57-paul way between the omnibuses and under the Roman noses of the mild fly - horses in [the enclosure]1067-the enclosure , until at length [he]57-paul found [himself]57-paul inside [the little booking - office]1853-the little booking - office . [He]57-paul was not too late ; [the train]2319-the train was still at [the platform]504-the platform , the engine getting up steam with a dull roar . But [he]57-paul dared not risk detection by travelling without a ticket . There was time for that , too . [No one]2331-no one was at the pigeon - hole but [one old lady]1857-one old lady . But , unhappily , [the old lady]1858-the old lady considered taking a ticket as a solemn rite to be performed with all due caution and deliberation . [She]1857-one old lady had already catechised [the clerk]1859-the clerk upon the number of stoppages during [her]1857-one old lady proposed journey , and exacted earnest assurances from [him]1859-the clerk that [she]1857-one old lady would not be called upon to change anywhere in the course of it ; and as [Paul]57-paul came up [she]1857-one old lady was laying out the purchase - money for [her]1857-one old lady ticket upon the ledge and counting it , which , the fare being high and the coins mostly halfpence , seemed likely to take some time . " One moment , [ma'am]3451-ma'am , if [you]3451-ma'am please , "[57-paul] cried [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , panting and desperate . " [I]57-paul 'm pressed for time . "[57-paul] " Now [you]57-paul 've gone and put [me]1858-the old lady out , [little boy]3452-little boy , "[1858-the old lady] said [the old lady]1858-the old lady fussily . " [I]1858-the old lady shall have to begin all over again . [Young man]3453-young man , will [you]57-paul take and count the other end and see if it adds up right ? There 's a halfpenny wrong somewhere ; [I]1858-the old lady know there is . "[1858-the old lady] " Now then , "[1861-the guard from the platform] shouted [the guard from the platform]1861-the guard from the platform . " Any more going on ? "[1861-the guard from the platform] " [I]57-paul 'm going on ! "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul . " Wait for [me]57-paul . First single to [St. Pancras]25-st. pancras , quick ! "[57-paul] " [Drat]179-drat [the boy]246-the boy ! "[1858-the old lady] said [the old lady]1858-the old lady angrily . " Do [you]57-paul think [the world]2377-the world 's to give way for [you]57-paul ? Such impidence ! Mind [your]57-paul manners , [little boy]3452-little boy , ca n't [you]57-paul ? [You]57-paul 've made [me]1858-the old lady drop a threepenny bit with [your]57-paul scrouging ! "[1858-the old lady] " First single , five shillings , "[1859-the clerk] said [the clerk]1859-the clerk , jerking out the precious ticket . " Right ! "[552-the guard] cried [the guard]552-the guard at the same instant . " Stand back there , will [you]57-paul ! "[552-the guard] [Paul]57-paul dashed towards the door of [the booking - office]1865-the booking - office which led to [the platform]504-the platform ; but just as [he]57-paul reached [it]1867-it a gate slammed in [his]57-paul face with a sharp click , through the bars of [it]1867-it [he]57-paul saw , with hot eyes , the tall , heavy carriages which had shelter and safety in [them]1868-them jolt heavily past , till even the red lamp on [the last van]1869-the last van was quenched in the darkness . [That miserable old woman]1870-that miserable old woman had shattered [his]57-paul hopes at the very moment of [their]1871-they fulfilment . It was fate again !

As [he]57-paul stood , fiercely gripping the bars of the gate , [he]57-paul heard [Coggs]89-coggs ' hateful voice again . " [Hallo]114-hallo ! so [you]57-paul have n't got the Globe and the other thing after all , then ; [they]1871-they 've shut [you]57-paul out ? "[89-coggs] " Yes , "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul in a hollow voice ; " [they]1871-they 've shut [me]57-paul out ! "[57-paul] As soon as the gate was opened , [Paul]57-paul went through mechanically with [the others]627-the others on to [the platform]504-the platform , and waited at the bookstall while [they]1871-they changed the paper . [He]57-paul knew well enough that what had seemed at the time a stroke of supreme cunning would now only land [him]57-paul in fresh difficulties , if indeed it did not lead to the detection of [his]57-paul scheme . But [he]57-paul dared not interfere and prevent [them]1871-they from making the unlucky exchange . Something seemed to tie [his]57-paul tongue , and in sullen leaden apathy [he]57-paul resigned [himself]57-paul to whatever might be in store for [him]57-paul . [They]1871-they passed out again by [the booking - office]1865-the booking - office . There was [the old lady]1858-the old lady still at the pigeon - hole , trying to persuade [the much - enduring clerk]1876-the much - enduring clerk to restore a lucky sixpence [she]1858-the old lady had given [him]57-paul by mistake , and was quite unable to describe . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul would have given much just then to go up and shake [her]1858-the old lady into hysterics , or curse [her]1858-the old lady bitterly for the mischief [she]1858-the old lady had done ; but [he]57-paul refrained , either from an innate chivalry , or from a feeling that such an outburst would be ill - judged . So , silent and miserable , with slow step and hanging head , [he]57-paul set out with [[his]57-paul gaolers]1877-his gaolers to render [himself]57-paul up once more at [[his]57-paul house of bondage]243-his house of bondage — a sort of involuntary Regulus , without the oath .

" [Dickie]164-dickie , [you]164-dickie were very anxious to run just now , "[101-chawner] observed [Chawner]101-chawner , after [they]1871-they had gone some distance on [their]1871-they homeward way . " [We]1871-they were late for tea — late for tea , "[57-paul] explained [Paul]57-paul hastily . " If [you]164-dickie think the tea worth racing like that for , [I]89-coggs do n't , "[89-coggs] said [Coggs]89-coggs viciously ; " it 's muck . "[89-coggs] " [You]164-dickie do n't catch [me]88-coker racing , except for something worth having , "[88-coker] said [Coker]88-coker . One more flash of distinct inspiration came to [Paul]57-paul 's aid in the very depths of [his]57-paul gloom . It was , in fact , a hazy recollection from English history of the ruse by which [Edward I.]180-edward i. , when [a prince]1879-a prince , contrived to escape from [[his]180-edward i. captors]1880-his captors at [Hereford Castle]46-hereford castle . " Why — why , "[88-coker] [he]88-coker said excitedly , " would [you]164-dickie race if [you]164-dickie had something worth racing for , hey ? would [you]164-dickie now ? "[88-coker] " Try [us]3457-us ! "[88-coker] said [Coker]88-coker emphatically . " What do [you]164-dickie call ' something ' ? "[101-chawner] inquired [Chawner]101-chawner suspiciously . " Well , "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul ; " what do [you]164-dickie say to a shilling ? "[57-paul] " [You]164-dickie have n't got a shilling , "[89-coggs] objected [Coggs]89-coggs . " Here 's a shilling , see , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , producing one . " Now then , [I]88-coker 'll give this to [any boy]3138-any boy [I]88-coker see get into tea first ! "[88-coker] " [Bultitude]57-paul thinks [he]3138-any boy can run , "[88-coker] said [Coker]88-coker , with an amiable unbelief in any disinterestedness . " [He]3138-any boy means to get in first and keep the shilling [himself]3138-any boy , [I]88-coker know . "[88-coker] " [I]89-coggs 'll back [myself]89-coggs to run [him]3138-any boy any day , "[89-coggs] put in [Coggs]89-coggs . " So will [I]101-chawner , "[101-chawner] added [Chawner]101-chawner . " Well , is it agreed ? "[57-paul] [Paul]57-paul asked anxiously . " Will [you]101-chawner try ? "[57-paul] " All right , "[101-chawner] said [Chawner]101-chawner . " [You]57-paul must give [us]1881-we a start to the next lamp - post , though . [You]57-paul stay [here]2411-here , and when [we]1881-we 're ready [we]1881-we 'll say ' off ' ! "[101-chawner] [They]1881-we drew a line on [the path]1829-the path with [their]1881-we feet to mark [Paul]57-paul 's starting point , and went on to the next lamp . After a moment or two of anxious waiting [he]57-paul heard [Coggs]89-coggs shout , all in one breath , " One - two - three - off ! "[89-coggs] and the sound of scampering feet followed immediately . It was a most exciting and hotly contested race . [Paul]57-paul saw [them]1881-we for one brief moment in the lamplight . [He]57-paul saw [Chawner]101-chawner scudding down [the path]1829-the path like some great camel , and [Coker]88-coker squaring [his]88-coker arms and working [them]1884-them as if they were wings . [Coggs]89-coggs seemed to be last . [He]57-paul ran a little way [himself]57-paul just to encourage [them]1881-we , but , as the sound of [their]1881-we feet grew fainter and fainter , [he]57-paul felt that [his]57-paul last desperate ruse had taken effect , and with a chuckle at [his]57-paul own cleverness , turned round and ran [his]57-paul fastest in the opposite direction . [He]57-paul felt little or no interest in the result of the race . Once more [he]57-paul entered [the booking - office]1865-the booking - office and , kneeling on a chair , consulted the time - board that hung on the wall over the sheaf of texts and the missionary box . [The next train]2577-the next train was not until 7.25 . A whole hour and twenty - five minutes to wait ! What was [he]57-paul to do ? Where was [he]57-paul to pass the weary time till then ? If [he]57-paul lingered on [the platform]504-the platform [he]57-paul would assuredly be recaptured . [His]57-paul absence could not remain long undiscovered and [the station]280-the station would be the first place [they]1881-we would search for [him]57-paul . And yet [he]57-paul dared not wander away from [the neighbourhood of [the station]280-the station]1889-the neighbourhood of the station . If [he]57-paul kept to [the shops]1891-the shops and [lighted thoroughfares]1892-lighted thoroughfares [he]57-paul might be recognised or traced . If , on the other hand , [he]57-paul went out farther into [the country]324-the country ( which was utterly unknown to [him]57-paul ) , [he]57-paul had no watch , and it would be only too easy to lose [his]57-paul way , or miscalculate time and distance in the darkness . To miss [the next train]2577-the next train would be absolutely fatal . [He]57-paul walked out upon [the platform]504-the platform , and on past [the refreshment and waiting rooms]1896-the refreshment and waiting rooms , past the weighing machine , [the stacked trucks]1897-the stacked trucks and the lamp - room , meeting and seen by [none]1521-none — even [the boy at [the bookstall]2518-the bookstall]1899-the boy at the bookstall was busy with bread and butter and a mug of tea in a dark corner , and never noticed [him]57-paul .

[He]57-paul went on to the end of [the platform]504-the platform where the planks sloped gently down to a wilderness of [sheds]1902-sheds , [coaling stages]1903-coaling stages and [sidings]1904-sidings ; [he]57-paul could just make out the bulky forms of [some tarpaulined cattle - vans]1905-some tarpaulined cattle - vans and open coal - trucks standing on the lines of metals which gleamed in the scanty gaslights . It struck [him]57-paul that one of [these vans]1906-these vans or trucks would serve [his]57-paul purpose admirably , if [he]57-paul could only get into [it]1907-it , and very cautiously [he]57-paul picked [his]57-paul way over the clogging ballast and rails , till [he]57-paul came to [a low narrow strip of platform between [two sidings]1909-two sidings]1908-a low narrow strip of platform between two sidings . [He]57-paul mounted it and went on till [he]57-paul came to the line of [trucks and vans drawn up alongside]1910-trucks and vans drawn up alongside ; [the vans]1911-the vans seemed all locked , but at the end [he]57-paul found an empty coal - waggon in which [he]57-paul thought [he]57-paul could manage to conceal [himself]57-paul and escape pursuit till [the longed - for 7.25 train]1912-the longed - for 7.25 train should arrive to relieve [him]57-paul . [He]57-paul stepped in and lay down in one corner of [it]1907-it , listening anxiously for any sound of search , but hearing nothing more than the dismal dirge of the telegraph wires overhead ; [he]57-paul soon grew cold and stiff , for [his]57-paul enforced attitude was far from comfortable , and there was more coal - dust in [his]57-paul chosen retreat than [he]57-paul could have wished . Still it was secluded enough ; it was not likely that it would occur to [anyone]2432-anyone to look for [him]57-paul [there]2356-there . Ten days ago [Mr. Paul Bultitude]57-paul would have found it hard to conceive [himself]57-paul lying down in [a hard and grimy coal - truck]1915-a hard and grimy coal - truck to escape [[his]57-paul son 's schoolmaster]494-his son 's schoolmaster , but since then [he]57-paul had gone through too much that was unprecedented and abnormal to see much incongruity in [his]57-paul situation — it was all too hideously real to be a nightmare . But even here [he]57-paul was not allowed to remain undisturbed ; after about half an hour , when [he]57-paul was beginning to feel almost secure , there came a sharp twanging of wires beneath , and two short strokes of a bell in the signal - box hard by . [He]57-paul heard some one from [the platform]504-the platform , probably [the station - master]630-the station - master , shout , " Look alive , there , Ing , [Pickstones]181-pickstones , some of [you]57-paul . There 's those three trucks on [the A siding to go to [Slopsbury]47-slopsbury by [the 6.30 luggage]3461-the 6.30 luggage]3460-the a siding to go to slopsbury by the 6.30 luggage — she'll be in in another five minutes . "[630-the station - master] There were steps as if [some persons]1919-some persons were coming out of [a cabin opposite]1920-a cabin opposite — [they]1919-some persons came nearer and nearer : " [These three]3462-these three , ai n't it , [Tommy]95-tommy ? "[1919-some persons] said a gruff voice , close to [Paul]57-paul 's ear . " That 's it , [mate]3463-mate , "[1919-some persons] said another , evidently Tommy's—"get 'em along up to the points there . Ca n't have the 6.30 standing about on this ' ere line all night , 'cos of the Limited . Now then , all together , shove ! [they]3462-these three 've got the old ' orse on at the other end . "[1919-some persons] And to [Paul]57-paul 's alarm [he]57-paul felt [the truck in which [he]57-paul was]1921-the truck in which he was begin to move ponderously on the greasy metals , and strike the next with its buffers with a jarring shock and a jangling of coupling chains . [He]57-paul could not stand this ; unless [he]57-paul revealed [himself]57-paul at once , or managed to get out of this delusive waggon , [the six - whatever - it - was train]1922-the six - whatever - it - was train would be up and carry [him]57-paul off to [Slopsbury]47-slopsbury , a hundred miles or so farther from [home]296-home ; [they]1919-some persons would have time to warn [Dick]60-dick — [he]57-paul would be expected — ambushes laid for [him]57-paul , and [his]57-paul one chance would be gone for ever ! There was a whistle far away on the down line , and that humming vibration which announces [an approaching train]1924-an approaching train : not a moment to lose — [he]57-paul was afraid to attempt a leap from the moving waggons , and resolved to risk all and show [himself]57-paul . With this intention [he]57-paul got upon [his]57-paul knees , and putting [his]57-paul head above the dirty bulwark , looked over and said softly , " [Tommy]95-tommy , [I]57-paul say , [Tommy]95-tommy ! "[57-paul] [A porter , who had been laboriously employed below]1925-a porter , who had been laboriously employed below , looked up with a white and scared face , and staggered back several feet ; [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul in a sudden panic ducked again . " [Bill]182-bill ! "[449-the porter] [Paul]57-paul heard [the porter]449-the porter say hoarsely , " [I]449-the porter 'll take [my]449-the porter Bible oath [I]449-the porter 've never touched a drop this week , not to speak of — but [I]449-the porter 've got 'em again , [Bill]182-bill , [I]449-the porter 've got 'em again ! "[449-the porter] " Got what agin ? "[182-bill] growled [Bill]182-bill . " What 's the matter now ? "[182-bill] " [It]3464-it 's the jumps , [Bill]182-bill , "[2428-the other] gasped [the other]2428-the other , " [the ' orrors]3465-the ' orrors — [they've]3465-the ' orrors got [me]2428-the other and no mistake . As [I]2428-the other 'm [a livin ' man]3466-a livin ' man , as [I]2428-the other was a shovin ' of [that there truck]3467-that there truck , [I]2428-the other saw a imp — a gashly imp , [Bill]182-bill , stick [its]3467-that there truck hugly ' ed over the side and say , ' [Tommy]95-tommy , ' it ses , jest like that — it ses , ' [Tommy]95-tommy , [I]2428-the other wants [you]95-tommy ! ' [I]2428-the other dursn't go near it , [Bill]182-bill . [I]2428-the other 'll get leave , and go ' ome and lay up — it glared at [me]2428-the other so ' orrid , [Bill]182-bill , and grinned — ugh ! [I]2428-the other 'll take the pledge after this ' ere , [I]2428-the other will — [I'll]2428-the other go to [chapel Sundays reg'lar]48-chapel sundays reg'lar ! "[2428-the other] " Let 's see if there ai n't something there first , "[182-bill] said [the practical Bill]182-bill . " Easy with the ' oss up there . Now then , "[182-bill] here [he]182-bill stepped on the box of the wheel and looked in . " [Shin]183-shin out of this , whatever [y'are]3468-y'are , [we]3469-we do n't contrack to carry no imps on this line — Well , if ever [I]182-bill — [Tommy]95-tommy , [old man]3470-old man , it 's all right , y'ain't got 'em this time—'ere 's [yer]95-tommy imp ! "[182-bill] And , reaching over , [he]182-bill hauled out the wretched [Paul]57-paul by the scruff of [his]57-paul neck in a state of utter collapse , and deposited [him]57-paul on the ground before [him]182-bill . " That ai n't [[your]95-tommy private kerridge]3471-your private kerridge , [yer]95-tommy know , that ain't — there was n't no bed made up there for [you]95-tommy , that [I]182-bill know on . [You]95-tommy ai n't arter no good , now ; [you]95-tommy 're [a wagabone]3472-a wagabone ! that 's about [your]95-tommy size , [I]182-bill can see — what [d'yer]3473-d'yer mean by it , eh ? "[182-bill] " Shet [yer]95-tommy ' ed , [Bill]182-bill , will [yer]95-tommy ? "[95-tommy] said [Tommy]95-tommy , whose relief probably softened [his]95-tommy temper , " this here 's [a young gent]2477-a young gent . "[95-tommy] " [Young gent]3475-young gent , or [no young gent]3476-no young gent , "[182-bill] replied [Bill]182-bill sententiously , " [he]2477-a young gent 's no call to go ' idin ' in [our]3477-our waggins and givin ' ' ard - workin ' [men]3478-men a turn . ' Old ' [i]182-bill m tight , [Tommy]95-tommy — here 's the luggage down on [us]3477-our . "[182-bill] [Tommy]95-tommy held [him]95-tommy fast with a grip of iron , while [the other porters]1928-the other porters coupled [the trucks]1929-the trucks , and [the luggage train]1930-the luggage train lumbered away with its load .

After this [the men]1931-the men slouched up and stood round [[their]1931-the men captive]1932-their captive , staring at [him]95-tommy curiously . " Look here , [[my]57-paul men]3479-my men , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " [I]57-paul 've run away from [school]226-school , [I]57-paul want to go on to [town]502-town by [the next train]2577-the next train , and [I]57-paul took the liberty of hiding in [the truck]3483-the truck , because [the schoolmaster]522-the schoolmaster will be up here very soon to look for [me]57-paul — [you]3479-my men understand ? "[57-paul] " [I]182-bill understand , "[182-bill] said [Bill]182-bill , " and a nice young party [you]3479-my men are . "[182-bill] " [I]57-paul — [I]57-paul do n't want to be caught , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul . " Naterally , "[95-tommy] assented [Tommy]95-tommy sympathetically . " Well , ca n't [you]3479-my men hide [me]95-tommy somewhere where [he]522-the schoolmaster wo n't see [me]95-tommy ? Come , [you]3479-my men can do that ? "[95-tommy] " What do [you]182-bill say , [Bill]182-bill ? "[95-tommy] asked [Tommy]95-tommy . " What 'll [the Guv'nor]184-the guv'nor say ? "[182-bill] said [Bill]182-bill dubiously . " [I]57-paul 've got a little money , "[57-paul] urged [Paul]57-paul . " [I]57-paul 'll make it worth [your]3479-my men while . "[57-paul] " Why did n't [you]57-paul say that afore ? "[182-bill] said [Bill]182-bill ; " [the Guv'nor]184-the guv'nor need n't know . "[182-bill] " Here 's half - a - sovereign between [you]3479-my men , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , holding it out . " That 's something like a imp , "[95-tommy] said [Tommy]95-tommy warmly ; " if [all bogeys]3485-all bogeys acted as ' andsome as this ' ere , [I]95-tommy do n't care how often [they]3485-all bogeys shows theirselves . [We]3486-we 'll have a supper on this , [mates]3487-mates , and drink [young Delirium Trimminses]185-young delirium trimminses ' jolly good ' ealth . [You]3479-my men come along o ' [me]95-tommy , [young shaver]3488-young shaver , [I]95-tommy 'll stow [you]3479-my men away right enough , and let [you]3479-my men out when [yer]3479-my men train comes in . "[95-tommy] [He]95-tommy led [Paul]57-paul on to [the platform]504-the platform again and opened a sort of cupboard or closet . " That 's where [we]3486-we keeps the brooms and lamp - rags , and them , "[95-tommy] [he]95-tommy said ; " it ai n't what [you]57-paul may call tidy , but if [I]95-tommy lock [you]3479-my men in [no one]2331-no one wo n't trouble [you]3479-my men . "[95-tommy] It was perfectly dark and the rags smelt unpleasantly , but [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was very glad of [this second ark of refuge]1934-this second ark of refuge , even though [he]57-paul did bruise [his]57-paul legs over the broom - handles ; [he]57-paul was gladder still by - and - by , when [he]57-paul heard a rapid heavy footfall outside , and a voice [he]57-paul knew only too well , saying , " [I]630-the station - master want to see [the station - master]630-the station - master . Ha , there [he]630-the station - master is . Good evening , [station - master]3491-station - master , [you]57-paul know [me]630-the station - master — [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone , of [Crichton House]4-crichton house . [I]630-the station - master want [you]57-paul to assist [me]630-the station - master in a very unpleasant affair — the fact is , [one of [[my]630-the station - master pupils]3493-my pupils]3492-one of my pupils has had the folly and wickedness to run away . "[630-the station - master] " [You]57-paul do n't say so ! "[630-the station - master] said [the station - master]630-the station - master . " It 's only too true , [I]630-the station - master 'm sorry to say ; [he]630-the station - master seemed happy and contented enough , too ; it 's a black ungrateful business . But [I]630-the station - master must catch [him]630-the station - master , [you]57-paul know ; [he]630-the station - master must be about here somewhere , [I]630-the station - master feel sure . [You]57-paul do n't happen to have noticed [a boy who looked as if [he]630-the station - master belonged to [me]630-the station - master]3494-a boy who looked as if he belonged to me ? [They]3495-they ca n't tell [me]630-the station - master at [the booking - office]1865-the booking - office . "[630-the station - master] How glad [Paul]57-paul was now [he]57-paul had made no inquiries of [the station - master]630-the station - master ! " No , "[446-the latter] said [the latter]446-the latter , " [I]446-the latter ca n't say [I]446-the latter have , [sir]2329-sir , but [some of [[my]446-the latter men]3479-my men]3498-some of my men may have come across [him]630-the station - master . [I]446-the latter 'll inquire — here , Ing , [I]446-the latter want [you]57-paul ; [this gentleman here]3500-this gentleman here has lost [one of [[his]3500-this gentleman here boys]3502-his boys]3501-one of his boys , have [you]57-paul seen [him]630-the station - master ? "[446-the latter] " What [sort of a young gentleman]3503-sort of a young gentleman was [he]630-the station - master to look at ? "[95-tommy] [Paul]57-paul heard [Tommy]95-tommy 's voice ask . "[95-tommy] If the door of the cupboard had not been locked , [Paul]57-paul would undoubtedly have burst out and yielded [himself]57-paul up , to escape the humiliation of being sold like this by [a mercenary and treacherous porter]1946-a mercenary and treacherous porter . Take the — — "[95-tommy] The rest was lost in the banging of the fly door and the rumble of wheels ; [the terrible man]1948-the terrible man had been got safely off on a wrong scent , and [Paul]57-paul fell back amongst the lumber in [[his]57-paul closet]1949-his closet , faint with the suspense and relief . "[95-tommy] Half an hour went slowly by for [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul in [his]57-paul darkness and solitude . [The platform]504-the platform gradually filled , as [he]57-paul could tell by the tread of feet , the voices , and the scent of cigars , and at last , welcome sound , [he]57-paul heard the station bell ringing for [the up - train]3531-the up - train . It ran in the next minute , shaking the cupboard in which [Paul]57-paul crouched , till the brushes rattled . There was the usual blind hurry and confusion outside as it stopped . [Paul]57-paul waited impatiently inside . The time passed , and still [no one]2331-no one came to let [him]57-paul out . [He]57-paul began to grow alarmed . Could [Tommy]95-tommy have forgotten [him]57-paul ? Had [he]95-tommy been sent away by some evil chance at the critical moment ? Two or three times [his]95-tommy excited fancy heard the fatal whistle sound for departure . Would [he]95-tommy be left behind after all ? But the next instant the door was noiselessly unlocked . " Could n't do it afore , "[95-tommy] said [honest Tommy]95-tommy . " [[Our]3539-our guv'nor]3540-our guv'nor would have seen [me]95-tommy . Now 's [your]57-paul time . "[1957-the first] There is a certain peculiar and uncomfortable suspicion that attacks most of [us]1961-we at times , which can not fairly be set down wholly to self - consciousness or an exaggerated idea of [our]1961-we own importance . [I]0-i mean the suspicion that a partly - heard conversation must have [ourselves]1961-we for its subject . More often than not , of course , it proves utterly unfounded , but once in a way , like most presentiments , it finds itself unpleasantly fulfilled . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , though [he]57-paul failed to recognise either of the voices , was somehow persuaded that the conversation had something to do with [himself]57-paul , and listened with eager attention . " Yes , "[1962-the speaker] [the speaker]1962-the speaker continued ; " [he]57-paul was never , according to what [I]1962-the speaker hear , [a man of any extraordinary capacity]3553-a man of any extraordinary capacity , but [he]57-paul was always spoken of as [a man of standing in [the City]2416-the city]3554-a man of standing in the city , doing a safe business , not a risky one , and so on , [you]3552-you know . ' "[2428-the other] " Then [he]57-paul would n't promise [me]2428-the other votes or give [me]2428-the other a letter or anything , without consulting [[his]57-paul head clerk]1344-his head clerk ; [he]57-paul seemed to know nothing whatever about it [himself]57-paul , and when that was over , [he]57-paul asked [me]2428-the other a quantity of frivolous questions which appeared to have a sort of catch in them , as far as [I]2428-the other could gather , and [he]57-paul was exceedingly angry when [I]2428-the other would n't humour [him]57-paul . These horrible tales were no doubt being circulated everywhere ! The conversation fell back into a less personal channel again after this ; [they]1969-they talked of " risks , "[1969-they] of [some one who had only been " writing "[1969-they] a year and was doing seven thousand a week]1970-some one who had only been " writing " a year and was doing seven thousand a week , of losses [they]1969-they had been " on , "[1969-they] and of the uselessness of " writing five hundred on everything , "[1969-they] and while at this point [the train]2319-the train slackened and stopped — [they]1969-they had reached [Dufferton]49-dufferton . There was an opening of doors all along [the train]2319-the train , and sounds of some inquiry and answer at each . The voices became audible at length , and , as [he]57-paul had expected , [Paul]57-paul found that [the Doctor]248-the doctor , not having discovered [him]57-paul on [the platform]504-the platform , was making a systematic search of [the train]2319-the train , evidently believing that [he]57-paul had managed to slip in somewhere unobserved . It was a horrible moment when the door of [[his]57-paul compartment]1976-his compartment was flung open and a stream of ice - cold air rushed under the blue cloth which , fortunately for [Paul]57-paul , hung down almost to the floor . [Some one]260-some one held a lantern up outside , and by its rays [Paul]57-paul saw from behind the hanging the upper half of [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone appear , very pale and polite , at the doorway . [He]57-paul remained there for some moments without speaking , carefully examining every corner of [the compartment]613-the compartment . "[271-one] " [I]248-the doctor do not propose to travel by [this train]2493-this train , [sir]2329-sir , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor ; " but , as [a person entrusted with the care of youth]3579-a person entrusted with the care of youth , permit [me]248-the doctor to inquire whether [you]2329-sir have seen ( or , it may be assisted to conceal ) [a small boy of intelligent appearance]3580-a small boy of intelligent appearance — — "[248-the doctor] " Why should [we]3581-we conceal [small boys of intelligent appearance]3582-small boys of intelligent appearance about [us]3581-we , pray ? "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , quite as angrily , " [I]248-the doctor insist upon looking under these seats before [you]2329-sir start [the train]2319-the train . [I]248-the doctor 've looked through [every other carriage]3596-every other carriage and [he]3256-that boy must be in [here]2411-here . [Gentlemen]2849-gentlemen , let [me]248-the doctor pass , [I]248-the doctor 'll get [him]3256-that boy if [I]248-the doctor have to travel in [this compartment]3599-this compartment to [town]502-town with [you]2329-sir ! "[248-the doctor] " For peace and quietness sake , [gentlemen]2849-gentlemen , "[552-the guard] said [the guard]552-the guard , " let [him]3256-that boy look round , just to ease [his]3256-that boy mind . Lend [me]552-the guard [your]2329-sir stick a minute , [sir]2329-sir , please . [I]552-the guard 'll turn [him]3256-that boy out if [he]3256-that boy 's anywhere about this [here compartment]3603-here compartment ! "[552-the guard] And with this [he]552-the guard pulled [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone down from the footboard and mounted it [himself]552-the guard ; after which [he]552-the guard began to rummage about under the seats with [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's heavy stick . Every lunge found out some tender part in [[Mr. Bultitude]57-paul 's person]1988-mr. bultitude 's person and caused [him]552-the guard exquisite torture ; but [he]552-the guard clenched [his]552-the guard teeth hard to prevent a sound , while [he]552-the guard thought each fresh dig must betray [his]552-the guard whereabouts . " There , "[552-the guard] said [the guard]552-the guard at last ; " there really ai n't [no one there]3604-no one there , [sir]2329-sir , [you]2329-sir see . [I]552-the guard 've felt everywhere and — — Hello , [I]552-the guard certainly did feel something just then , [gentlemen]2849-gentlemen ! "[552-the guard] [he]552-the guard added , in an undertone , after a lunge which took all the breath out of [Paul]57-paul 's body . All was lost now ! " [You]2329-sir touch that again with that confounded stick if [you]2329-sir dare ! "[1990-one of the passengers] said [one of [the passengers]1991-the passengers]1990-one of the passengers . Now perhaps [you]2329-sir 'll let [us]3609-us alone ! "[1990-one of the passengers] " Well , [sir]2329-sir , "[552-the guard] said [the guard]552-the guard at last to [the Doctor]248-the doctor , as [he]552-the guard withdrew , " [he]3608-his boy ai n't in [there]2356-there . "[188-goldicutt] For [Paul]57-paul , alarmed at the suggestion about [the guard]552-the guard , once more felt inclined to risk the worst and reveal [himself]57-paul . Begrimed with coal , smeared with whitewash , and covered with dust and flue , [he]57-paul crawled slowly out and gazed imploringly up at [[his]57-paul fellow - passengers]901-his fellow - passengers . Why , it 's lovely ! [The boy]246-the boy 's got pluck and manners too . " Ah , [he]3643-that hot - tempered master of yours might do that , to be sure — [sharp boy]3645-sharp boy this — well , as [we]901-his fellow - passengers 've gone so far , [I]57-paul suppose [we]901-his fellow - passengers must go through with the business now and smuggle [the young scamp]3646-the young scamp past [the detectives]3647-the detectives , eh , [Travers]189-travers ? "[57-paul] [The younger man]2006-the younger man addressed assented readily enough , for [the Doctor]248-the doctor had been so unfortunate as to prejudice [them]2008-they both from the first by [his]248-the doctor unjustifiable suspicions , and it is to be feared [they]2008-they had no scruples in helping to outwit [him]248-the doctor . Then [they]2008-they noticed the pitiable state [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul was in , and [he]57-paul had to give [them]2008-they a fair account of [his]57-paul escape and subsequent adventures , at which even [their]2008-they sympathy could not restrain delighted shouts of laughter — though [Paul]57-paul [himself]57-paul saw little enough in it all to laugh at ; [they]2008-they asked [his]57-paul name , which [he]57-paul thought more prudent , for various reasons , to give as " [Jones]190-jones , "[2008-they] and other details , which [I]0-i am afraid [he]57-paul invented as [he]57-paul went on , and altogether [they]2008-they reached [Kentish Town]51-kentish town in a state of high satisfaction with [themselves]2008-they and [[their]2008-they protégé]2009-their protégé . At [Kentish Town]51-kentish town there was one more danger to be encountered , for with [the ticket collector]2010-the ticket collector there appeared [one of [the station inspectors]2012-the station inspectors]2011-one of the station inspectors . " Beg pardon , [gentlemen]2849-gentlemen , "[446-the latter] said [the latter]446-the latter , peering curiously in , " but does [that young gent in the corner]3649-that young gent in the corner happen to belong to [either of [you]2849-gentlemen]3650-either of you ? "[446-the latter] [The white - whiskered gentleman]2014-the white - whiskered gentleman seemed a little flustered at this downright inquiry , but the other was more equal to the occasion . [The man]2317-the man apologised for what [he]2317-the man conceived to be a mistake . " [We]2008-they 've orders to look out for [a young gent about the size of yours]3654-a young gent about the size of yours , [sir]2329-sir , "[2014-the white - whiskered gentleman] [he]2014-the white - whiskered gentleman explained ; " no offence meant , [I]2014-the white - whiskered gentleman 'm sure , "[2014-the white - whiskered gentleman] and [he]2014-the white - whiskered gentleman went away satisfied . A very few minutes more and [the train]2319-the train rolled in to [the terminus]2018-the terminus , under the same wide arch beneath which [Paul]57-paul had stood , helpless and bewildered , a week ago . " Now [my]188-goldicutt advice to [you]57-paul , [young man]3453-young man , "[188-goldicutt] said [Mr. Goldicutt]188-goldicutt , as [he]188-goldicutt put [Paul]57-paul into [a cab]2316-a cab , and pressed half - a - sovereign into [his]57-paul unwilling hand , " is to go straight [home]296-home to [Papa]147-papa and tell [him]147-papa all about it . [I]188-goldicutt daresay [he]147-papa wo n't be very hard on [you]57-paul — here 's [my]188-goldicutt card , refer [him]147-papa to [me]188-goldicutt if [you]57-paul like . Good - night , [[my]188-goldicutt boy]2376-my boy , good - night , and good luck to [you]57-paul . Gad , the best joke [I]188-goldicutt 've had for years ! "[188-goldicutt] And [the cab]2315-the cab rolled away , leaving [them]2021-them standing chuckling on [the platform]504-the platform , and , as [Paul]57-paul found [himself]57-paul plunging once more into the welcome roar and rattle of [London streets]2023-london streets , [he]57-paul forgot the difficulties and dangers that might yet lie before [him]57-paul in the thought that at last [he]57-paul was beyond the frontier , and , for the first time since [he]57-paul had slipped through the playground gate , [he]57-paul breathed freely . [Paul]57-paul had been careful , whilst in the hearing of [[his]57-paul friends]1091-his friends , to give [the cabman]2025-the cabman a fictitious address , but as soon as [he]57-paul reached [the Euston Road]16-the euston road , [he]57-paul stopped [the man]2317-the man and ordered [him]2317-the man to put [him]2317-the man down at [the church near [the south end of [Westbourne Terrace]3-westbourne terrace]2028-the south end of westbourne terrace]2027-the church near the south end of westbourne terrace , for [he]57-paul dared not drive up openly to [his]57-paul own door . At last [he]57-paul found [himself]57-paul standing safely on [the pavement]341-the pavement , looking down the long line of yellow lamps of [[his]57-paul own terrace]2030-his own terrace , only a few hundred yards from [home]296-home .

But though [his]57-paul purpose was now within easy reach , [his]57-paul spirits were far from high ; [his]57-paul anxiety had returned with tenfold power ; [he]57-paul felt no eagerness or exultation ; on the contrary , the task [he]57-paul had set [himself]57-paul had never before seemed so hopeless , so insurmountable . [He]57-paul stood for some time by the railing of [the church]1390-the church , which was lighted up for evening service , listening blankly to the solemn drone of the organ within , unable to summon up resolution to move from the spot and present [himself]57-paul to [[his]57-paul unsuspecting family]2033-his unsuspecting family . It was a cold night , with a howling wind , and high in the blue black sky fleecy clouds were coursing swiftly along ; [he]57-paul obliged [himself]57-paul to set out at last , and walked down the flags towards [[his]57-paul house]1375-his house , shivering as much from nervousness as cold . There was a dance somewhere in [the terrace]2035-the terrace that evening , a large one ; as far as [he]57-paul could see there were close ranks of carriages with blazing lamps , and [he]57-paul even fancied [he]57-paul could hear the shouts of [the link - boys]2036-the link - boys and the whistles summoning cabs . As [he]57-paul came nearer , [he]57-paul had a hideous suspicion , which soon became a certainty , that the entertainment was at [[his]57-paul own house]396-his own house ; worse still , it was of a kind and on a scale calculated to shock and horrify [any prudent householder]2038-any prudent householder and [father of [a family]2040-a family]2039-father of a family . [The balcony above the portico]2041-the balcony above the portico was positively hung with gaudy Chinese lanterns , and there were even some strange sticks and shapes up in one corner that looked suspiciously like fireworks . Fireworks in [Westbourne Terrace]3-westbourne terrace ! What would [the neighbours]2042-the neighbours think or do ? Between the wall which separates [the main road]2043-the main road from [the terrace]2035-the terrace and [the street front]2045-the street front there were no less than four piano - organs , playing , it is to be feared , by express invitation ; and there was the usual crowd of idlers and loungers standing about by the awning stretched over [the portico]2046-the portico , listening to the music and loud laughter which came from [the brilliantly lighted upper rooms]2047-the brilliantly lighted upper rooms . [Paul]57-paul remembered then , too late , that [Barbara]153-barbara in that memorable letter of [hers]153-barbara had mentioned [a grand children]2048-a grand children 's party as being in contemplation . [Dick]60-dick had held [his]60-dick tongue about it that morning ; and [he]60-dick [himself]60-dick had not thought it was to be so soon . For an instant [he]60-dick felt almost inclined to turn away and give the whole thing up in sick despair — even to return to [Market Rodwell]5-market rodwell and brave [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's anger ; for how could [he]60-dick hope to explain matters to [[his]60-dick family]1008-his family and [servants]2051-servants , or get the Garudâ Stone safely into [his]60-dick hands again before [all these guests , in the whirl and tumult of an evening party]2052-all these guests , in the whirl and tumult of an evening party ? And yet [he]60-dick dared not , after all , go back to [Crichton House]4-crichton house — that was too terrible an alternative , and [he]60-dick obviously could not roam [the world]2377-the world to any extent , [a runaway schoolboy to all appearance]2054-a runaway schoolboy to all appearance , and with less than a sovereign in [his]60-dick pocket ! After a short struggle , [he]60-dick felt [he]60-dick must make [his]60-dick way in , watch and wait , and leave the rest to chance . It was [his]60-dick evil fate , after all , that had led [him]60-dick on to make [his]60-dick escape on this night of all others , and had allowed [him]60-dick to come through so much , only to be met with these unforeseen complications just when [he]60-dick might have imagined the worst was over . [He]60-dick forced [his]60-dick way through [the staring crowd]2055-the staring crowd , and went down the steps into [the area]2056-the area ; for [he]60-dick naturally shrank from braving the front door , with [its crowd of footmen]2057-its crowd of footmen and [hired waiters]2058-hired waiters . [He]60-dick found the door in [the basement]2059-the basement open , which was fortunate , and slipped quietly through [the pantry]2060-the pantry , intending to reach [the hall]259-the hall by the [kitchen stairs]2062-kitchen stairs . But here another check met [him]60-dick . The glass door which led to the stairs happened to be shut , and [he]60-dick heard voices in [the kitchen]2807-the kitchen , which convinced [him]60-dick that if [he]60-dick wished to escape notice [he]60-dick must wait quietly in the darkness until the door was opened for [him]60-dick , whenever that might be . The door from [the pantry]2060-the pantry to [the kitchen]2807-the kitchen was partly open , however , and [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul could not avoid hearing everything that passed there , although every fresh word added to [his]60-dick uneasiness , until at last [he]60-dick would have given worlds to escape from [his]60-dick involuntary position of [eavesdropper]2066-eavesdropper . There were only [two persons]2067-two persons just then in [the kitchen]2807-the kitchen : [[his]60-dick cook , who , still in [her]2070-her working dress , was refreshing [herself]2070-her after [her]2070-her labours over the supper with a journal of some sort , and [the housemaid]2071-the housemaid , who , in neat gala costume , was engaged in fastening a pin more securely in [her]2071-the housemaid white cap]2069-his cook , who , still in her working dress , was refreshing herself after her labours over the supper with a journal of some sort , and the housemaid , who , in neat gala costume , was engaged in fastening a pin more securely in her white cap . " [They]2069-his cook , who , still in her working dress , was refreshing herself after her labours over the supper with a journal of some sort , and the housemaid , who , in neat gala costume , was engaged in fastening a pin more securely in her white cap have n't give [me]269-the cook a answer yet , [Eliza]192-eliza , "[269-the cook] said [the cook]269-the cook , looking up from [her]269-the cook paper . "[192-eliza] And [she]192-eliza proceeded to read from [her]192-eliza paper : " ' [Lady Bird.—You]193-lady bird.—you ask [us]3661-we ( 1 ) what are the signs by which [you]192-eliza may recognise the first dawnings of [[your]192-eliza lover]3662-your lover 's affection . On so delicate a matter [we]3661-we are naturally averse from advising [you]192-eliza ; [your]192-eliza own heart must be [[your]192-eliza best guide]3663-your best guide . But perhaps [we]3661-we may mention a few of the most usual and infallible symptoms'—What sort of a thing is a symptim , [Eliza]192-eliza ? "[192-eliza] " [A symptim , cook]3664-a symptim , cook , "[192-eliza] explained [Eliza]192-eliza , " is somethink wrong with the inside .
