"[192-eliza] " It do n't seem to make sense though , [Eliza]192-eliza , "[192-eliza] objected cook doubtfully . " Hear how it goes on : ' Infallible symptoms . If [you]192-eliza have truly inspired [him]3666-he with a genuine and lasting passion ' ( do n't [he]3666-he write beautiful ? ) ' passion , [he]3666-he will continually haunt those places in which [you]192-eliza are most likely to be found ' ( [I]192-eliza could n't tell [you]192-eliza the times [master]3667-master 's bin down in [my]192-eliza kitching this last week ) ; ' [he]3666-he will appear awkward and constrained in [your]192-eliza presence ' ( anything more awkward than [master]3667-master [I]192-eliza never set eyes on . [He]3666-he 's knocked down one of the best porcelain vegetables this very afternoon ! ) ; ' [he]3666-he will beg for any little favours , some trifle , it may be , made by [your]192-eliza own hand ' ( [master]3667-master 's always a - asking if [I]192-eliza 've got any of those doughnuts to give away ) ; ' and , if granted , [he]3666-he will treasure them in secret with pride and rapture ' ( [I]192-eliza do n't think [master]3667-master kep ' any of them doughnuts though , [Eliza]192-eliza . [I]192-eliza saw [him]3666-he swaller five ; but [you]192-eliza could n't treasure a doughnut , not to mention — — [I]192-eliza 'll make [him]3666-he a pincushion when [I]192-eliza 've time , and see what [he]3666-he does with it ) . ' If [you]192-eliza detect all these indications of liking in the person [you]192-eliza suspect of paying [his]3666-he addresses to [you]192-eliza , [you]192-eliza may safely reckon upon bringing [him]3666-he to [your]192-eliza feet in a very short space of time . ( 2 ) Yes , fuller 's earth will make them exquisitely white . ' "[192-eliza] " There , [Eliza]192-eliza ! "[2073-me] said cook , with some pride , when [she]2073-me had finished ; " if it had been meant for [me]2073-me it could n't have been clearer . Ai n't it written nice ? And on'y to think of [my]2073-me bringing [master]3667-master to [my]2073-me feet ! It seems almost too much for [a cook]3672-a cook to expect ! "[2073-me] " [I]192-eliza would n't say so , [cook]3659-cook ; [I]192-eliza would n't . Have some proper pride . Do n't let [him]3666-he think [he]3666-he 's only to ask and have ! "[2093-that dreadful woman] [That dreadful woman]2093-that dreadful woman ! " [he]57-paul groaned . " But more than ever [he]57-paul began to wish that [he]57-paul had stayed in [the playground]648-the playground . When [he]57-paul reached [the hall]259-the hall [he]57-paul stood there for some moments in anxious deliberation over [his]57-paul best course of proceeding . [His]57-paul main idea was to lie in wait somewhere for [Dick]60-dick , and try the result of an appeal to [his]57-paul better feelings to acknowledge [[his]57-paul outcast parent]3698-his outcast parent and abdicate gracefully . If that failed , and there was every reason to expect that it would fail , [he]57-paul must threaten to denounce [him]60-dick before [the whole party]3699-the whole party . It would cause a considerable scandal no doubt , and be extremely repugnant to [his]57-paul own feelings , but still [he]57-paul must do it , or frighten [Dick]60-dick by threatening to do it , and at all hazards [he]57-paul must contrive during the interview to snatch or purloin the magic stone ; without that [he]57-paul was practically helpless .[60-dick]

[He]2095-he looked round [him]2095-he : [the study]3155-the study was piled up with [small boys]2097-small boys ' hats and coats , and in one corner was a kind of refined bar , where till lately [a trim housemaid]2098-a trim housemaid had been dispensing coffee and weak lemonade ; [she]2098-a trim housemaid might return at any moment , [he]2095-he would not be safe [there]2356-there . Nor would [the dining - room]275-the dining - room be more secluded , for in [it]275-the dining - room there was an elaborate supper being laid out by [the waiters]2101-the waiters which , as far as [he]2095-he could see through the crack in the door , consisted chiefly of lobsters , trifle , and pink champagne . [He]2095-he felt a grim joy at the sight , more than [he]2095-he would suffer for this night 's festivities . As [he]2095-he stole about , with a dismal sense of the unfitness of [his]2095-he sneaking about [[his]2095-he own house]396-his own house in this guilty fashion , [he]2095-he became gradually aware of the scent of a fine cigar , one of [his]2095-he own special Cabañas . [He]2095-he wondered who had the impudence to trespass on [his]2095-he cigar - chest ; it could hardly be [one of [the children]2858-the children]2103-one of the children . [He]2095-he traced the scent to [a billiard room which [he]2095-he had built out at the side of [the house]234-the house]2105-a billiard room which he had built out at the side of the house , which was [a corner one]2107-a corner one , and going down to the door opened it sharply and walked in . "[74-uncle marmaduke] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul had always detested [the man]2317-the man — there was an underbred swagger and familiarity in [his]2317-the man manner that made [him]2317-the man indescribably offensive ; just now [he]2317-the man seemed doubly detestable , and yet [Paul]57-paul by a strong effort succeeded in controlling [his]57-paul temper . "[74-uncle marmaduke] " How did [I]57-paul get hold of the story ? "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , observing the impression [he]57-paul had made . " Do [you]2428-the other think if [I]57-paul were really [a boy of thirteen]3740-a boy of thirteen [I]57-paul should know as much about [you]2428-the other as [I]57-paul do ? Do [you]2428-the other want to know more ? Ask , if [you]2428-the other dare ! Shall [I]57-paul tell [you]2428-the other how it was [you]2428-the other left [[your]2428-the other army coach]3741-your army coach without going up for examination ? Will [you]2428-the other have the story of [your]2428-the other career in [[my]57-paul old friend]2351-my old friend [[Parkinson]197-parkinson 's counting - house]3743-parkinson 's counting - house , or the real reason of [your]2428-the other trip to [New York]53-new york , or what it was that made [[your]2428-the other father]2566-your father add that codicil , cutting [you]2428-the other off with a set of engravings of the ' Rake 's Progress , ' and a guinea to pay for framing them ? [I]57-paul can tell [you]2428-the other all about it , if [you]2428-the other care to hear . "[57-paul] " No ! "[74-uncle marmaduke] shrieked [Paradine]75-paradine , " [I]74-uncle marmaduke wo n't listen . [You]2428-the other 're cut out for [an editor of one]3746-an editor of one . It does n't interest [me]74-uncle marmaduke . "[74-uncle marmaduke] " Do [you]2428-the other believe [my]57-paul story or not ? "[57-paul] asked [Paul]57-paul . " [I]2428-the other do n't know . Who could believe it ? "[2428-the other] said [the other]2428-the other sullenly . " How can [you]2428-the other possibly account for it ? "[2428-the other]

" Do [you]2428-the other remember giving [Maria]152-maria a little sandal - wood box with a small stone in it ? "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul . " [I]57-paul have some recollection of giving [her]152-maria something of that kind . A curiosity , was n't it ? "[57-paul] " [I]74-uncle marmaduke wish [I]74-uncle marmaduke had never seen it . That infernal stone , [Paradine]75-paradine , has done all this to [me]74-uncle marmaduke . Did [no one]2331-no one tell [you]2428-the other it was supposed to have any magic power ? "[74-uncle marmaduke] " Why , now [I]57-paul think of it , [that old black rascal]3748-that old black rascal , [Bindabun Doss]198-bindabun doss , did try to humbug [me]57-paul with some such story ; said it was believed to be a talisman , but the secret was lost . [I]57-paul thought it was just [his]3748-that old black rascal stingy way of trying to make the rubbish out as something priceless , as it ought to have been , considering all [I]57-paul did for [the old ruffian]3749-the old ruffian . "[57-paul] " [You]2428-the other told [Maria]152-maria it was a talisman . [Bindabun]198-bindabun doss what's - [his]3748-that old black rascal - name was right . It is a talisman of the deadliest sort . [I]74-uncle marmaduke 'll soon convince [you]2428-the other , if [you]2428-the other will only hear [me]74-uncle marmaduke out . "[74-uncle marmaduke] And then , in white - hot wrath and indignation , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul began to tell the story [I]0-i have already attempted to sketch here , dwelling bitterly on [Dick]60-dick 's heartless selfishness and cruelty , and piteously on [his]60-dick own incredible sufferings , while [Uncle Marmaduke]74-uncle marmaduke , lolling back in [his]74-uncle marmaduke armchair with an attempt ( which was soon abandoned ) to retain a smile of amused scepticism on [his]74-uncle marmaduke face , heard [him]57-paul out in complete silence and with all due gravity . Indeed , [Paul]57-paul 's manner left [him]57-paul no room for further unbelief . [His]57-paul tale , wild and improbable as it was , was too consistent and elaborate for [any schoolboy]2118-any schoolboy to have invented , and , besides , the imposture would have been so entirely purposeless . When [[his]57-paul brother - in - law]318-his brother - in - law had come to the end of [his]57-paul sad history , [Paradine]75-paradine was silent for some time . It was some relief to know that the darkest secrets of [his]57-paul life had not been ferreted out by [a phenomenally sharp nephew]2120-a phenomenally sharp nephew ; but the change in the situation was not without its drawbacks — it remained to be seen how it might affect [himself]57-paul . [He]57-paul already saw [his]57-paul reign in [Westbourne]54-westbourne Terrace threatened with a speedy determination unless [he]57-paul played [his]57-paul cards well . " Well , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said at last , with a swift , keen glance at [Paul]57-paul , who sat anxiously waiting for [his]57-paul next words ; " suppose [I]57-paul were to say that [I]57-paul think there may be something in this story of [yours]57-paul , what then ? What is it [you]57-paul want [me]57-paul to do for [you]57-paul ? "[57-paul] " Why , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " with all [you]57-paul owe to [me]57-paul , now [you]57-paul know the horrible injustice [I]57-paul have had to bear , [you]57-paul surely do n't mean to say that [you]57-paul wo n't help [me]57-paul to right [myself]57-paul ? "[57-paul] " And if [I]57-paul did help [you]57-paul , what then ? "[57-paul] " Why , [I]57-paul should be able to recover all [I]57-paul have lost , of course , "[57-paul] said [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul . "[57-paul] " Thank [you]57-paul ! "[2428-the other] said [the other]2428-the other . " And even , if necessary , provide [you]57-paul with a small fund to start afresh upon — honestly , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul ; " [you]57-paul will not find [me]57-paul difficult to deal with . "[57-paul] " It 's a dazzling proposition , "[75-paradine] remarked [Paradine]75-paradine drily . " [You]57-paul have such an alluring way of putting things . But the fact , is , [you]57-paul 'll hardly believe it , but [I]75-paradine 'm remarkably well off here . [I]75-paradine am indeed . [[Your]57-paul son]2322-your son , [you]57-paul know , though not [you]57-paul ( except as a mere matter of form ) , really makes , as [they]3751-they say of the marmalade in the advertisements , an admirable substitute . "[75-paradine] " So do [I]57-paul , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul ; " very much . "[75-paradine] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul had no choice ; there was just time to set up an old folding screen which stood in a corner of [the room]213-the room and slip behind it before the door opened . It might not be the highest wisdom to trust everything to [[his]57-paul new ally]2127-his new ally in this manner ; but what else could [he]57-paul do , except stand by in forced inactivity while the momentous duel was being fought out ? Just then , at all events , [he]57-paul saw no other course .

[Dick]60-dick burst open the door of [the billiard - room]245-the billiard - room rather suddenly , and then stood holding on to the handle and smiling down upon [[his]60-dick relative]2129-his relative in a happy and affectionate but rather weak manner . " So here [you]2129-his relative are ! "[60-dick] [he]60-dick said . " Been lookin ' for [you]2129-his relative everywhere . What 's good of shutting ' self in here ? Come up and play gamesh . No ? Come in and have shupper . [I]60-dick 've had shupper . "[60-dick] " So [I]74-uncle marmaduke perceive , "[74-uncle marmaduke] observed [Uncle Marmaduke]74-uncle marmaduke ; and the fact was certainly obvious enough . " Tell y'what [I]60-dick did , "[60-dick] giggled [the wretched Dick]60-dick . " [You]2129-his relative know [I]60-dick never did get what [I]60-dick call regular good blow out — always [some one to shay]3796-some one to shay ' had quite ' nough ' ' fore [I]60-dick 'd begun . So [I]60-dick thought this time [I]60-dick would have a tuck - in till — till [I]60-dick felt tired , and [I]60-dick — [he]74-uncle marmaduke - [he]74-uncle marmaduke - [he]74-uncle marmaduke — [I]60-dick got down ' fore [anybody]2344-anybody elsh and helped [myshelf]3798-myshelf . Had first go - in . [No one]2331-no one to help to thingsh . [No girlsh]3800-no girlsh to bother . It was prime ! When [they]3801-they 've all gone up again [you]2131-his uncle and [me'll]3802-me'll go in and have shome more , eh ? "[60-dick] " [You]2131-his uncle 're [a model host]3803-a model host , "[2131-his uncle] said [[his]2130-his uncle]2131-his uncle . " It 's [a good shupper]3804-a good shupper , "[60-dick] [Dick]60-dick went on . " [I]60-dick ought to know . [I]60-dick 've had some of everything . It'sh almost too good for [kids]3805-kids . But it'sh a good thing [I]60-dick went in first . After [I]60-dick 'd been in a little time [I]60-dick saw a sponge - cake on the table , and when [I]60-dick tried it , what [d'ye]3806-d'ye think [I]60-dick found ? It was as full inside of brandy - an'-sherry as it could be . All it could do to shtand ! [I]60-dick saw d'rectly it washn't in condition come to table , and [I]60-dick said , ' Take it away ! take it away ! It'sh drunk ; it'sh a dishgraceful sight for [children]240-children ! ' But [they]240-children would n't take it away ; sho [I]60-dick had to take it away . But [you]60-dick ca n't take away a whole tipshy - cake ! "[60-dick] " [I]75-paradine am quite sure [you]60-dick did [your]60-dick best , "[75-paradine] murmured [Paradine]75-paradine .

" Been having such gamesh [upstairs]264-upstairs ! "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , with another giggle . " [That lil ' [Dolly Merridew]199-dolly merridew 's [jolly girl]3810-jolly girl]3809-that lil ' dolly merridew 's jolly girl . Not sho nice as [Dulcie]110-dulcie , though . "[60-dick] " No , no , "[2131-his uncle] said [[his]60-dick uncle]2131-his uncle . " [You]60-dick and [I]2131-his uncle are too old for that sort of thing . [You]60-dick should leave the larks to [the young fellows]3815-the young fellows . "[2131-his uncle] " How do [you]2131-his uncle know [I]60-dick 'm too old for sorterthing ? "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , with an offended air . " Well , [you]60-dick 're not [a young man]2820-a young man any longer , [you]60-dick know . [You]60-dick ought to behave like the steady old buffer [you]60-dick look . "[60-dick] " Why ? "[60-dick] " Very well then , [I]2131-his uncle have done with [you]60-dick . "[2131-his uncle] " No , do n't leave [me]60-dick , let [me]60-dick alone for a minute , "[60-dick] pleaded [Dick]60-dick , still fumbling . At this a sudden suspicion of [[his]60-dick brother - in - law]318-his brother - in - law 's motives for wishing to get the Stone into [his]60-dick own hands overcame all [Paul]57-paul 's prudence . If [he]57-paul was so clever in deceiving [Dick]60-dick , might [he]57-paul not be cheating [him]60-dick , too , just as completely ? [He]57-paul could wait no longer , but burst from behind the screen and rushed in between [the pair]632-the pair . " Go back ! "[75-paradine] screamed [Paradine]75-paradine . " [[You]60-dick infernal old idiot]3879-you infernal old idiot , [you]60-dick 've ruined everything ! "[75-paradine] " [I]57-paul wo n't go back , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , " [I]57-paul do n't believe in [you]60-dick . [I]57-paul 'll hide no longer . "[57-paul] [Dick]60-dick had risen in horror at the sudden apparition , and staggered back against the wall , where [he]60-dick stood staring stupidly at [[his]60-dick unfortunate father]2138-his unfortunate father with fixed and vacant eyes . " Badly as [you]60-dick 've treated [me]60-dick , [I]60-dick 'd rather trust [you]60-dick than [that shifty plausible fellow there]3881-that shifty plausible fellow there . Just look at [me]60-dick , [Dick]60-dick , and then say if [you]60-dick can let this cruelty go on . If [you]60-dick knew all [I]60-dick 've suffered since [I]60-dick have been among [those infernal boys]2669-those infernal boys , [you]60-dick would pity [me]60-dick , [you]60-dick would indeed .... If [you]60-dick send [me]60-dick back [there]2356-there again , it will kill [me]60-dick .... [You]60-dick know as well as [I]60-dick do that it is worse for [me]60-dick than ever it could be for [you]60-dick .... [You]60-dick ca n't really justify [yourself]60-dick because of a thoughtless wish of mine , spoken without the least intention of being taken at [my]60-dick word . [Dick]60-dick , [I]60-dick may not have shown as much affection for [you]60-dick as [I]60-dick might have done , but [I]60-dick do n't think [I]60-dick deserve all this . Be generous with [me]60-dick now , and [I]60-dick swear [you]60-dick will never regret it . "[60-dick] [Dick]60-dick 's lips moved ; there really was something like pity and repentance in [his]60-dick face , muddled and dazed as [his]60-dick general expression was by [his]60-dick recent over - indulgence , but [he]60-dick said nothing . " Give [papa]147-papa the Stone by all means , "[60-dick] sneered [Paradine]75-paradine . " If [you]60-dick do , [he]147-papa will find some one to wish the pair of [you]60-dick back again , and then , back [you]60-dick go to [school]226-school again , [the laughing - stock of [everybody]3827-everybody]3885-the laughing - stock of everybody , [[you]60-dick silly young cub]3887-you silly young cub ! "[75-paradine] " Do n't listen to [him]147-papa , [Dick]60-dick , "[57-paul] urged [Paul]57-paul . " Give it to [me]57-paul , for Heaven 's sake ; if [you]60-dick let [him]147-papa have it , [he]147-papa 'll use it to ruin [us]3888-us all . "[57-paul] But [Dick]60-dick turned [his]60-dick white face to [the rival claimants]2139-the rival claimants and said , getting the words out with difficulty : " [Papa]147-papa , [I]60-dick 'm shorry . It is a shame . If [I]60-dick had the Shtone , [I]60-dick really would give it [you]147-papa , upon [my]60-dick word - an'-honour [I]60-dick would . But — but , now [I]60-dick ca n't ever give it up to [you]147-papa . It'sh gone . Losht ! "[60-dick] " Lost ! "[75-paradine] cried [Marmaduke]75-paradine . " When , where ? When do [you]60-dick last recollect seeing it ? [you]60-dick must know ! "[75-paradine] " In the morning , "[60-dick] said [Dick]60-dick , twirling [his]60-dick chain , where part of the cheap gilt fastening still hung . " No ; afternoon . [I]60-dick do n't know , "[60-dick] [he]60-dick added helplessly . [Paul]57-paul sank down on a chair with a heartbroken groan ; a moment ago [he]57-paul had felt [himself]57-paul very near [his]57-paul goal , [he]57-paul had regained something of [his]57-paul old influence over [Dick]60-dick , [he]57-paul had actually managed to touch [his]57-paul heart — and now it was all in vain ! [Paradine]75-paradine 's jaw fell ; [he]75-paradine , too , had had [his]75-paradine dreams of doing wonderful things with the talisman after [he]75-paradine had cajoled [Dick]60-dick to part with it . Whether the restoration of [[his]75-paradine brother - in - law]318-his brother - in - law formed any part of [his]75-paradine programme , it is better , perhaps , not to inquire . [His]75-paradine dreams were scattered now ; the Stone might be anywhere , buried in [London]36-london mud , lying on railway ballast , or ground to powder by cartwheels . There was little chance , indeed , that even the most liberal rewards would lead to discovery . [He]75-paradine swore long and comprehensively . As for [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , [he]75-paradine sat motionless in [his]75-paradine chair , staring in dull , speechless reproach at the conscience - stricken Dick , who stood in the corner blinking and whimpering with an abject penitence , odd and painful to see in one of [his]57-paul portly form . [The children]2858-the children had now apparently finished supper , for there were sounds above as of dancing , and " [Sir Roger de Coverley]203-sir roger de coverley , "[2858-the children] with its rollicking , never - wearying repetition , was distinctly audible above the din and laughter . Once before , a week ago that very day , had that heartless piano mocked [him]75-paradine with its untimely gaiety . But things were not at their worst even yet , for , while [they]2858-the children sat like this , there was a sharp , short peal at the house - bell , followed by loud and rather angry knocking , for carriages being no longer expected , [the servants]2402-the servants and [waiters]2143-waiters had now closed the front - door , and left [the passage]2144-the passage for [the supper - room]2145-the supper - room . " [The visitors]3889-the visitors ' bell ! "[57-paul] cried [Paul]57-paul , roused from [his]57-paul apathy ; and [he]57-paul rushed to the window which commanded a side - view of [the portico]2046-the portico ; it might be only [a servant]2147-a servant calling for [one of [the children]2858-the children]2103-one of the children , but [he]57-paul feared the worst , and could not rest till [he]57-paul knew it . It was a rash thing to do , for as [he]57-paul drew the blind , [he]57-paul saw [a large person in a heavy Inverness cloak standing on the steps]2150-a large person in a heavy inverness cloak standing on the steps , and ( which was worse ) [the person both]2151-the person both saw and recognised [him]75-paradine ! With fascinated horror , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul saw [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's small grey eyes fixed angrily on [him]75-paradine , and knew that [he]75-paradine was hunted down at last . [He]57-paul turned to [the other two]542-the other two with a sort of ghastly composure : " It 's all over now , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said . " [I]57-paul 've just seen [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone standing on [my]57-paul doorstep ; [he]62-dr. grimstone has come after [me]57-paul . "[57-paul] [Uncle Marmaduke]74-uncle marmaduke gave a malicious little laugh : " [I]74-uncle marmaduke 'm sorry for [you]57-paul , [[my]74-uncle marmaduke friend]3181-my friend , "[74-uncle marmaduke] [he]74-uncle marmaduke said , " but [I]74-uncle marmaduke really ca n't help it . "[74-uncle marmaduke] " [You]57-paul can , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul ; " [you]57-paul can tell [him]62-dr. grimstone what [you]57-paul know . [You]57-paul can save [me]57-paul . "[57-paul] " Very poor economy that , "[74-uncle marmaduke] said [Marmaduke]74-uncle marmaduke airily . " [I]74-uncle marmaduke prefer spending to saving , always did . "[74-uncle marmaduke] " [Dick]60-dick , "[57-paul] said poor [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul , disgusted at this exhibition of selfishness , " [you]60-dick said [you]60-dick were sorry just now . Will [you]60-dick tell [him]62-dr. grimstone the truth ? "[57-paul]

But [Dick]60-dick was quite unnerved , [he]60-dick cowered away , almost crying ; " [I]60-dick dare n't , [I]60-dick dare n't , "[60-dick] [he]60-dick stammered ; " [I]60-dick — [I]60-dick ca n't go back to [the fellows]2980-the fellows like this . [I]60-dick 'm afraid to tell [him]62-dr. grimstone . [I]60-dick — [I]60-dick want to hide somewhere . "[60-dick] And certainly [he]60-dick was in no condition to convince [an angry schoolmaster]2154-an angry schoolmaster of anything whatever , except that [he]60-dick was in a state very unbecoming to [the head of [a family]2040-a family]2155-the head of a family . It was all over ; [Paul]57-paul saw that too well , [he]57-paul dashed frantically from [the fatal billiard - room]2157-the fatal billiard - room , and in [the hall]259-the hall met [Boaler]67-boaler preparing to admit [the visitor]2159-the visitor . " Do n't open the door ! "[57-paul] [he]57-paul screamed . " Keep [him]2159-the visitor out , [you]57-paul must n't let [him]2159-the visitor in . It 's [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone . "[57-paul] [Boaler]67-boaler , surprised as [he]67-boaler naturally was at [[his]67-boaler young master]2160-his young master 's unaccountable appearance and evident panic , nevertheless never moved a muscle of [his]67-boaler face ; [he]67-boaler was one of [those perfectly bred servants , who , if [they]2161-those perfectly bred servants , who , if they chanced to open the door to a ghoul or a skeleton chanced to open the door to [a ghoul or a skeleton]2162-a ghoul or a skeleton]2161-those perfectly bred servants , who , if they chanced to open the door to a ghoul or a skeleton , would merely inquire , " What name , if [you]57-paul please ? "[67-boaler] " [I]67-boaler must go and ask [[your]57-paul Par]3893-your par , then , [Master Dick]60-dick ; there 's time to ' ook it [upstairs]264-upstairs while [I]67-boaler 'm gone . [I]67-boaler wo n't say nothing , "[67-boaler] [he]67-boaler added compassionately . [Paul]57-paul lost no time in following this suggestion , but rushed [upstairs]264-upstairs , two or three steps at the time , stumbling at every flight , with a hideous nightmare feeling that [some invisible thing behind]2164-some invisible thing behind was trying to trip up [his]57-paul heels . [He]57-paul rushed blindly past [the conservatory]2165-the conservatory , which was lit up by Chinese lanterns and crowded with little " [Kate Greenaway]204-kate greenaway "[57-paul] maidens crowned with fantastic headdresses out of the crackers , and comparing presents with [boy - lovers]2166-boy - lovers ; [he]57-paul upset [perspiring waiters]2167-perspiring waiters with glasses and trays , and scattered [the children sitting on the stairs]2168-the children sitting on the stairs , as [he]57-paul bounded on in [his]57-paul reckless flight , leaving crashes of glass behind [him]57-paul . [He]57-paul had no clear idea of what [he]57-paul meant to do ; [he]57-paul thought of barricading [himself]57-paul in [[his]57-paul bedroom]2762-his bedroom and hiding in the wardrobe ; [he]57-paul had desperate notions of getting on to [the housetop]2170-the housetop by means of a step - ladder and the sky - light above [the nursery landing]2171-the nursery landing ; on one point [he]57-paul was resolved — [he]57-paul would not be retaken alive ! Never before in [this commonplace [London]36-london world of [ours]2173-ours]2172-this commonplace london world of ours was [an unfortunate householder]2174-an unfortunate householder hunted up [his]2174-an unfortunate householder own staircase in this distressing manner ; even [his]2174-an unfortunate householder terror did not blind [him]2174-an unfortunate householder to the extreme ignominy and injustice of [his]2174-an unfortunate householder position . And below [he]57-paul heard the bell ringing more and more impatiently , as [the Doctor]248-the doctor still remained on the wrong side of the door . In another minute [he]57-paul must be admitted — and then ! Who will not sympathise with [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul as [he]57-paul approaches the crisis of [his]57-paul misfortunes ? [I]0-i protest , for [my]0-i own part , that as [I]0-i am compelled to describe [him]57-paul springing from step to step in wild terror , like [a highly respectable chamois]2176-a highly respectable chamois before [some Alpine marksman]2177-some alpine marksman , [my]0-i own heart bleeds for [him]57-paul , and [I]0-i hasten to end [my]0-i distressing tale , and make the rest of it as little painful as [I]0-i may with honesty . [Poor Mr. Bultitude]205-poor mr. bultitude , springing wildly [upstairs]264-upstairs in a last desperate effort to avoid capture , had now almost reached [his]205-poor mr. bultitude goal . Just above [him]205-poor mr. bultitude was [the nursery landing]2171-the nursery landing , with [its]2171-the nursery landing little wooden gate , and near [it]2171-the nursery landing , leaning against the wall , was a pair of [kitchen steps]2180-kitchen steps , with which [he]205-poor mr. bultitude had hopes of reaching the roof , or [the cistern loft]2181-the cistern loft , or some other safe and inaccessible place . Better a night spent on the slates amongst the chimney - pots than a bed in [that terrible No . 6 Dormitory]2182-that terrible no . 6 dormitory !

But here , too , fate was against [him]205-poor mr. bultitude . [He]205-poor mr. bultitude was not more than half - a - dozen steps from the top , when , to [his]205-poor mr. bultitude unspeakable horror , [he]205-poor mr. bultitude saw a small form in a white frock and cardinal - red sash come running out of [the nursery]2183-the nursery , and begin to descend slowly and cautiously , clinging to the banisters with one chubby little hand . It was [[his]205-poor mr. bultitude youngest son]2184-his youngest son , [Roly]65-roly , and as soon as [he]205-poor mr. bultitude saw this , [he]205-poor mr. bultitude lost hope once and for all ; [he]205-poor mr. bultitude could not escape being recognised , [the child]2694-the child would probably refuse to leave [him]205-poor mr. bultitude , and even if [he]205-poor mr. bultitude did contrive to get away from [him]205-poor mr. bultitude , it would be hopeless to make [Roly]65-roly understand that [he]205-poor mr. bultitude was not to betray [his]205-poor mr. bultitude hiding - place . So [he]205-poor mr. bultitude stopped on the stairs , aghast at this new misfortune , and feeling [himself]205-poor mr. bultitude at the end of all [his]205-poor mr. bultitude resources . [Roly]65-roly knew [him]65-roly at once , and began to dance delightedly up and down on the stair in [his]65-roly little bronze shoes . " [Buzzer Dicky]206-buzzer dicky , "[205-poor mr. bultitude] [he]205-poor mr. bultitude cried , " dear buzzer [Dicky]206-buzzer dicky , tum ' ome to party ! "[205-poor mr. bultitude] " It 's not [brother Dicky]206-buzzer dicky , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul miserably ; " it 's all a mistake . "[205-poor mr. bultitude] " Oh , but it is though , "[65-roly] said [Roly]65-roly ; " and [you]57-paul do n't know what [Roly]65-roly 's found . "[65-roly] " No , no , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul , trying to pass ( which , as [Roly]65-roly persisted in leaping joyously from side to side of the narrow stair , was difficult ) ; " [you]57-paul shall show [me]65-roly another time . [I]65-roly 'm in a hurry , [[my]65-roly boy]2376-my boy , [I]65-roly 've got an appointment . "[65-roly] " [Roly]65-roly 's got something better than that , "[2694-the child] observed [the child]2694-the child . " Well , what has [Roly]65-roly found — a cracker ? "[57-paul] " No , no , better than a cwacker — [you]57-paul guess . "[57-paul] " [I]57-paul ca n't guess , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul ; " never mind , [I]57-paul do n't want to know . "[57-paul] " Well then , "[65-roly] said [Roly]65-roly , " there . "[65-roly] And [he]65-roly slowly unclosed a fat little fist , and in it [Paul]57-paul saw , with a revulsion of feeling that turned [him]57-paul dizzy and faint , the priceless talisman itself , the identical Garudâ Stone , with part of the frail gilt ring still attached to it . The fastening had probably given way during [Master Dick]60-dick 's uproarious revels in [the drawing - room]2342-the drawing - room , and [Roly]65-roly must have picked it up on the carpet shortly afterwards . " Is n't it a pitty sing ? "[65-roly] said [Roly]65-roly , insisting that [his]65-roly treasure should be duly admired . [Roly]65-roly found it . "[65-roly] [Paul]57-paul 's fears rose again ; would [he]57-paul be wrecked in [port]2189-port after all ? [His]57-paul ear , unnaturally strained , caught the sound of the front door being opened , [he]57-paul heard [the Doctor]248-the doctor 's deep voice booming faintly below , then the noise of [persons ascending]2191-persons ascending . " [Roly]65-roly shall have it , then , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said perfidiously , " if [he]65-roly will say after [me]57-paul what [I]57-paul tell [him]65-roly . "[65-roly] For [the Stone]73-the stone had done its work once more , and this time with happier results ; with a supreme relief and joy , which [no one who has read this book]2196-no one who has read this book can fail to understand , [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul felt that [he]57-paul actually was [his]57-paul old self again . Just when all hope seemed cut off and relief was most unlikely , the magic spell that had caused [him]57-paul such intolerable misery for one hideous week was reversed by the hand of [[his]57-paul innocent child]2197-his innocent child . [He]57-paul caught [Roly]65-roly up in [his]57-paul arms and kissed [him]65-roly as [he]57-paul had never been kissed in [his]57-paul whole life before , at least by [[his]65-roly father]242-his father , and comforting [him]65-roly as well as [he]57-paul could , for [the poor child]2199-the poor child had naturally received rather a severe shock , [he]57-paul stepped airily down the staircase , which [he]57-paul had mounted with such different emotions five minutes before . On [his]57-paul way [he]57-paul could not resist going into [[his]57-paul dressing - room]2200-his dressing - room and assuring [himself]57-paul by a prolonged examination before the cheval - glass that [the Stone]73-the stone had not played [him]57-paul some last piece of jugglery ; but [he]57-paul found everything quite correct ; [he]57-paul was [the same formal , precise and portly person , wearing the same morning dress even as on that other Monday evening]2201-the same formal , precise and portly person , wearing the same morning dress even as on that other monday evening , and [he]57-paul went on with greater confidence . [He]57-paul took care , however , to stop at the first window , when [he]57-paul managed , after some coaxing , to persuade [Roly]65-roly to give up the Garudâ Stone . As soon as [he]57-paul had it in [his]57-paul hands again , [he]57-paul opened the window wide and flung the dangerous talisman far out into the darkness . Not till then did [he]57-paul feel perfectly secure .

[He]57-paul passed [the groups of little guests gathered about [the conservatory]2165-the conservatory]2202-the groups of little guests gathered about the conservatory , and lower down [he]57-paul met [Boaler]67-boaler , [the nurse]2204-the nurse , and [one or two servants]2205-one or two servants and [waiters]2143-waiters , rushing up in a state of great anxiety and flurry ; even [Boaler]67-boaler 's usual composure seemed shaken . " Please , [sir]2329-sir , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul asked , " [the schoolmaster gentleman]3900-the schoolmaster gentleman , [Master Dick]60-dick — [he've]3900-the schoolmaster gentleman run [upstairs]264-upstairs , have n't [you]2329-sir seen [him]60-dick ? "[57-paul] [Paul]57-paul had almost forgotten [Dick]60-dick in [his]57-paul new happiness ; there would be a heavy score to settle with [him]57-paul ; [he]57-paul had the upper hand once more , and yet , somehow , [he]57-paul did not feel as much righteous wrath and desire for revenge as [he]57-paul expected to do . " Do n't be alarmed , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , waving [them]2207-them back with more benignity than [he]57-paul thought [he]57-paul had in [him]57-paul . " [Master Dick]60-dick is safe enough . [I]57-paul know all about it . Where is [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone ? In [the library]3902-the library , eh ? Very well , [I]57-paul will see [him]62-dr. grimstone [there]2356-there . "[57-paul] And leaving [Roly]65-roly with [the nurse]2204-the nurse , [he]57-paul went down to [the library]3902-the library ; not , if the truth must be told , without a slight degree of nervousness , unreasonable and unaccountable enough now , but quite beyond [his]57-paul power to control . [He]57-paul entered [the room]213-the room , and there , surrounded by piles of ticketed hats and coats , under the pale light of one gas - burner , [he]57-paul saw [the terrible man before whom [he]57-paul had trembled for the last seven horrible days]2211-the terrible man before whom he had trembled for the last seven horrible days . A feeling of self - defence made [Paul]57-paul assume rather more than [his]57-paul old stiffness as [he]57-paul shook hands . " [I]57-paul am very glad to see [you]248-the doctor , [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , " but [your]248-the doctor coming at this time forces [me]57-paul to ask if there is any unusual reason for , for [my]57-paul having the — a — pleasure of seeing [you]248-the doctor here ? "[57-paul] " [I]248-the doctor am exceedingly distressed to have to say that there is , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor solemnly , " or [I]248-the doctor should not have troubled [you]57-paul at this hour . " [You]248-the doctor do n't say so ! "[57-paul] " [I]57-paul do indeed ; [he]3906-your unhappy boy has , in short , run away . " [I]57-paul should certainly have recaptured [him]3906-your unhappy boy before [he]3906-your unhappy boy could have left [the railway station]3908-the railway station , where [he]3906-your unhappy boy seems to have gone at once , only , acting on information ( which [I]57-paul strongly suspect now was intentionally misleading ) , [I]57-paul drove on to [the station]280-the station on [the up - line]3910-the up - line , thinking to find [him]3906-your unhappy boy [there]2356-there . "[57-paul] " No , [sir]2329-sir , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor passionately , " [I]248-the doctor did not find [him]3906-your unhappy boy , but [he]3906-your unhappy boy was there ; [he]3906-your unhappy boy must have been [there]2356-there ! but the shameless connivance of [two excessively ill - bred persons , who positively refused to allow [me]248-the doctor access to [their]3920-two excessively ill - bred persons , who positively refused to allow me access to their compartment compartment]3920-two excessively ill - bred persons , who positively refused to allow me access to their compartment , caused [him]3906-your unhappy boy to slip through [my]248-the doctor fingers . "[248-the doctor] [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul observed , rather ungratefully , that , if this was so , it was a most improper thing for [them]2215-them to do . " It was , indeed , but it is of no consequence fortunately . [I]57-paul was forced to wait for [the next train]2577-the next train , but that was not a very slow one , and so [I]57-paul was able to come on here before a very late hour and acquaint [you]248-the doctor with what had taken place . "[57-paul] " Thank [you]248-the doctor very much , "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul . " It 's a painful thing to occur in [a school]3922-a school , "[248-the doctor] observed [the Doctor]248-the doctor after a pause .

" Most unfortunate , "[57-paul] agreed [Paul]57-paul , coughing . " So apt to lead [persons who are not acquainted with the facts]3923-persons who are not acquainted with the facts to imagine that [the boy]246-the boy was unhappy under [my]248-the doctor care , "[248-the doctor] continued [the Doctor]248-the doctor . " In this case , [I]57-paul assure [you]248-the doctor , [I]57-paul have no doubts , "[57-paul] protested [Paul]57-paul with politeness and ( seldom a possible combination ) perfect truth . " Very kind of [you]248-the doctor to say so ; really , it 's a great mystery to [me]57-paul . [I]57-paul certainly , as [I]57-paul felt it [my]57-paul duty to inform [you]248-the doctor at the time , came very near inflicting corporal punishment upon [him]246-the boy this morning — very near . But then [he]246-the boy was pardoned on [your]248-the doctor intercession ; and , besides , [the boy]246-the boy would never have run away for fear of a flogging . "[57-paul] " Oh , no , perfectly absurd ! "[57-paul] agreed [Paul]57-paul again . " Such [a merry , high - spirited lad]3926-a merry , high - spirited lad , too , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , sincerely enough ; " popular with [[his]246-the boy schoolfellows]3365-his schoolfellows ; a favourite ( in spite of [his]246-the boy faults ) with [[his]246-the boy teachers]3928-his teachers . "[248-the doctor] " No , was [he]246-the boy though ? "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul with more surprise , for [he]57-paul had not been fortunate enough to reap much vicarious benefit from [[his]57-paul son]225-his son 's popularity , as [he]57-paul could not help remembering . " All this , added to the comforts ( or , may [I]57-paul say , the luxuries ? ) [he]246-the boy enjoyed under [my]57-paul supervision , does make it seem very strange and ungrateful in [the boy]246-the boy to take this sudden and ill - considered step . "[57-paul] " Very , indeed ; but do [you]248-the doctor know , [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone , [I]248-the doctor ca n't help thinking — and pray do not misunderstand [me]248-the doctor if [I]248-the doctor speak plainly — that , perhaps , [he]246-the boy had reasons for being unhappy [you]248-the doctor can have no idea of ? " [You]248-the doctor did discourage [him]246-the boy , indeed ! "[57-paul] said [Paul]57-paul inwardly , thinking of those attempted confidences with a shudder . "[57-paul] " A cursory visit , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , " a formal inspection — [you]57-paul can not fairly judge [boys]2308-boys by that . "[248-the doctor] It was the very last thing [Paul]57-paul did want — [he]57-paul knew [them]2225-them quite well enough , but it was of no use to say so , and [he]57-paul merely assented politely . " And now , "[248-the doctor] said [the Doctor]248-the doctor , " with regard to [[your]57-paul misguided boy]3940-your misguided boy . " "[0-i] [I]0-i think that [[your]0-i son]2322-your son , who doubtless knew of [your]0-i intention , was hurt at being excluded from the festivities and , in a fit of mad wilful folly , resolved to be present at [them]2229-them in spite of [you]0-i . " "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear [Doctor]209-doctor]2230-my dear doctor , " cried [Paul]57-paul , who saw the conveniences of this theory , "[0-i] that must be it , of course — that explains it all ! [You]2230-my dear doctor agree with [me]0-i , [I]0-i trust ? " The memory of [his]2231-the little scoundrel wrongs overcame [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul for the moment : "[2230-my dear doctor] Nothing can be too bad for [the little scoundrel]2231-the little scoundrel ! " [he]2231-the little scoundrel said , between [his]2231-the little scoundrel teeth . "[2231-the little scoundrel] [He]2231-the little scoundrel shall have it , [sir]2329-sir , [I]0-i swear to [you]2329-sir ; [he]2231-the little scoundrel shall be made to repent this as long as [he]2231-the little scoundrel lives . " [The Doctor]248-the doctor was more angry than [an impartial lover of justice]3945-an impartial lover of justice might perhaps approve of , but then it must be remembered that [he]248-the doctor had seen [himself]248-the doctor completely outwitted and [his]248-the doctor authority set at nought in a very humiliating fashion . However , [his]248-the doctor excessive wrath cooled [Paul]57-paul 's own resentment instead of inflaming it ; it made [him]248-the doctor reflect that , after all , it was [he]248-the doctor who had the best right to be angry . "[0-i] Well , " [he]0-i said , rather coldly , "[0-i] [we]2234-we must find [him]2231-the little scoundrel first , and then consider what shall be done to [him]2231-the little scoundrel . "[62-dr. grimstone] As for [Dick]60-dick , [he]60-dick ran to [[his]60-dick father]242-his father , and hung gratefully on to [his]242-his father arm with a remorseful hug , a thing [he]60-dick had never dared to do , or thought of attempting , in [his]60-dick life till then . " Well , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said mildly , " prove to [me]57-paul that [I]57-paul have made no mistake . "[57-paul] And soon afterwards [a cab]2316-a cab was called , and [Dr. Grimstone]62-dr. grimstone prepared to return to [Market Rodwell]5-market rodwell , with [the deserter]2256-the deserter , by [the last train]2257-the last train . " Mind , "[57-paul] [he]57-paul said , " [you]246-the boy have been at [school]226-school all this past week ; [you]246-the boy have run away to attend this party , [you]246-the boy understand ? Good - bye , [[my]57-paul boy]2376-my boy , and here 's something to put in [your]246-the boy pocket , and another for [Jolland]78-jolland ; but [he]78-jolland need not know it comes from [me]57-paul . "[57-paul] And when [Dick]60-dick opened [his]60-dick hand afterwards , [he]60-dick found two half - sovereigns in it . So [the cab]2315-the cab rolled away , and [Paul]57-paul went up to [the drawing - room]2342-the drawing - room , where , although [he]57-paul certainly allowed the fireworks on [the balcony]811-the balcony and in [the garden]3417-the garden to languish forgotten on their sticks , [he]57-paul led [all the other revels]2263-all the other revels up to an advanced hour with jovial abandon quite worthy of [Dick]60-dick , and [none of [[his]57-paul little guests]2265-his little guests]2264-none of his little guests ever suspected the change of host . When it was all over , and [the sleepy children]2266-the sleepy children had driven off , [Paul]57-paul sat down in an easy chair by the bright fire which sparkled frostily in [[his]57-paul bedroom]2762-his bedroom , to think gratefully over all the events of the day — events which were beginning already to take an unreal and fantastic shape . Bitterly as [he]57-paul had suffered , and in spite of the just anger and thirst for revenge with which [he]57-paul had returned , [I]0-i am glad to say [he]57-paul did not regret the spirit of mildness that had stayed [his]57-paul hand when [his]57-paul hour of triumph came . [His]57-paul experiences , unpleasant as they had been , had had their advantages : they had drawn [him]57-paul and [[his]57-paul family]1008-his family closer together . In [[his]57-paul daughter]2769-his daughter [Barbara]64-barbara , as [she]64-barbara wished [him]57-paul good - night ( knowing nothing , of course , of the escape ) , [he]57-paul had suddenly become aware of a girlish freshness and grace [he]57-paul had never looked for or cared to see before . [Roly]65-roly after this , too , had a claim upon [him]57-paul [he]57-paul could never wish to forget , and even with [the graceless Dick]60-dick there was a warmer and more natural feeling on both sides — a strange result , no doubt , of such unfilial behaviour , but so it was . [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul would never after this consider [[his]57-paul family]1008-his family as a set of [troublesome and thankless incumbrances]2271-troublesome and thankless incumbrances ; thanks to [Dick]60-dick 's offices during the interregnum , [they]1008-his family would henceforth throw off [their]1008-his family reserve and constraint in [[their]1008-his family father]2272-their father 's presence , and in so doing , open [his]57-paul eyes to qualities of which [he]57-paul had hitherto been in contented ignorance . It would be pleasanter perhaps to take leave of [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul thus , as [he]57-paul sits by [his]57-paul bedroom fire in the first flush of supreme and unalloyed content .

But [I]0-i feel almost bound to point out a fact which few will find any difficulty in accepting , namely , that , although the wrong had been retrieved without scandal or exposure , for which [Paul]57-paul could not be too thankful , there were many consequences which could not but survive it . [Neither father]2273-neither father nor [son]366-son found [himself]57-paul exactly in the same position as before [their]2275-their exchange of characters . It took [Mr. Bultitude]57-paul considerable time and trouble to repair all the damage [[his]57-paul son]225-his son 's boyish excesses had wrought both at [Westbourne Terrace]3-westbourne terrace and in [the City]2416-the city . [He]57-paul found the discipline of [[[his]57-paul clerks]422-his clerks ' room]2279-his clerks ' room and [counting - house]2280-counting - house sorely relaxed , and [[his]57-paul office - boy]2281-his office - boy in particular attempted a tone towards [him]57-paul of such atrocious familiarity that [he]57-paul was indignantly dismissed , much to [his]57-paul astonishment , the very first day . And probably [Paul]57-paul will never quite clear [himself]57-paul of the cloud that hangs over [a man of business who , in the course of however well regulated a career , is known to have been at least once " a little odd]3989-a man of business who , in the course of however well regulated a career , is known to have been at least once " a little odd . "[57-paul] And [[his]57-paul home]377-his home , too , was distinctly demoralised : [[his]57-paul cook]2283-his cook was [an artist , unrivalled at soups and entrées]2284-an artist , unrivalled at soups and entrées ; but [he]57-paul had to get rid of [her]2283-his cook notwithstanding . It was only too evident that [she]2283-his cook looked upon [herself]2283-his cook as [the prospective mistress of [[his]57-paul household]1806-his household]2285-the prospective mistress of his household , and [he]57-paul did not feel called upon as [a parent]2881-a parent to fulfil any expectations which [Dick]60-dick 's youthful cupboard love had unintentionally excited . For some time , as fresh proof of [Dick]60-dick 's extravagances came [home]296-home to [him]57-paul , [Paul]57-paul found it cost [him]57-paul no little effort to restrain a tendency to [his]57-paul former bitterness and resentment , but [he]57-paul valued the new understanding between [himself]57-paul and [[his]57-paul son]225-his son too highly to risk losing it again by any open reproach , and so with each succeeding discovery the victory over [his]57-paul feelings became easier . As for [Dick]60-dick , [he]57-paul found the inconveniences at which [[his]60-dick father]242-his father had hinted anything but imaginary , as will perhaps be easily understood .

It was an unpleasant shock to discover that in one short week [[his]60-dick father]242-his father had contrived somehow to procure [him]60-dick a lasting unpopularity . [He]60-dick was obviously looked upon by all , [masters]1221-masters and [boys]2308-boys , as [a confirmed coward and sneak]2294-a confirmed coward and sneak . And although [some of [[his]60-dick companions]2323-his companions]2295-some of his companions could not fairly reproach [him]60-dick on the latter score , the imputation was particularly galling to [Dick]60-dick , who had always treated such practices with sturdy contempt . [He]60-dick was sorely tempted at times to right [himself]60-dick by declaring the real state of the case ; but [he]60-dick remembered [his]60-dick promise and [[his]60-dick father]242-his father 's unexpected clemency and [his]60-dick gratitude always kept [him]60-dick silent . [He]60-dick never quite understood how it was that [the whole school]2673-the whole school seemed to have an impression that [they]2673-the whole school could kick and assault [him]60-dick generally with perfect impunity ; but a few very unsuccessful experiments convinced [them]2673-the whole school that this was a popular error on [their]2673-the whole school part . Although , however , in everything else [he]60-dick did gradually succeed in recovering all the ground [[his]60-dick father]242-his father had lost [him]60-dick , yet there was one respect in which , [I]0-i am sorry to say , [he]60-dick found all [his]60-dick efforts to retrieve [himself]60-dick hopeless . [[His]60-dick little sweetheart]2300-his little sweetheart , with the grey eyes and soft brown hair , cruelly refused to have anything more to do with [him]60-dick . For [Dulcie]110-dulcie 's pride had been wounded by what [she]2300-his little sweetheart considered [his]60-dick shameless perfidy on that memorable Saturday by the parallel bars ; the last lingering traces of affection had vanished before [Paul]57-paul 's ingratitude on the following Monday , and [she]2300-his little sweetheart never forgave [him]60-dick . [She]2300-his little sweetheart did not even give [him]60-dick an opportunity of explaining [himself]60-dick , never by word or sign up to the last day of the term showing that [she]2300-his little sweetheart was even aware of [his]60-dick return . What was worse , in [her]2300-his little sweetheart resentment [she]2300-his little sweetheart transferred [her]2300-his little sweetheart favour to [Tipping]90-tipping , who became [[her]2300-his little sweetheart humble slave]2301-her humble slave for a too brief period ; after which [he]90-tipping was found wanting in polish , and was ignominiously thrown over for [the shy new boy [Kiffin]91-kiffin , whose head [Dick]60-dick found a certain melancholy pleasure in punching in consequence]2302-the shy new boy kiffin , whose head dick found a certain melancholy pleasure in punching in consequence . This was [Dick]60-dick 's punishment , and a very real and heavy one [he]60-dick found it . [He]60-dick is at [Harrow]12-harrow now , where [he]60-dick is doing fairly well ; but [I]0-i think there are moments even yet when [Dulcie]110-dulcie 's charming little face , [her]110-dulcie pretty confidences , and [her]110-dulcie chilling disdain , are remembered with something as nearly resembling a heartache as [a healthy unsentimental boy]2303-a healthy unsentimental boy can allow [himself]2303-a healthy unsentimental boy . Perhaps , if some day [he]60-dick goes back once more to [Crichton House]4-crichton house " to see [the fellows]2980-the fellows , "[110-dulcie] this time with the mysterious glamour of [a great public school about [him]60-dick]2304-a great public school about him , [he]60-dick may yet obtain forgiveness , for [she]110-dulcie is getting horribly tired of [Kiffin]91-kiffin , who , to tell the truth , is something of a milksop . As for the Garudâ Stone , [I]0-i really can not say what has become of it . Perhaps it was dashed to pieces on the cobble - stones of [the stables]2305-the stables behind [the terrace]2035-the terrace , and a good thing too . Perhaps it was not , and is still in existence , with all its dangerous powers as ready for use as ever it was ; and in that case the best [I]0-i can wish [[my]0-i readers]2307-my readers is , that [they]2307-my readers may be mercifully preserved from finding it anywhere , or if [they]2307-my readers are unfortunate enough to come upon it , that [they]2307-my readers may at least be more careful with it than [Mr. Paul Bultitude]57-paul , by whose melancholy example [I]0-i trust [they]2307-my readers will take timely warning . And with these very sincere wishes [I]0-i beg to bid [them]2307-my readers a reluctant farewell .
